description:
I know the reason for coming to Devils teeth is for the baked goods and there are numerous reviews on those with multiple details.  I'm doing a review on their eggs since I'm on an extreme low carb diet and one of my best friends was feasting on baked goods that day.  

The three eggs in a bowl is awesome, dare I say life saver.  One of my weakeneses is biscuits and we all know how good the biscuits are here.  I was almost about to cheat when I saw the eggs in the bowl order.  I then happily ordered that and added cheddar cheese, avocado, bacon and their garlic-lemon-aioli.  WOW! that was good.  It's one of the best scrambled eggs I've ever had.  Good bite on the eggs an enough seasonings and flavor.  The avocado was good and the bacon and cheddar shines.  
I would come back just for this order and would suggest this for others even when they have no diet restrictions.  Good work Devil's Teeth for having this option.  FYI this can be a vegetarian-gluten free option as well.  Amazing and I'm a happy Yelper!!!
author: John G.

description:
Devil's Teeth is known far and wide for their breakfast sandwiches - fluffy eggs, melty cheese and savory applewood smoked bacon on a freshly baked biscuit. 

I'm sad to report that their sandwiches are not up to snuff anymore and certainly not worth the price nor the long lines on weekends. The biscuit itself was well constructed, flaky, buttery and held up the ingredients well. However, the contents of the sandwich were rather lacking in flavor and my bacon was downright burnt. The bacon was charred to the point of being inedible. I was aghast that they would deign to serve that to a customer. I don't think this place is worth the hype anymore. The quality has definitely declined over the years and overall, I don't think it's worth the trek to the Outer Sunset.
author: Laura Y.

description:
It's a small place with a very Oceanside feel. Their $1 beignets (on Sunday) and special breakfast sandwiches are superb. Obviously there's a line but it moves quickly and their staff is friendly. 

Recommend this place if you are in this neighborhood and looking for a quick and delicious bite.
author: Eshita S.

description:
The $7 special breakfast sandwich and the $1 Sunday beignets are the biggest hits here. 

This is the best breakfast spot in San Francisco. Walking distance from the beach, fresh baked goods, and delicious biscuit sandwiches. There's typically a line, but it goes by quick since everyone is waiting for the same sandwich. 

The seating indoors is limited and there's an open bench set up out front. This is a dog friendly spot and packed with families.
author: Patty B.

description:
I've been on a mission to explore Outer Sunset and all of the cafes the neighborhood has to offer. I found Devil's Teeth Baking on Yelp and decided to stop by for breakfast and some coffee. The line was out the door at around 9:30AM on a Sunday, but the wait was not too bad. 

They have an awesome selection of pastries, breakfast and lunch options (which are served all day), and $1 beignets only on Sundays! I ended up ordering the special breakfast sandwich (which is their regular sandwich + bacon + avocado for an additional dollar) and a beignet in addition to a latte. 

The wait for the breakfast sandwich and the beignet was longer than the wait to order, which was a bit frustrating. However, I do appreciate that everything is made to order, even the beignets. The beignet was soft, pillow-y, and quite doughy in the middle, which is exactly how I like them. I thought it was kind of weirdly packaged though, in a brown paper bag with powdered sugar just sitting at the bottom and not actually sifted on to the beignet. The breakfast sandwich was decent, I particularly enjoyed the bacon but I wish I had the option to order it with something else other than the biscuit. 

I will probably be back at some point to try all the different cookies and more of the items on their breakfast/lunch menu!
author: Sherry L.

description:
Wowza is this place good. I recommend coming early (we went around 8am and the line was very manageable but when we left 30-40 min later it was down the block). We came here on a Sunday morning and was very pleased because it's the only day of the week they make fresh beignets (made to order). Needless to say, they were warm and incredibly delicious.

We came for the special breakfast sandwich, called "the best breakfast sandwich" by the infatuation, which is my go to spot for all things food. This little piece of heaven is served on a buttermilk biscuit and comes with scrambled eggs, lemon garlic aioli, pepper jack cheese, avocado and bacon. I came all the way from New York to try this breakfast sandwich and am so happy I did! Definitely worth making the barge out to the Sunset to get this sandwich. The biscuit was buttery and flakey, and all ingredients were well balanced and plentiful.

I also got a coffee which was great - they have a full espresso bar and iced coffee too, as well as a chocolate chip cookie for later. It's a bakery so there are endless tempting treats that I couldn't help but try. Make the trip here and get the best breakfast sandwich of your life!
author: Courtney B.

description:
After hearing such wonderful things about this place, I came here with two friends on Sunday morning around 11 AM. The line was out the door because it was beignet Sunday. After waiting for about 10-15 minutes, we were able to place our orders. 

I got the strawberry muffin, and my friend got the biscuit and cinnamon roll. The muffin was good, but nothing that totally knocked it out of the park. It was fluffy with a light banana taste to it. The strawberry flavor was good since it was fresh strawberries instead of artificial, but I didn't think it was distributed throughout the muffin that well. I had a bite of my friend's biscuit, and while I expected the fluffy and flaky traditional biscuit consistency, I was surprised with a dense and thick one instead. It wasn't bad, I just prefer the other kind of biscuit. The cinnamon was good and had a strong cinnamon taste - I would have enjoyed this with coffee I think. 

I don't think I would come back here since it's pretty far out in the Outer Sunset. But on the other hand, I do think if I happen to be in the area, I will come back and try the special breakfast sandwich which sounds great. I can see how the biscuit would totally work in the breakfast sandwich. Overall: good, but not really anything that special enough for me to trek all the way out to the area for.  I like the vibe of the place - hip and beachy-chill without the pretentious Mission district cafe vibe.
author: Steph V.

description:
Consistently the best bakery breakfast sandwich location I've had anywhere in California. The staff is consistently approachable and efficient getting through the sometimes enormous lines. Be assured, the wait is well worth it!

Ive been honored to try several things on the menu and have never been let down. I will say I do have a bit more of a traditional rich-conservative palate and enjoy the simple cheddar and egg  buttery biscuit just as it comes. The lemon bar, cinnamon roll, and  beignets (on Sunday's only) are all equally amazing just beep song on what your palate is craving most. 

Anytime I'm within 50miles of Devils Teeth, I make it a point to come by! Thank you guys, you're phenomenal.
author: Matthew E.

description:
Man oh man... In one word - Incredible.

It makes me happy when something is made up of several ingredients and all flavours and textures work together. Their special breakfast sandwich is evidence of this.

The buttermilk biscuit was crumbly as desired but dense enough to hold the ingredients without falling apart. All of the ingredients were great but that really set this apart was the lemon-garlic aioli. It was a subtle flavour but it tied it all together very nicely.
author: Jack D.

description:
Okay, let's not fuck around here! I would sell my soul for that damn biscuit sandwich!!! 

Unholy Shit this place is good!! We were in town dropping off our kid for colege (jk I know how to spell it), and we did that little Yelp lookup for b-fast and low and behold was this place right down the street from our girl. 

There's nothing better than those places that are about the food and not as much worried about the over the top decor and menu. Devil's Teeth is all about putting out the most amazing food and people will wait for it! 

The Special Breakfast Sandwich! You ever been to that place out of town that is so good you hate it because you can't get it at home? Yeah, fucking hate that sandwich! The biscuit - stupidly perfect and flaky. So happy I don't have to worry about it crumbling on my clothes. Eggs, cheese, garlic aioli, bacon and avocado inside. Damn it!! So wish I could have one of these right now!!  

The Sticky Bun! Crap, I can actually remember on our drive up to Oregon eating that thing and cursing finding that place!! I even hate writing this review right now. 

Devil's Teeth is so so so worth the trip. Oh, and our daughter too!  Looking forward to next time DT, until then, I hate you!!!
author: Tom D.

description:
Yup, Devil's Teeth definitely lives up to the hype. This Outer Sunset bakery brings in a lot of people, especially on the weekends, and after tasting their goodies, I can definitely see why!

Standouts --
- special breakfast sandwich: SO bomb, probably one of my favorite breakfast sandwiches. The aioli is such a nice touch, and the biscuit was super fluffy and satisfying. I waited around 15 minutes for this, but it was worth it! 
- beignets: only $1! I believe only served on Sundays. This came out pretty quickly, and came out piping hot! We had to wait a couple minutes before diving in. The beignets are super worth it, definitely surprised at how big they were since they were only $1! They were fluffy and delicious. A little denser than other beignets I've had, but I actually enjoyed this.
- focaccia bread: a huge piece, very yummy. A perfect pick for me who likes more savory bakery goodies.
- cinnamon roll: Nathan got the cinnamon roll and loved it. I think that's another crowd favorite and I can see why!

I stopped in recently on a Sunday around 1PM and the crowds had actually died down a bit by then! There was no line to order, but definitely a lot of people waiting for their food. It's a small location but there is more seating available outside on some benches, a nice option if it's a nice day in the Outer Sunset!

Will definitely be stopping in again to try more of the menu (but will probably not be able to resist getting another breakfast sammie)!
author: Greg J.

description:
Yes, the Special Breakfast Sandwich is the bomb. Would I say that I would come out of my way to get this? Probably not. If you're in the area, definitely stop in and get ready to wait.
Tried some other pastries, and all were pretty good, but SF has so many options.
Staff was a hit or miss, but overall friendly and laid back.
author: Angie K.

description:
We came here around 8 a.m. on a weekend morning and the line was long but it moved pretty quick. 
The special breakfast sandwich is a must order! It came with their aoili sauce, crispy bacon, scrambled eggs, cheese, avocado, and a freshly baked biscuit! 

We did order the beignet and I would say this is one thing that was not worth the wait. They are only a dollar each but it took us about 20 minutes to get ours. Unfortunately, it tasted way too much like the oil it was cooked it. It was super greasy and tasted like nothing to us. I would not order again.
author: Jane C.

description:
"Is this love that I'm feeling
Is this the love that I've been searching for
Is this love or am I dreaming
This must be love
'Cause it's really got a hold on me
A hold on me..." - Whitesnake

Hell yeah! At least it wasn't Ozzie! The devil made me do it! To be honest I'm an angel and I believe angels are hella stronger than devils... a chance to sprinkle my holy water on this devilish place. Yet, somehow I came here listening to.. IS THIS LOVE by Whitesnake on my buds! A HAIRBAND! Go figure!

Devil's Teeth Baking Company actually has nothing to do with evil or the like. The owner's husband is a San Francisco Police Department officer! She opened the rustic-ish cafe in the outer sunset district  to make her famous breakfast sandwiches that her husband loves... that simple! And simple is the mantra here. Keep it simple, fresh, quality, & it'll taste good! This was over five years ago and today there's a cult like following when the doors open!

For me, I really wanted to get my paws on the Special Breakfast Sandwich! So on a weekend (I heard lines get insane at times) early morning I head to the Devil and see what it's all about... it's on Noriega St. and in the Outer Sunset like many mention, so expect fog if coming here early! 

I arrive to maybe five people in line, another eight waiting on their orders, and at least five employees pumping out the goods. The crowd seemed mixed, from surfers, to professionals pretending to be skaters, mom, and a couple silver foxes. After a few minutes it's my turn (line really moves fast)! I order the Special Breakfast Sandwich (buttermilk biscuit, scrambled eggs, lemon garlic aioli, avocado, topped with crispy bacon & melted pepper jack cheese), I add... Açai drink, Strawberry Muffin for later. A few minutes later my name is called... 

The cafe was smaller than I imagined, yet it worked, and had that hippie communal vibe, a couple small tables were inside, a counter with stools, and the beach benches on the sidewalk. Eclectic decor. If you come early more "nature" chairs can be found next-door at the surf shop - where I found a seat.

One bite into that Special Breakfast Sandwich was orgasmic and more! Yup, it was HEAVENLY! Like others mention believe the hype for this one item... its heart-thumping DELICIOUS! The Açaí drink was a perfect compliment to the Sammy. I held off on the Strawberry Muffin 'til later. The Muffin was good, but not off-the-hook like the Sammy! 

All in all, I highly recommend Devil's Teeth Baking Company. Don't expect glam here or even glam rock here! No devil bands or even fancy dishes! Just a small cafe in the foggy part of the city... toss on some Whitesnake and order that incredible Special Breakfast Sandwich! Thank me later, Baby;)
author: Eric R.

description: Came on a Saturday afternoon and there was a line out the door, but the line went by quickly. They take your order first, and then you pay at the register. I ordered the special breakfast sandwich and the cinnamon bun (which you can get heated as well if you want to eat it on the spot). Got my order and 2 bites into the sandwich I realized they gave me the normal one and not the special one (the special one has avocado and jack cheese). Told the employee at the register and got my order fixed. All in all, a great sandwich and cinnamon bun, just unfortunate that they got my order incorrect.
author: Megan K.

description: This place is packed on a Saturday morning in the Sunset by Ocean Beach. A mix of people coming out for a tasty breakfast bite or drink. I got a ginger cookie, special breakfast sandwich, and a lemon donut. I didn't get a drink. I waited 20 minutes for the sandwich. It was all good, but I felt guilty after for indulging in this food. It was very crowded and slow. Out by Ocean Beach, this spot is special I'd say. I don't come around that often.
author: Denise C.

description:
Breakfast. Sammich. JUST. DO IT! 

Oh wait; *Ahem*... SPECIAL. Breakfast. Sammich. You. Better. Do. It. NOOOW!!!

It's called special because damnit, that thang IS special! You don't know how many times I've traveled outside of the Bay for a damn biscuit sammich and said "Maaan, I wish we had something like this in the Bay!". Aaaaand then, BOOM I finally discover this place! Why oh whyyyy did it take me so long to discover it! I've been missing out in life, but NOW... I have the Devil's Teeth Baking Co to fulfill my biscuit sandwich craving! 

Located in the Outer Sunset District just a few blocks away from beautiful Ocean Beach, lay this wonderful little piece of baked goods heaven. Cookies, muffins, cinnamon rolls, coffee cakes, and............ BREAKFAST SAMMICHES that are to DIE for! The BISCUITS! Laaawd GEE-ZUS! Just gimme sooome! So, so, so, soooo good! Yes, this is one of those crazy places where you have to wait in a long line... and YES you should without a doubt just do it! 

Those biscuits bay-beh! Warm, soft, buttery, and flaky. Melting away in your mouth like chocolate. Mm mm mmmm! And their special breakfast sandwich; a buttermilk biscuit filled with 2 scrambled eggs, lemon-garlic aioli, pepper-jack cheese, avocado, and bacon!!!!!!!!! Now if THAT don't make the sun shine, then I honestly don't know what else will! It sounds like a lot, but TRUST meeeee! That biscuit sammy is LIFE. Period. While I was eating this at the beach, I just couldn't stop shaking my head... couldn't keep my eyes open. I was just trying to cherish the taste of this biscuit sandwich forever. 

Okay. I've gotta move on from the biscuit sandwich, but dayuuum. I want another one now! Anyways... their cinnamon rolls are Godly! I swear that cinnamon roll weighed at least a pound! For $5, you can get one of the biggest cinnamon rolls evaaa! Their chai latte was very delicious as well and was served so hot that I almost burned my tongue. The lines can get long, but they move pretty quickly. Everyone in that store is hard at work. With lines out the door like that, there's really no time to fool around. 

Seating is limited to outside and is pretty sparse. But with Ocean Beach being just a few blocks away, just take it to go and enjoy that baby right on the beach! I highly, HIGHLY recommend this place! One of the best breakfast sandwiches that I've ever had, sincerely! Until we meet again special breakfast sammich, I'll be dreaming about you...
author: Shayla B.

description:
If you only order one thing, get the special breakfast sandwich with the aioli and avocado. But really, you shouldn't order just one thing because why?? This place is so good and if you're willing to wait in a long line on the sidewalk and wait a little more for the sandwich to be made fresh, you might as well get a fresh açaí mango lemonade, a cinnamon roll, and if you go on a Sunday, a couple beignets. Ok, now you've done it right!

The homemade biscuits for the sandwich are flaky, so flaky you'll need a fork to help you eat all the yummy crumb flakes. Also, my pro tip, eat the sandwich there! They have this amazing homemade salsa with no to-go cups so just plop down on a stool next to it and enjoy!
author: Nitar L.

description:
The food at Devil's Teeth is good.  However, the wait can be ridiculous.  When told that there would be a 15-20 minute wait, and that 15 minute wait turns into an 70-80 minute wait, that is rather annoying.  I mean yeah, it's good, but I do not think it is good enough to wait more than an hour.  Heck - If I knew there the 20 minute wait actually meant 80 minutes, I would have just left.  But once they have your money, I guess you are kinda stuck.  That happened twice.  Once was a breakfast sandwich, and the second time was a grilled cheese.

In a couple other incidents:  They have bread.  I like their bread.  I am wiling to give them money for the bread based on the price on the menu board.  But the workers have to get authorization to sell the bread.  On one hand, that is amusing and comical to watch them walk around asking for authorization; on the other hand it is kind of like WTF?  Is this communist USSR...Remember the Soup Nazi from Seinfeld?  They are like the bread version.  I mean stood in line for 15 minutes to buy bread, not for a chance that I might be able to buy bread.  Why do they need authorization to sell the bread.   It is some weird thing  really need to sort out!  If they do not want to sell bread, do not put that on the menu board.

Additionally I find it weird that they tax EVERYTHING.  Even to go foods and foods that are not heated because that is not the norm, especially baked goods items.

The ready made stuff is good if you do not want to wait after ordering.  Unless it is bread.  I like the cookies.  The monster cinnamon roll is a bit much to eat in one sitting; either that or split it with someone.  

I will probably be back - but maybe only for occasional cookie or other ready baked item.
author: James Y.

description:
The Special Breakfast Sandwich is Godly. Top 5 breakfast sammies in the world. Yea I said it. Anyone who says otherwise must've came on a weekend when the lines wrap around the corner and the biscuits (might) take a dip in the quality dept.

Luckily, I came on a weekday & wknd. The biscuits are insanely fluffy, yet firm and keeps the sammie together. 
The avocado is supremely fresh. 
The bacon is crispy and delicious. 
The eggs are pure excellence. Light and plentiful instead of hard or fried. 
The lemon garlic aioli sauce is such a perfect compliment to the sandwich.

Their desserts are bomb too. Cinnamon roll and donut muffin are lit.

Start your Cali day off right. Stop scrolling thru Yelp and go get this outstanding breakfast sandwich now. Worry about the rest later.
author: Jay G.

description:
Who knew a bakery in San Francisco would have the best biscuit I've had yet?? The breakfast sandwich special here has to be one of the best forms of biscuit EVER. And when you order it, you can see it made fresh in the open kitchen behind the counter. Talk about made to order! Judging by the other Yelp reviews I knew it was going to be a pretty hefty sandwich, but I still couldn't resist the other baked goods at the counter! So I ended up also ordering an entire loaf of sourdough bread, which was also really delicious and not terribly expensive ($6 for a huge loaf). 

I think everyone knows the special is what this bakery is known for, but their other baked goods are equally good too!
author: Jessica H.

description:
One unexpected perk of being an SF State student?  Having access to the Devil's Teeth Baking Company pop-up every Thursday from 10 am to 3 pm at the Farmer's Market right outside the Humanities building.  Some of my fondest memories involve DTBC brownies and I hold them up as a standard - not too cakey, not too fudge-like either, with a nice crust that you can sink your teeth into.  

Since graduating, I hardly ever try to make it into the Sunset area of SF.  This past Saturday, however, was an exception.  My two gal pals and I had a calligraphy class at 10 am in Hayes Valley and decided to swing by DT to check out the breakfast sandwiches my friend Jacque C. raves about.  We lucked out and found parking right outside and just a few other people in line.  It was an unusually sunny day and there were plenty of people seated on the benches right outside.  

The crew at DT works really efficiently and we placed and received our order of sandwiches in what felt like less than five minutes.  After snapping some pics in front of the shark painted on the right side wall, we were off to our class.  

On the way there I began tucking into the special breakfast sandwich and HOLY... I felt like I was transported back to Pine State Biscuits in Portland.  The biscuit is moist, flaky and buttery without having any artificial flavor or feel (you know that coated feeling that sometimes lingers on the roof of your mouth after eating movie theater popcorn?).  The bacon was perfectly cooked as well and added some crunch to go with the smooth, rich slices of avocado, the melted pepper jack cheese, scrambled eggs and the lemon-garlic aioli.  For $6.75 - heaven!  I'm so glad I don't live in the Sunset area because I would legitimately find myself at DT every single morning.

I kind of wish they expanded the biscuit sandwich offerings, but other than that, no complaints just compliments for this SF gem.
author: Iona C.

description:
It's been the better half of a year since we were last at Devil's Teeth Baking Company. Boy, have things changed - for the better!

As much as I enjoy their food, we don't make it in this area early enough to catch all the goodies in the morning very often. This past weekend though we made the trek on the way to a hike.

We ordered a Special Breakfast Sandwich, a slice of carrot cake, and a giant cinnamon roll. The breakfast sandwich was amazing - equal portions of the ingredients and big and fluffier biscuit; much improved from last time. Carrot cake was the same; I forgot it didn't have as much spice as I prefer so it was still good but not my fave. Finally tried the famous cinnamon roll and it was solid. Made with their biscuit dough, it's sweet and buttery. I didn't long for a glaze but it wouldn't hurt.

Wait time for their beignets was quoted at 25 min so we skipped it but we were good with the bounty we did get.

Arrive early and hungry.
author: Lindsey C.

description:
Believe the hype y'all, the special breakfast sandwich here is truly amazing! The biscuit is deliciously buttery and actually held the contents of the sandwich well together, lemon-garlic aioli brought a nice tang, they aren't cheap with the bacon & egg, and pepper jack, I feel, is the perfect choice in cheese! Avocado was a bit unnecessary for me since there was so much sauce. Ended up being a bit messy. 7$ sounds like a lot for a breakfast sandwich but trust me, it's huge and will fill you up! 

I did buy one of the shark cookies for my nephew and he did not enjoy it. I took a bite and it definitely wasn't fresh. Their mocha is pretty good, not too sweet.

Seating inside is pretty limited. I'd say there's enough to seat 7-8 people. Came in on a rainy Thursday morning and was able to enjoy my breakfast inside. Many blocks and benches available outside on a nice day.
author: Mary R.

description:
So I don't really get the hype...

30+ minute lines on the weekends is something I'm fine with if the food is amazing... But it really wasn't. 

The biscuit... It's suppose to be buttery and amazing. It was dry and stale. 

I ordered the special breakfast sandwich for $7. First off, upon receiving the sandwich, they gave me the wrong one... Make sure to check your food before you leave so you know you got the correct order. 

While the buscuit was dry and stale, everything else was just mushy. It was not a good combination. 

Seriously... What gives?
author: Mandi W.

description:
BEST BREAKFAST SANDWICH EVER! 

Get the special breakfast sandwich and eat it sitting outside on the mini park. The sandwich is made with this perfectly flakey and moist biscuit with scrambled eggs, thick cut bacon, avocado and a sauce that ties it all together. 

Reasonably priced as well. I would recommend buying two though as it's so good you'll want seconds for sure.

I will go out of my way to get this sandwich at least once a week.
author: Michael P.

description: I have had this on my list of places to go for ages and finally had the opportunity to stop by shortly before they closed the other day. Several things caught my eye (beignets! made to order! shark cookies, so cute!) but I ended up ordering a lemon bar, a strawberry banana muffin (at the staff recommendation), dog treats to bring home for my pup, and a lemonade. I wasn't super impressed with the lemon bar but the muffin was wonderful and my dog LOVED the treats. The lemonade was very fresh and refreshing. The guy who served us behind the counter was very friendly and we had a great experience. All in all, I'm glad I stopped by and would do so again!
author: Tayler K.

description:
Breakfast sandwich is still the thing to get here.  I personally like the regular versus the special but whatever floats your boat.  Again aioli and avocado is too much.  I prefer one or the other.  

As usual we ordered to go so we can enjoy it at Ocean Beach which is three short blocks away.  No beignets this time.  They only have them on Sundays.  Line as long as usual but goes quick.  

Regular and special breakfast sandwich with donut muffin and grilled cheese this time.  
Donut muffin was too sweet for my taste.  It's muffin dough, soft and crumbly, sprinkled with cinnamon sugar.  Smelled like churros.  Not my favorite.  
Grilled cheese was $5.  Not worth it.  Looks like something I can make at home for far less.  It was more disappointing when I realized it was burnt.  

Stick to the breakfast sandwich.  Biscuit, egg, bacon, and cheese.  Best I've ever had.
author: Naty D.

description: Cinnamon bread. That's literally all that you need. You're welcome. :)
author: Alan D.

description:
I was super looking forward to my trip here but was sorely disappointed. The shop itself is bustling and charming with the volume of people necessary to tell all passers-by it's a good place to eat - but the food really didn't live up to that. 

We didn't try the famed breakfast sandwich because I'm more of a sausage breakfast sandwich person, but we did get the lemon bar, cinnamon rolls, and a sourdough loaf. The lemon bar was par for the course - not stunning but a good enough lemon bar. The sourdough loaf was tasty with a chewy texture but not the structure and air holes you'd find in a traditional loaf. 

The biggest disappointment was the cinnamon roll - it clearly would have been good while fresh, but was cold by the time we bought them at 10am - and they don't reheat them so your options are to eat it cold or take it home and heat it yourself. As such, it was SATURATED with butter, and not in the good way. I also missed the traditional cream cheese icing, which they don't offer. 

Really wanted to love this place, but while it was "bad," I definitely won't be back.
author: Kim B.

description:
A Sunset classic! 

Always come here for their famous breakfast sandwiches, and they never disappoint. My boyfriend loves the classic (eggs, cheddar, bacon on a biscuit), but I prefer the special (eggs, pepper jack, avo, bacon, aioli on a biscuit). Best part is it's under $10, and these days if I can get anything in San Francisco for less than $10 I'm pleased!

In addition to the sandos, I always enjoy their beignets and have been satisfied with the few other pastries I've tried.
author: Jessie K.

description:
The Breakfast Sandwich description is b.s.

They definitely did not use 2 scrambled eggs in my sad little biscuit sandwich. 

I was a fan of the biscuit sandwich on my first visit because I was blinded by the novelty of getting a bacon egg and cheese biscuit at a cute place. 

On my second visit, I don't think we even got a full egg in the each of the sandwiches - unless they're using two tiny quail eggs. They need someone on quality control here.

The same awesome cashier was working there. He is smiley and very nice. The only reason I haven't dropped them to a 2 star.
author: Thien H.

description:
Say goodbye to gluten free, vegan, and healthy options because devils teeth baking company whips up a storm with amazingly delicious breakfast sandwiches, cinnamon buns, quiche, scones, lemon bars, brownies, and more! 

A Saturday morning and two hungry stomachs brought my boyfriend and I to the cafe. We came by around 9:30am and the line was out the door. Surprisingly, the wait wasn't too long and within 10 minutes we placed our order.

My boyfriend ordered the special breakfast sandwich which included bacon, avocado, jack cheese, egg, lemon garlic aioli all sandwiched in between a biscuit. For here or to go, these sandwiches are packed in a foil sheet which makes for easy eating. In regards to the taste, I would say BOOM DYNAMITE! It was really tasty and once you pour some hot sauce on the sandwich, you're truly offered an explosion of flavors in your mouth.
author: Briana H.

description:
Don't make the mistake of ordering a BLT(although it is also very good) instead of the Special Breakfast Sandwich even if it's not breakfast time anymore.. Don't even look at any other item on the menu!  
The SBS comes on a perfectly moist buttery biscuit, with eggs, cheese, avocado, crispy thick bacon and their special sauce that is out of this world good. All for only $7!
I've only gone on the weekends and the line is usually out the door, but totally worth the wait! 
Hoping to go again this weekend and will probably order two because it's just that good (:
author: Molly M.

description:
Not sure this place lives up to all the hype. We arrived here on a Sunday morning to find the line slightly out the door. I really only wanted a simple breakfast sandwich....biscuit, egg, bacon and cheese.

Ten mins later, I got to place my order. There was no place to wait inside since it was jam packed with people eating and waiting for their names to be called, so I ended up waiting outside. No big deal, that's what happens when a place gets a lot of hype and its a busy Sunday morning.

My name got called another ten minutes later and I got my sandwich. Meanwhile I waited for a friend to get his in which he never did and got his money back. I took a bite as we left and couldn't help think that this sandwich was okay, but nothing that stood out or worth a long wait. I'd try them again if I was in the area on a less crowded week day.
author: Joseph H.

description:
Disclaimer: They lost a star due to wait...and meh coffee....BUT...
Eat here!!!! The breakfast special loaded with heavenly aioli and surrounded by buttery biscuity yummiess!  What? Crisp bacon, melty cheese and avocado perfection too?!
The line is long...so send someone across the street for a delicious coffee. 
Sit outside where the COLD ocean breeze reminds you "this is SF"...and local families with toddlers abound. Chalk buckets provided for children...thoughtful touch.
author: Laura P.

description: The special breakfast sandwich is so good and so filling and never disappoints! Line can be long on weekend mornings but it moves by pretty fast. I have yet to try the beignets but they look really good. I recommend grabbing your biscuits and then driving down to the beach to eat with a view! Will definitely be back.
author: Megha M.

description:
Absolutely fucking incredible.

I keep reading in the other reviews that this place is "hipster" but it's definitely not anywhere close to that word. If anything it's the opposite of hipster, it looks like a super-cramped and dumpy looking ocean shack that pumps out really good food and desserts. Parking is very easy and the service is nice and friendly. I ordered the chocolate cake and also the special breakfast sandwich, which was super fucking special. Like really special. Like so special that if it was a public school student it would have to ride on the little bus (if you catch my drift). It was awesome, and I definitely recommend it. Warm flaky biscuit with scrambled eggs and cuts of bacon that combine for an insane sandwich. 

Definitely recommend. A hot special breakfast sandwich with a walk on the beach, damn good way to start your day.
author: Kyle L.

description:
Finally made my way back to Devil's Teeth Baking Company!

Sorry, but outer sunset is just...very far.

Walking in, I was already set on ordering the Special Breakfast Biscuit Sandwich and a cup of coffee to wash it down...but looking through the glass, I was just called to order a lemon bar too! Altogether, my choices came to $14.10, which is definitely not the cheapest option, but was it worth it? Yes.

When the guy originally handed me my coffee in a to-go cup, it came without a cardboard coozie and yes, it was piping hot. I immediately turned and set it down on the benchtop behind me and when I turned around, he had actually come from behind the counter with my lemon bar packaged in a little brown bag. Considering how he could have just set it on top of the pastry casing, I really appreciated this little touch of added customer service. After setting up camp, my breakfast sandwich came out maybe 5 minutes later... 

Delivered nice and hot with ooey-gooey cheese and aioli spilling out, it looked absolutely delectable! And yes, it tasted just as divine as it looked! I definitely appreciated how much avocado they added to the sandwich given the price of those dang things these days (plus...I know places charging $8 for avocado toast that maybe gives you a quarter avocado...totally no bueno). If I had any complaint about the sandwich, it was that the bacon was little overdone. It didn't really have any meatiness to it given how brittle it was. Still, I can't complain because my favorite part of the sandwich was done perfectly. Yes. It's the biscuit if you're wondering. It was buttery and fluffy just as a biscuit should be in my opinion.

Definitely would have this again.

Coffee was standard, nothing to write home about in my opinion.

I opted to save my lemon bar for later in the day and it held up surprisingly well. Excellent lemon flavor and definitely a delicious little treat for an afternoon snack. Does it beat the cinnamon roll? Eh, maybe not but it was still worth the try.
author: Elaine Y.

description:
Pastries are still delicious here. 
Free dog treats on counter. Mochi says they taste great!
author: Brent J.

description:
As we stood in line on my second visit to Devil's Bakery, the couple behind us asked "is it worth the wait?" My cousin immediately screamed yes and went on and on about the place. I thought back to my last visit 9 months ago and sweetly dreamt of the special breakfast sandwich that I had. The homemade biscuit stuffed with crispy bacon, scrambled eggs, avocado and aioli alone made me 
want to move back to San Francisco. 

After standing for 20minutes in line, to my horror, I discovered they were out of avocado. How could that be??? There's a freaking produce market across the street! Well I'm here and ready to eat so I order my avocado-less special breakfast sandwich and a $1 Sunday special beignet. 

After sitting for wait seemed like forever, my name was finally called. That's right...between waiting in line and waiting for my food that was 40minutes of waiting! And this isn't your sit down kind of place! Maybe because there wasn't any avocado, maybe it was a different chef, maybe I wasn't as hungry but this special breakfast sandwich just wasn't as special as my first one. Did I eat the whole thing? You bet! Will I go back? Hell yeah! Getting their special breakfast sandwich is almost a rite of passage for all locals and tourists alike.
author: Celina Y.

description:
This place had the best breakfast sandwiches. The biscuits warm and flaky and eggs were amazing too. The bacon cooked just right.
Definitely recommend if you are in the area! Perfect for a quick breakfast. The muffins looked incredible as well.
author: Maddie T.

description:
The special breakfast sandwich is worth the hype. The soft buttermilk biscuit with a very lightly crunchy exterior was great. The eggs were fluffy and seasoned. The avocado, pepper jack cheese, and lemon-garlic aioli really brought everything together in a medley of deliciousness. The applewood bacon was good when balanced with everything else but by itself was too salty.

We came on a Sunday so we got to try the $1 beignets. I liked how it was fresh and seemed fried right before reaching the customer but I've had better beignets.

We also tried the lemon bar. The lemon was prominent and fragrant. The curd was quite sticky and a little on the sweet side. The crust was nice and buttery. 

Our wait at around 940 AM Sunday morning was not too bad (~15min to order, ~15min for the food). I liked how they gave you food as they were ready instead of waiting to give you everything together. It helps pass the time to have something to nibble before the grand sandwich.
author: Christine L.

description:
I really love this place. The biscuit sandwiches are amazing & the people are really friendly... especially Casey!

*BUT*

it's VERY inconsiderate to people who can't use sugar as a sweetener for their coffee. I'm a Type 1 diabetic and when I want the occasional latte or coffee.. I can't sweeten my coffee without the dramatic spike in my blood sugar. I always run over to Yonkers to snag a couple packets of Splenda. Please add some substitutes!!
author: Amanda C.

description: Amazing sweet treats! Got the dark chocolate cake which was moist and yummy. The lemon and raspberry bar were great too.
author: Sunil R.

description:
A friend in the area recommended this place's breakfast sandwiches so we came from Union Square to eat here! When I first arrived, I was surprised at how small the storefront was. It is located in a residential area of sunset on a street lined with several tiny businesses. I got the Special breakfast sandwich which included avocado. It was absolutely delicious. the main difference is that their buns are not made of english muffins but something resembling corn bread. Crunchy, warm, and delish. I love it.

Parking can be tricky but since you are in sunset, you are bound to find a spot if you keep looking around. The sandwich itself was not too expensive and came out just under 10 dollars. There is not much indoor seating and instead most is outside without tables. If you come with large parties, I recommend saving a bench or two while someone orders to make sure that you are able to sit together. Either that or take it to go and head down to the beach and hang out (if it isnt too cold).
author: Ori N.

description: Unfortunately, because I try to stay away from gluten, I can't say anything about their infamous breakfast sandwiches. However, I will say that this is a hole-in-the-wall for a cozy, quaint place to grab a yummy coffee or tea and catch up with friends. Not a great place to do work or study, because the seating inside is very limited, consisting of a small wood tabletop with just a few stool-style seats. On the bright side, they have an awesome-looking pastry case, plus extra seating outside.
author: Connie X.

description:
Love this bakery!! Long lines but only bc they have the best stuff. 
Must gets: special breakfast sandwich (it has all the works like bacon and is only like 1-2 bucks higher than a reg breakfast sandwich)
- $1 beignets on sundays 
- iced almond chai latte is a fave
- their zucchini bread is AMAZE
in short everything's great here so have fun stocking up in the morns
author: Julia T.

description: Damn, I don't know what kind of ingredients they use, but everything has so much flavor it's honestly addicting. One of my favorite unique breakfast shop. Their sandwich / burger isn't huge, but it sure fills you up. Also everything feels fresh and healthy, I always leave feeling content and ready to start my day.
author: Yuriy T.

description: We went here last week and of course we all had the breakfast sandwich-which was excellent. The chocolate chip cookies were pretty much like Mom used to make and tasted like they just came out of the oven. I could easily get hooked on those!
author: Kim B.

description:
That Special Breakfast Sandwich in the afternoon, which tastes amazing. I came here on a Sunday afternoon visiting a friend over in this part of the city. 

FOOD: Special Breakfast Sandwich. With all of the right bits in there, the bacon was cooked to perfection. None of that rubbery or too crispy bit, but just right. The avocado was a nice touch that was smooth through the entire biscuit. Definitely one of the most well-priced and tasty breakfast sandwiches I've had in a long time. 

SERVICE: They definitely make the sandwich to order, which took a little bit, but that is much appreciated for something that tastes that good. 

For its price and the quality, Devil's Teeth is tucked away in a part of San Francisco that is meant for locals. I know if I find myself back, I will be back for that sandwich.
author: Albert H.

description:
Special Breakfast Sandwich!!!

1) Do come early for their sandwich, otherwise you will get an alternative bread instead of biscuit like me. 

2) There is a line, but it goes by quickly. 

3) Great portion and inexpensive.

I can't wait to come back here again. I hope you give this place a try. Cheers!
author: Owie N.

description:
Okay, let's start w this. I love the Sunset. I support the Sunset. And I'm all about supporting the Sunset's local biz. But the foods inconsistent. Half the time I'm there, I've seen them "forget" or "mess up" someone's order. And the lines here are crazy af!! Ppl need to chill. 

I've driven past Devils Teeth at 5am, 7pm, 12am (basically all hrs of the day), and even in their off hours they're working SUPER hard to wind down and/or prepare for the next day. I can appreciate their dedication and their hustle. 

But here's the thing. I've been here more than a handful of times. And I get the infamous special breakfast sandwich. I don't eat meat, so I always ask for it without bacon. Same price. You'd think it'd be a dollar or two less. I mean, that or add something else in its place. It's only fair...

Then consistency. I've come in at 2pm on wkend to get the sandwich before, and it's amazing. Perfectly toasted biscuit. That sauce. The fluffy egg. Add this hot sauce that most don't know about. On point to the max. Then I come in at 7am another day, thinking it'll be fresher and crispier and tastier than my 2pm order, it's the complete opposite?! Biscuit is cold...almost a bit on the stale side. Maybe bc it wasn't toasted all the way?? Idk. And the cheese is hard and cold. I would've told them, but I ordered it as a to-go and didn't chow down til I got home :/

Anyways, my chances of getting a good sandwich is ALWAYS 50/50. And for the price it costs for a veggie special breakfast sandwich, I'm not down w it. Sad that I can't give my neighborhood spot more love. 3 stars
author: Jennifer L.

description: Love, love their breakfast sandwiches here! I wish I lived closer but whenever I'm near the Ocean Beach area, this place is a must for me to grab breakfast. Although, the lines can get quite long, but it does move! I ordered the Special Breakfast sandwich on 7/14. It took about 30 minutes to get my food after paying. So be prepared for the wait if you're extremely hungry people! I would totally recommend this place if you're wanting a breakfast on the go or eat while walking the beach!
author: Sally S.

description: Super cute local bakery! This place is busy no matter what time of day you go. Locals and outsiders alike flock here from the early morning to get their pastry fix. My go to order is the breakfast sandwich which is made with a delicious biscuit, egg, bacon, and cheese. The scramble is delicious as well!
author: Alice L.

description:
Special Breakfast Sandwich - eggs, bacon, avocado, aioli, cheese on a biscuit - is worth finding this place. 

Sit outside and enjoy the local color. 

One hour parking on the street - so usually you can find a spot easily. 

Coffee cups are too small. I NEED BIGGER CUPS! ;-)
author: Marilyn D.

description:
BEST PLACE TO GET CINNAMON ROLLS!

Move over cinnabon...you've got nothin' on Devil's Teeth over in the sunset.  Pick up a cinnamon roll or 5...awesome cold or heated up a bit.  This isn't your typical soft, fluffy, super iced roll.  This has almost a crunchy, caramelized top but soft and chewy with every bite.  The rolls are large and can be shared amongst 2 people.  

They have such an assortment of other items including savory scones, cookies, muffins, quiche, and breakfast sandwiches.  

They are only open til 4 everyday but tend to run out of things later on in the day.  Street parking only but easy to find.
author: Jen W.

description:
I love myself a good breakfast sandwich so when I found out about Devil's Teeth, I immediately bookmarked it.  But due to it being in Outer Sunset, an area we don't frequent all that often, it stayed in my bookmarks for a few years.  When Gio finally knocked it off of her bookmarks, it reminded me that I need to do what my tagline says (will travel for food) and finally sink my teeth into one.  

To get a taste of both, we ordered one regular breakfast sandwich and one special which comes with avocado and lemon garlic aioli for an additional buck.  I love the combination of the special as who doesn't love avocado with some aioli but for some reason I seem to enjoy the biscuit for the regular better as it was more buttery and fluffier.  Not sure if the combo comes in a wheat biscuit as the color is slightly darker.  If not, then there is inconsistency in the biscuits as you can see with my pics (darker and less fluffy). 

The line to order moved quickly but that was unfortunately the only quick thing about it.  I literally had to ask after a half an hour for an update as others who ordered breakfast sandwiches after me got theirs before me and a person that was waiting for hers found out it was given to someone else earlier so to me there is definitely a breakdown in organization that dropped a star for me.   

I am a fan of the sandwich although it doesn't compare to the one I had at Dahlia's in Seattle but the service was meh making this only an A-OK experience for me.
author: Joyce Z.

description:
IMPORTANT: Sundays are $1 beignet days (+tax). 

Many bakeries and brunch restaurants are popular on Sundays. This one is no exception. It will take about 15-30 minutes to order if the line is quite long and then maybe about 5-10 minutes to receive things you've ordered. Some of the items I bought were the lemon bar and cinnamon roll. These are already made, so these were given to me right away. I also ordered 6 beignets and a special breakfast sandwich. Everyone seemed to be getting beignets most likely due to the $1 special. They're also pretty light and tasty, so the special is perfect. 

The lemon bar is a little tart, but what should one expect from something called a LEMON bar. I really like that it isn't super sour like how some other places might make a lemon bar. The cinnamon roll is pretty gigantic and not totally covered in frosting, which I do prefer. 

Now on to the best thing I ordered: the special breakfast sandwich. If you're deciding whether or not to order it, remember Nike's motto and JUST DO IT! It comes with bacon, eggs, cheese, avocado, and a garlic aioli sauce. I took one bite and knew I had made the mistake of just ordering one special breakfast sandwich. It might look small, but they do put a lot into the sandwich, so it filled me up.

If you're in the area and looking for somewhere to get good baked goods and/or sandwiches, I definitely recommend this place!
author: Allyson L.

description:
My party decided to take a quick breakfast stop at Devil's Teeth Bakery before heading to a Napa day trip. We arrived around 9am on a Sunday morning and there was a line out store. We actually got lucky and found parking almost at the front of the bakery, although I can imagine parking get harder later in the day since you'll have to find street parking. The store is very small and intimate, which is why there most likely will be a line out the door. Besides the area where you order, there are tables along the wall where you can sit and stand. There are also a lot of people who just eat right outside of the bakery. 

The Special Breakfast Sandwich at Devil's Teeth Bakery is a MUST get item. There are two breakfast sandwiches so make sure you specify you want the "special" version. The differences between the sandwiches are really pepper jack cheese instead of cheddar cheese, the lemon garlic aioli, and the avocado. While the regular breakfast sandwich also sounds good, I think the lemon garlic aioli both really adds to the eating experience. I personally think the $1.25 difference in cost is totally worth it. To my surprise, when we ordered the sandwiches, we were actually told that we would need to wait about 20min for the sandwich (probably because of the amount of orders they're getting). The sandwiches are pretty big, and was plenty of food for my sister and I to share. 

We also ordered a beignet for each person, since they have $1 Beignet Sundays! The beignets were super warm and fluffy. They basically put them in a bag and throw a bunch of powdered sugar in the bag, so you'll see a lot of people shaking the brown bag cover their beignets with powder sugar (just be careful since it might get all over the place). 

Overall, I had an amazing breakfast experience at Devil's Teeth Bakery and would definitely try to come back if I'm in the area. Just thinking about the special breakfast sandwich already makes me crave it! 

Pros:
-AMAZING breakfast sandwich
-Good pastry & sweets options
-Opens early

Cons:
-Long line/wait
-Limited seating
author: Nina W.

description:
Oh so incredibly yummy!!!!! Before I even arrived in SF I knew I wanted to come here for breakfast and I am so happy I did!  We ventured here on a Thursday morning and it was steadily busy.  When we arrived we walked up to the counter, ordered and paid.  They then gave me the drink for my nephew and a cookie I ordered for him to have later. They began making our sandwiches while we waited.  I ordered one how it comes and one with cheddar cheese instead of pepper jack.  It took a few minutes for the sandwiches but everything was clearly made fresh and to order.  The special breakfast sandwiches were freaking awesome!  It was filling, tasty, warm and very satisfying.  The bacon was crispy, the avocado was perfectly ripe, the cheese was a good piece of cheese, the aioli was fresh and the biscuit was crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside. Very good!  I would love to return here!!!

In addition to their killer breakfast sandwiches, they also have a variety of cookies, pastries and freshly baked bread.
author: Angela D.

description:
So my review is based on a handful of their baked goods MINUS their biscuit sandwiches!  

Just like so many others on Yelp, the thousands of nearly perfect star reviews lured us over to DTBC on a mid sunday morning . We were looking for a quick to go breakfast option and thought this might be the place.

We were wrong. Line was out the door and many people sitting around also waiting for their orders, this is definitely not a quick option for breakfast.  We didn't feel like waiting so, we decided to head across the street for breakfast burritos. Surrounding businesses must get s lot of business from people giving up on waiting at DTBC! 

Anyway, while we were eating across the street , the endless line got us more then curious , so I decided to go ahead and stand in que. it took about 15 minutes to get the counter. I asked the lady what she would recommend from the baked goods under the glass. She hesitated for a brief moment before replying that  they're "known for their biscuit sandwiches."  Ok got that. So it was up to me to pick out a few goodies. I ended up ordering a couple of the bacon beer cheese muffins, a strawberry muffin, lemon bar, and a peanut butter chocolate chip cookie to go. Order came out to 15$ and some change.  

I couldn't wait to eat my gluten rich purchase, so when I got in the car,  I took a bite out of everything! Afterwards, I decided I could have waited longer.  Everything was just ordinary. Nothing tasted particularly fresh baked. Everything was cold and flavors were muted. 

The strawberry muffin looked like it was going to be amazing, but it was very doughy and I didn't get a very berry note at all.  The beer bacon cheese muffin was too salty and again it was cold and had a very odd dense and heavy texture . It just wasn't all that good.  The peanut butter cookie was huge and covered in chocolate chips and I had high hopes for the cookie. The cookie did not deliver. It did have an intense peanut butter flavor, but the texture of the cookie was not to my liking . It was very granulated, like it was sugar heavy and less flour. It didn't have that toothsome bite you expect in a large chewy cookie.  The lemon bar was the last item i tasted. The Lemon filling was ok , but the crust part was not that great . It was not flaky and lacked in flavor . 

What a let down! Non of the prepared baked goods lived up to the hype of a 5 star establishment ! I don't feel that "baking company " is an appropriate name for DTBC. In my humble opinion , they are not an expert full on bakery, based the handful of items I got to taste. If the biscuit is all their known for , they should think about changing their name to "Devils Teeth Biscuit Company " or identify as a cafe, which would be more accurate. 

Anyway, if I was in the area again and there was no line , I guess I will have to order one of their biscuit sammies.
author: Brenda B.

description:
YUMMMM THE SPECIAL BREAKFAST SANDWICH! Unique in its own way compared to other breakfast sandwiches.

Although the egg in it is not comparable to Eggslut, the other ingredients in this sandwich make it bomb.com. 
PERFECTLY CRISP BACON. Generous smooth portion of avocado. Flavorful aioli. Sandwiched between fluffy buttery biscuits. 
I tried the Donut Muffin as well which was just a tad too sweet/cinnamon sugary for my taste (and I have a giant sweet tooth!)

Get the special breakfast sandwich!
author: Yvi L.

description:
I was randomly in the neighborhood a few days ago for a meeting when I looked across the street and low and behold, Devil's Teeth Baking Company! I've read a ton of reviews about this place and have been meaning to check it out but, it's pretty far from my casa. 

Anyway, it's as advertised and holy moly, that's an amazing breakfast sandwich. You wanna know the best part? The biscuit. It's a massive sandwich that could honestly be split for two people and I highly recommend it (like everyone else). I also ordered a coffee and it was pretty darn tasty! 

I'll definitely be back on a weekday as the lines are a bit shorter but, don't let that deter you. It's worth the stop anytime!
author: Benjamin F.

description:
Get the breakfast sandwich, no matter what meal time it is. :) And perhaps finish the meal with a cookie.

Their breakfast sandwich is seriously good. One of the better ones I have had in my lifetime. It's really quite simple and the quality of each ingredient makes it really stand out. It's a little bit messy, which is the hallmark of a good sandwich.

Their other baked goods were very tempting and looked good as well. Next trip!

The location is really chill and the staff is very helpful and courteous. I feel like I'm in a small surf town rather than in a big city.
author: Cindy L.

description: There is a routine I have. On a Saturday I will drive over to Devil's Teeth Bakery, wait in line and order their Special Breakfast Sandwich, a pastry and a cup of coffee. Once I get my order I walk the short distance to Ocean Beach, sit on the sand and eat my breakfast while I look out over the waves. The SBS is excellent, the biscuit is flaky, the bacon is thick and the lemon-garlic aioli really makes the sandwich for me. The pastries are always good, had the donut muffin this morning. Try to get here before 9 or the line gets really long.
author: Will L.

description:
If you are in search of a large breakfast sandwich look no further.  My sister told me to look up this business before we head to San Francisco so we could put in on our list of possible places to visit.  One look and I knew I wanted to try it.  

We came in on a Thursday in the late morning and they had a steady flow of customers.  We ordered the following the special breakfast sandwich for me, my sister the same but substituted the type of cheese (which they did happily), and milk and a cookie for my son.  Our order was ready in about 10 minutes and we got it to go.  There is much of an indoor seating area and it was a little cold to sit outside.  

Once we ate the food it was very good.  I personally didn't care much for the ailoi but other that that it was good.  The biscuit was large and flaky, the bacon and egg was perfectly cooked and had fresh slices of avocado.  I think if I came back again I'd either get the same sandwich or try one of their amazing looking pastries because so much of it looked tasty.
author: Ashley E.

description:
Best cinnamon roll of my life.

These are large and definitely shareable. Unlike traditional cinnamon rolls, where you power through the edges to get to the soft center, this whole roll is soft and full of cinnamon goodness (but not under-baked / gooey). The roll is icing-less, which at first made me worried. However, the entire top of the roll is perfectly caramelized and crispy and sweet and amazing, so I definitely did not miss the icing I'm used to on cinnamon rolls. I got an extra roll and ate it cold the next morning, and it was still soft and wonderful.

The line was long but moved relatively quickly. There are a few tables/stools inside and a few chairs/benches outside, but it was packed and pretty chilly (summer in San Francisco kind of weather) so we got ours to go. 

Good service, clean premises, and delicious cinnamon rolls. The other pastries in the display didn't catch my eye, but perhaps they taste better than they look.
author: Nelya T.

description:
A beachy and young-staffed spot with pastries and delicious biscuit breakfast sandwiches!

I've had this place bookmarked for who knows how long now! Given I wanted something small, but tasty for my late breakfast, I remember this spot and how I bookmarked it for their delicious looking biscuit breakfast sandwiches. Plus, my co-worker who recently told me he loved them so I had to see for myself!

I ordered mine without bacon (default option comes with it), which had tomato, avocado, egg, cheddar cheese, and their house aioli (which is super salty is you have too much or use it as dip for your pretzel so don't do that! Lol). 

I'm glad I didn't have to worry about a long line since I came in the early afternoon. Try it if you're near, or if you have been looking to try like me! Overall it was worth it I think -- filling, reasonably priced, and tasty! 

Enjoy! :D
author: Giovanna R.

description:
Devil's Teeth was on my list of places to try. I moved to the area and I have been here enough to share my opinion. 

The breakfast sandwiches are popular and do not disappoint.  I only order the breakfast sandwich and somehow every visit, it needs clarification 2-3x that I only want or ordered the breakfast sandwich and not the "special."  They always imply that you want or ordered the special so you have to fight this battle every time. That's frustrating. 

The bacon cheddar muffin is delicious. I'm hooked on those at the moment.  The banana strawberry muffins are dense and lacking in flavor.  The cinnamon rolls are best served warm. They'll microwave it for you if you ask. Zucchini fig bread is also good. They're inconsistent in their servings though (thin or thick).  I have yet to try other pastries but some aren't very appealing. BTW, they bake at night, so nothing will be fresh out of the oven, just the assembled breakfast sandwiches. 

Let's talk about service, which will probably explain a little about the long line. There's the person who takes your order - sometimes they comprehend, other times they don't. Are they even paying attention?! You move on to the cashier and repeat what you just told the person who packed your pastries - sometimes they comprehend, sometimes they don't. This has happened just about every time I've gone in. Weekday, weekend.  Giving change was a little difficult for one cashier. She just couldn't get it right...and I bought one item. 

I think it's time to de-stress and give this place a break. It's too frustrating and not worth my time, line or no line.
author: Melissa C.

description:
Good spot for a grab and go breakfast in the Sunset, but be prepared for a wait on Saturday/Sunday morning if you aren't there pretty early.

They make a simple sandwich with eggs, cheese, avo, and meat if you choose. I'm not a huge fan of biscuits so I'll choose a breakfast sandwich on a bun over a biscuit if I can. However, their biscuits are soft and not super crumbly so it's still enjoyable.

There isn't much seating inside - you can sit outside on the bench or planters, or grab it and walk over to Golden Gate park or to the beach which is down the street.

They also have a lot of interesting breads and pastries that you can order along with a breakfast sandwich - all of them looked really good and I'll be back to try some!
author: Renu A.

description:
Perhaps it was the chance to spend a few hours with one of my two favorite daughters, but the magic of this place overwhelmed from the start. The line outside was about twenty five people long and then the wait after ordering was another 30 minutes...totally worth it for a great Saturday morning experience. 
We ordered some baked goods, and the best of this was the coffee cake. 
But the reason to come here is the special breakfast sandwich...after pastry and coffee we took these to go, drove to golden gate park and ate with the bison. The sandwich is on a freshly made softball sized biscuit, with fluffy eggs, avocado, crispy bacon and the kicker, a divine lemon aioli. It is a breakfast sandwich that transcends breakfast...
author: Brett S.

description:
The breakfast sandwich was DELICIOUS! The only encouragement I have for improvement is maybe a little less seasoning on the English muffin! But that could have been just mine. 
The pop tart was yummy but the sandwich defiantly won!
author: Marissa A.

description: I used to live pretty much on Ocean Beach, and this was the only decent option as to fresh-baked goods. If it was located anywhere else, I don't think they could compete with the seriously delicious options throughout the city. The pastries are heartier here, and less moist, flavorful, and delightful than I like when I want sweets.
author: Cat N.

description:
I am visiting from out of town with a couple friends, and our airbnb host recommended Devil's Teeth Baking Company. When we arrived, the line was shorter and still inside, but quickly grew and was out the door in a matter of minutes.
We got a couple Breakfast Sandwiches and Special Breakfast Sandwiches, as well as a couple coffees and peanut butter cookies to go. The breakfast sandwiches were delicious, the homemade biscuits were amazing. The muffins looked amazing, I regret not getting the strawberry banana muffin. I also overheard someone say the donut muffins are delicious. I definitely want to try to go back and get some baked goods.
author: Chelsea D.

description:
This review is pretty straightforward. Their customer service is not consistent anymore (2-4 stars, depending on the day), but the baked goods are as great as they've always been.

Yes, get the breakfast sandwiches, and yes, get the beignets. They also sell fresh bread and biscuits to go that I rarely notice people ordering. I can't vouch for the dog treats, but I see a lot of happy-looking pups outside. 

I hope they work on service, including wait time. 5 stars for the food.
author: Gloria B.

description:
More of a 3.5. I rounded up because I LOVE the breakfast sandwich here. The biscuit is flaky and delicious. I make it a point to drop by whenever I'm in SF. 

Although, the last time I was here....they forgot the egg in my breakfast sandwicheS. Yes plural. I didn't realize what happened until after I left and it was Christmas Eve...
author: Heidi L.

description:
This place lives up to the hype.  We had to try breakfast here once we read reviews and saw pictures of their food.  We got there around 8 in the morning and of course there was already a line, but it's not that bad, the wait wasn't long at all.  

We ordered the Breakfast Sandwich and the Special Breakfast and they were the bomb!!  You think it's a simple sandwich but it's not, it's the biscuit that makes this sandwich shine.  Honestly, you could probably split one sandwich.  The Aioli and avocado on the Special Breakfast Sandwich makes that sandwich better than the other.  I highly recommend a visit here if you are near the beach area.
author: David S.

description:
I've never been a huge fan of cinnamon buns or rolls unless it's made REALLY well. That said, I've never craved a cinnamon roll until one of my friends brought me one from Devil's Teeth. It was insane. Layers perfected with morsels of cinnamon sugar syrup between flaky, soft pastry on the inside and caramelized outside. It's so good, which is why they don't douse it in any frosting, exactly how I like it. This is a cinnamon roll that is wonderfully delicious through and through. Each bite is perfect!

Definitely get the Cinnamon Roll. Eat it hot! They do run out of these pretty fast, so make sure you come early, preferably before 9/10am on a weekend. Yes, it's early but it'll be so worth your while. 

Special Breakfast Biscuit. GET IT. It's so good. The biscuit is light, flavorful and flaky with buttery goodness. Then, filled to the brim with thick rustic cuts of bacon, scrambled eggs, avocado and a generous spoonful of sausage gravy. This is so good. I love biscuits and gravy, making this in combination with all the other ingredients a perfect pairing. It's huge too, so you'll be able to share with another person if you can't eat something the size of your fist on an early morning. 

Strawberry Muffins: made with fresh strawberries! None of the preservatives, just fresh fruits. It's delicious, a little tart, and not too sweet! Reminds me of summer on the farm.

Bacon and cheese scone. Also very good with thick pieces of bacon and savory rich cheese with every bite. 

I don't often drive out to Ocean Beach, other than to light a bonfire with some friends every now and then, but have definitely came here more since my friend introduced me to Devil's Teeth and all its delicious offering. It's too far too reach by public transportation, as are many great restaurants in SF, but the drive isn't too bad. The food is phenomenon, followed up with a nice stroll along Ocean Beach, with the smell of a fresh ocean breeze. Perfect.
author: Jenny Z.

description: Drove from soma to outer sunset and back to soma just to get the special breakfast sandwich and cinnamon roll for breakfast. Worth the driver (multiple days in a row)! The cinnamon rolls Sells out pretty early, but the sandwich is available all day.
author: Annie L.

description:
Bookmarked for a while, I finally paid a visit one early afternoon on a Saturday to Devil's Teeth Baking Company.

The main selling item that attracted my visit was the special breakfast sandwich. A tasty and very filling sandwich of savory crispy bacon, scrambled eggs, creamy avocado and melted pepper jack cheese in between two slices of crumbly warm buttermilk biscuits was absolutely delicious. The mistake was ordering only one to share. These sandwiches are made to order and it takes a while to prepare them.

We also shared a donut muffin and cinnamon roll. The donut muffin was crispy outside but very doughy inside. And the cinnamon roll huge! The edges were hard, so cutting it into smaller pieces was tough and sloppy. Both were worth a try, but I wouldn't reorder either again.

Overall quick service (except for the breakfast sandwiches) and nice staff. Very hipster-y environment and crowd, but a good place to get breakfast sweets on the weekend.
author: Priscilla W.

description:
This place is known for their breakfast sandwiches and that is what we got. Initially, I wanted the soup and grilled cheese but they ran out of the soup pretty quickly. We had the sandwich and I was impressed. The bacon was really crispy and it gave a great crunch to the sandwich and the biscuit was not too dry which is an important thing for me. 

We also had their cinnamon roll and it kept getting better and better as you got to the middle. Their sugar cookies were also delicious. Coffee was ok. 

We came here during the weekend, so there is a wait. Be prepared. However, the urban park outside this restaurant makes it possible to not completely hate the wait.
author: Mariana V.

description:
Cinnamon rolls fit for a king!

The shop itself is super tiny but for what it lacks in size, it makes up for in size of their cinnamon rolls. While I only tried the cinnamon roll (oops, probably shouldn't have come straight after brunch and ice cream), everything else looks delicious too. We're talking some real serious Costco-sized cinnamon rolls here. I have to say though, that the cinnamon and sugar inside was almost a little too gritty for my taste.

On another note, the guy working was awesome! He saw me with my friend and asked if we were sharing one and when I responded "yeah, why?" he told me that he would give me a larger one since we were sharing. This man is da real MVP.

In all seriousness though, yes it's a bit out of the way but it's definitely worth a trip if you're anywhere remotely close! I'll be back to sample everything else soon and I'll make sure Devil's Teeth is the first thing I eat that day.
author: Jason W.

description:
Unreal!!! Finally finally finally made it to Devil's Teeth last weekend after hearing it time and time again. My roommates suggested bagels and without even thinking I threw out the idea to go to Devil's Teeth and both roommates happily agreed.

You know the place has gotta be good when there is a constant line. We waited in line for about 20 minutes, which is not too bad at all. I was told I needed to order the Special Breakfast Sandwich but was also overwhelmed with all the other amazing baked good options. My roommates and I decided to split a bunch of things. We may or may not have gone a little bit overboard.  

I ordered the Special Breakfast Sandwich (it's served on a biscuit! sub cheddar cheese, add tomato), an extra biscuit for later, a beignet (shout out to $1 beignet Sundays!), an orange juice and an iced coffee. My roommates and I all split the coffee cake (spoiler alert: it's amazing!!!), homemade blueberry (?) pop tart (delicious!), soft pretzel (not my favorite...it was a little dry and needed some kind of dip like a mustard or cheese dip).

This is a quick order at the counter then wait til you hear your name called type place. We grabbed a table outside while we waited and enjoyed the sunshine. 

It is a schlep and a half to get here (outer outer sunset) but so incredibly worth it.
author: Ilana B.

description: Excellent pastries! Delicious! Also, got a half loaf of Sourdough bread. It was the best bread we had on the entire trip to SF. Will definitely make an effort to return on our next visit.
author: David S.

description:
When I tell you that the breakfast sandwich was quite possibly the BEST I've had in a long time, I'm telling you the truth.

This place is super popular so it gets a bit crowded and you could be waiting in line for 10-15 minutes but it's definitely worth it, especially for the special breakfast sandwich. I think what really sets it off is the biscuit. It was warm, soft, flaky and was the best part of this egg, avocado and mystery sauce sandwich for me. 

There really isn't anywhere to sit (seats outside are usually moms with small children and ppl waiting with their dogs). I went on a Saturday around noon and had to wait but it the line moved rather quickly given the large amount of people. If you visit during this time, be prepared to wait for a seat, eat on the random bench around the corner or in your car  . They're located very close to Ocean Beach so you also have the option of grabbing food to go and eating on the water on a nice day!
author: Angela H.

description: I'm really upset....I ordered a breakfast by phone to be picked up because as a muni bus driver we only have so much time in between trips to eat....being we don't have a designated lunch time Allotted for us.  The order was called ahead. Approx 30-45 min before I arrived. Only to come find out as I arrived there was a long line and that they hadn't even started on my breakfast order. And all I got was a sorry....really? So there it goes no breakfast....I'm sure everybody understands what it's like to go through your day without breakfast let alone deal with the general public on an empty stomach. It's so disappointing because I love this place. I've been coming here since they opened. They need to get it together here.
author: Derek F.

description: The special breakfast sandwich is is a MUST!! The biscuit is buttered to perfection with a crisp golden touch! Inside the sandwich contains a glaze with bacon, avocado, egg and cheese! The hot sauce in the side is a nice touch on the sandwich as well!! Will definitely be coming back!!
author: Chris+Lilly 1.

description:
But, it's so non-pretentious from the outside? Why is it so freaking good?? And how many of these beer bacon muffins can eat before it becomes socially unacceptable???

We had the hardest time deciding what to order. Clearly the special breakfast sandwich is a must (bacon, eggs, avocado, other wonderful things), but then looking at the pastry case, there are so many options. Do I get sweet? Do I get savory? The cinnamon bun is HUGE and lovely. Next time I would ask them to warm it up. I also may have eaten the beer bacon muffin in two bites? Whoops. 

I think my favorite part about this place actually is all the outdoor seating. Lots of benches, and a few tables and chairs. Had it not been for the wind, we would have taken our food and coffee to-go, and walked along ocean beach. 

There's even 1 hour parking right in front!! Like are you kidding me, no meters?? Are we still in San Francisco??
author: Steph D.

description:
I work in Sunset a couple days a week, so if I manage to get my lazy butt out of the house 10 min earlier, I have to drop by and grab a bite to eat. I've been here maybe a dozen of times, but I haven't tried their famous breakfast biscuit sandwiches yet. I'll get around to it sometime, but with 5 minutes to spare, I usually pick out a baked good from the display case. 

Everything I've had has been stellar. I've tried their sweet and savory muffins, cakes, quiches, and scones. My all-time favorite is the carrot cake and yes, I do eat cake for breakfast sometimes. It is insanely delicious. I am salivating just thinking of ways to describe this piece of ambrosia. The cake is incredibly moist and tender, and then the already perfect cake is lovingly smothered with a tangy cream cheese frosting. And on top of the amazing food, I usually leave with most of my wallet unscathed! I can spend less than $5 and be completely satisfied.

Unfortunately this place is too popular. There's lines and it's crowded. This is not a joint where you can find a table to sit and enjoy their delectable offerings. There is limited seating and the seats are always taken. And things run out. Parking isn't too bad. You might have to loop around twice to find a primo spot, but you'll find one.
author: Kim W.

description:
This is the Saturday, walk up breakfast everyone has dreamed of. 

We ended a Land's End hike at the beach and were driving back when we noticed a line out the door in front of this place. We pulled Devil's Teeth up on Yelp, saw the 5-star reviews and decided to give it a shot (everyone in the car was starving).

We each ordered one of their breakfast sandwiches and threw in a couple of cinnamon rolls for good measure. It took a while for us to get our food but, in the end, it was well worth it. The sauce on the sandwich is awesome, and we could tell the biscuits had come right out of the oven. The cinnamon roll (also right out of the oven) was incredible. So good that it caramelized on the top and was soft and flakey on the inside. If you aren't salivating yet, I haven't done a good enough job of describing this place, and you need to check it out for yourself.

So. Good.
author: Katie R.

description:
