This was a long awaited visit to Devil's Teeth. While they have more baked goods on their menu, I was there to see if the breakfast sandwich lived up to my expectations! 

In the outer sunset, I had no issue with parking. As expected, there was a line. Recommendations to go earlier to secure your breakfast sandwich and maybe miss a long line. I met my friend and we both ordered the special sandwich with avo, bacon, and pepper jack cheese. It was certainly a nice size, but not as big as I thought it would be. The biscuit was perfectly flaky and moist, and the bacon was quality. TBH I was a bit jealous of my friend's sandwich as her's looked perfect. When I opened mine it looked a bit disheveled, but there was no disappointment in taste- it did indeed meet my expectations. It is packed with calories, and Devil's Teeth is conveniently located next to the beach. We decided to walk off the calories up to Land's End. This could certainly turn into a nice weekend ritual.
author: Nova P.

description:
Can't get enough!!! A co worker brought in a bag of Devil's Teeth biscuits a few months ago and while I kept cutting them in half to "share," I found myself walking straight back to the kitchen to polish off the rest....four times (not recommended) 

I finally made it to the actual bakery a few weeks ago on a rainy day. The line was pretty short and we even got a seat. I imagine that when it's sunny it's probably packed, but you definitely don't need a seat to enjoy this sandwich. 

I ordered the vegetarian breakfast sandwich with the lemon garlic aioli. The biscuit alone is life-changing. It's flaky yet full of flavor, it's buttery and crisp and honestly what dreams are made of. The fact that the soft scrambled eggs, cheese, perfect avocado and tomatoes were piled on only added to the magic. Also that aioli! I don't know how they make it but it's really the perfect glue to tie it all together. Unlike Outerlands which is also a trek, I'd much rather wait in line here!
author: Sophie S.

description:
Yummy specialties but inefficient output. 

I came here in the late afternoon around 2pm recently. They had a few different pastries left because they sold out, which didn't matter to me because I was there for a sandwich. They also ran out of biscuits for their sandwiches, which is also okay for me because I like sourdough anyways! 

So I got a special breakfast sandwich and a cinnamon roll. The only modification that I had was the sourdough in place of the biscuit. I thought that the sandwich was really yummy. It was a great breakfast sandwich with bacon, healthy portion of eggs, and avocado. I liked that the eggs were pretty fluffy and the cheese was nice and melty. The bacon was also really good because it wasn't cooked for too long and the pieces were fairly thick. 

The cinnamon roll is MASSIVE. It's sticky and dense. Yummy. One to share for sure. 

The line for the pastries moves quickly and the cashier was kind and smiley. My issue with my experience was that it was SO inefficient. I really don't understand how there can only be ONE cast iron skillet for the grilled cheese. I watched the back of house staff make the sandwiches and I just didn't understand why that is the method of choice. I understand the TLC is needed, but one skillet and one grilled cheese at a time? with the washing and reseasoning in between... longer than it should take. The sandwiches get made SO slowly. I noticed that the cook waits for multiple sandwiches at once, but assembly time was SO slow. I would have liked to see one sheet pan in the oven with sandwiches moving on and off the pan. Like does that make sense? Because my sandwich doesn't need to come out at the same time as someone five spots behind me. I waited 27 mins (thanks yelp check-in time stamp). 

Overall, yes I would come again if someone suggested but I'll make sure to leave wait time.
author: Tina Y.

description: The sandwiches and coffee the handful of times I've stopped by this place have been great, but the last time I went in the area behind the counter and the kitchen look like it needed a serious deep cleaning. Its unfortunate because it makes me not want to return even though I thoroughly enjoy the food.
author: Adam A.

description: Food is great. Service is not. Just walked in to buy zucchini bread for my mom like the good child I am and as I am paying all the staff was "secretly" making fun of me for choosing to only buy zucchini bread. "That's all you're gonna get? Zucchini bread?" They don't know me or my story behind choosing to buy from them as I easily could've gone to Yonkers if I was buying for myself. All i saw today was a bunch of immature adults trying to pick on a teen who loves his mom. Whoever was working on 9/12/18 around 8 am, you guys belong in the new preschool next door to you guys
author: Ty T.

description:
This place is really great! The service was pretty slow the first time I visited, but it's been perfect since so I really can't complain. Everyone told me to order the special breakfast sandwich, which was great, but I honestly found the regular breakfast sandwich to be much better. It's pretty standard, but absolutely delicious, which I bought was mostly because the simple ingredients were the star (especially the biscuit, which was phenomenal). 

In another note, Devil's Teeth is just a short walk to the beach, which makes it a perfect stop on a weekend morning!
author: Kristin W.

description:
Reviews are right: get the cinnamon roll. It's pricey but huge so you can share between 2-3 people.

We also got the chai latte and iced chai. The hot chai was super spicy, too pepper-y for me. 
The iced chai was spicy as well but refreshing at the same time, which I liked better.
author: Coralie S.

description:
Located on Noriega and 46th, this little gem offers one of the best breakfast sandwiches I've ever had! Parking is street/meter. The bakery is tiny, but they have a little outdoor patio for their customers. Pet friendly (patio) and family friendly! They also have a little shelf of books for people to read. 

I've come here twice so far - Thursday morning at 11 am and Saturday morning at 8 am. The lines weren't crazy for either days. Plenty of parking outside. My bf and I ordered the special breakfast sandwich ($7) which consists of scrambled eggs, pepper jack cheese, avocado, bacon, biscuits, and their special aioli sauce. It is one of the BEST breakfast sandwiches I've ever eaten! It looks like a gourmet breakfast sandwich of McDonalds but it is so filling and good.

I ate my Saturday sandwich about 1.5 hr later and it wasn't as good as it is fresh. Definitely recommend eating it first!

I've also had their cinnamon roll and it is big - big enough to share. Unfortunately, I didn't find it as good as expected. 

I can't wait to come back! Y'all need to try it!!
author: Mandy G.

description:
Great food, really poor service.

Pro tip: If you run out of a certain item, cross it off your board or put a sign up. And serve your customers first-come first serve. I ordered a grilled cheese & soup combo, waited for more than half-an-hour, and finally got my grilled cheese. When I didn't see my soup, I asked where it was, and all they could tell me was "We're out of soup." wtf I saw 4 people walk out with soup before they told me they were out.
author: Aya M.

description: Unreal breakfast sandwich and cinnamon roll. Worth the 15 minute wait. If you're hungry, get 2 sandwiches. I was sad that I didn't and then the line was too long to get back into. DANK DANK DANK
author: Brandon H.

description: The special breakfast sandwich is amazing! Just came here today for the first time and will definitely come back again! Great food and coffee!
author: Katie M.

description:
simply put: 
one of the best (special) breakfast sandwiches 
i have had in a very long time

the biscuit is perfectly flaky, buttery, crispy and soft
all at the same time
the thick, savory bacon 
with the cool creamy avocado
and stretchy jack cheese
tie the sandwich together
and the lemon aioli is the cherry on top

so, so good
i also love how friendly and quick the service is
author: Clara L.

description: I got the breakfast sandwich and it was really good! The wait wasn't too terrible and i went on a Saturday morning. They did mess up on my order and it did kill my experience since my friends were eating without me until I got my proper order. The parking seems hard to find but I got lucky and found a spot fast. They have outdoor seating but those fill up quick.
author: Ilse V.

description: Uhmmm I love this place, like a lot. The first time I came here I got the oatmeal raisin cookie and decided that wasn't enough and also got the carrot cake. I've also had the zucchini bread and brownie....every time I'm craving something sweet I think back to this place. I also seem to buy two treats at a time, and yeah for myself, because you seriously can't just buy one. Also, the seating outside is super cute and everyone is chill and friendly. I was eating my carrot cake with a friend and this guy sat near us with his friends eating his chocolate cake and he pauses and looks at us and says it's so good. So there you go...I feel like you can't go wrong with anything here!
author: Melody Y.

description:
Sensational breakfast sandwiches and pastries. This is by far the best biscuit sandwich I've had, and it's because there's no place I've ever been to that makes it quite like Devil's Teeth. Specifically because it's on a biscuit. There aren't many breakfast sandwiches made on biscuits where I come from.

The biscuits are immense, and they are excessively stuffed. Of the more decadent options is their Special Breakfast Sandwich that has two eggs, pepper jack cheese, applewood smoked bacon, avocado and lemon-garlic aioli. Or you can keep it simple and have the Breakfast Sandwich with two eggs, cheddar cheese and applewood smoked bacon. 

The prices are reasonable. The Special is $6.75 while the Regular is $5.50. The pastries are extremely delicious as well. The cinnamon bun is superb and the muffins are a savory delight.

There isn't much that needs to be said other than if you have the opportunity to try Devil's Teeth, then don't miss it.
author: Julie T.

description:
Breakfast Sandwich Special... Enough said.... Biscuit was soft and fresh, aioli spread was AMAZING, Bacon, egg and avocado... BAM! Too bad I do not live locally but I will def come back when I go back to the city....

Get your coffee across the street at Yonkers :)
author: Charles D.

description:
The name Devil's Teeth is ill-suited to this restaurant. I recommend they rebrand as Jesus' Tongue Bakery. I believe this because the food tastes so good that Jesus would probably like it. (I'm assuming he has a refined palate and eats real food.)

I had the special breakfast sandwich, as should be required for all serious visitors. On a homemade biscuit is put tscrambled eggs, pepper jack, applewood smoked bacon, avocado and lemon-garlic aioli. Perhaps the best breakfast sandwich on Noriega Street in Outer Sunset, if not in the world. While this is the star, I made myself try some other items. I had the cheddar bacon beer muffin, which was a muffin, flavorful, and great. I had a peanut butter cookie, as well. So good. Because of how good the three items I tried were, I bet that the other items they have are also good.  

Expect a line when you arrive. But waiting in it is a great opportunity to experience a part of San Francisco that you've likely never had reason to go to and probably won't visit again.
author: Oliver S.

description:
4.5 stars!

Wow what a great little gem. DELECTABLE breakfast sandwiches and bakery items. Make sure you get the Special Breakfast Sandwich. The lemon garlic aioli makes it all worth it. Don't leave without some monkey bread, either! Hot chocolate tasted like it was from Ghirardelli's, but can't confirm.

Always a line, which it's worth it, so put a smile on and wait it out. They need a new system to the orders, though, besides just first names. Got my order stolen because someone else also has my name. Go figure.
author: Stephen C.

description:
My partner and I came here on a Sunday morning, we didn't anticipate the line.. but for a highly reviewed spot, it can only mean the best!
We both got the Special Breakfast Sandwich and it was worth every bite!  I will definitely need to go back soon!
author: Donovan R.

description: Missed out on the beignets sadly. But the breakfast sandwiches were great. Next time I will try to get their early enough.
author: David M.

description:
A small café in the outer Sunset that packs a big punch, in flavour and value.  It is best known for the breakfast sandwich-- quite good, the extra-special version with bacon, avocado dressed in an incredible lemony aioli.  If you like biscuits, you will love it.  Dough-nut muffin was alright.  I possess a less exotic palate though.  So...

My menu move at Devil's Teeth is the "Bowl of Eggs".  It did not arrive in a bowl, but rather a brown take-out box carton.  No matter.  Simple well-executed and YUM.  I add avocado, which was two small scoops.  YUMMER.  Super-generous portion of savoury perfectly seasoned scrambled eggs (definitely more than three) easily share-able.  Goes great with the nice hearty bacon cheese green onion muffin, chock full of excellent bacon.

Food orders seem more rapidly delivered than the coffee.  We were half-way done with our breakfast items when the coffee-- just simple pour, brewed stuff, not even espresso drinks-- was finally ready.

As far as seating, there are only several stools up against the window or the wall with shallow counters.  Tight squeeze to plant yourself inside to chow down.  Outside has more bench seating, but that becomes crowded too.

Warning:  the line gets long, best to try and hit during off-hours (i.e. not on a week-end morning).  It's nice to have someone to hang out with if you do get stuck in a line, so maybe invite a pal along.  Customers are friendly and plenty bring their dogs.  So it can be pleasant despite the waiting.
author: Jade T.

description:
The biscuit based breakfast sandwich here is insane! I come from a land of biscuits (& barbecue & many problematic beliefs), so don't take this thing I'm saying about the biscuits lightly. It's a big biscuit too, which is what you want if you're ordering a breakfast sandwich. 

The coffee cake and coffee were also awesome. Not a ton of seating, so take that under consideration. There was outside seating, but if it's gonna be cold, could be smart to grab an extra layer.
author: Stalag T.

description: Lived up to the hype. The special breakfast biscuit is the best I've had in SF yet. If you can find another one better, message me ASAP
author: Johny B.

description: The two stars are for the lemon bar I bought. The people behind the counter acted like they were doing me a favor by acknowledging me. There were 4 of them back there and 2 customers (one of whom was me--they weren't busy/stressed.) The young man at the check-out was on the phone and completely ignored me. I left the money on the counter and left the place. I guess I wasn't young or hip enough to warrant even a modicum of cordiality. They should have self-serve and self check-out to spare the customers (who don't fit their desired client demographics) the funky attitude. At least the lemon bar was good. Not going to patronize them--I'll just make my own lemon bars.
author: Constance B.

description:
I came here for the first time the other Saturday morning omg what a DISASTER.  If you are coming here for baked good/pastries/coffee you'll be fine, but if you want something savory THINK AGAIN.  

I ordered an egg bowl, which was comprised of 3 eggs, and I added bacon, avo, and cheese because why wouldn't you. 

The wait staff apparently was telling everyone who was ordering breakfast sandwiches the wait was going to be 45 minutes, so they all knew what was going down after they paid.  A long ass 45 minute wait that's what.  But for some reason no one told me I would have the same wait time for my friggin egg bowl.

So an HOUR GOES BY and all my friends have finished their coffee and pastries and here I am hungry AF, it's 1 pm I haven't eaten all day and I just want my goddamn three eggs. Also, I keep asking when my order will be ready, and they tell me "oh about 10 minutes" three times. -___- 

Very sad time. 

Finally my name is called and I inhale them and didn't really enjoy them because I was so hangry.

Wouldn't recommend if you're in the mood for something savory and not down to wait an hour.
author: Christina L.

description:
Fair breakfast sandwich with the biscuit being the best part, but not worth the wait. 

We came here unplanned and found a line, so we bought the hype. But I'm left wondering if the line was simply due to their method of serving customers.

The biscuit had nice texture and was structurally sound- it didn't fall apart as I bit the sandwich. So the 3 stars is for this reason. Eggs, bacon and cheddar are aight. I would have been fine with just buying the buscuits alone.

Even though the beignets were fresh, they weren't worth the wait in my opinion.
author: Raymond L.

description:
I come here for their breakfast sandwiches, cinnamon rolls and the tasty beignets they offer on Sunday's. While I'm sure each item contains your daily amount of calories, fat and sugar...it's worth itttt. Not so appealing is the long lines but the kitchen it pretty efficient (especially for the rush they see on weekends) and they have sidewalk chalk for entertainment while you wait for that glorious moment when your name gets called and that fluffy, buttery, salty, cheesy sandwiches gets placed into your hands. Their cinnamon rolls are divine, fluffy and sweet but with a nice crunch that comes from the bottom where the sugar, butter and cinnamon has hardened at the bottom of the pan. So satisfying. 

Please note that eat sandwich comes with a food coma nap at no additional cost...for me at least.
author: Paige M.

description: The cinnamon buns here would make Sir-Mix-a-Lot jealous. They're decadent, generous in size, and filled with that ooey gooey goodness. The breakfast biscuit sandwich is the best in the Bay. I'm not even a Bay resident...but taste it, and tell me otherwise. Taste and see, Yelp friends, *taste* and *see.*  Prices are fair, quality is top-notch, and service is excellent. Devil's Teeth also serves coffee if you'd like something to sip on while you wait for your order, or if it's a morning-must for you. Seating is inside (minimal), and outside (communal, expect an ocean breeze). My appetite is sold - I'll definitely be back!
author: Jennifer H.

description: Holy sht. The BEST breakfast sandwhich I've ever had next to Morsel in Seattle. Get the special breakfast sandwhich. They PACK it with egg, special sauce and avocado. I really wanted another one so bad but ya girl on a budget
author: Hayle C.

description:
I discovered this place on accident as I was getting a massage next door and I didn't know how famous this bakery was. I know they're famous for their breakfast sandwich but I thought their pastries were amazing. What I recommend you try: 

1. Cinnamon bun: The buns here are HUGE as definitely tastes better after microwaving for 10-15 seconds. I normally don't like cinnamon buns due to the texture and overly cinnamon taste but this place does it right. I love the doughiness of the center and the delicious glaze on the top. 

2. Breakfast muffin: I forgot what it's actually called but holy crap this muffin is like crack. There's huge bits of bacon in it and its the perfect size for a quick breakfast snack. Again, it tastes a lot better after being microwaved for a few sections. 

3. Breakfast sandwich with avocado: This is what this place is famous for and I thought it was pretty good but didn't wow me. The mixture of bacon, egg and biscuit went well together and I loved that they cooked each egg fresh in the back. It wasn't some premade scrambled egg mixture that they make in bulk. 

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Overall, this place is a must try and I like that there's usually parking around. Warning that this place gets really crowded on weekends especially from 11am-1pm. I'd recommend coming earlier or later if you don't want to wait 30 mins for your sandwich. I love that they have excellent savory and sweet options with whatever I'm craving.
author: Jonathan L.

description:
Conflicted between a 3 star or 4 star.

6 years ago I literally worked just up the street from Devil's Teeth and I'd get coffee almost every morning. The coffee was made to order drip Blue Bottle and cost me $2. The coffee was strong and opaque black. It was so strong that I had to stop ordering it. Fast forward to a year ago when I was craving some coffee, I went back to Devil's Teeth for a cup. It was no longer made to order drip, instead it was mass brewed and poured into a large coffee dispenser. The coffee which was now $2.50 was flavorless, bland, and looked like dirty sink water.

Skip the coffee altogether and get yourself a BLT or the curry chicken salad. The BLT is delicious as is the curry chicken salad.
author: Mabel Y.

description: So yummy!!! Went to pick up breakfast for Father's Day. Cinnamon rolls are buttery and delicious. Donut muffins are super yummy. Breakfast sandwich was buttery and delicious too.  A definite must when you're in the city .
author: liz n.

description:
Pro-tip: great place to take a date to pick up some food/coffee before heading down to walk along the beach. Even if your date is lackluster, the pastries will make sure the entire morning isn't a wash.

Rating Breakdown:
1.5/2 Stars for Taste --
I came here mostly for the $1 Sunday beignets, but when I saw the monster cinnamon roll behind the glass, I knew I needed to one of those as well. I'm not usually a huge fan of cinnamon rolls but this was AMAZING. I had my doubts because it wasn't fresh from the oven, but the compact thin layers crusted thickly with cinnamon sugar made me shed a single tear. Delicious. My beignets (I got three...for myself) almost paled in comparison. I thought the beignets were simply aiite, but for $1 each, they weren't terrible.

My date offered me a single bite of his breakfast sandwich (even though I gave this stingy mofo half of my cinnamon roll AND he ate one of my beignets. I'm not bitter or nothing) and the biscuit was buttery and delicious. However, I don't think I have enough data to speculate about the deliciousness of the fabled special breakfast sandwich (I do, however, have enough data to say for certain that this boy ain't gettin' another date, nuh uh.) I guess I'll just have to come again to try that sandwich.

0.5/1 Star for Value --
$1 for a beignet sounds like a steal, but the beignets aren't actually that big. I thought getting three for myself might have been overkill, but they're like...two mouthfuls each. I think I could have easily eaten half a dozen by myself (note: could, not should). Also, paying $5 for a pastry kind of kills my soul a little bit, but I guess that's the going price of pastries in San Francisco these days.

1/1 Star for Customer Service --
The workers here are super fast and friendly. The line is always out the door, but they keep it moving. Fair warning though, we had to wait almost 30 minutes for the breakfast sandwich. The beignets came out super quick though.

Bonus star because I'd definitely come back when I'm craving pastries...and definitely to try that sandwich! 

TL;DR: $1 beignets on Sundays, crack cinnamon rolls, long but worthwhile wait for breakfast sandwich
author: Abby W.

description:
Egg bowl. Cinnamin rolls the size of your head. Beignets on Sundays.

Need I say more?

If I must, almond milk chai was fantastic.
author: Haeley G.

description: The cookies are huge! Love the donut muffin and my son got a kick out of the shark cookie. Super friendly staff.
author: Hea T.

description:
This place was my weekend habit, but as time goes on I find myself longing for the good old days.  Can success create complacency?

There used to be a core staff that appeared to be a well choreographed working group serving their customers.  The last few visits I see different staff working hard in a chaotic manner with long wait times.  

The breakfast sandwiches are their signature and have brought them fame - fresh biscuits, creamy scrambled eggs, oven cooked crisp bacon and cheddar cheese!  Drooling!  The size used to be huge.  Now they are about the size (diameter and thickness) of an egg McMuffin.  

The bakery items are tasty!

I'll stop by when I'm in the area, but I'll manage my expectations to the new normal.
author: G S.

description: It's popular and I see why. Pretty crowded and the food was pretty good. However bathroom is kinda dirty. Mostly outdoor seating.
author: Ava Z.

description:
This is exactly what a locally owned small business should be! They had everything I was craving after a post beach run for breakfast!  

When I was planning on mapping my run, I searched yelp for food places that I can swing by along my route that was close to the Airbnb that we were staying in... and this just hit the spot.  Who can resist an egg sandwich made with biscuits just minutes old, veggies from the grocery store across the street, and fresh broken egg!  Then top it off with other delicious muffins like the donut muffin and the delicious and very filling beer, onion, bacon one.  Wash it down with a well crafted coffee... yum.  All this tucked away in a neighborhood that is frequented by locals, bikers, surfers, and people on their way to work...  I wish my neighborhood back home had a place like this.
author: Ches P.

description:
Worth a special trip just for their sinfully scrumptious breakfast sandwiches alone. Don't just get the "regular" breakfast sandwich. Go BIG with their "special" one - two scrambled eggs, pepper jack cheese, applewood smoked bacon, avocado, and famous lemon-garlic aioli, all on a heavenly tasty buttermilk biscuit. At $6.75 currently, it's actually cheaper than many breakfast sandwiches you'll see at run-of-the-mill delis and diners around town. And in any case it's certainly worth it for what you get.

Their baked goods, whether sweet or savory, are also delectable and reasonably priced. Yes folks, there's good reason why there are such huge lines here on weekend mornings. The food lives up to the hype.
author: Vincent L.

description:
Mr. A's Famous 5 Point 5 Star Review

Portion: 5 Stars (Medium. For reference, I'm 6'3" 215lbs I could have eaten 2-3 sandwiches)

Atmosphere: 2 Stars (complete and crowded chaos. I don't hold them responsible for this. It's very popular and they would have to expand)

Service: 3 Stars (takes a good amount of time to get a sandwhich. Be prepared to wait 20 mins)

Food: 6 Stars  (yea... that's right..  my first 6 stars. The sandwhich was one of the most heavenly things I've tasted.)

Value: 5 Stars (great food. Could be a little bit cheaper per sandwhich though. )

All in all, I would highly recommend this place. Sandwhich was delectable. Worth a stop
author: Arya M.

description:
The is the quintessential hipster bakery.
Coming from the East coast, I never would have thought a hipster bakery even exists.
Lucky for us, I haven't shaved in a while, so they served us.
The food was delicious. 
The breakfast sandwiches were excellent.
The sweets, were fine.
Get the cinnamon buns.
Go across the street and buy some produce and stuff.
author: Hal S.

description: I've now come here a couple times and Devil's Teeth hasn't let me down yet. You can always tell a good place when the line is out the door. Most recently, I got their regular breakfast sandwich, a coffee, a donut muffin, and a house-made beignet (I was hungry after running from the Castro to Ocean Beach!). Everything was really good. The sandwich had nice thick bacon, and their biscuits that form the bread of the sandwich is what they are famous for and it didn't disappoint this time. Coffee, from Oakland's Bicycle Coffee roasters, was on point. Donut muffin was perfect and a great snack while I was waiting for the sandwich. They only make this beignets on Sundays so I was pretty excited for them, but when I got them I was a but disappointed; they're small, and not really made like true beignets that are supposed to be hollow in side. These ones were doughier, but still good with powdered sugar. Overall, Devil's Teeth is still pretty hard to beat especially if you're in the Ocean Beach area. Go for a walk along the beach after. A great Sunday Funday destination.
author: Chip W.

description: I will say I am not a Dan of their breakfast biscuits. Too salty in my opinion but their baked goods are definitely winners. The carrot cake was soo moist and flavorful, the cinnamon muffin donut was perfectly cinnamon-y and not greasy at all. And the ginger molasses cookie was soft and chewy delish! I will be back service was nice and friendly but the wait can be freaking long so don't come too hungry.
author: Janet D.

description:
This place has some odd pastries, though they are very good.
They lose a star for lack of cleanliness and flies flying around the pastry display case!
author: ColomboArgentino C.

description: Best Special Breakfast sandwich ever. Thanks to yelp this is our 4th time here. It's only down the street from ocean beach and the sandwich keeps you full all day.
author: Rochelle B.

description: I had a really terrible experience here last Sunday. The girl behind the counter was in a really bad mood and was extremely rude. I ordered a vegetarian quiche, but they were out of it. Instead of saying "Sorry we don't have that today," she was dismissive and got angry that I had to think for a second about what else I could eat there. When I asked her what kind of meat was in the regular quiche, she was super rude again and really wanted me to just fuck off. I understand they are busy, but there is absolutely no need to be so rude and give customers that kind of attitude. She clearly does not not want to be there nor do I! I ended up getting a cold avo toast on stale sourdough bread (that wasn't even toasted) which took 37 minutes to make. About 15 people got served before I did while I waited patiently by the cash register with the rude girl giving me dirty looks. I ended up speaking to the manager, Chris, and another employee who apologized for her attitude and behavior, but my morning was completely ruined. I will never go back. I tasted the cinnamon roll that my husband got...it's nothing to write home about. Please don't waste your precious time waiting in line, just to get yelled at by their rude and untrained staff.
author: M J.

description:
Location: limited bar seating inside, and a lot of communal seating outside. parking is pretty easy- lots of street spots. grab a breakfast and head down to the water! 

Service: very nice considering how busy they are! I think food comes out fairly quickly (~10 min at 9 AM) but I've heard it takes longer. Line starts to pick up towards 9:30. 

Food: the special breakfast sandwich is sooo yummy! Absolutely loved it. I'm glad we got this one that had the aioli and avocado. Crumbly biscuit and crunchy bacon with melty cheese. Oh so good!
author: Shelley K.

description:
1000th reviewer! 

Biscuits so flakey and buttery! The hubby and I couldn't be happier having their breakfast sandwich. At $5 for one, it was not a bad price. The biscuits were definitely larger than my palm and had a nice amount of egg, bacon and cheese. Very tasty! You won't be hungry for a while. 

It was definitely worth the trek from the East Bay! I ended up getting a 12 oz bowl of their house granola for $3.75 and it should last for a week at least. We also bought a couple of their biscuits so we can have them breakfast the next day! For dessert later, we also got a Peanut Butter Cookie which was dotted generously with chocolate chips.! 

For the coffee lover, they also serve Bicycle Coffee!  Definitely want to return and try their cinnamon roll and other pastries!
author: Hazel C.

description:
Finally had the opportunity to try the special breakfast biscuit and it does not disappoint. If you're a fan of flaky biscuits (like I am) and cooked to perfection bacon - you need this in your life now. 

Total came close $11 for the special and a cup of coffee. Obviously this is not something for your everyday wallet, but still delicious for those special occasions. I'm sure lines are rather long on the weekends. Come on a weekday in the afternoon to avoid the chaos.
author: Alex H.

description: Epic breakfast and a great stop on the way to the beach. Dogs also benefit from the food with the amazing doggy treats. Definitely a local stop. The breakfast egg sandwiches with cheese, avocado and biscuits is to die for.
author: Alex G.

description:
CB4 come to life!  

Have you seen CB4? That movie with Chris Rock as a gangsta rapper, but we all know what the move was really about... the Big A** Biscuits! Well, Devil's Teeth Baking Company has these biscuits and they are so dang good. 

Special Breakfast Sandwich ($6.75) - Craving an awesome breakfast sandwich? This is it. A large buttermilk biscuit packed with bacon, scrambled eggs, pepper jack cheese, avocado and lemon garlic aioli.  It looks big, but not that big, but once you start eating, it fills you up really quick. I could barely finish mine. The biscuit is butter and fluffy on the inside, toasted shell on the outside, just the right mix ingredients and textures. Two fist bumps and hug for this sandwich!

Breakfast Sandwich ($5.50) - Buttermilk biscuit, bacon, scrambled eggs, cheddar cheese. 

Cinnamon Rolls - Decadent. A large roll spun in thin layers that is rife with cinnamon and sugar throughout the tender insides. A sugary glaze on top compliments this perfectly. 

Other mouthwatering baked goods I saw:

Coffee Cake
Shark Cookie (shaped like a shark!)
Peanut Butter and Chocolate Chip Cookie
Ginger Cookie
Oatmeal Cranberry Cookie
Donut Muffin
Bacon, Beer, Cheddar, Green Onion Muffin
Quiche

Lunch items: 

BLT 
Lasagne 
Chicken Curry 
Grilled Cheese 
Soup of the Day
Tamale pie

They have a coffee and full espresso offerings. 

If you are in the vicinity, hit up Devil's Teeth for some great breakfast treats! I got lucky, came on a weekday and it was only a 5 minute wait. I hear the line gets crazy on the weekends.
author: Howie C.

description: The special breakfast sandwich is absolutely AMAZING. The biscuits are so good you'll think you're in the south. I highly highly recommend coming here for one! I also tried the cinnamon roll which was to die for.
author: Megan M.

description:
It has been a while since I've frequented Devil's Teeth. $1 Beignet Sundays, anyone? Snacking on a beignet and hanging out on the bench seats of the public parklet is a pretty relaxing way to spend a Sunday afternoon in the Sunset.

Beignets:
To be honest, I wasn't too impressed with the beignet upon first bite. Like any other beignet, it is just a doughnut covered in powdered sugar. But after a few bites, I began to appreciate how light and airy the beignets are. Each of them are as puffy as a pillows, filled with air pockets, and leave a trail of powdered sugar all over my lips and clothing. 

Doughnut Muffin:
I did not care for this muffin-shaped doughnut. It was surprisingly dense. Plus I don't like anything covered in hard crystal sugars, because I find the granules too rough on my palate.

Chocolate Chip Cookie:
decent choc chip cookie, what more can I say?

Cinnamon Roll:
rather interesting square cinnamon roll. The sugary layers seem as if they were bruleed. This is something you can really sink your teeth into. The ridiculously sweet and moist swirls are really sugar overkill.

Kale Parmesan Scone:
I liked the flavors of parm and kale together. But like most scones, this had a dense, somewhat dry, crumbly texture.

Special Breakfast Sandwich - two eggs scrambled with pepper jack cheese, applewood smoked bacon, avocado, lemon-garlic aioli on homemade buttermilk biscuit:
Mr. Joy picked this up for me when he asked if I wanted breakfast and I said sure. When I unwrapped it, I came upon a monster of a sandwich. I thought no big deal, I can finish it. It was really quite hefty. To say it filled me up is an understatement. Perhaps I felt that way because I don't usually have a big appetite in the morning.
I thought the eggs and avocado could have used a little more seasoning. It needed more flavor. The biscuit was nice and buttery, but it was crumbling under the weight of all the ingredients in the sandwich. 
If I were to get this again, I would really need to share it with someone. Or prep for a high-cardio day.

Overall, I really like this bakery. Most of the baked goods are tasty and it has a friendly, home-y feel.
author: Joy W.

description: I was here yesterday, Memorial day. I had the Special Breakfast Sandwich (very good, packed with eggs and avocado), 2 cookies (bit hard and bit pricey) and a Cinnamon roll (used a lot of brown sugar and butter -too much). Line was not too long, started at the door and there is room to sit outside.
author: Winglo A.

description:
3.5 STARS. After hearing about this place for awhile, I finally came here for the first time on Sunday. I spent about an hour an a half here and during the entire time, there was not one moment when there was not a line, and usually the line was out the door. Tbh, after trying this place, I'm a little surprised. 

I tried the special breakfast sandwich, beignets, lasagna, chocolate chip cookie, and banana walnut bread. The better items were probably the special breakfast sandwich and beignets, but to be honest, nothing I tried really blew me away. When I ordered the special breakfast sandwich, they informed me the wait would be 25 minutes, but really, it was more like 45 minuets. The special breakfast sandwich has scrambled eggs, bacon, avocado, pepper jack cheese, and lemon garlic aioli sauce all in a tasty buttermilk biscuit. It was pretty good, but my only complaint is that the ingredients were not spread out enough. The bacon was squished in one corner and I could only taste the aioli in one bite in the center. But it is the item that most people come here to order and it is good. 

The beignets are $1 on Sundays and they came out fresh and warm. They are plain beignets covered in powdered sugar (shake them in the paper bag). If you like beignets, you will probably like these. And for $1, its hard to go wrong.

The meat (turkey) lasagna was good, but not very special. It was smaller than I expected and the side was all burnt and super hard to chew, making the edible half even smaller. 

The banana walnut bread and chocolate chip cookie did not impress me much. The banana walnut bread was cold and a pinch too dry. The cookie was kind of bland and not delicious. I shared the cookie with 3 people and no one really liked it either. I was surprised cuz so many places have pretty good chocolate chip cookies (Butter Love, Cookie Connection, even Peet's coffee and Starbucks!)

During the entire hour and half I was there, there was a lady shouting out names to pick up their order. Her voice was loud. There are no tables, just a small counter with a few counter chairs and an area to hang out outside with wooden benches. It's very SF hip. It's also located a few blocks from the beach. Street parking can be hard to find. 

Devil's Teeth Baking Company is a good, hip bakery in SF, very close to the beach. If you come here, I would recommend trying the special breakfast sandwich (if you have the time to wait) and the beignets for $1 (on Sunday).
author: Jean S.

description: I come here pretty regular, ordered a special breakfast sandwhich and requested no bacon. They literally wrote no bacon on the order, my sandwhich came and there was bacon on it. I was fine as we are all human it's ok to get it wrong the first time. I went back and asked if they can make it with no bacon, again, it was clearly written in the little tag. They bring me the sandwhich, and to my surprise, there was bacon in my sandwhich....yes the second time. At this point I just asked for my money back because I didn't feel comfortable asking them to correct my order for the 3RD TIME. Whoever the acting manager was just said "sorry man" instead of doing some actual service recovery. Not sure if I would come back here, service was not good.
author: Max L.

description: Delicious baked goods, easy service. The garlic aioli was delicious. Chai tea is unsweetened- really good.
author: J H.

description:
Review #666 - Devil's Teeth Baking Company

My cousin in San Francisco brought us some pastries from this bakery.  My Travel Buddy, Yuri, loved the Cinnamon Roll and I enjoyed the savory Bacon, Beer, Cheddar, Green Onion Muffin.  The flavors kept haunting us and making us want more...

On our way back to LA, Yuri and I stopped by for a Breakfast Sandwich, coffee, and some goodies to go. The free parking in front of the store is convenient!  
The yummy Kale Scone was perfect for me to munch on during my plane ride. Yuri was able to get a Cinnamon Roll. ..The one that was haunting her - whoa, that thing is heavy!  

The Special Breakfast Sandwich was filling and messy and has a bit of a kick from the aioli!  I liked the bacon, egg, and avocado in the middle of a large biscuit - It's a good thing we sat in the shop to consume it!  It held me over until my plane ride!

Service was a bit "gruff".  There was a lot of chatting with regular customers even though it was a busy morning.  Staff is friendly and helpful overall!  We'll probably be back!
author: Nadine C.

description:
Coffee cake is not worth the price 
The portion is a lot smaller than I remember and it DOES NOT taste like a coffee cake. 
Very sad to say this but Starbucks coffee cake is a lot better compared devils teeth coffee cake 

Also, who puts raisins in their coffee cake!? 

Won't be back
author: Selena H.

description:
I was really looking forward to their special breakfast sandwich after listening to my friend hype it up and looking at pictures on yelp on Saturday morning, but it was pretty disappointing. 

A fresh biscuit with scrambled eggs, melted pepper jack cheese, lemon aioli, and avocado- that's the special breakfast sandwich, but without the avocado it doesn't really sound special and Saturday morning they were out of avocados and had the option to try and fill the void with a slice of tomato. Sorry not the same. The missing avocado may be part of it, but the biscuit was bland and tasted like there was something missing. 

The line goes out the door and there's many people lounging outside for their orders or eating their food but the line goes quick. You can order a cup of coffee to sip on while you wait. They forgot to make my friend's drink but after a little reminder they were quick to get to his order. My friend got the cinnamon roll which is pretty big and rather chewy/sticky from the caramelized sugar on the bread. The chocolate chip cookie could almost be the size of your face and really buttery. 

Overall, the experience was mediocre. But I wanna give the sandwich another try when they have avocado again.
author: Jane K.

description: The line was huge but deff worth the wait. Amazing breakfast sandwich! The cheddar biscuit and the carrot juice were pretty good also but it does not compare to the sandwich. If you're in the area you should deff stop by and then take a nice stroll down the beach.
author: Nicole M.

description: Devils Teeth is my new go to breakfast spot when I'm in San Fransisco! I recently tried it when I was on my way back to LA and let me tell you it was worth the wait! The lone was long but it was a Sunday morning so understand. I got the signature sandwich it was delicious! I also got some lemon bars for the road and they were a 10/10
author: Tatiana B.

description: The line for Mother's day was super long so we decided to try it out the next day.  We bought the breakfast special with garlic aoli. Bomb! We also tried their yogurt parfait, muffins, donut, etc.  Everything tasted so good (better than homemade). What a gem!
author: May A.

description:
No question, the breakfast sando is amazing. It's the reason there is always a line out the door. But do try the pastries, as they are also universally delish. You might want to steer from some of the other items on the menu. They are just fine, but not worth traversing the city to hit. 

Also, beignets on Sunday.
author: Jon L.

description: Stopped off at this bakery on our way through SF. We enjoyed the Biscuit sandwiches, a scone and a cappuccino. All were sooo delicious! I am a big fan of biscuits in general and loved it! They even have a small container of homemade dog treats at the counter for your pup! Awesome place and super friendly staff.
author: Alyssa C.

description:
Rating their pastries:

Strawberry muffin: super good. Strawberries used are fresh strawberries, so it's super mushy and may be warm (so if that's offputting to you, don't get it). Overall, super moist, perfect portion, great as a breakfast item since it's not super sweet

Poptart: oozes berry jam, so would recommend not eating this to go. Pastry itself is multi-layered and very flaky. Icing is super sweet, be warned

Scone: perfectly crumbly, and love the blueberry bits in this one. Also really moist which I like. It's also massive.
author: Jessica Y.

description:
My husband and I stopped at Devil's Teeth after a walk a on the beach one Saturday morning. We were both really excited because we'd heard a lot about their biscuits. We're from the south east and biscuits are something we miss all the time. 

When we got there is was slammed (to be expected), but we decided to give it a try anyway. I ordered the special breakfast sandwich and a cinnamon roll for later. It took about 45 minutes to get our food which was the first turn off for me. I've been to many places just as busy that can get their food out much faster. And when we finally got the biscuits I was very underwhelmed. It wasn't very buttery, flaky, or tender. If you don't have a lot of experience with biscuits you might enjoy it more, but for me it left a lot to be desired. I also thought the lemon aioli was a strange flavor combination with eggs and bacon. 

Overall, nothing was horrible and if it took 10 or 15 minutes to get in and out (like most order at the counter places) I would probably be back pretty often. But, for the wait it just isn't worth it to me.
author: Allie E.

description: Wow! What a slow kitchen. Working in food as well I have never seen such a mismanaged kitchen. Orders being lost and misplaced. The food is great service SUCKS! Again the breakfast sandwich rocks!
author: Caitlin Q.

description: Unique and yummy breakfast sandwich, just what I wanted. Not bogged down with too many choices, either.
author: Ruby H.

description:
Devils teeth is home to one of the City's best breakfast sandwiches! The "Special" is a mouthwatering combination of applewood smoked bacon, pepper jack cheese, avocado, scrambled eggs, and lemon-garlic aioli, on a homemade buttermilk biscuit. It's filling and flavorful, and full of your favorite foods to jumpstart your morning and then sentence you to a full-blown food coma. 

One of my personal favorites is their luscious cinnamon rolls. Let's not get into how much butter is in this fella, or how it has so many layers it'll make an onion blush, or how one piece is really meant for two...or not.  It has a decadent cinnamon brown sugar butter glaze baked into every nook and cranny. The glaze is a bit hard on top so I like to take it home and warm it up in the toaster. So delicious! 

The donut muffins rolled in cinnamon sugar are a tasty staple and are pretty much what you'd expect - a cross between a fluffy raised donut and a soft cakey muffin. Perhaps they could have named them duffins? Mufnuts? Monuts..? Maybe not. 

If you encounter a coveted warm and sunny day, grab a breakfast sammie and head down to Ocean Beach for the perfect San Francisco morning. You might have to wait half an hour for it, but trust me, it'll be worth it!
author: Deanna Y.

description:
They had the best breakfast sandwich I ever had. 
I was in the for the weekend with friends and I am super glad that I came here for breakfast. Their quiche was good, but their breakfast sandwich is definitely a must try. Their salsa also goes very very well with their breakfast food. 
They don't have much seating, but people come in and go pretty fast.

If you are in the area, definitely a must try.
author: Susan L.

description: Line went fast to take order... however, customer be aware. it does take some time to make breakfast sandwiches. we waited 32 min on Saturday at 11:40am. was it good? it was alright. i think after waiting as long as we did, the initial excitment of people telling us how good it was wore off. that being said we'll take our $6 and make our own at home.
author: Danielle H.

description: Delicious breakfast sandwich, super popular on weekends so get ready to line up.  Biscuits and sausages and cheese, yum!  It's quite rich so best to have it once in a while but it's a delicious treat and afterwards a nice stroll on the beach.  Perfection!!!
author: J L.

description: Love the special breakfast sandwich and the bake goods are really yummy! The neighborhood vibes are great and they have a great parklet outside too to enjoy your food. Or it's a short walk to the beach!
author: Galina H.

description: They have best breakfast sandwich in town! I also love the donut muffin. Unfortunately, must deduct one star for the subpar service. I've been dozens of times, and I always get a strange feeling from the workers. They seem either too cool to work there, or they don't care about interacting with customers. I would see how impatient they would be if a customer didn't order everything quickly. God help you if you have any questions. It feels like the Seinfeld episode with the soup. I used to think that they were cold and rude because of how busy they usually are. But I've been there a few times when I'm the only person in line and the interaction was still curt and cold. Will still go here for great breakfast sandwiches, but I wish they were nicer.
author: Funk G.

description: I've been here a few times. What had me coming back was their cinnamon roll! It's the most succulent, sweet, and buttery cinnamon I've ever had! Plus, my boyfriend loves their scrambles. Also, they have fresh juices ready all the time! This place is great for breakfast. However, I've become vegan since my first visit and sadly their vegan options are very slim. None of the pastries are vegan, that I've seen. :-( However, I did try their vegan chili, which was very hearty and delicious! But I was disappointed in their chai latte. It tasted like dirty water. Overall alright place.
author: Jes Y.

description: Special breakfast sandwich was super good! The biscuits used were really moist. A breakfast sandwich with avocado and bacon in it is a true winner in my books. Highly suggest! It's a $7 breakfast sandwich with ingredients I could probably pick up myself from a grocery store, but I think the biscuits they use are what really bring the entire sandwich together.
author: Meagan C.

description: It was ok. It wasn't terrible but it wasn't amazing either. The line was super long on a Sunday morning, as expected. The special breakfast sandwich was underwhelming. It was good, but wasn't as delicious as I was expecting. The cookies were great! I would go back for those.
author: Hillary V.

description:
Wow. All other bfast sandwiches aspire to be the special breakfast sandwich from here. Aioli, cheese, eggs, cado, and bacon, on a biscuit that resembles two buttermilk clouds, is the perfect bfast sandwich. Had to wait 20 mins for the next batch of biscuits to come out but it was worth it. 

There was just something very SF about standing in line (which ppl were snap chatting) to get bfast on an overcast morning while playing with passerby dogs. 

The line moves pretty fast, it's the waiting in anticipation after you order that gets you. Go early, sit out on the parklet and let the sandwich do the rest. I've been really digging the outer sunset lately, and this place is all the more reason to keep coming back. There is also a San Franpsycho store right next door which you can browse through while you wait. 

Next time I will have to try some of their other items. In addition to the bfast sandwich, of course.
author: Thielson D.

description: Beignets on Sunday. Breakfast sandwiches every day. Good coffee. Sometimes has a long line.
author: Chris S.

description:
TL;DR - Breakfast sandwich game changer. Get the special breakfast sandwich. Just do it.

I'm not a HUGE fan of breakfast sandwiches at all. For some reason, biscuits, heavy sauces, cheese and just a carb-overload don't appeal to me at 8am.

After a long hike I saw that we were close to Devil's Teeth. I remembered a friend saying that they had amazing cookies and since I was in the hood, I decided to try this place out.

THANK GOODNESS I DID. We arrived a bit after noon on sunday and there was essentially no line. I ordered 3 cookies, (chocolate chip, ginger, and pb chocolate). But when I saw everyone outside eating the same sandwich, it piqued my curiosity. I just had to order one too.

Wow. Amazing. Delightful. Yum.
The biscuit is flakey and light, but also kinda dense? Everything in the sandwich was amazing and I didn't feel super weighed down after eating it (as I usually feel kind of ill after eating a dense biscuit). 

Yes. Solid 10/10 here!
author: Crystal Z.

description:
This review is for the Special Breakfast Sandwich and the cinnamon rolls.

ORDER THEM, EAT THEM, BE HAPPY. 

I first tried the cinnamon rolls a few years ago, and ugh. So good! I love that the outer layer is crispy because the sugar is caramelized, and then it's nice and fluffy and warm on the inside. 

I tried the Special Breakfast Sandwich recently, and I am so sad to have only just tried it recently. Why did I never order one before??? The sandwiches are made to order and wrapped in foil to keep all the goodness toasty warm. The scrambled eggs are so deliciously soft and the garlic aioli -- OH FOR THE LOVE OF AIOLI, so good. I'm no a big biscuit girl because biscuits tend to be dry and give me cotton mouth, but the biscuit was good. The ingredients gave enough moisture so that you weren't overwhelmed by the breadiness. 

Special Breakfast Sandwich, I'll be back for you.
author: Doris K.

description:
Absolutely love the Devils teeth Baking company. I got the special sandwich with no cheese,the sauce on the side and extra bacon. Definitely lived up to the reputation. 
I also got the chocolate cake which was the Bomb! Staff was friendly, line was long but moved quickly. 
I was even lucky enough to snag a seat inside to eat. It was extra cozy since it was raining. 

Overall 5star to me.
author: Frankie A.

description: First time here, and I will be back many more times! Great breakfast sandwiches (the "special" is wonderful) and the yogurt and homemade granola is a wonderful blend. Did I mention the beignets are the real deal served only on Sunday. Good service and delicious food with eclectic, diverse patrons makes it a good place for a morning SF style breakfast spot.
author: Mike M.

description:
Devil's Teeth is definitely devilishly delish. 

The hype is real!!! The breakfast sandwich tastes like heaven.... But I'm sure it has the nutrition facts of hell (Devil's Teeth is such an appropriate name). The ingredients encompass the guiltiest of breakfast comfort foods: 
- Buttermilk biscuit: Delightfully soft texture and butteriness at Goldilocks level--flavorful without being too rich
- Scrambled eggs: As good as gourmet brunch scrambled eggs. I don't think I can ever go back to those tasteless pre-made egg patties in breakfast sandos at fast food chains
- Applewood smoked bacon: Thicker than normal bacon and mildly caramelized. Indulgent. 

We got the *special* breakfast sammich, which adds:
- Pepperjack cheese: Could have used more pepper, but melted cheese always makes breakfast taste better
- Avocado: Excellent addition, though with the disappointingly small amount and heterogeneous distribution, only a few bites contain avocado
- Lemon-garlic aioli: Omg so good. This is an aioli that compares with upscale restaurants. The zesty drizzle packs a punch and does a good job balancing out the intense biscuityness

Delicious and memorable, but the $6.75 price tag is pricey especially since it doesn't include tax. However it's still somewhat reasonable-ish considering how everything is housemade, and the fact that breakfast sandwiches in bouge SF brunch places can be more expensive, less tasty, and in smaller portions. 

The bakery features a number of interesting items that look like the playful experiments of a creative and skilled baker: the famous ginormous cinnamon rolls, kale parmesan scones, donut muffins, even a bacon beer cheddar green onion muffin.

Oh and they have complimentary dog treats, because it's SF where there are supposedly more dogs than babies--so of course they would have freebies for dogs but not people.

I'm almost glad Devil's Teeth location in the Outer Sunset is out of the way; otherwise I would be tempted to always come here, and I'd be selling my wallet and my soul to the Devil ('s Teeth).
author: Edna C.

description: Love their special breakfast sandwich and at $7 it's s great deal for SF prices. Comes with avocado, bacon, egg, cheese, lemon aoili on a fresh baked biscuit. Took off a star because the biscuit is hit or miss - sometimes delicious and buttery and sometimes it's dry
author: Ben S.

description:
I once loved this place and would drive from across town for their goodies.  Not anymore.  Quality and taste have taken a dive.  Yesterday, I purchased a few items.  The lemon bar was fairly good but the topping was very thin and the crust way to thick.  Not a good balance.  Two bites of the chocolate chip cookie and it was tossed in the trash.  The cookie no longer has a nice buttery taste and it is now low on chocolate chips.  Bland, tastless waste of calories.  The brownie had a weird subtle funky taste which is hard to describe.  

About a year back I stopped purchasing the carrot cake, which was the best in town IMHO.  I don't know what they did to the recipe or ingredients but it isn't the same.
author: Donna P.

description: This is the breakfast sandwich of my dreams. I don't even know why upgrading to the special breakfast sandwich is an option because I wouldn't even think of not doing it. The biscuit was butter and soft with a perfect egg and this special sauce that rounds all the flavors nicely. Grab a few pastries for later and you have it made.
author: Dylan K.

description:
A must try: Special Breakfast Sandwich
The sandwich was made of a warm, soft biscuit. The sauce they put in it was so good I even licked some of it off of the foil. It had the crispy bacon and creamy avocado. Ooooo it's mouth watering just thinking about it. 

Their cinnamon roll is pretty delicious too. It fits perfectly in their to go box. There's a nice cinnamon sugar crust along the top and bottom of the roll.
author: Nicole S.

description: It's a cool location but the pastries just aren't that flavorful. I've tried pretty much every one (the shark cookie, cinnamon roll, croissant, and more) and they are all missing something.. Salt? Spices? Not sure what it is but for being a bakery in SF they could do way better. The egg sandwiches are the one thing I'd go here for but they take FOREVER to make them. Expect to wait a while for your order here.
author: Jamie Y.

description: Special breakfast sandwich is the bomb. Went on a Sunday. Had to wait in line...it moved fast though. They have $1 beignets on Sundays which were made to order and delicious. Atmosphere is nice. Lots of people sitting outside eating. Recommend!
author: Jessica G.

description: I am a breakfast sandwich fiend, and this one is well worth heading into the Sunset. One tip: if you show up in the last hour they are open, though many of the baked goods will be sold out, you can still get a breakfast sando without the crazy wait in line. Mmmmmmm.
author: Alice W.

description:
I was really excited to come and try this place based off of the Yelp reviews and so many amazing pics of their breakfast biscuits.

We came in early on a Saturday morning and the place was pretty busy with a steady line that was moving quickly.  The staff working there were all very nice and efficient.
We had two Breakfast Sandwiches (buttermilk biscuit, eggs, bacon, cheddar) and one Special Breakfast Sandwich (biscuit, eggs, bacon, pepper jack cheese, garlic aioli and avocado).

They were all "good" but  they are very dry.  
The Special was a little better due to the moistness of the avocado and aioli.
I know that is the nature of a biscuit (sometimes).
Not sure I'd go back just for this but I would stop if in the area and needing a nice bakery as they also have some other yummy looking options in their case, plus a full line of coffees and teas.
author: Joe T.

description:
Special Breakfast Sandwich alone is worth coming in! You must order it!

Bacon Cheddar Beer Muffin was a nice surprise.

Cinnamon Roll and Donut Muffin were delicious.

We also ordered a Grilled Cheese that nothing great and paled in comparison with everything else.
author: Gabriel R.

description:
Tippers beware; the service here is atrocious.

While I can understand a popular breakfast/brunch spot is a hectic place to work, however in working in the service industry, part of your job is, well, the service.

Employees handle the stress of a line out the door by trying to rush customers from ordering to payment as soon as a single item is ordered, not considering you might want something to drink with your pastry/sandwich/what have you.

There is also a general lack of care and attention put into the service; having to repeat your name over three times in a 2 minute interaction, only to have the name omitted from the order entirely.

I get it. Some customers can be rude, impatient, and disrespectful, and it makes working with a smile on that much harder. But the solution/response from employees should never be to react with general apathy and annoyance to each customer who comes through the door. It only exacerbates those behaviors in customers who start to perceive your work as genuinely spiteful.

Food is good, but really not worth the poor execution on the front of house.
author: Jeff R.

description:
Used to really like this place but today I had the displeasure of getting the chicken curry sandwich, which has...changed.  It's been micro-sized for maximal profit!  

What used to be a normal size sandwich is now a $7 sandwich which took literally only *10 quick bites* to finish.  It might as well have been a tea sandwich.  No, I'm not fooled.  No, I won't be back.
author: Femita J.

description:
Opens at 7:00AM without fail and has some of the most unique pastries in the city. 

The staff is friendly, the service is quick, and the pastries are more then satisfying. I highly recommend stopping by and trying the variety of muffins they have and if you're sharing, their cinnamon rolls are delicious and enormous!
author: Brian H.

description:
Wow. Can you say best breakfast sandwich ever?? This tiny little bakery will most likely be PACKED when you arrive, with very little space to wait for your sandwich, so get comfy with the strangers. 
We came here on a rainy Sunday morning to take advantage of the beignets (Sundays only, $1!)
We thought we were lucky with no line out the door, but little did we know that everyone else inside was waiting for their food. We ended up having to wait 20 mins for our breakfast sandwich, but it was SO WORTH IT.

Trust. 

Flaky, buttery biscuit holding fluffy eggs, bacon, cheese, avocado, and the best part..CRACK SAUCE. I have no idea what makes up this sauce, but it is absolutely amazing! and really brings the whole sandwich together. I ended up sharing it with Christie L. and it was definitely enough for the both of us since we also got a beignet each. 

We also tried the kale scone and bacon/cheddar muffin. Both were really good! also very buttery. I liked the kale scone better, but it was a bit heavy. Little pieces were good though!

But the one thing you MUST get is definitely the SPECIAL BREAKFAST SANDWICH. 
I wanted to try the cinnamon roll too, but our poor stomachs couldn't handle it. NEXT TIME!! I will be back.
author: Kimmy U.

description: this review is for the scones and  muffins!  I think they are over price the scones were dry and the muffins lack of flavor!!!!  I have eaten much much better pastries in other places for the same price!!!! I do not think I will go back !!! actually  across the street from the bakery  there is a little market that sells better pastries  !!!!
author: Cecilia C.

description:
If you like your breakfast sandwiches and pastries for breakfast, I think you have to add this to your list of places to try. 

Came here on Monday morning around 10 something. Plenty of street parking that's free, but only one hour. I hear the weekend can get really cray with wait times, but today it was okay. Enter through the left door if looking at the store front and you'll find some pressed orange, carrot, or lemonade at $3 each and straight behind the counter are all the delicious baked goodies. 

I got the cinnamon roll ($4.50?) and I have to say I could have passed on it. Don't get me wrong, it wasn't really what I expected of a cinnamon roll. It was more of a crescent like bread cinnamon roll. A little dry and way too much for one person to handle by themselves. I would rather much share it if I were to get it again. I also got an oatmeal cranberry cookie ($2.50) which was absolutely bomb. Just the right amount of oat to craisin ratio. I have to go back to try their other goodies like carrot cake, peppermint cake (seasonal), and their cheddar beer muffin that I read about in so many reviews. 

I so highly recommend the special breakfast sandwich made on their delicious flakey scone like bread. Yum. Although the sauce on it was a bit too much for me, it was one of the most delicious breakfast sandwiches I had! Granted that's what the line is for and the wait. Everyone is waiting for that delicious sandwich. You gotta listen hard for your name though since they yell it out. Only downside if you are waiting outside since there is limited seating. 

Great little spot with an ocean view and def very community friendly. They are currently selling "helping hands cookies", plain sugar cookies with white icing for $3 to help with the Oakland ghostship fire.
author: Joan T.

description:
Parking is terrible around here so it's best to go at least an hour before closing time if you despise lines like I do. Practically barely anybody there, but you might miss out on some baked goods so it's kind of a risk/reward.

They definitely make the best breakfast sandwich on this side of the bay! It's very filling w/a flaky biscuit, 2 scrambled eggs, guacamole, aioli sauce and crispy bacon.  I've tried their baked goods ranging from their cookies, rolls, and different cakes.  I haven't found a single thing I didn't like to eat over here.
author: Eric T.

description:
The special breakfast sandwich is the best breakfast sandwich I've ever had. Reasonable price too (~$7). 10/10 would eat again and again and again and again.

There's usually a line and it's not too spacious inside, but it's completely worth it.
author: Libby L.

description: Hands down the best breakfast sandwhich I've ever had! Get the special breakfast sandwhich and you won't be disappointed! They have some awesome baked goods too!
author: Khushnuma D.

description:
I had the regular breakfast sandwich and a mocha. Pretty simple but delicious. They also have free samples of brownies and several pastries in the counter.

I'm very happy that I paid a visit
author: Dan Mark D.

description: Sooooo so yummy. Eat the special breakfast sandwich. That's all you really need to know. It was ridiculously delicious.
author: Melissa R.

description: Came here about 20 min before they closed. I didn't not get a good vibe from the curly haired white chick who helped us. She literally looked super uninterested as if we were a burden. Not coming back.
author: Katrina P.

description: Randomly found this place while in town visiting and Got the special breakfast sandwich which is a simply item but so delicious. Loved their homemade biscuit cause it was just perfectly made. And to drink I got the acai mango lemonade which was also really good and went great with the sandwich. Ha I wish I wasn't so full to try a Pastry cause those looked really good too. Would definitely go back if I was in town again.
author: Devin G.

description: Delicious!!! I came, tried and devoured. This place is incredible and the special breakfast sandwich is the BUSINESS! Thank you for existing. We will return.
author: Phil S.

description: Looove devils teeth. World class breakfast sandwiches. They're super full so make sure to go in the morning early before they start rubbing out of stuff!
author: Lucia B.

description: I tried the Special Breakfast Sandwich, which includes scrambled eggs, pepper jack cheese, avocado, bacon, aioli, and buttermilk biscuits as the bun. The flavor was great, and it had a very generous amount of avocado which was much appreciated. The most interesting thing about the sandwich is the biscuit bun, which is fairly large. The consistency has a nice buttery flakeyness to it. The only thing I would say is that because the biscuit was so large, it was the dominant taste, and as a result I didn't seem to notice the eggs as much. I'd prefer a slightly smaller biscuit and more eggs. The wait on a Sunday around noon was a little long (both for ordering and for the sandwich to be made), but the outdoor seating was a nice and made the it more palatable.
author: Michael S.

description:
I happened to come across this place as I was dropping my doggies off with their petsitter, and figured it was worth checking out. Anything with "baked goods" in the title is sure to catch my attention! There also appeared to be a line, which is always a good (yet annoying) sign. The staff appeared to be very welcoming, and although the place appeared to experience high traffic, they seemed to maintain a "hometown" atmosphere where they get to know customers by name. 

There were so many options for baked goods, and they all looked delicious! Not wanting to seem like the internal fatty that I am, I decided to go with just a breakfast sandwich (no bacon) and a cinnamon roll. The breakfast sandwiches are definitely one of their more popular items, so I ended up waiting about 15-20 minutes.

The breakfast sandwich (which came on a biscuit...ultimate deliciousness) was pretty ok. The biscuit was a bit crunchier than I wanted and not as flaky, but the egg and cheese were nicely cooked and the biscuit did have a great buttery inside. I also got the cinnamon roll, which is HUMONGOUS! The cinnamon roll didn't have any icing on it but rather had tons of cinnamon sugar gooeyness, and flaky layers that reminded me of a croissant. It was pretty good (not too sweet, but sweet enough to keep me munching away at the layers).

All in all, great place to check out on the weekends or if you're on your way to the beach for an early morning surf, or happen to wander into the sunset district by accident. 

Likes:
-great customer service
-ton of baked good options (talk about a sugar attack!)
-on a Muni bus line
-cute outdoor seating and benches 

Dislikes:
-biscuit was buttery, but not the soft and flaky goodness I'm used to having.
author: Tracy T.

description:
The special breakfast sandwich is so good!! Everyone working there was really nice. I have been here a handful of times, and I always get the breakfast sandwich. I've also had some of the cookies and other baked goods, but the sandwich is what I always come back for. 

There's not really any seating in the bakery itself, but there are benches outside with a good amount of space to sit.
author: Jacqueline K.

description: Fabulous place. Incredible biscuits, bread, breakfast sandwich with avocado! No organic milk for coffee drinks, but drip coffee decent (although I've had better).
author: Tanya B.

description: We had an excellent breakfast sandwich and cinnamon roll. The service was great and everyone was friendly. There was a long line, but it moved efficiently. We'll be back when we return to San Francisco!
author: Vanessa P.

description:
I called for 2 days at different times for a total of 10 times before making the drive from Benicia to SF to come to this bakery with a friend. We had had their chocolate monkey bread when a co-worker brought it in one morning and wanted to pick some up and decided we'd make a day of it. I called 8 times before driving over Saturday and no answer. 

When we arrived they not only didn't have the chocolate monkey bread, but the staff member who was helping me said they hadn't had it for weeks. I told him I had been calling to see if they had it before making the hours drive, and he told me with a snarky laugh "Yeah, we don't answer the phone, especially on the weekend." Really? That's your response? Rude! The place wasn't busy when we arrived, really no good reason for that. My friend called while we were there and we didn't even hear it ring. 

There really wasn't much to pick from. I chose a slice of zucchini and fig bread. The staff member said it would be sweet, when I asked. It wasn't sweet at all. It wasn't even moist, sadly it was the worst I'd ever had. I do not recommend it at all!

I also bought a cheese, bacon and beer muffin. I asked if it had much of a beer taste and was told you couldn't even taste it it was so little beer. After trying it, I spit it right out, it tasted like beer, like bitter crunchy beer. Awful! 

The last thing I bought was their cinnamon roll, I hear they are known for it. I bought this one for a friend. He said it was good, but he only ate half because as he got close to the center it wasn't baked all the way through and was filled with powder.....WOW! 

Horrible experience, I would not recommend this place. How they have so many stars is beyond me. I'm sorry to say I drove so far, received poor service, paid toll and wasted money on overpriced, undercooked baked (not so) good(s). Never again!
author: Amy C.

description:
"Will run for food."

I came here based on the yelp-famous breakfast sandwich. It's sort of out of the way so I ended up running here with the beau and it was a nice reward after a 4+ mile run through the park and down the beach.

Devil's Teeth is part of a cool block of shops in this part of the outer sunset. Family crowd (they had chalk outside for kids to draw on the sidewalk) and a nice parklette for additional seating outside. We arrived just before 10am and beat the line that formed about 15 minutes later. We ordered two special breakfast sandwiches and the wait was around 15 minutes.

The sandwiches were good but were cold when we got them :/ They also only gave us one special and one regular breakfast sandwich but it was too crowded/hectic to correct the mistake. I ate the plain one since the aioli/sauce on the special one didn't look too appetizing. We had a donut muffin too which I didn't care for (too dense) and were sad that there weren't any beignets on Saturdays (only Sundays). 

I also had coffee which wasn't very tasty (not sure what kind of coffee they brew here). Overall, I will return to try the beignets and try to get a hot biscuit sandwich.
author: Semuteh F.

description:
The breakfast sandwich is good, but is it worth a 45 min wait? Mmmm, not really.  The biscuit was incredible but the eggs were not really hot and tasted as though they had been sitting under a heat lamp.  If the eggs were as creamy and amazing as egg slut, I would give 5 stars and wait an hour.
Go on a weekday and you will have a better experience!
author: Shannanigans001 ..

description: The food is great! Sandwiches and the pastries are must to order if you're in the area but coffees are a hit or miss literally. Especially if you order a mocha. As you can see, the chocolate wasn't even mixed properly and it tasted more watery rather and just plain bitter. I've ordered the same drink every time I'm there and all I can say, please train all your baristas the same. I didn't complain coz it was almost closing time but still it's a $4.07 drink, I expected at least a better presentation than what I got. (Cocoa mix was unsweetened so if not mixed well it just taste bitter and watered down) I tipped my change bcoz I know the bakers are great and most of the staff is great.
author: Paula S.

description:
This place is legit.  I don't think you can order something here that you wouldn't be pleased with and I pretty much think we tried when my mother was in town.  The cinnamon rolls, croissants and everything was delicious.

The line can get long here but hold out as it's worth it.
author: Blake B.

description:
$1 beignets?? More like..ben-yay! 

Made fresh to order, comes piping hot and covered..ok ok, BLANKETED in powdered sugar, and at only a buck a piece. I WAS SOLD. Just be sure to grab a napkin or two or three or else you'll end up looking like Tyrone Biggums (where my Dave Chapelle fans at??) and quite possibly leave a gargantuan trail of powdered sugar all over your car and/or clothes. Don't say I didn't warn you!
author: Gabrielle S.

description: Finally hubby and I tried devil's teeth! My cousin always raves about this place but I haven't had a chance to try it until this past weekend. Came around Saturday 11:30am and the line was pretty long. I guess this was the peak time bc when we finally got our food around 12:10 ish the line was short. Hubby and I got the special breakfast sandwich (of course, duh!) and the cinnamon roll. The cinnamon roll is more dense than regular cinnamon roll but idk, it didn't blow me away. The sandwich though, was pretty damn good. Good sized sandwich and that special sauce is what really blows the sandwich away. I would totally wait in line again for the sandwich :)
author: Vickiiieee V.

description:
Let me start by saying that I so desperately wanted to love this place. A nice store front, and a product that I can get behind. I was sitting out in the sun, and it was a perfect day for a biscuit sandwich.

I ordered the Special breakfast sandwich, and it took quite a decent amount of time to make, which I presumed was because they were making everything fresh (which seriously seriously excited me). After basking for a bit of time, I received my sandwich with much anticipation. I dug in and was saddened with my food. The biscuit had a very stale texture. Tough on top and not exactly soft, fluffy, or flaky on the inside like I was expecting. It seemed more just like a casing rather than a fluffy buttery biscuit. Egg was okay, and the avocado was not received well. Bacon was solid and the garlic aioli had big flavor. Overall, very underwhelming.

A disappointing experience. I may give them another chance just because I want this place to be good... Have to be consistent to be great.
author: Bryant C.
