description: Went here to try the shark cookies, but they were out :( decided to order the classic egg breakfast sandwich, and it's really good! The biscuit was perfect and the eggs and bacon were cooked really well.
author: Nicole S.

description:
Good Cookies!

I came here with my little one and, perhaps, should have ordered the sandwich everyone else was ordering while we waited in line.

Ginger Cookie-4 Stars!
This is a very good cookie with a kick to it. The little one and I both enjoyed it. A soft cookie that would go well with a hot cup of java or tall glass od cold milk.

Coffee Bread-3.5 Stars
Sweet and fresh! Super fluffy bread that would be great for dunking!

~Hot Cocoa-1 Star!
The little one said it was watery and full of clumps. I didn't taste it but saw the clumps. It was very poorly mixed and we had nothing to stir it with. Trashed it and a waste of money.

~Coffee-1 Star!
Tasted terrible. I wish I could return it but we were already on the road. It joined his buddy in the trash at the gas station...another waste of money. 

Overall Experience...bad because of the drinks.
author: Nick H.

description:
2 stars

1/5 - latte; couldn't drink it; espresso not pulled properly and milk way over steamed  

2/5 biscuit; 2 stars because it was edible but there was nothing particularly pleasant about it.

Can't believe people wait in line for this place. Not recommended.
author: Sara G.

description:
I cannot believe it's taken me this long to try their Special Breakfast Sandwich. I've been so focused on their Cinnamon Roll but me tell you, their Special Breakfast Sandwich is heavenly. 

I'd normally avoid getting it because I'd always see people waiting for it and I'd be too hungry to wait but seriously. Just get it. WORTH THE WAIT. I normally don't like biscuits but this one is mm mm good. So buttery and flaky and the sauce is such a great touch on top of all the egg, bacon, and avocado. They give good amounts of bacon and avocado. It's definitely like a cheat meal...that I wanna have like every weekend now! I actually shared this with my boyfriend and we had enough room to eat half a cinnamon roll afterward but it's definitely big enough for one person. 

Cinnamon rolls are good (I wrote more about it in my previous review) but I highly recommend microwaving it. Sometimes you get it and the sweet glaze on top is hard and makes it difficult to eat without a knife and fork. It's a lot easier and tastier heated up!
author: Amanda L.

description:
Wowzers!!!
I'm only giving this place a review based on their cinnamon roll and their carrot cake. We casually found this place walking down Noriega, we went in and it was cinnamon rolls galore. 

Once we ordered the cinnamon rolls and their carrot cake (by the way cinnamon rolls are bogo because we got them before they closed) the employee encouraged us to take one of their dog biscuits which are human grade. I don't know what they put on their cinnamon rolls nor how it's cooked however it's the greatest non traditional roll I have ever had, the reason why i say non tradition is because parts of the cinnamon roll seemed crunchy and their glaze is different than any other roll I've had, pure amazingness.  The carrot cake was just as good, as weird as it sounds I ended up eating the dog biscuit and it was sooo good.

I will definitely be back to try their breakfast sandwiches.  5 solid stars.
author: Josh Giosue D.

description: Whoever thought the new view from the window seats would be interestin and appetizing? They were wrong.
author: Jim F.

description: The line is always out the door wrapped around the corner, you know damn well this place must be good. Homemade buttermilk muffins biscuit. Mmmmmh!
author: Annie Y.

description:
Egg Sandwiches = Heaven

Latte = strong and damn good

Coffee cake = hit the sweet spot just right

This should be your every day breakfast spot
author: Tara W.

description:
Meh. About sums it up. I had driven by before and saw the line and wondered how great must this place be?

Well it's not great. The service is speedy but impersonal bordering on. Arrogant. The baked goods were mediocre (I had a peanut butter cookie and the chocolate pound cake). I don't think anything is actually baked here though. 

The main claim to fame seems to be the breakfast sandwiches, which is all anyone was ordering. They put 2 eggs and bacon on a buttermilk biscuits. Not bad. But is that all? 

I don't think this place should be called a bakery. I was expecting Arizmendi, but got KFC in the morning.

Oh I had their coffee too. it was good. Nice and strong, not bitter or the crap you often find at donut shops.
author: Peter C.

description:
This a great example of a place doing few thing but extremely well. We were intrigued by beignets, especially as on Sunday they are $1 a pop! No regrets, absolutely delicious! Another 'must try' item on the menu is the breakfast biscuit. Perfectly fluffy, filled with eggs, cheese and bacon - heeeaaven! Hubby got an extra potion of bacon (and it was really good thick bacon) for $1, can't beat that!
Another aspect that I really liked is that the place had this unassuming, relaxed feel about it. It's a small cafe with outside seating (which is a public parklet) and extremely diverse clientele, chilling outside, enjoying the sun and great food!
Highly recommend it!
author: Elena W.

description: Cool little spot in the sunset. Had their breakfast sandwich and their BLT which were both pretty good. Their breakfast sandwich is the main attraction and I like that they use a biscuit for their breakfast sandwich. A little messy but nice and crispy which made the sandwich almost perfect!
author: Joshua H.

description:
Their special breakfast sandwich is so good. They have absolutely perfected the biscuit. So flaky and buttery and perfectly golden brown. Also the lemon garlic aioli is amazing and they somehow manage to always find the tastiest avocados. With the bacon, egg, and cheese it comes together perfectly. Do know that on weekends they run out of the biscuits around 11am sometimes so don't be too late! On the weekend it's usually about a 20 minute wait after ordering till your sandwich is done, but it's well worth the wait!

It's super busy on weekends. There is definitely a line starting sometime in the 9am hour, and it gets long, but they do move it along quickly. It's one of those places that's super busy, but they manage it really well so you don't feel stressed or ignored. It's surprisingly calm for how busy it is. 

The $1 beignets on Sundays are great. Nice and fluffy! Cinnamon rolls are also awesome. 

The only thing I'm not impressed with is the coffee. It's just a bit too acidic for my taste. But the food is so good they still get 5 stars. 

There is a great Parklet out front to sit in or you can take it down to the beach 4 blocks away (there isn't room inside to sit). 

Love taking visitors here!
author: Sarah C.

description: I got to experience beignet Sunday and it was everything I dreamed!! I picked up carrot cake for my friend visiting from New York, a peanut butter and chocolate chip cookie for my sis and a lemon bar for my mom!! Everyone was raving from Sunday to now (Wednesday!!) how out of sight these treats were!! The scene was gorgeous, the breakfast sandwiches looked amazing, and the verrrrrrry loooooooong line moved fast!!  I tried the beignets myself, two of them, glad I got two because one was very donut like but the other was hollow; but maybe I should've gotten more to share because it was a crazy amount of powered sugar; I couldn't have put the powdered sugar in my coffee though because the only size coffee is actually pretty small!! All in all, I loved it and the tiny things I would change that I just mentioned, I'd throw out as long as they always offer the cheddar beer bacon muffin!!!! OMG out of this world!! I loved it!! I know whatever they do, I will be satisfied every time I make it back. :)
author: Angela F.

description: Had their regular breakfast sandwich  and it was devilish! Very hearty with good amount of eggs, thick crispy bacon and melted cheddar. Yummy food!
author: Tiffany H.

description: One of our favorite bakeries in the Sunset! Their shady sugar cookie is dangerously delicious! Their breakfast sandwiches are bomb! And $1 beignets on Sunday's make Sunday's bearable. Walkable from the beach makes this a perfect coffee and breakfast on the go. The staff is always friendly and working hard while looking like they are having fun!
author: Alice B.

description:
I discovered Devil's Teeth late last night when craving a breakfast sandwich. After extensively stalking the Yelp page, my friend and I--undeterred by the long MUNI rides to the Outer Sunset--trekked over for brunch.

THIS PLACE IS REALLY, REALLY, REALLY GOOD. You might see a line going out the door, but this is nothing compared to the line at Tartine (it is 1) shorter and 2) moves much faster). I arrived close to 1 PM, and a few minutes before I got to the front of the line, a staff member came out to tell us they were out of beignets for the day. This was devastating at the time, but in retrospect, it wasn't such a big deal because it meant we had room to try other things.

We ordered two special breakfast sandwiches (we came back for the second one... it was that good), a cinnamon roll, and a donut muffin. I was tremendously impressed with all of the items. Everything about the special breakfast sandwich is just right: the fluffy biscuits, the scrambled egg, the garlic-lemon aioli, the bacon (thick and crispy!!!), the avocado half... I will be dreaming about this sandwich tonight. The cinnamon roll to me is almost a cinnamon roll/sticky bun/monkey bread hybrid--definitely ask them to warm it up for you if you plan to eat it on the spot. My friend was not impressed with the donut muffin, but I thought it was amazing. For $2, you get a deliciously soft, cinnamony, dense but fluffy donut-muffin lovechild. How could that possibly go wrong?

Planning my next trip to Devil's Teeth right now TBH.
author: Kelly R.

description:
Hands down top 3 breakfast Sandwich in San Francisco and perhaps Bay Area (haven't eaten every where). Be sure to grab yourself two things: The Special Breakfast Sandwich and Lemon Bars. 

The Special Breakfast Sandwich is only $7 and is worth every single dollar. I order two this time, one for me to eat right away and one for my girlfriend to eat the following day and it was still super bomb!! The biscuit was so fresh and flaky, the eggs so buttery, avocado, bacon and special sauce. Oh so freaking good. I could eat this sandwich everyday if I lived closer. 

Lemon Bars from Devil's Teeth are so damn good too. So tasty, yet not too sweet. The best part of their Lemon Bars are the crust. Order up on these because you'll want more and want to share the goodness.
author: John M.

description:
Good food although pricey. $5 scone.  The coffee could use some major improvement.  Maybe more beans in the brewing process.

  My opinion now voiced.
author: Louis L.

description:
I used to always get their special breakfast sandwiches, which are delicious - maybe even one of the best I've had. However, on my recent trip to Devil's Teeth they took 20 minutes to get 2 sandwiches to me and all the while they were giving people who ordered behind me theirs. I didn't make a fuss about it because their sandwiches are that good. The bad review comes from their VERY POOR HAND HYGIENE. While I was waiting I noticed two guys handling money, touching the pastries, and cooking the pieces for the breakfast sandwiches. They NEVER washed their hands in between. I even noticed one guy scratch his head, handle garbage and continue to touch the pastries with his bare, UNWASHED hands. I don't normally write reviews, especially bad ones but in this case I felt a social responsibility to get this public service announcement out.

Sorry Devil's Teeth, but even the best breakfast sandwich in the world isn't worth potentially getting sick due to dirty hands.
author: Venice L.

description: Yum! We visited a few times for baked goods, breakfast and coffee during our stay in the neighborhood. Everything was delicious! The breakfast bowl was a huge portion and the biscuits were just like the ones in the South. Coffee cake soooo good! Pop tart too! Friendly staff and reasonably priced.
author: Shawn I.

description: This place is pretty decent with a small selection of sandwiches as well as pasteries and coffee. My friend recommended this place to me and there were a lot of people around. It's very dog friendly too. I got a cheese sandwich tomato soup combo and both were alright. Not flavorful or deep in taste, but decent for lunch. My boyfriend got a blt and it was ok. I also tried that bacon cheese muffin thing and it was pretty ok although dry. My dog seems to enjoy the treats here and they are free so he was a stuffed chubster when we left. I like how casual this place is and their cheap and simple selection. Its not amazing but it's decent.
author: Jenn T.

description: This place is so damn good. There is always a line but its worth the wait. I always go with the special breakfast sandwich with eggs, bacon, pepperjack cheese, avocado and garlic aioli. This combo is on point. The bacon is crispy, the cheese is gooey, avocado is fresh and the garlic aioli punches your taste buds with love. Just don't try to kiss your significant other after. I highly recommend you try this place if you are in the area.
author: S P.

description:
Devil's Teeth Baking Company gives reference to its namesake via its outdoorsy logo; nevertheless, my belief is that their name refers to what your teeth will resemble after consuming any delicious carb-loaded item that they offer on their shelves.

The $1 BEIGNETS are Sunday are undoubtedly delicious. They come hot, fresh, and oily, not yet deflowered by the scoops of powdered sugar sitting at the bottom of the brown paper bag. It's a DIY shake-a-thon as you smother these babies with glorious sweetness before stuffing your face. It's all good.

But, I feel like the beignet was topped by the $2 DONUT MUFFIN. Duffin? Mufnut??

Buuuuut, I feel like the donut muffin was topped by the $2.50 BACON, BEER, CHEDDAR, and GREEN ONION MUFFIN. More appropriately, it should be called a muffin biscuit. Muscuit? Biffin??

For the breakfast sandwich lovers, never fear--Devil's Teeth is well known for their SPECIAL BREAKFAST SANDWICH, $6.75. This treasure is a warm, soft buttermilk biscuit that envelopes fluffy scrambled eggs, ooey gooey pepperjack cheese, perfectly fried applewood smoked bacon, a huge avocado half, and homemade lemon-garlic aioli. The last two ingredients take the "ordinary" $5.50 breakfast sandwich and make it EXTRA-ordinary. Because avocado srsly makes everything better.

The $4.25 CINNAMON ROLL is good but very dense and sticky. If you can't devour the huge carb-monster in one sitting, you can keep it in your fridge and warm it up later on.

Additional eye candy: $4.25 blueberry lemon glaze scone, $4.25 cranberry scone, $2 apple streusel muffin, $4.25 cranberry apricot buckwheat scone.

Ooh my dentist is not gunna be happy :(
author: Adele F.

description: If you come here stoned, I hope you've already paid your rent, car payment, child support, and all your other bills. I could see this place making someone homeless. And diabetic, probably fat too.
author: Marc R.

description: The best breakfast sandwich I have ever had! Highly recommend. Great place to go after a test at SFSU.
author: Chris P.

description: Tried the Special Breakfast Sandwich which is around $7. Friend grabbed one on the go for us to try when we were going on a 2 hour road trip. Their biscuits are TO DIE FOR. It is the soft, steamy kind of biscuits, not hard or sand-like. Definitely fresh. I want to come back and try their quiche!
author: Leah A.

description:
Wow....15 minute wait for the best damn breakfast sandwich I have ever had.

The lemon garlic aioli is friggen magical.

Got a peanut butter chocolate chip cookie too,  ill be for some banana walnut and sourdough bread....
author: Justin K.

description:
Breakfast sandwiches (regular or special). That's all you really need to know.

Coffee is okay. Expect to painfully long wait time on weekends.
author: Nick K.

description: Brah this place is amazing ! Came all the way from Michigan and have to eat here Everytime. Breakfast sandwiches are the bomb and anytime they have something sweet in the case ready for chow town. Brownies Muffins Rolls ya can't go wrong. Highly recommend.
author: Tony C.

description:
It is definitely a treat to have a good quality bakery in the deep sunset. They are closed on Tuesday's so do not come by because you will be disappointed. 

Nice location easily found on Noriega. Plenty of street parking. If you come during the morning on the weekends then expect to wait in line. Come by after 10:30am or during the week then you wont have to worry about the line.

They offer a small selection of breakfast and lunch items.

I tried the Special Breakfast Sandwich. The sandwich consisted of scrambled eggs, applewood bacon, avocado, pepper jack cheese, and with lemon-garlic aioli between a buttermilk biscuit. I am a fan and this was an instant favorite. I am not a pepper jack cheese fan but the ingredients complimented each other very well. Nothing was over powering but was very tasty. The biscuit was nicely toasted on the outside and had a soft flaky interior. 

They also have a nice and wide selection of baked goods. Definitely something there to satisfy everyone's sweet craving. I have tried and recommend the Lemon Bar, Brownie, Peanut Butter Chocolate Chip Cookie, Donut Muffin and Chocolate Cake. They also have some seasonal or special baked goods.
author: Paul V.

description:
#tl;dr Super unpretentious, super unhipster*. Breakfast Sandwiches x Shark Cookies; beyond that, get whatever.

3 3/4 or 3 1/2 stars bc I got punked - I ordered my sandwiches with no cheese, dude repeated it back to me "no cheese"... aaaaaand my sandwiches had cheese. #smh Not the end of the world #asweknowitandifeelfine, but still. I'm just glad there weren't any food allergy requests involved.

Other thing was the iced tea I got was like a kids cup. If this is going to be a happy meal, where's my free ninja turtle toy? jk

Though it was crizzowded (20min wait on breakfast sandwiches stated upfront), they kept things moving fairly briskly. I'd return. #ofthemack #ofthejedi

*A good thing or a bad thing, depending on your hipsterlosophy.
author: Dan B.

description: I've only been here a few times, but each time I've felt that this place is mediocre. I've ordered the BLT with mayo and mustard and I think they put horseradish in it or the mustard has it, which I abhor. Perhaps it was a mistake? Not sure. The special breakfast sandwich isn't really impressive to me either nor was the peanut butter cookie with chocolate chips. I want to like this place more, but I just don't think it's worth the line.
author: Apryl S.

description: Great spot to grab a little breakfast and some coffee. I've had the special breakfast biscuit twice now. The first time I went I got a bag of beignets. Freakin awesome!!!
author: Evan S.

description: The breakfast sandwich is one of my favorites in SF. I recommend eating it while it's warm. I ate it so fast I barely took a breath. I looked to my right and another guy was killing it. We both laughed at how hard we smashed on it. I've had this sandwich 5 times now and they come out consistently delicious.
author: Daniel D.

description:
This place has great breakfast sandwiches. If you can get one.

Just stopped by since I was in the neighborhood. There's a line, but nothing too crazy. I ask specifically before ordering if they still have biscuits left, to which the cashier answers in the affirmative, so I order two.

Ten minutes later, a different cashier starts calling everyone's name after a point in the line (before me) because they oversold their biscuits. 

So I'll have it on sourdough instead, not the same, but usually still tasty.

Except when they call my name, it's only one sandwich apparently forgetting the other one.

So 30 minutes and $24 later (can't take the tip back now, can I?), I get what I didn't order, and am now leaving unsatisfied.

Thanks again Devil's Teeth, probably won't be swinging by on a whim again unless I call ahead.
author: Nathan O.

description: I absolutely LOVE this place. Yes be prepared to wait in line & for your order to be ready for about 30 minutes, however the food is definitely worth the wait. I went on a Sunday and I ordered the special breakfast sandwich. The aioli was sooo good as was the bacon. The OJ was decent. I also ordered beignets and I loved those as well. I regretted only buying two. Also, the girl with the awesome pink hair was friendly and helped me decide what to order. She also let me know that wait time for my order would be about 30 minutes. This I appreciated because you're not blindsided with a long wait time. I took my order to go; Ocean Beach is only like four blocks away so I wanted to have my breakfast there with a nice view. I'm from LA, so I can't wait to go back to SF to go to this place again.
author: Ash R.

description: Everything was just alright.  Had their breakfast sammie and it was good but dry from the biscuits. I love cinnamon rolls so I had to dry one here but it was just descent. The dough was pretty dense. Cookies were okay too, nothing special, but the pop tart was ahhmazing.
author: Samantha C.

description:
Line was out the door, moved quickly. Ordered the $7 special breakfast sandwich which was a buttermilk biscuit, egg, jack cheese, aioli sauce, bacon and avocado. It was larger than your average MacDonald egg biscuit so I didn't feel ripped off. It took 15 mins to get the sandwich--it was very tasty.
Coffee was good.
Brownie was good
Chocolate chip cookie was soft, nice large size and  very tasty. I will definitely be back.
author: Larry K.

description:
OH MAN.......

I don't care if you're only in town for a day. I don't care if you have no time to come to Outer Sunset. I don't care if you already have brunch plans. YOU. MUST. COME. HERE. 

Was visiting my best friend in SF and decided to try this place out since it had a PLETHORA of amazing reviews on their Special Breakfast Sandwich. Stopped by at around 9 am on a Friday and there was no line. Ordered a special breakfast sandwich bc after seeing all those reviews, how could I not????

Sat and waited about 15 mins for the sandwich, which I didn't mind because they're literally made to order. You can see straight into the kitchen from the counter, so I saw the dude working on the sandwiches in the back. It finally came out... I unwrapped it and OH. MY GOD. THE STEAM. COMING OUT OF THE SANDWICH. THE LAYERS OF BUTTERY FLAKY GOODNESS OF THE HOME MADE BISCUIT. I DON'T EVEN LIKE BISCUITS!!!!! I BUT I LOVED THIS ONE!!!!!!!!!! And the cheese and the eggs and the bacon COOKED. TO. PER. FECT. ION. And the avocadoooo and the aioli my goodness I'm dying just thinking about it. What more could you possibly want in a breakfast sandwich????? 

Special breakfast sandwich? VERY special indeed. Singlehandedly THE BEST breakfast sandwich I've ever had in my life. The biscuit was holding its own... Usually biscuits fall apart under the slightest pressure but not this biscuit. No sir. This biscuit was dense but not heavy. Don't know how they managed to do that. I'm not even a huge fan of breakfast sandwiches because most of them end up soggy and sad and the eggs are weird and rubbery or the cheese is chalky or the avocado isn't ripe or you take a bite of the bacon and you chew it for an eternity because it wasn't cooked properly but NOT THIS SANDWICH!!! Every component of this sandwich was made perfectly and when combined, it naturally made the perfect breakfast sandwich. Granted, she's not a looker (check out the pic I took), but she's definitely a keeper. They should rename it "The Only Breakfast Sandwich You Will Ever Want to Eat For the Rest of Your Life". 

This sandwich changed me. I am a changed woman. No longer will I discriminate against breakfast sandwiches as I have done in the past. I will give every breakfast sandwich a chance in hopes that it will be even a smidge similar to this one. 

For real though, you GOTTA get your hands on one of these babies. It will change you. As it did me.
author: Kaitlin F.

description:
The first time I got here, it was 10:50 on a weekday and they had run out of sandwich bread. No breakfast sandwiches. Pretty disappointing, especially since they are a bakery!

This time I made sure to get there at 8:30 on a Monday, and the line was practically nonexistent. They did run out of avocados though - probably more because we are in a drought and avocados have recently become even more expensive. (It would've made the sandwich even better. Instead they offered to substitute tomato).

The special breakfast sandwich was still amazing. I think it comes down to the buttermilk biscuit - it was super buttery (and so super yummy and soft). The aioli also gave a really nice flavor too. If the sandwich didn't have those things, it probably would be similar to breakfast sandwiches at other places.
author: Julianna K.

description:
Devil's Teeth has been on my bookmarks for a while now, and I don't know why I didn't get to try it till recently! I just finished working out and of course, I looked for the most gluttonous food to honor that workout when picking up lunch for me and the bf...... In my case, a donut muffin ($2), a cinnamon roll ($6 I think), and 2 special breakfast sandwiches ($6.75)!

Ordering at the counter was really easy and everything was ready fairly fast. You can see the employees scrambling the eggs and assembling the sandwiches in the back which is pretty cool, so you know they're made to order. I liked looking through the glass at all the pastries... I wanted to try so many different things! Seating is great outside on a nice day, and there are a couple stools inside to wait for your food.

About the food... I actually ate the donut muffin on the way to see him, so it didn't even make it out of the car LOL. Basically a muffin-shaped donut with cinnamon sugar topping. Delicious! It had more of a dense texture--think more cake donut and definitely not krispy kreme. But I loved it!

When I finally got to his house, I opened the foil wrapped special breakfast sandwich... It was glorious. The huge heaping of fluffy, perfectly scrambled eggs, the generous portion of avocado, and the crispy bacon peeking out of the freshly baked buttermilk biscuit was so appealing to me! (Did I just make you hungry?) It was still warm thankfully so I took my first bite and was soooo happy. The lemon garlic aioli made a huge difference in the sammy and wasn't too lemony for my taste! In my opinion, I would definitely TREAT YOSELF with the special breakfast sandwich instead of the normal one... Once you try it, you'll never go back hahaha. Also usually I really dislike biscuits, but this one was so good!! Not dry like mcdonald's or KFC but flaky, yet soft... I don't know how to describe it. Try it yourself!

I'm sad because I left the cinnamon roll at his house and forgot to try it... Welp. Next time! I heard it's one of their most popular items! I can't wait to come back for beignets on Sundays... Only $1 each!!
author: Tara A.

description: Their cinnamon rolls, staff & customer service get 5 stars! I ordered a mocha and the special breakfast sandwich and they both tasted good. The bacon was my fav part of the sandwich. Honestly, they didn't leave me wanting more, though. The flavors didn't make a great impression on me.
author: Sydney L.

description:
I honestly didn't even know Devil's Teeth existed until the other weekend when my friend who lives in the Sunset told me about the Special Breakfast. I met her at the bakery around 10:30 and was dismayed to find a line that went down half the block. Thankfully we had some catching up to do, so the 35+ minute wait didn't feel so long. I'm known for getting hangry rather quickly, but was promised one of the best breakfasts of my life. We both ordered the Special Breakfast and a drip coffee, then proceeded to wait even longer for our food to come out. The coffee was tasty, and the sugar/cream station wasn't too congested. While we waited, we hung out by the stack of books near the front door. I really like the idea of being able to grab a book while you eat or wait. 

Once we sat down with our food, I had to constantly remind myself to chew and swallow instead of inhaling the entire breakfast sandwich at once. I have to admit, the Special Breakfast was delicious. The giant biscuit alone was worth the wait, and the aioli was especially tasty. There was a generous helping of everything, including the avocado, which people tend to skimp on. It was a big sloppy mess and I loved every minute of it. Definitely one of the best breakfast sandwiches I've had (maybe ever), but I'm not quite sure it's worth driving all the way to the Sunset for and then waiting in a long line. Basically, when it comes to breakfast or brunch, lines are a huge deterrent for me, and this is no different.
author: Regina L.

description: First time visiting this bakery but I'll definitely stop by again! The special breakfast sando on a homemade buttermilk biscuit is great! Late was smooth and creamy! The only reason i gave 4 stars is due the lack of cleanliness of the restroom.
author: Jenny D.

description:
Devil's Teeth's carrot cake is absolutely to die for. It has real bits of carrots inside, and it's always perfectly moist. And that cream cheese frosting, never certain what Lil does but it has the perfect amount of sweetness to it. My boyfriend has been going to Devil's Teeth for 5-7 years since he has moved San Francisco. He would wake me up in the morning on the weekends bright and early to get the carrot cake. He would also calculate his route to and from work every week to pick it up. If I can give this place 50 five stars I would. 

Thank you Lil for making such an amazing Carrot Cake =).
author: Yilun K.

description:
Temptation vixen serve up incredible sinful devilish  baked goods made with TLC.  
When I saw a breakfast sandwich took 10 minutes made from scratch... Knew it had to be special.
Aioli thick crunchy bacon on a fluffy layer biscuit... Wowza

If they only had a runny yolk version that would put this into next level.

Nestled in a height ashbury sunset miniature variant... This eclectic neighborhood is unique.  People are actually nice here and greet with morning hellos.
author: David H.

description: The Special Breakfast Sandwich is the best breakfast sandwich around. Donut Muffins are great too. This place is worth going out of your way for.
author: rick s.

description:
The Devil got me good because I just committed gluttony. The special breakfast sandwich is special to my heart...and my stomach! 

I am a huge fan of their Special Breakfast Sandwich: scrambled eggs, pepper jack cheese, avocado, bacon, buttermilk biscuits. The sandwich is HUGE and extremely filling. It's freshly made and overwhelming with deliciousness. The sandwich oozes with avocado and eggs, and the biscuits are flaky and soft. All of its ingredients are very well put together - making it an exceptionally SPECIAL breakfast sandwich. MUST TRY! 

Also, every Sunday, beignets are $1 each! MMM powdered sugary goodness. The beignets are fairly big as well - two could be good enough for one person. 

Place is packed on the weekends, but service moves quickly. 

Super cute local bakery!
author: Kristal D.

description:
Solid bakery. The size and prices of the pastries and overall menu are extremely reasonable. 

The bacon, beer, cheddar, and green onion muffin was the highlight of my pastry buying binge. It was packed with flavor and the right amount of cheddar. 

I was hella hype for the donut muffin but it was a bit on the weak side. It needed to be more solid on the texture. It felt more like a crumb cake muffin. The chai latte was standard, good but nothing standout about it. There was also a kale parmesan scone. The scone was well made in regards in texture but also standard on the flavor front.

I would go back but it's not like Tartine where I would wait in line for thirty minutes to get a pastry. I do admit for a quick cup of coffee and something in the morning, it's an extremely reasonable option.
author: Kathryn T.

description:
Anyone who grew up with me knows my absolute hankering for sweets. But, since growing a bit older (hopefully wiser) and a bit more health conscious, I've suppressed a lot of my sugary habits... Until now.

Oh Lord, forgive me for I have sinned. Even the thought of consuming sweets sends me into a guilt trip. 

That being said, I have heard so many great things about Devil's Teeth Baking Company and decided to make the trek from SOMA to the outer Sunset District just for this place. And with a name like Devil's Teeth, who wouldn't be slightly seduced?

And like the forbidden tree in the Garden of Eden, I knew I shouldn't have been anywhere near it.

Oh well! Sometimes you just gotta YOLO it! *throws scruples to the wind*

Upon arrival, as I opened my car door, I could immediately smell the aroma of delicious baked goods permeating through the air. It was like a delicate lullaby to my nose tempting me to come closer.

God please help me to resist temptation as I walk through the valley of the shadow of death.

As I walked into the store, my heart skipped a beat. There they were. Cookies, croissants, cinnamon rolls, danishes and a plethora of other delightful delicacies sat behind the glass display ready to be devoured.

I really really really really DO try hard to make healthy choices, but today was NOT going to be that day.

The first thing my eyes settled on was a large peanut butter chocolate chip cookie. The angel on my shoulder said not to, but the devil on my shoulder said come on, just try a little. The chocolate chips were so large and numerous throughout the cookie that I was convinced that maybe a small bite wouldn't hurt.

Next my eyes shifted to the crumb cake. I grew up eating cheap ol' Little Debbie's and thought that even then, it was the greatest thing in the world. Since those Little Debbie days, I've learned a thing or two about quality and let's just say that this coffee crumb cake had it goin' on in all aspects! Soft, delicately sweet, with a bit of a tart flavor from the rhubarb. 

Sweet Lordy Jesus. 

By now I had no conscious at all. Just give me the goodz!

I also purchased the cinnamon roll. Words cannot describe what I tasted and felt, but let me go ahead and try. Soft Gooey Sweet Cinnamony Crunchy. 

You name it. This forbidden "fruit" was better than I had ever imagined.

I needed something to wash this all down before leaving, so I decided to go with one of their house made mango juices from the fridge. A perfect way to end such a sugary trip.

Prices are a tad high, but for the quality and flavor you get, it is well worth the extra pennies.

They have outdoor seating that is great for relaxing with your coffee or pastries, or to even just chatting with your friends. This place is kid friendly and has colorful chalk for children to draw on the city walkways with.

They also serve savory dishes, sandwiches and sourdough bread. So, if you aren't in the mood for something sweet, there are plenty of other options to choose from at this bakery.

The only excuse I have for going on such a sugar crazed frenzy is "The devil made me do it." Yeah, that's it. 

Meanwhile, I'll think about repenting later just to sin here all over again. 

*Throws holy water on myself*

*shudders*
author: Ann S.

description:
Finally got to see what the hype is about and I wasn't that impressed. Went at 8:30AM on a weekend and there was no line. YAY! Place is small and there is some seating outside. Staff is friendly, but a bit disorganized 

Got the Special w/ two eggs scrambled, with pepper jack cheese, applewood smoked bacon, avocado, and our famous lemon-garlic aioli on our homemade buttermilk biscuit sandwich-still had to wait about 20 minutes. After we got our sandwich, we drove off. We opened up the foil and took are first bite and it was just the regular breakfast sandwich. They gave us the wrong one! We drove all the way back because we want what we paid. The cashier was nice enough to give us someone else's special sandwich so I didn't have to wait long. It was good, but I wasn't impressed. I wouldn't come back to wait and the biscuit is still a bit dry to me. 

All their pastries look good, but you have to eat it warm and they don't warm it for you. I warmed it at home in my toaster oven and it still didn't taste good.
author: Karen H.

description: We took a little neighborhood field-trip over to this cute neighborhood bakery. Packed the pup with and motioned over to see about the hubbub. Took everyone's suggestion from Yelp so I didn't have to pour of the menu upon getting there. Unfortunately, they were out of the biscuits when we finally were in sight of the doorway. The breakfast sandwich seemed to be everyone's favorite, maybe next time for me. Settled on some quiche and morning bun since orders were coming off the shelves quickly. Worth coming out to the avenues for a bite and coffee.
author: Patrick W.

description: I love everything about this toothsome bakery - except the lingering lines on weekends when I'm hoping to share this experience with out-of-town visitors. This place has saved my life a few times after what began as harmless weeknight happy hour drinks, but quickly escalated into utter debauchery. The biscuits are fresh out the oven and each breakfast sandwich is made fresh to order. HQ hipster coffee is available and the staff is cheerful and proactive with placing orders. Definitely go during the week when you need a pick me up to get you through the week and if you want to spread the cheer... gather some baked goods to share w/ your coworkers!
author: Katie P.

description:
are you looking for a quick breakfast place at opens really early in the morning? then this is the place for you! i came here twice for a quick breakfast since i had to partake in outdoor activities in the morning.

special breakfast sandwich (5/5 stars) - yummmm. i am in love with their special breakfast sandwich. it's a buttermilk muffin biscuit with eggs, pepper jack cheese, applewood smoked bacon avocado, and garlic aioli. it's everything i like combined! i definitely recommend getting sandwich. you will not be disappointed!

coffee cake (5/5 stars) - this was pretty good. it has pecans and pear bits. i love the crunchy/crumbly texture.

donut muffin (4/5 stars) - it's pretty much a donut shaped like a muffin. this was really sweet, but good too. i think i'll stick to savory foods in the morning haha.

don't be intimidated by the long line. it moves quick and you get your food in a reasonable amount of time. there's a little public outdoor seating area for you to eat your food. there's also chalk for little kids to draw on the ground. there's plenty of a parking in this area! i will come back here to try their other sweets during the day!
author: Sylvia H.

description: Amazing breakfast sandwiches on biscuits, but be prepared for a VERY long wait on a weekend. We're talking 25-30 minutes. I didn't mind waiting because I was catching up with a friend, but beware that it's not the type of place you just stop by for a quick breakfast on the go on a weekend.
author: Cynthia S.

description: Simply the best cinnamon rolls I have ever had.  Everything they make is a winner.  Whenever we are near there we are stopping by.
author: Steve C.

description:
If I run, I run for food. 

After reluctantly signing up for the Across The Bay 12k, I started training two weeks before the race (whoops!). On a recent Saturday morning I decided to run from 24th street in the Mission out to Devil's Teeth to see if I was going to make it over the finish line on race day. And, I decided to reward myself with a Secret Breakfast Sandwich for making it. 

This breakfast sandwich was everything. It was so, so worth it. I was absolutely beside myself with hunger when I got there, and it took everything I had not to reach over and grab a biscuit right off of a cooling rack, but I made it. 

Perfectly crisp bacon, and absolute best biscuit I've ever had, garlic aioli, avocado. All of it fresh, all of it delicious, all of it working oh, so well together in it's little foil wrap. 

I could have eaten two, and I would have if I wasn't headed off to eat my second breakfast (second breakfast!). But, I'll be back soon!
author: Brittany B.

description:
Average breakfast sandwiches are easy to find. Good ones are incredibly rare. This is what took me all the way out to outer sunset to try Devil's Teeth Baking Company. I think I may have built this sandwich up a bit too much in my mind though, because it didn't quite live up to my expectations. 

Special Breakfast Sandwich - 3/5 - The biscuit was decent, but average overall. It was quite large though, as was the sandwich itself. This thing was loaded with avocado which I enjoyed. There was a good amount of bacon, although it was very thin cut and could have been thicker. The egg in this sandwich was scrambled which I didn't care for. I would have much preferred it fried and runny. There was a small layer of pepperjack cheese which was good, but got overpowered by the avocado. It was altogether a decent breakfast sandwich, but I do think there are better and I don't really agree

Apple Turnover - 4/5 - Very nice flaky crust with some sort of added seasoning. Together felt light and airy.
Chocolate chip cookie - 2/5
Peanut butter cookie - 2/5
Zucchini fig bread - 4/5 - This was unique and interesting. Unfortunately it is being discontinued.
Lemon bar - 3/5
Seasonal coffee cake - 3/5 - The seasonal flavor was pear, but it wasn't really noticeable.
Bacon beer cheddar muffin - 4/5 - Great savory combination of flavors. 

Donut muffin - 5/5 - Amazing. The texture was perfect on this one and the taste was great as well.
Cinnamon roll - 5/5 - This was very, very good. It also was not what I was expecting. It is much more dense and chewy than your average cinnamon roll and it definitely made it turn out better.

Overall, I liked Devil's Teeth a lot, but it wasn't for the breakfast sandwich that made the 2015 7x7 list. This is a solid bakery with some amazing items, especially the donut muffin and cinnamon roll. For those two items in particular, this is "as good as it gets."
author: Mark O.

description: Went to this super friendly bakery for a coffee and cinnamon roll! :) great service, full of energetic young people there! Love the vibe. Cool little bakery to hangout in the morning. I sit outside to catch some sunshine while enjoy  my amazing cinnamon roll and coffee! Great to have this in the neighborhood.
author: Sunsun L.

description: The food and beverage here is fine. I came for the $1 beignets (a major draw on Sundays), and they were enjoyable although they won't scratch your itch if you're looking for something authentic. Although the place was not crowded, the service was slow, and the woman at the front counter was unbearably rude. She was rude to my whole party (including two young children). We spent almost $60 on breakfast and three coffee beverages (which was no surprise knowing the clientele a "hipster chic" place like this attracts). However, I would expect that we would be treated with a minimal level of respect. Guess that's too much to ask. The two stars are for the mediocre food and coffee. I will NEVER be going to this place again. You're better off at Trouble or Andytown. Trust me.
author: Cat B.

description: Got the special breakfast sandwich and okay I'm not exaggerating when I say this is the best breakfast sandwich I've ever had. The picture does not do it justice at all!
author: Dominique V.

description: Heaven is a place on earth with this breakfast sandwich!! After looking for place in San Fran to have breakfast I gave up when I found out they all had a waiting time of over an hour!!! I "settled" on this place and it was far from a settlement. Yes the line was out the door and the waiting time after ordering was 20 min but it was well worth it! The line moves fast so don't let that stop you from coming here. I got the classic breakfast sandwich and it was made with buttermilk biscuit, bacon, egg and cheddar cheese. I think the ingredients speak for themselves and I do not need to say more than it was simple and delicious.
author: Fernanda R.

description: Walked 2 miles and they gave me the wrong breakfast sandwich lol. Don't work in the food industry if you hate all of you're customers and act annoyed they are even there.
author: Alexander J.

description: Great and friendly service! I heard awesome things about this place so decided to check out. Currently and excitedly waiting for my special breakfast sandwich, but we also ordered some cookies and a cinnamon roll. Cookies were bomb! Really wanted to try their carrot cake but they ran out. Would definitely come back and try the rest of their menu. Been waiting for the sandwich for maybe 15 minutes now but understandable...it's Saturday, everyone seems to be ordering it and I've been told it's worth the wait.
author: Nicole B.

description: pretty good. I tried their biscuit sandwich. I shouldn't have put avocado in it because it made the texture very weird. I usually love avocados and I put it in everything every chance I get. So seeing this concept lured me. It just didn't taste as I imagined it would, I like the sandwich I might just have to leave the avocado out next time.
author: Khaye S.

description: As many others before me have stated, this cafe has the best breakfast sandwich in SF (order the 'Special Breakfast Sandwich'). Expect a long line though.
author: Tom P.

description:
Let me start y saying that I have been a loyal DT customer since they opened and their quality and product is usually on pointe.  However, my last visit (about 10 minutes ago), proved less satisfying.  I ordered the meat lasagne and grilled cheese and soup combo.  The soup that was posted today was broccoli and cheddar.  I was surprised when I tasted the soup and not a shred of broccoli was to be found.  What I think they gave me instead was some sort of potato soup, which tasted fine, but was a letdown in terms of paring with the grilled cheese. 

The second point of disappointment- they gave me the vegetarian lasagne, which I wouldn't have minded, except that it was swimming in grease (refer to photo).  I should have known when I had to ask for another box cause the oil was leaking through the first one, but I was so grossed out that I couldn't bear to eat it. 

I will def make sure to double check my food in the future, but I think the staff needs to consider what the food looks like when they serve it.
author: Christina W.

description:
Everything is as delicious as everyone else says (though skip the curry chicken salad sandwich and go for the BLT with avocado). The beer, bacon, and cheese muffin is better than it looks. The baked goods really are on point.

It can take 20 minutes to get a breakfast sandwich even if no one is standing in front of you.
author: Matt L.

description:
Hmmmmm.......

The hype about this place is real but it is also a bit exaggerated.

Was looking for some breakfast this morning and this place was on my list of Yelp bookmarks for breakfast. 

In having talked to several of my co-workers about good places to go for breakfast they all suggested this place to me some time ago. Today I found myself near the beach and this was going to be my breakfast spot.

As foretold by many that I know, there was a line out the door. There were also plenty of people waiting for their food seated outside as well.  I walked in line and waited patiently. The first thing I noticed was the pastry case. Lots of pastries behind the glass. Clearly there was a rush this morning because most of the shelves were empty. 

The menu is very straight forward. From pastries, breakfast sandwiches, coffee, tea, etc. The offer what most breakfast/brunch places tend to offer. 

The inside of this place is rather small and compact. There are several stools for sitting but not enough space to move around. Put it like this, the line descends into the sidewalk because the distance from the pastry case to the sidewalk is less that 8 feet, roughly! The nice thing about this place is that they have an order and pickup sign. That makes a huge difference. There is not uncertainty when you arrive where you need to be in order to get your food. 

There were about 6 employees working today. I guess that is the normal amount of employees to have. This definitely made a difference in expediting the line. THAT IS COOL!!! 

Customer service is good as well. Greeting followed by an order request is always a plus! CHEEE. I ordered the Special Breakfast Sandwich because I have heard enough comments about it that I had to try it myself. I also got a chocolate chip cookie just to see if it passes MY COOKIE test.

After placing my order I waited and just took in everything from this place. The books, the kitchen, customer engagement, speed of service, and overall experience are things that I monitor when determining how well a business functions.

After waiting for 5 to 6 minutes I received my food and was on my way. Excellent. 

When I got home I opened my food and examined my sandwich. Not the biggest sandwich in the world but decent. I saw the eggs and could smell the avocado. NICE!! First bite, good! Not sandwich that I rave about but more of a snack. I finished eating the whole sandwich in under 3 minutes. I mean, it was good but gone to fast. The reviews that I had heard made this sandwich seem like the GODZILLA of breakfast sandwiches, NOT THE CASE! Quality sandwich yes but not the GOLIATH that is made out to be. If the sandwich was doubled in size then this would be a TOTALLY DIFFERENT REVIEW. But hey, if you like the special breakfast sandwich go and have a great SNACK! 

As far as the Chocolate Chip cookie. It passed the texture test. It has passed the chip test. The only discrepancy is that the cookie was not as soft as I thought it would be. Maybe I got the a bad cookie or something but mine was too hard. That does not fly for me. The appearance and size was great but the taste was just NOT GOOD. I expected so much better from this place based on the reviews and recommendations. If this can be fixed then this review can be updated to a 5 star review.

Overall, I would come back here if I happen to be in the area but I would not come back because I craved something from here. It is nice that this place is close to the beach. For all the surfers that build up an appetite after being out in the water all day this place is convenient. Also, for the locals in the area this place probably makes getting that cup of coffee in the morning a little easier because of the location. 

Nuff said, your turn!
author: Robert F.

description:
Devils teeth, talk about hidden gem 

This place was off the beaten path and I was impressed at the crowd waiting 

The pastries were delicious and I lucked out and was able to get the last of the shark cookies
author: Amanda T.

description:
I usually get their Coffee Cake, which I personally think is to die for! Another item I like is the Maple Scone, which takes me  a while to consume.

I love the element of Devil's Teeth. The people are very friendly. Not to mention, the bakery is 3 blocks from the beach, which gives off a heavenly-vibe!
author: Julio B.

description:
So, the prices here add up quickly, but it's kind of hard to resist all the baked goods! Came here on a Saturday around 10:30am. I sampled a wide variety of things; a few thoughts below:

Special breakfast sandwich: clearly the bestseller, but I didn't think it was worth the 30 minute wait. (Also, a little frustrating that the woman who took our order didn't inform us of the extensive wait; we only learned about it after hearing a few other people order after us and get warned of the wait. PLUS, it's a scrambled egg sandwich and the biscuits are already cooked - how on earth does it take so long to make these??) Very thick cut bacon but I thought it was overcooked (very hard.) Avocado and cheese worked well in the combination.

Parmesan kale scone: probably my favorite! The cheesy flavor and light, fluffy texture make this one a winner.

Blueberry scone with lemon glaze: strong fruity flavor and nice texture (and the blueberries within were nice), but $5 seemed a little steep.

Bacon beer cheese muffin: very dense, so not my favorite texture, but the flavor was great - cheesy, with large bacon bits throughout.

Chocolate chip cookie: okay. It didn't really stand out to me in either butteriness or chocolatiness. The chocolate chip cookie at Arizmendi is a much stronger contender in my opinion...

Kale/bacon/garlic quiche: not great. It just tasted really eggy, and none of the other flavors came through (where's the cheese??)

Donut muffin: pretty much a moist coffee cake rolled in cinnamon sugar. Sure, it was a decent muffin, but it didn't have a lot in common with donuts. 

Cinnamon roll: not only gigantic, but delicious! This is definitely something they've perfected and I can see why it's a crowd favorite. The inner layers are sweet and fluffy, and the edges are crisp and caramelized with the sugary glaze. Amazing, and also enough for at least 4 servings.
author: Delia Z.

description:
$1 Beignet Sundays! Cool, cute, quirky af. Small cafe with some seating and a line out the door.

Beignets are best eaten fresh. Powdered sugar is not evenly distributed. They put it in a brown paper bag and when you shake it, powdered sugar comes poofin' out the cracks. Which is my bad for shaking it, but their bad for not sprinkling it on each beignet (just one scoop of powdered sugar on the bottom of the bag) resulting for some very plain ones. Prob the staff dgaf because they have to pop these out like crazy on a Sunday.

Other than that, really enjoyed the beer,bacon,green onion, cheddar muffin. Not your typical muffin texture (more hearty breadlike if anything), but crunchy on the outside with great savory flavors. Also tried the donut muffin, which feels/tastes like a snickerdoodle in muffin shape. Very moist and soft on the inside with a nice sugary crusty exterior.

This bakery is def way in the fvck out there, like bordering the beach. Also seemed like a totally random location. But, still enjoyed the find!
author: Josephine T.

description:
Cool neighborhood bakery that serves up simple and tasty food.
Saturday when I passed by, there was a line outside the door.
It's been a while since I've visited Devil's Teeth Bakery so I decided to get in the line.

There are savory and sweet items in the morning.
I am a "sweet" person :0)
To sample, I picked up a banana walnut slice and a donut muffin.
Nothing fancy just straightforward baked goods. Both were okay; nothing fancy.
I also ordered a chai tea latte with almond milk ($3.75). The cup for the beverage is small so keep that in mind. Tasted (again) okay.

Given the fact that the location is on Noriega and 46th Avenue by the beach (Outer Sunset), this bakery has the market on fresh bakery goods; but also "is" the market. 
They are the only game in this part of town.
author: Joanna T.

description:
If there's a line out the door on a Sunday morning, you know it's good! Be prepared to buy more than you intended too. 

Don't let the line scare you away, it's fast, and the wait is 100% worth it. It definitely gets crowded, and the seating is pretty limited (indoors and outdoors). I highly recommend getting your items to-go!

Devil's Teeth Baking Company makes the best special breakfast sandwich: a hearty combo of bacon, pepper jack cheese, avocado, scrambled eggs, lemon-garlic aioli, and a buttermilk biscuit (drool). The biscuit was warm, buttery, soft, and complemented everything well. It was the perfect way to start my Sunday morning. 

I also loved their cinnamon rolls and chocolate chip cookies. Didn't get to try the one dollar Beignet Sundays, but I will be back!
author: Fanny H.

description: Probably one of the best breakfast sandwiches I've ever had! The buttermilk biscuits that make the bun are to die for. And, the best Beignets that are comparable to ones in New Orleans. The line was super long but definitely worth the wait! The coffee was also delicious and complimented their selections really well. Would definitely come here again!
author: Felix L.

description: I came here on a Saturday, and the line was pretty long. However, I sucked it up because of all the rave reviews. I sampled quite a bit, including the cinnamon roll, the ginger cookie, a Parmesan rosemary scone, the donut muffin, and the cheese garlic pretzel. My favorites were the cookie and the pretzel. Everything else was average. I guess I don't get the hype. Maybe it's because I didn't get the breakfast sandwich. But I will say the workers are very friendly.
author: Rachel H.

description:
Special Breakfast Sandwich- #12 on the 2015 7x7 100 Things to Eat Before You Die list.

I've been to Devil's Teeth Baking Company before, but had to come back to check out their highly touted Special Breakfast Sandwich. I stopped by around 10:30am on a Saturday, and although they were busy with a lot of people already enjoying their food outside and also waiting inside for their orders, the line was very short and moved quickly. However, 5-10 minutes after I placed my order, the line started getting quite long, and was out the door. The moral of the story is make sure you come early if you don't want to wait in line! This time around I tried:

-Special Breakfast Sandwich (Two Eggs Scrambled, Pepper Jack Cheese, Applewood Smoked Bacon, Avocado, Lemon-Garlic Aioli, Homemade Buttermilk Biscuit, $6.75, http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=QLQJVPEmo4_vlpaE55CIuA&userid=76vIFZcC7owykCBjMfGVXg): SO FREAKING DELICIOUS, and a must order! The biscuit was super buttery and flaky, and I loved the combination of eggs, cheese, bacon, avocado, and aioli. I will definitely be back for more breakfast sandwiches.
-Brownie ($3, http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=DDerBKEKawF_S0hxVnAi3w&userid=76vIFZcC7owykCBjMfGVXg): Nice and chocolately, but I didn't fall in love with it. This is the only item I don't think I would get again.
-Cinnamon Roll ($4.25, http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=Xj-Aow0aZ2GQIC8IpbBi-w&userid=76vIFZcC7owykCBjMfGVXg): Delicious- one of the best cinnamon rolls I've had in a while. You can definitely taste the butter though, so this isn't diet food, but worth getting as a treat.

They have plenty of other baked good options to choose from, and coffees you can order, so definitely a great place to check out. There isn't much comfortable seating though- you can sit outside on some stone type steps, and there is a small counter area inside to sit at. Parking was fine during the time that I went, but street parking can be difficult to find.
author: Amy D.

description:
Honestly used to be one of my favorite bakeries out in the suburbs of Sam Francisco. 

Extremely close to the beach and always packed with tons of sweets & yes THE BREAKFAST SANDWICH is worth it. I've been coming to this bakery for over 7 years now and the sweets have remained the same. The breakfast sandwich consist of a hearty buttery biscuit and in between is 2 scrambled eggs, bacon, and cheddar cheese. It is really heavy but meh, who cares.

Most of the sweets here are overly sweet but what do you expect from cookies, lemon bars, chocolate cake, and brownies.

Also gave the iced chai a try today, overall alright.
author: Kary Y.

description:
I hadn't eaten at Devils Teeth in a while largely because of the long lines of hipsters, but I went there with my sons today to get breakfast sandwiches.

Straight away I noted that the biscuits were no longer thick, firm and flaky. Instead, ours were thin and doughy. Secondly, there definitely was only two slices of bacon on the sandwiches (there used to be three). My son says he asked somebody at the counter about that recently, and they told him it was because the price of bacon has gone up. Fair enough, but so have the prices on your sandwiches (20% since you opened). I'm fine with paying more for a prepared meal when the cost of ingredients goes up...but not so much with paying more for less.

There is also a noticeable inconsistency in the size of the breakfast sandwiches. We got three sandwiches. Two of them had maybe 1-1.5 eggs in them and the third had about 2.5 eggs in it. I noticed others with regular breakfast sandwiches varying noticeable in size. I hope Devils Teeth works on better uniformity in their breakfast sandwiches.

Lastly, and this is a big thing for me, I watched a person in the back doing food prep. He was cutting up 3-4 large blocks of cheese using his bare hands (ewww!). Maybe he washed his hands; maybe he didn't. That isn't the point. Plastic food prep gloves don't cost much...people handling food for others to consume should be wearing them.

Now $6 and of lesser quality than the signature item which put them on the map and made them a destination, I still think Devils Teeth breakfast sandwiches are OK. It's a few blocks away, so it's convenient. However, I can't see myself continuing to recommend Devils Teeth as a destination to my friends in other parts of SF for an average sandwich and questionable food prep hygiene.
author: Michael W.

description:
My gf and I stopped by before heading up to Sonoma. I wish we would have come earlier because the traffic was horrible. Anyhow, the first thing we noticed was the line. Naturally we complained to ourselves but I've never complained after eating food from a place with a line like this.

We had:
- chocolate chip cookie - ehhh it was alright
- Lemon bar - WOW so good
- Special breakfast sandwich - Mind. blown.
- Coffee. It was coffee. nothing special.

I highly recommend this place!
author: Elliott J.

description: The breakfast sandwich is one of the most perfectly put together items I've ever ordered, it's amazing every single time and never leaves anything to be desired. The line can get a little crazy, so go early and be patient.
author: Sam A.

description: When they first opened, they use to be way more innovative with their desserts. And now, they probably just sell what is more popular - but it was really disappointing because I thought it was part of their charm.
author: Saideh H.

description: Stick with the egg sammy and the pastries. I've attempted ordering the BLT a few times and every single time it comes overloaded with mayo and mustard. Like... mustard so strong you might think there's horseradish on there. So, I asked for less mayo and less mustard. What happens? The BLT comes out literally dripping of mayo and mustard. The mustard was so intense I couldn't eat more than a few bites and had to toss the rest. It's a bummer for sure because I love this place. I'll also add whenever a friend orders the BLT they forget to make it. So weird but it has happened every single time to them as well as a few times to me. Lucky those egg sammies are so good!
author: Ryan M.

description:
OMG the cinnamon roll is out of this world!!!  It is more like a brioche in the shape of a cinnamon roll.  You can taste the butter in each bite.  But the most incredible part is the candied sugar crust that adds an amazing crunch which is lacking in a typical cinnamon roll.  At $4.25, this roll is humongous (more appropriately sized for 2 people) and worth every penny and is hands down one of my favorite baked goods in SF.  Oh and we came at 11:15am on a Saturday and they had not run out.  

On my second visit I also tried the breakfast sandwich and it too was good.  The biscuit was soft and buttery with a crisp edge and the eggs, bacon, and melted cheddar were great.  I wolfed it down and 20 minutes later felt insanely full.  Delicious as it was though, I probably would not regularly travel across the city and then wait 30 minutes for the breakfast sandwich.  Next time I want to saturate my butter intake I might just order two cinnamon buns...
author: Beatrice W.

description: This place has killer breakfast sandwiches! My husband has been bugging me to go here and I've been dreading it because I don't like biscuits and I don't like breakfast sandwiches. I'm a parfait or cereal kind of person. Wow, this place got me! The special breakfast sandwich was love at first bite.
author: Sofia B.

description: The special breakfast sandwich here deserves 6 stars. They bake their biscuits in house and they are so fluffy, buttery, and greasy (but I'm saying that as a good thing). In between you get fluffy eggs, bacon, pepper jack cheese, and creamy avocado. They then top off the sandwich with lemon garlic aioli which binds all the ingredients together. It's good, really good. My only two complaints: 1) they need to put more of the aioli and 2) Devil's Teeth is way to far from where a live.
author: Cindy A.

description:
I've been coming to Devils teeth for quite some time now. This time I was not impressed. I ordered beignets, lemon bars and special breakfast sandwich. The beignets were burnt. And the lemon bars are melting in the bag the second they were handed to me. On the other hand the breakfast sandwich was good.

I've also noticed each time I come in the workers are more interested in gossiping than actually paying attention to customers. It's only when they need to get customers out the door or a payment that they really pay attention to each customer.
author: Stephanie F.

description:
Visited this fine establishment the other day and enjoyed their Bacon, beer, cheddar, green onion muffin ($3.50) and Peanut butter chocolate chip cookie ($2.50). 

If your looking for comfort snacks this is your place!
author: Kristina S.

description: 3 people in line ahead of me got the cinnamon rolls. I don't really even like them that much but decided to give it a try since they were so popular! And it did not disappoint! If you ever need some bad carbs this is the place to go!
author: David P.

description:
I kept mistakenly thinking this was called Doctor Teeth... How ironic.

This wasn't my first time at Devil's teeth, so I was excited to try something new once more! I've had their chocolate chip cookie, ginger cookie, and a mini pie back in the day. The other day I was able to try their Blackberry Crumble Cake and their Bignets! I didn't know they had those!

The Blackberry Crumble Cake actually wasn't as sweet as I had hoped it to be. Although I normally like my crumble cakes with a combination of coffee in one hand, this pastry was easily edible without it. The crumble on top did not fall apart like other places would but it was not as flaky as I normally liked either. The cake itself was moist and heavy but the large blackberry's definitely had their chance to make an appearance. 

The bignets came out to be small miniature donuts that was slapped in a bag of powdered sugar. We ordered two and shook the crap out of the paper bag until the powdered sugar started to release into the air. We ripped open the bag to only see that only one was covered entirely though. Still, I thought it was a good chance to see what the hubub was about. The bignet bread itself was very fresh and hot. It was lightly crusted on the outside and thick and soft on the inside. The powdered sugar was a definite MUST to make this bignet complete. On the other hand, the bignet without minimal powdered sugar was not as succesful. It literally tasted like a plain unflavored donut. I would've preferred some glazed icing.

I loved their outdoor seating and the community that this small bakery brings together. The bakers in the back are very kind and very honest of their favorites. So if you don't know what to choose, it doesn't hurt to close your eyes and point, because all of them will hit your taste buds just as good as the next!
author: Linda K.

description: Great neighborhood bakery. I'm addicted to their egg biscuit sandwiches. The cinnamon bun is ridiculously large and delicious. I'm not into beignets, but they are tasty. I love sitting in their outdoor space and hanging with the locals.
author: rik p.

description: I like it, only draw back might be the limited inside seating. Got the special breakfast sandwich, yummy, Fresh squeesed OJ, Feta Pretzle. If theres a line or no inside seat available when you go ask for the chalk and make a work of art while you wait or maybe some words of wisdom or a laugh.
author: Patrick H.

description:
Came here around 1pm on Sunday. I have heard great things about this place and was excited to try it out. 

I don't know if they've had a rough morning or anything but from the first look of it, I must doubt the cleanliness. Honestly if the reviews weren't so great, I'd walk straight out. I could see a bunch of dirty towels next to the espresso machine, the beignet dough wasn't covered and it was just sitting on the countertop with everything going on. 

Long story short, the reg girl was rude, every staff in the store (except for one dude) act like everyone owes them money. The special sandwich was good, the pastries were ok, and the beignet was dense, it was fried dough with sugar so it was still good. I know it's only $1 but don't call it a beignet when it is clearly not. 

Im pretty positive that I'll not be coming here again. I mean, why should I put up with such a tude when I'm a paying customer with a smile on my face? Just because you have good ratings and a line throughout the door doesn't mean that you can treat your customer like shit. It's called customer service, look it up.
author: Alyssa H.

description:
Stopped by here before Corgi Con 2016. I got the donut muffin and the special breakfast sandwich. I also got to sample the cinnamon roll. The food was extremely good. The breakfast sandwich was to die for; buttery biscuits, perfectly cooked bacon, my fresh tasty ingredients all around. The donut muffin was also tasty but the sample I had of the cinnamon roll was truly amazing! 

The big drawback: the line and the wait. The line moved quickly enough despite its enormous length but once we had ordered the real wait began. It was pretty painfully long. It took probably 30-45 minutes after we ordered to get our sandwiches. Very disappointing wait time. Then someone else actually took my friends sandwich because there was a name mixup. 

So the wait is painful but the food is great.
author: Monica M.

description:
Ordered a special breakfast sandwich and when i got home there was no avocado, no sauce, and no cheese... $7 and a long line for a mouth full of biscuit. I would have rather ordered a breakfast sandwich from McDonald's. 

Cinnamon roll was tasty though :/
author: Michelle H.

description: This place has earned every one of its 5 stars on Yelp. Every baked delight I've tried I've loved. The coffee's on point, their service is top notch, and their breakfast sandwiches are killer (and totally worth the 25 minute wait on weekends)
author: Sasha A.

description: The special breakfast sandwich is bomb! Do yourself a favor and check it out. I'm not a local so will not be able to enjoy weekly but I would suggest getting there before 9:00 am if you don't want to wait in line. Made to order and drip coffee! What more do you need?
author: Jarrod B.

description:
That. Was. Awesome.
Get the special breakfast sandwich (or bowl of eggs if you're not into the delicious buttermilk biscuit). The cinnamon rolls looked insane too--but we happily opted for the raspberry bars with no regrets!
It's a random spot that's worth the drive and potential long line (15-20 min?).
author: Avi Z.

description: Hands down the most amazing breakfast sandwich! I was in the area for a week and came back multiple times! I got the special bfast sandwich -- LOVED the millionaires bacon. Also had an iced chai tea latte which was pretty standard, not a stand out drink, but satisfying.  Picked up a few pastries to bring home and I enjoyed the carrot cake. My little sister wasn't a huge fan of the shark-shaped cookie in terms of taste, although it is cute! The line is long, but this place is worth the wait!
author: Cassandra F.

description: I Absolutely LOVE the food served here! Definitely a place to visit in the Sunset area. Although their items are a little overpriced it's too delicious to not get. The wait here definitely tests your patience, but trust me the food is worth the wait (depending on how long the line is, it gets packed here on the weekends). Sometimes they run out of bread, so I suggest you have a back up plan. Overall great service and good food, I definitely recommend it.
author: Cessy C.

description:
It's 4 stars, even though I had a somewhat negative experience. 

Was turned on by a friend; showed up on a quiet Tuesday morning. Ended up waiting 30 minutes for an unremarkable grilled cheese. 

Some dude that was there before me stormed out because they apparently lost his order, and the people in line after me kept coming in from the parklet looking for their order... because if you're ordering from a counter at a not-busy bakery, shit should take about 20 minutes max. 

I appreciate that the talent is pulling shit off just right, but they need to figure out how to more efficiently execute their magic. (And also, the grilled cheese WAS disappointing.)

I'm a fan of the food, but the getting-it-to-me part was woeful. Figure it out, friends.
author: Angela K.

description: Super small cozy bakery shop! Delicious pastries of all kinds. Their huge cinnamon rolls are sweet and crunchy! Best I've ever eaten! They have outdoor seating but it gets crowded and you might not be able to sit.
author: Crystal R.

description:
Everything here is absolutely delicious. I love their infamously delicious and hearty breakfast sandwich, with fresh homemade bisquits, eggs, bacon, and cheddar. If it's a Sunday I am there wolfing down a batch of freshly fried beignets. Third love is definitely the cinnamon rolls, which are pretty incredible, they're flakey and have caramelized sugar and cinnamon on the bottoms. 

A note on the line that you will invariably encounter: Don't be fooled by the hungry crowd, the boys and girls of Devils Teeth keep the line moving so you won't be waiting too long. With the exception of extra wait time for fresh goodies to be prepared, which is way worth it. And any wait time is pretty well mitigated by the fact that you get to do said waiting in the (mostly) lovely outer sunset with a convenient curbside parklet with a good amount of seating. 

Bonus points for cute dogs galore.
author: Amanda B.

description:
Today, this bakery flaked on delivering two birthday cakes, lemon bars, and raspberry bars for my grandfather's 90th birthday party. My grandmother confirmed the delivery in advance the week prior via both email and telephone, and she and my mother began calling the bakery when an hour had passed since the cakes were supposed to be delivered. 

No one picked up the phone at Devil's Teeth for three hours during which the bakery was open (noon - 3pm). My mother saved the celebration by driving to Ambrosia Bakery, which quickly prepped a substitute chocolate cake and custard tart with my grandfather's name. Thanks, responsible bakers of Ambrosia! You saved my grandfathers birthday today.

As the celebration was winding down, we finally receive a phone call from Devil's Teeth. What followed was pitiful. The bakery promised a full refund, but said they'd still deliver the order (too little too late). 

The catch? They couldn't even deliver the lemon bars OR raspberry bars because "they were under cooked today," so instead, they brought some brownies and muffins from (I assume) their storefront's morning display. The chocolate cake arrived (remember, too late to count!) squished. The second cake, a buttercream white cake, was only slightly less damaged.

"You had just ONE job" sums it up. Funny how their website claims they specialize in cakes and catering. This review won't overcome the effusive praise that this place's cinnabuns and expensive sandwiches have somehow earned it, and it looks like DTBakingCo has glowing approval from many well-respected hipster websites. But do not count on this place to take an expensive, important order seriously - or even answer your calls.

UPDATE: Devil's Teeth dutifully returned my grandmother's $122 today, as well as a few lemon bars. 

I'll just quote her here: "However, guests had travelled a distance for the occasion.  The hostess had worked months arranging the event in his honor-- and not to have the cakes--high point of the festivity not appear broke the spell of the work and the festivity.

No good will can return that rising happiness."
author: Levi G.

description: One of my favorite bakeries. All of their baked goods are hand made, from scratch, and delicious. The line can get a bit long but it is worth the wait.
author: Celeste B.

description:
What a gem in the Outer Sunset! I'm glad to see a hip, rustic bake shop away from Downtown SF and the Mission.

I came here relatively early with my roommates on a Saturday morning around 8:30am. There was no long line, and the wait for the food was about 5-10 minutes.

We got the cinnamon roll, the "Special Breakfast Sandwich," and donut muffins. The cinnamon roll, though it wasn't warmed, was light and gooey (and totally big enough to share). The "Special Breakfast Sandwich" (made to order) had a delightful tangy sauce and was served on a flaky, fluffy biscuit. The donut muffins were perfectly sprinkled with cinnamon and sugar and surprisingly light.

I would definitely come back here again--especially to try their Sunday $1 beignets!
author: Ryan M.

description:
The breakfast sandwich and the cinnamon rolls are amazing. Customer service is very polite, however the waiting time is ridiculous and it looks like the are not organized. I saw at least 10 people receive their breakfast sandwich before me when they order after. It kind of ruined my whole experience. It happened to another person as well so it could be a common problem.

I'll give it another try.
author: Silvia U.

description:
Devil's teeth does not make the best breakfast sandwich of the year. BUT THE BEST BREAKFAST SANDWICH OF THE LIFE. A sandwich the likes of Picasso, West, and Disney dream off. 

Tip: Don't be basic and get the regular breakfast sandwich. (Although it is quite tasty. Not to hate on basic people, only positive vibes.) The special breakfast sandwich is where it's at. If you have earbuds and access to music, listen to your favorite song while eating this. 

Anyways, you can't go wrong with anything on the menu. The treats are to die for. The Sunset vibes enhance Devil's Teeth's aesthetic. This is a must go for anyone visiting SF. This is a must for anyone that has working tastebuds!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: CJ A.

description:
Their breakfast sandwich really hit the spot! 
- The highlight of sandwich was the thick cut bacon, cooked so that the strips were nice and crispy all the way through. 
- Eggs were cooked well but needed some seasoning. Their salsa (which is near the ketchup, straws, salt, pepper, etc) is pretty good on the egg. 
- Biscuit to filling ratio was awesome. It seemed to be a super flat but wide biscuit so that there was more filling than biscuit.
