- Not enough cheese but I didn't mind since that bacon was soo good.

Arrived after 1:30pm on a Sunday and there was a line of course, and after waiting in line, a longer wait for the sandwich, but soo worth it. Like others said, probably best not to come if you're in a hurry.

Parking wasn't too hard to find in this area.

The sweets looked good and a lot of people seemed to like their beignets but I only tried their breakfast sandwich and a couple drinks.

Iced tea was nothing special and the thai milk tea was not bad.
author: Yvonne K.

description:
This is my friend's favorite breakfast place so he decided to take me here and try it out. If you're driving here, good luck finding parking - which is usually on the street. The line here is super long so if you have a friend with you, drop them off in the front and have them stand in line because it will get long fast!

We waited for about 10-15 minutes until we we're able to order. For the baked goods, we ordered the donut muffin and the bacon cheddar muffin. The donut muffin was literally sprinkled with sugar and was too sweet for me. However, the bacon cheddar muffin surprisingly tasted superb!

We also ordered the special breakfast sandwich and was shocked to find out that they said it would take 25-30 minutes. We looked at each other with skepticism but decided to go for it anyway since we we're already here and it was my first time. After placing our order, we went home quickly to gather our things for our trip later and drove back to find that our order was still not ready and waited another 15-20 minutes.

45-ish minutes in, they finally completed our order... At this point I was not having it because it was a surprise to us that we had to wait that long on top of the line.

Props to the lady on the register who handled everything smoothly. What surprised me was that why it took about 50 minutes to make our sandwich when two people's orders were switched up - two special breakfast sandwich suddenly appeared.

Suggestion: Have an estimate time of the line + the order before people start lining up so they're aware of what they're getting themselves into. Also, mass produce the special breakfast sandwich. I'm sure either way that it would taste great, but it's not wait-50-minutes-to-get-one-sandwich great.

Would I come back here? Maybe.. I'd like to try more of their food. Would I recommend this to a friend? Perhaps, if they don't mind waiting in line and waiting for their order for that long.
author: Aj C.

description:
Devils Teeth Baking is something the perfectly encompasses what San Francisco is known for. Good food, strong coffee, and cold weather.

Located very close to Ocean beach I have the luxury of being walking distance to this place and I try to take advantage of it as much as possible. What can be said about Devil's Teeth that hasn't already been said about this place? Nothing unfortunately, the breakfast sandwich is probably one of the best things to eat in San Francisco, with the warm biscuit, soft egg, avocado, and of course that special sauce they put on it. To top it off the house made sweets are always yummy and I always take some home to snack on.

Devils teeth will always stand out in my mind as a truly great staple of San Francisco living, with delicious food, great pastries, and a staff that will always greet you with a smile. This place is a must try in San Francisco.
author: James C.

description:
This place is  beloved local Sunset brekky haunt. 

But I gotta say, my cinnamon roll was not even the slightest redolent of cinnamon spice. I felt the dough fell waaaay short of delivering. Big size doesn't mean well crafted to me. 

And the breakfast biscuit: wasn't that bowled over by the quality of the buttermilk disc. Inside filling: standard Denny's. 

Don't get why the huge lines. Did I try the wrong stuff, or just a dearth of other options? Lovely little curbside kick-it area to soak up some rays though. That was def special.
author: Jana C.

description:
This is by far my favorite breakfast spot!
I've been here twice and both times have been excellent. Really good customer service, and the sandwich's are to die for. I always order the breakfast sandwich ($5.50) and my boyfriend gets the special breakfast sandwich ($6.75). The buttermilk biscuit is homemade and melts in your mouth. The bacon is just how I like it, nice and crispy and the egg, is well just a regular scrambled egg. You can also get cheese on your sandwich but I request no cheese because I am lactose intolerant.  But all of it put together so AMAZING!

Depending on the time of day you go, the line can get long. This means the wait will be even longer because everything is freshly made. All totally worth it though. 

Will be back soon!
author: Jenna N.

description:
My dear friend Tim was in town last weekend and in exchange for a ride to the Sunset, I was awarded breakfast! (This literally always works with me: buy me food and I will grant any favor -within reason, come on guys.) 

We stopped in on this past gorgeous Saturday and ordered two Breakfast Sandwiches. He got an Arnold Palmer, I had a lemonade. Simple and perfect. The breakfast sandwich was seriously massive and kept me full all day. Imagine this: two warm, homemade crusty biscuits enveloping a stack of fluffy, yellow scrambled eggs, melty cheese, and thick cut bacon. Mmmmm just thinking about it is making me drool a little, as I'm sure is happening to you also.  I washed this beaut down with my tart lemonade and smiled at my pal, the gaggle of dogs walking past, and at the treasure I had been introduced to. Bake on, Devil's Teeth, bake on.
author: Crystal C.

description:
+ THE FOOD
I tried the donut muffin and loved it! The texture of the muffin was really cake-y and moist. I kind of expected the donut aspect to be more like a glazed donut, but it was actually a sugar donut. It still tasted really good as it wasn't too sweet.

+ THE PRICES
I actually expected the prices to be way more expensive. The donut muffin was only $2.50. Other pastries are around $5 or less!
author: Cindy C.

description: Staff is rude and was not helpful. Drove for over an hour to get there and they did not have what we wanted and were very rude.
author: Jessica J.

description: Very reasonable prices for the best baked goods I've had in SF. You must try the special breakfast sandwich and the cheese danish. There was a small line at 8:45am, but my understanding is that it gets exponentially longer as the day goes on.
author: Neha S.

description:
Four words. Breakfast sandwich.. GET IT. 

Lemon garlic aioli with avocado, bacon, eggs, fluffy biscuit.. whats not to love? I really enjoyed it, but it left me feeling really heavy after since I normally eat oatmeal, yogurt, or fruit for breakfast. I don't think I would wait more than 15 mins for this breakfast delicacy, just because I hate lines, but if you happen to be in the area, and its not that crowded, feel free to stop in for one of these bad boys.
author: Eleana H.

description:
The Special is truly a triumph in breakfast sandwich making - it's a must order. 

The pastries are also good and coffee options are decent. Come early to avoid long lines on Saturdays and Sundays - it's a small kitchen so expect to wait!
author: Brooke N.

description: I can't believe I had never been here before. Some of the most delicious Chocolate cake I've ever had!!! Very nice employees and quick service, I'll be back, a lot!!!
author: Erin V.

description:
So we live 3 blocks away...we usually avoid this place cause the line is really long...however we were able to get there right around when it opened today, my BF left the house at 6:54am and drove down. They open at 7am.....Only 1 person was in front of my BF in line....why does it take so long to get an order??

This was my BF's text to me at 7:24am as he was still waiting for his order...

"I hate this place. Wtf are they doing butchering the fkn pig by hand and raising chickens to lay the eggs? Maybe threshing the wheat to make the flour and smelting the metal to make the pan. 
They're also fracking the natural gas to heat the stove probably...There was 1 person in front of me..." (LOL)

workers are talking in between slicing a biscuit....and talking while working the stove....my BF goes to the counter and and says "I don't want to be THAT guy but what are you guys doing? 30 minutes for a breakfast sandwich while you guys are standing around talking and hanging out?" The guy goes oh what's your name? And he tells him and the guy says oh it's right here ready....

Yup, sitting there behind the counter....just waiting....and no one called his name...

No wonder the line is always long! Cause people wait a ridiculous amount of time to get their order!

If the wait time being the first couple customers of the day takes 30 minutes, no thanks.

So if you want to wait forever for your food while workers just talk and hang out at this place and don't want to give people their orders by all means GO...

We however are never going back again....
author: Linda L.

description:
I really love this place! The customer service is awesome, food is delicious, coffee is great and I really have nothing but positive feedback on them. 

I was craving a breakfast Sandoval for months...finally getting back to SF I got one (opted for the no meat because though I love bacon, it has to be made to order for me and here their bacon is cooked in advance) and it was so delicious. 

A lot of places will pass off subpar avocado but not here! It's awesome. I tried a breakfast sandwich from another spot recently and honestly I think McDonald's could have been better if they added avocado lol but here, it was tasty and fresh and made with love (awwww). 

If you're in sf visiting or live in or around the area, please make it a point to stop in here. They have tons of baked goods and fresh bread and great drinks. You just can't go wrong!

Enjoy ;)
author: Bella B.

description: This is probably the best breakfast sandwich I've ever had. The biscuit was so flaky and buttery and the garlic aioli took the sandwich to a whole new level. My friend and I also got their massive cinnamon roll and it was so gooey and delicious. It was not a traditional cinnamon roll, but I was obsessed with it.  I'm looking forward to going back and trying their other pastries.
author: Marite C.

description: The special breakfast sandwich makes waking up unreasonably early on a weekend actually worth it. I wish I'd ordered two.
author: Judit N.

description:
So, I should start my review by saying that if it weren't for the savory menu items that I ordered, I probably would have given this place four stars based on their sweet items:

Honestly, maybe my experience with their desserts/pastries was another one of those times where the hype is so great, that I expected a mouthwatering experience, but I was very underwhelmed with what I had ordered. I had gotten their donut muffin, chocolate chip cookie, scone, and a couple of other items. All of them failed to impress me. I have a huge sweet tooth so as it is, my expectations were high and they were most likely set even higher with everything I heard about this place from newsletters, reviews, stories, etc. Don't get me wrong, they were good, but nothing that I couldn't have a) made myself at home or b) gotten at some other bakery.

HOWEVER, their savory items... WOW oh WOW.... I am a huge breakfast person so when I find a breakfast sandwich that literally makes me salivate, I know I am in heaven. Their special breakfast sandwich is what will make me come all the way here from SOMA because it is that good. I thought it would honestly be too much with the amount of ingredients that are in there but shockingly, it worked. Now, I have to warn people that when it is crowded, it can take up to 15-20 minutes to get this sandwich so do not come here if you are in a rush. However, if you have the patience, then absolutely get one. I also got the savory muffin. Now I don't usually like "savory pastries" aka bacon scones, bacon/chive biscuits, ham croissants, but this muffin... AMAZING. I don't remember what was in it but it was just as good and filling as the breakfast sandwich.

Again, not a huge fan of the sweet items, but I will DEFINITELY be coming back for the breakfast sandwich and/or savory muffin!
author: Kunal N.

description: Arrived on a Sunday morning around 8, very busy. Service was OK, they looked under pressure I get it. Ordered the quiche with meat, delicious!. Not a lot of meet going on mostly just on the top. Tasted the jalapeño cheese pretzel. It was OK, nothing great.
author: Shakei D.

description:
Their product is good. Don't get me wrong.  But today, my first experience, was wrought with errors. 

First, they were out of everything by 10am. They close at 4pm, so to run out if so much before the halfway point in their day is kind of rough. A bakery should have a better handle on inventory. Other established bakeries in the area don't seem to have that problem.

Second, we waited a very long time for our food. People behind us in line were getting their orders before us. So I asked the girl at the counter and she just handed me my sandwiches. They were just sitting there. 

Third, they messed up our order. Because what we ordered was more expensive, she charged us again.   We ended up paying $31 for three breakfast sandwiches and a cup of coffee. When we asked the cashier, he said, "sounds about right." But I think he's wrong.... The sandwiches we ordered are only $6.75 each and a cup of coffee is $2.75. Math.

Fourth, when we asked to get our correct order, the cook threw a major tantrum and was hate cooking!!! We ate HATE SANDWICHES. And their kitchen is in plain view, so to see all that anger then be handed the food was a little disheartening.

And last but definitely not least, I saw one of their employees handle food without gloves. That wouldn't be a problem, but she was on her cell phone, touching other stuff, bringing food to people  in the front of the restaurant, and I didn't see her wash them again before returning to touching food. Oh the unsanitary! 

Anyways, I love their food though, so I'll likely return, but not before considering other places before. Donut muffin. Special breakfast sandwich. YUM!
author: Preston M.

description: Overrated.  It's good but not worth waiting 30-45 minutes for. The Yonker cafe the opposite street has great bagel sandwich. Coffee here is so so too. Won't come back.
author: Glenn A.

description: Always fantastic. Amazing sweets, fantastic sandwiches (read: not low cal) made with melt in your mouth biscuits great coffee and it's all dirt cheap. There's always a line, but it moves quickly.
author: David L.

description: Warm wonderful beignets, great hearty breakfast sandwiches and amazing cinnamon rolls.
author: Michael N.

description: Best breakfast sandwich in the city, and the rest of the baked goods are delicious.  Awesome little spot, but get there at or before 9AM or there'll be a wait.  If you can't get there by 9, it's still worth the wait...
author: Alex P.

description:
A mix of cafe and brunch place, not exactly one or the other. While the menu is not extensive the items are pretty good. The portions are big  - I liked the BLT most.

The breakfast bars and cinnamon roll are rich and sugary, definitely needs to be shared. IMO their donut muffins are even better than their beignets (Sundays only though). Always get donut muffins, have extras for next day breakfast (just heat them back up). The coffee is strong so careful if you're not a regular drinker. I also like they carry coconut water and fresh juice to go.

Almost strictly to-go as the only seats are a few high stools facing the street. The parklet outside is nice to sit on a sunny day - it does get crowded. Most customers are still locals and it is very family and pet friendly (always more families and pets than the typical foodie).

Good thing they close at 4pm so you can go pretty much anytime - wake up late on the weekend, after a bike/run along the Great Highway, before visiting the SF Zoo, going to Ocean Beach, etc.
author: Peter L.

description:
This place is perfect in a nice, sunny day when you want to grab a few solid items and head on over to the beach. A good alternative to the typical sit-down brunch. 

The thing to get? Breakfast sandwiches. The biscuits are made in house and they're jam packed with scrambled eggs, cheese, avocado and bacon (if you get the special). Delicious when you eat it fresh and hot. 

Bonus: if you come on Sunday, they have $1 beignets--and they're big, fluffy and all kinds of sugary goodness.

I would avoid getting the other baked goods--nothing really stuck out as incredible, but go ahead and grab yourself an iced coffee and stroll on over to the beach

Note: they have outdoor seating but don't expect to find space inside. It's quite small and very very limited
author: Jay P.

description:
Best breakfast sandwich I have ever eaten in my entire life! ... seriously. The Special breakfast sandwich, not just the normal one. The Special breakfast sandwich comes with scrambled eggs (love the texture of the eggs), pepper jack cheese (LOVE pepper jack cheese...this enhanced it a lot), bacon, their lemon-garlic aioli sauce (couldn't figure out what this sauce was at the time, but was reallllly good), and AVOCADO!!!! .. and lots of it! On top of that, they bake their own flaky buttermilk biscuits. 

Tiny place, had a line when we went, and not too many places to sit, but we did find a bench on the outside of the store to sit/stand/eat around. 

Will definitely come back and bring some more friends/family along. :)
author: Connie H.

description:
Had the original breakfast sandwich and a latte. Went at 11am on a Wednesday so there was no line, but still had to wait a while for both to come out. The breakfast sandwich took 10 minutes, but it did come out hot and fresh and super delicious. The biscuit was buttery and flaky. The bacon was thick and crispy. The sandwich is also pretty large so it's good if you like a big hearty breakfast to start your day. Latte was foamy. Friendly staff as well. 

Overall, really good food and coffee, but wait was a little longer than I hoped especially with no line.
author: Chloe T.

description:
Quite possibly the heaviest cinnamon roll on the planet! Not sure how any one person can finish this beast by themselves. There must be a few sticks of butter in each one of this bad boy. It was the only thing my wife and I picked up today. 

This is my first time at this bakery. It's a block away from where my wife grew up. Interesting to see how there's always a line of yuppies lining up for this heart attack bake goods. Must be everyone cheat day.

Good thing we came in the afternoon. We didn't have to wait to order our pound of brick. I heard that people line up up to an hour to get their breakfast sandwiches. Perhaps I'll find out one day if it's worth the wait.
author: Tawan G.

description: Yum yum yum! After a Saturday morning jog, my boyfriend and I headed over to The Devil's teeth baking for some good old fashion biscuit and eggs, bacon, cheese and avocado. Never disappointed. We deserved the greatest reward and coming here was worth it. Truly love everything, the staff, vibes, and walking distance to the beach. Since I moved to the sunset area I'm definitely going to be a regular for now on :)
author: Evelyn O.

description: Great little local cafe! We stopped by here on the way home to get some breakfast (eggs with sides) and coffee. The staff is super friendly and the food was delicious. It really has a small town beach front cafe vibe (duh, it is right by Ocean Beach).  Seems most people take their food to go, but we sat at the little window bar to eat.
author: Elena R.

description:
The line on a Sunday morning was out the door, and for good reason.

Cinnamon Roll - Do yourself a solid and split this with someone. Just because you can finish it doesn't mean you should, my friend. This is delicious, but it is a cavity and diabetes-inducing monstrosity. 

Breakfast Sandwich - This is made to order so expect to be waiting a while if you come during busy times. The biscuit is flak and buttery, and the egg is velvety and fluffy. It could use an extra strip of bacon to be honest.

I tried samples of the brownie and carrot cake and both were divine!! Highly recommend if you want to treat yourself.

Definitely would revisit and try the other things like the bacon & cheese scone.
author: Lucy N.

description:
I had to file a flight plan to get to the Devil's Teeth and sample their sticky bun ( I'm coming from the East Bay). The bun was everything I'd hoped for. It's layers and layers of gooey goodness. This bun can only get better if  you can get it home, throw it in the oven and drown it in butter.  I have to get back and try one of  the biscuit sandwiches. 

The Devil's Teeth is about three blocks from the ocean. So, during the summer months, this would be a great place to get a sandwich and sticky bun and have a mini picnic on the beach.
author: Anthony W.

description:
Wonderful service - went on beignet Sunday when there was a line way out the door. Ordered the special breakfast sandwich without the bacon - really yummy and filling and they def didn't skimp out on any of the contents, especially the avocado...The chunks were literally falling off left and right :D 
Everyone else in line was ordering dozens upon dozens of beignet so I regretted ordering only one but after that bfast sandwich I'm glad I didn't let my eyes order! The beignet was the yummiest powder-dusted fried ball of dough i've ever had.
author: Sakina G.

description:
Showed up at 0700 to be first in after reading this place usually has a line.  It smelled of beacon throughout the store. There were tasty looking baked goods behind the counter glass case. After asking what was the best think there, I was told the breakfast sandwich. 3 eggs, cheese, beacon all in a delicious biscuit. It was made to order. The biscuit was amazing, complimenting everything perfectly. 
That being said while waiting for my food I read what the special breakfast sandwich comes with and kinda wishing I would have ordered that. I guess I'll have to be back and try it out. 
I also order a strawberry banana muffin. I can comment on it yet cause I have not tried it but I am sure it will be awesome. 
I recommend this place!!
author: Sean B.

description: Nice place to get a quick bite or some baked snacks.  The selection is quite eclectic and the foods seems very fresh.  At the peak of the morning rush, there's a line out the door.  A little pricey but its a nice treat every so often.
author: Nit N.

description:
Finally had the chance to make a visit this morning to get the bake goods fresh right when the bakery opened :) 

FOOD: I ordered the famous cinnamon roll foe $4.25 and OMG. Best cinnamon roll I've ever tried so far. These cinnamon rolls are not you're average white sugar frosting glazed cinnamon rolls. It's way better. It's caramelized sugar that makes the top really crispy and sweet while the insides are nice and fluffy. mmmmm :D It is a bit on the sweeter side (took me awhile to finish this even with my big sweet tooth), so splitting this with one or two other people would be best.

My sister got the lemon poppy seed scone $4.25 and it was so warm, flaky and fresh and flavorful.

Their portions are pretty big so if you come here with a small group I would suggest all getting some different and splitting everything so you can taste a little bit of every thing. 

SERVICE: very friendly!

AMBIANCE: It's a very casual and hipster feel with beach decor. Very cute and artsy bench seating in front of the store and this bakery is practically right next to the beach so if you wanted to go watch the sunrise or go for a scroll with your pastries - it would be the perfect location. 

Overall. I will most definitely be visiting again, to try the donut muffin and coffee cake - IF it's still in season.
author: Samantha F.

description: I finally made it to Devil's Teeth! For years I've been put off by the line and had never found a time to go into it mentally prepared. Much to my surprise, it went very quickly! So many wasted years. Having studied it for quite some time, I decided to get a large amount of baked goods to bring (half) home to my family. I got three breakfast sandwiches (two of which were the special ones), a cinnamon roll, two pieces of focaccia, the chocolate pound cake, the donut muffin, and the everything pretzel. Wooooow, was everything delicious! It was just really solid. It was nothing new or trendy or revolutionary, but everything was just incredibly well made. The biscuit on the breakfast sandwich: perfectly flakey and salty. The focaccia: perfectly savory with a crispy exterior and doughy interior. The cinnamon roll: perfectly buttery layers covered in perfectly cooled melted brown sugar. You can't be in a bad mood when you eat these treats. I think everyone sticks around and hangs out outside because they just want to savor how perfect this food is. The employees have good vibes, the other customers have good vibes, the dogs have good vibes (obviously). I regret waiting so long to come here, but I will be back regularly to make up for lost time!
author: Isabella G.

description: Hands down yummiest bakery! Beignets, cinnamon roll, donut muffins, special breakfast sandwich, chocolate chip cookie, bacon...we legit ordered it all AND ate it all!
author: Betty S.

description: They are one of the best bakeries in San Francisco. Everything they have is delicious and worth trying. I absolutely love their food, I just wish it wasn't so expensive. I would give them 4.5/5. I love the cookies, cake, breakfast sandwiches, and more.
author: Nick J.

description:
Out of everything I've tried, the cinnamon roll is the best thing here hands down. Not only is it big, but it's super good. How can you argue with both quantity and quality? I love how it's composed of numerous thin layers rather than a thick piece of rolled up dough. This makes the flavor more homogeneous instead of having thick, distinct zones of cinnamon sugar and dough. I think the flavor of the cinnamon roll is a lot more cohesive this way. Because the layers are thinner, its more condensed and heavier. If you really want a soft, fluffy cinnamon roll, this is not what you're looking for. The cinnamon rolls also have a wonderful caramelized sugar glaze on top. It kinda has that burnt caramel flavor, which adds an intense character. Along with adding flavor, the glaze also gives the top a terrific, sugary crunch. These might be some of the best cinnamon rolls of all time. 

A lot of people come here for the beignets too. I like that they're freshly fried and hot. The crust is crispy and generously covered in powdered sugar. They're a bit too dense for my liking though. I prefer beignets that are more airy and fluffy. I would stick with the cinnamon rolls.
author: Nei N.

description: Their special breakfast sandwich is the best thing here! It takes about 20-30 mins for them to make depending on the amount of orders ahead of you. It is definitely a small hole in the wall type place but they make everything there from scratch. It is worth the wait and it is a pretty fulfilling sandwich. Plus try their hot sauce with the sandwich it is quite tasty and compliments it very well.
author: Lisa H.

description:
A new brunch spot discovered in my neighborhood :)
I really enjoyed their Bfast Sammie- I opted for sourdough instead of their biscuit.
Beignets are only $1 on Sundays!
Line is a bit long but worth it! I will be back to try more goodies.
author: Angela D.

description:
I have been wanting to try Devil's Teeth for a while now, a lot of people talk very highly of it and every time I have driven by there is always a line, so I figured it must be good.
     Today I finally made the decision to try it out. As I said there is a line, all the time (It does go pretty fast though). When I got to the counter there was no one there, so I walked to the register and the girl standing there (white girl with brown curly hair) rudely told me I had to wait for someone to help me first. . . ok? So I waited. After a while a very friendly gentleman (he had dyed blonde hair and a blue baseball hat) came over and grabbed a cinnamon roll and a beignets (Sundays they have $1 beignets) and I ordered the highly recommend special breakfast sandwich. The rude girl at the register chose to then go and grab food for the next guest in line. . . still not sure why she couldn't grab mine? So I waited at the register for another girl to come and just stare at me until I told her what I had.
     The beignet was good. . .for only being a $1, but it wasn't really a beignet. It was very dense and thrown into a brown paper bag that was soggy from all the oil, if it was more than $1 I would have complained but I guess you get what you pay for? On to the Special breakfast sandwich, Amazing! It was actually as good as everyone says it is, and more. The biscuit was soft and flaky, the bacon was crunchy, the avocado was fresh and the aoli was delicious!!
     It's just sad that so many places in SF have great food and terrible service. No one smiled, no one said hello/good day/how are you, and the pastries looked underwhelming (except for the breakfast sandwich). Besides the sandwich the food was just ok and could be found in any number of cafes around, so I won't be coming back.
     I'll say this, if you have never been, try it once. Order the special sandwich, it really is good, but I don't see a reason to come back a second time.
author: Josh D.

description:
The hype is real about the BREAKFAST SANDWICH SPECIAL...the biscuit is freshly baked as ordered so expect a 35-45minute wait. I think the secret goodness is in the garlic aioli and bacon combo! It's bomb so you must get!!
The rest unfortunately was just "meh" like the donut muffin- it was too grainy, hard, and tasted a bit stale

Chicken curry sandwich- good stuff but not as bomb as the breakfast sandwich special!
Bacon muffin- too dry 
Peanut butter cookie- was "aite"
Cinnamon bun/roll- better if it just came out of the oven or re-heated...
Lemonades
Arnold Palmer 
These drinks were bland and perfect combo if you're eating it with the cinnamon bun/roll ;)
author: Dee R.

description:
Ordered a Special Breakfast Sandwich Friday morning to bring to work. When I got to work, turns out I got a regular breakfast sandwich. It still tasted good but I waited forever to try their Special because they were out of avocados for a while.

I returned Monday morning to get the Special because I really wanted to try it. I gave them a heads up that I received the wrong order last time and they were apologetic and willing to correct their mistake. 

The Special was as good as I expected.

Thanks for the great customer service!
author: Annie N.

description: Stupid good breakfast sandwiches. I'm a vegetarian and I was able to swap bacon for greens and a tomato. Bravo!
author: Tom H.

description: I ordered a breakfast sandwich at 10:30am. While waiting for it to be made, I noticed the seemingly owner's unprofessional behavior. What astonished me was that she was rude and unappreciative to not just staff but also customers. I received my sandwich at 10:57am (27 minutes on a weekday). I enjoyed the sandwich, but won't be returning to support this behavior. It's a shame that the entire bakery's staff will be negatively impacted by one person's unprofessionalism.
author: Angel M.

description:
Came here around 11AM to meet up a friend for a quick brunch and boy...there was a line. Great thing is that the line moves along and they have a system in place to do thing efficiently.

I got the breakfast sandwich, paired with an Arnold Palmer. Also, I couldn't resist getting the beignets...only $1.00 each on Sundays! 

What's great about the breakfast sandwich is the biscuit they make themselves. To me, the sandwich was very filling, so I actually saved a bit of it for the next morning. And the beignets were a hearty portion. 

I'm definitely going to come back and hope to try their other breakfast sandwich, as well as pastries. I suggest coming earlier if you want to avoid the lines.
author: Vincent L.

description: Can't beat their food for the price! The folks that work there are nice! I had a guy tell me a coffee sitting in a pitcher already made and luke warm was fresh drip by the cup but hey, people believe a lot of strange things these days. The food is great!
author: S8adow M.

description:
Tried Special Breakfast Sandwich, Chocolate chip cookie, donut muffin and strawberry& banana muffin
-The Special Breakfast Sandwich  was super flavorful! the biscuit was flaky, the bacon was crisp & crunchy and the avocado made everything even better! would definitely recommend this sandwich! super satisfying but can be a bit heavy!

-Donut muffin was soft, fluffy & moist on the inside, a little bit too sweet and sugary for our taste but would be perfect for someone who has a sweet tooth! 

-Got the Chocolate Chip cookie, it's perfectly chewy on the inside and has a nice crust on the outside, perfect amount of sweetness and would definitely satisfy any cookie cravings! cookie is decently sized too so one cookie is enough for us! oh! and don't forget to ask for it heated! absolutely perfect!

- Although Strawberry& Banana muffin was good I don't think I would repurchase, I wasn't a big fan of the strawberries but the base of the banana muffin was good! i am looking forward to trying their other banana items though! I feel like those will be super tastey!

would definitely visit this place again!
author: Inthia T.

description:
Started going to devils teeth when they first opened. They are a super popular spot in the morning of the weekends. They are known for their breakfast sandwich which you can get it regular or the special. And on Sunday you can get $1 beignets! 

The reason why i rated average is because they are not very consistent with their foods. Sometimes my breakfast sandwich would be huge other times it look so skinny sad looking. I wish they would tell their chef to make sure to crank it out more consistently and not be pressure by the crowds on weekends. Fyi i feel like if i go on weekdays the quality is better because they are not as rushed.

Overall i would come back at least once a week for their yummy sandwiches and carrot cake!
author: Kaycie N.

description:
Saw the special breakfast sandwich on a friend's Instagram and decided I NEEDED to consume this potentially heart-attack inducing food item as soon as possible. For reference, it consists of two scrambled eggs, a thick slab of bacon, half an avocado, lemon-garlic aioli, all enclosed within a giant freshly baked buttermilk biscuit.

Tasty, extremely fulfilling (and gluttonous), and enough food for two meals; although I applaud those who inhale the sandwich in one sitting. 

The want was real but the wait was also very real. Luckily, we came on a Sunday so we got to try the beignets also. Worth a visit if you're in the neighborhood.
author: Linda X.

description:
GET THE SPECIAL BREAKFAST SANDWICH (omg, drool). I've been hearing such great stuff about it, I decided it was my turn to taste. To my surprise, it was freshly made, and cooked to perfection! The scramble eggs had just the right amount of salt and pepper, generous portion of avocado, crispy bacon, and finally... the biscuit. Omg the biscuit.... Brought the whole thing together. 

Go do yourself a favor and get yourself one right now.
author: Carrie L.

description:
The biscuit breakfast sandwiches are to die for! They are also huge and you are getting alot of bang for your buck!

I love the lemon-pepper sauce on the special breakfast sandwich. It pairs perfectly with the avocado!

I'm also a big fan of the cinnamon rolls, which they only serve on weekends. These are definitely the best cinnamon rolls i've ever had!

***Coffee is good too! 

This place is a must-try if you are in the area!
author: Kimia M.

description: Delicious coffee & breakfast sandwich...near the ocean & the golden gate park for your viewing pleasures!
author: Fatemeh S.

description:
I'm going to keep this short. 

This place has the greatest breakfast sandwich on earth. The end. Everyone else just stop trying. 

Get their special breakfast sandwich and ascend to a higher level of existence. 

Pardon me while I go sit in the corner in a fetal position; this place is sadly across the country from me.
author: Jonathan M.

description: The breakfast sandwiches here are amazing! Definitely would recommend to friends and family! A must-try if you are in the Sunset exploring!
author: Josie W.

description: Long line on a Friday morning. Seating is very limited and we were on the run so we decided to get two pastries to go: a muffin donut and a bacon, beer, jalapeño muffin. I LOVED the savory muffin. The thick chunks of bacon and cheese took over most of the muffin. The muffin donut was OK, just a fried ball of dough covered in cinnamon sugar. I would definitely go back to try the breakfast sandwich.
author: Vivian H.

description: Worth the 40 minute wait. They run like a well-oiled machine. Great service, amongst a busy environment. Easy to get stressed out with weekend brunch rush behind the counter but they remain cool, calm and smiling. Best breakfast sandwich in SF.
author: Maeve S.

description:
$1 beignets on Sunday are worth waiting until the end of your weekend for + that extra 20 minutes of cook time towards hot fresh, powdered sugar coated goodness. 

Their cinnamon buns rock my world (totally sharable by the way) and they take friendly service to a whole nutha level. I wish Devil's Teeth was around when I was still regularly roaming the Outer Sunset, but I'll gladly go out of my way to pick up some coffee, pastries, and maybe even a pricey little shark sugar cookie. Oh, and the outdoor seating is just the cherry on top - good for you for making San Francisco streets a little more livable. Take my money, Devil's Teeth, take my money.

it's just that good.
author: Colleen M.

description:
So, my custom for writing Yelp reviews is to be supportive of small businesses by writing only 5-star reviews of places I like, but today I'm inspired to break with my tradition.  So... I've attempted to be a loyal customer by being fine with waiting in line 45 minutes to enjoy Devil's Teeth's really good breakfast sandwiches (did I mention they're really good?).  

However, today I wanted 10 of their really good biscuits (to bring to a get-together).  After waiting 20 minutes in line, I was told: "We are not selling biscuits today."  Here's where I get irritated. Are you not a bakery?  I've bought your biscuits in the past, why are they not being sold today? I'm asking for 10, not 50 or 100.  I don't think my proposed transaction is unreasonable.  I'm sure you would have sold me 10 breakfast sandwiches; but that isn't what I want today, and it only occurred to me after I left to order 10 breakfast sandwiches--hold the eggs & bacon...  Biscuit shortage solved by purchasing them from Elite Cafe (they make awesome biscuits too), but I'm not cool with being turned away from my neighborhood joint.

I'll be back waiting in line 45 minutes for biscuits + eggs + bacon soon enough (I'm sufficiently irritated to ask: why does it take 45 minutes for biscuit + egg + bacon...), but I'm disappointed/irritated at the lack of flexibility.
author: Ben T.

description: Yes yes, omg yes!!  I need to invent a teleporter to take me to the Outer Sunset to eat at this fine establishment.  We indulged on the over-the-top biscuit egg sandwich, cinammon rolls, quiche, and a cute little shark cookie.  Everything was fabulous, the flavors were great, and the freshness can't be beat as you can see the staff whipping up fresh eggs in the kitchen.  I didn't have the opportunity to try their $1 Sunday beignets but I'm sure there is a line for good reason.
author: Ethan F.

description:
My sister took me here because she swears by this place. I got the chai tea latte, iced; which was pretty good! It wasn't the best I have ever had but it was different because of the spices it had infused within. I got the special breakfast sandwich on recommendation from my sister. I've been craving homemade biscuits. The line is huge and it is very small but the food speaks for itself. So I do believe it's worth the wait. We came at 1:15 and line was still out the door. 

On the breakfast sandwich: it was amazing. What sold me on ordering it was the lemon garlic aioli sauce. And it really added flavor. The bacon was amazing as well!
author: Kelsey E.

description: It was pretty good!! My quiche was excellent, but the iced mocha was a little bitter. I definitely recommend!
author: Serenity D.

description: Bought a slice of chocolate cake got my husband on Valentines Day....but I left the bakery I notice the lady left me a big huge smear in the box. There was no line inside too. Really messy...--did her finger touch my frosting then the box?!?!  Nasty lady...try a be alittle neater please I hate germs
author: Wolfie M.

description:
So YUMMY. 

My husband and I both got a BLT with avocado, and we were not disappointed. Everyone says to get the breakfast sandwich, but if you had a big breakfast earlier that day and are feeling the lunch vibes, go with the BLT!! It was delicious! 

Tip: The bakers are not shy with condiments; so if you like it light on the mustard and mayo, be sure to ask. We loved it as is though!! 

We waited outside the bakery for our sandwiches for a bit but grabbed a donut muffin to split as our appetizer to tide us over. Seriously YUM!! 

Tip: It is definitely a cake donut, so don't go expecting a yeast donut muffin. ;) It is sugary goodness. 

Great service with a smile! Go expecting some sort of line, but don't worry. It goes by quickly!
author: Rachael M.

description: Trendy trendy trendy, there is always a long slow line that reaches down the street and they don't even have table service or seating for that matter.
author: Frankie R.

description: YUM. Came here for breakfast and got the breakfast sandwich with egg and bacon. So good. It was hard to resist all of the other baked goods. Coffee and service were good. A bit cramped during the morning "rush hour" as there were quite a few people waiting for their orders and it's a smaller space. Enjoyed my visit to this local gen very much!
author: gail b.

description:
I have tried :

-special brekkie sammie ( worth the extra bucks )
-lemon bar - SO UNDERRATED, a m a z i n g
-lasagna is delicious, generous portion too. That little brown box WILL be heavy.
-PB choc cookie - alot of choc chips. PB taste is great and not overly sweet, which is the best part!
-beer cheddar onion bacon muffin - I'm not sure if you can ask them to heat it up, but when I got home and heated it up, it was awesome. moist inside with tons of flava !
-kale parmesan scone - soooo good. yummy even the next day.

cannot wait to try everything else on their menu!!

tip** come on the weekdays around 2-closing (4pm), no lines!!
author: Selina W.

description: I'll start off this by saying that I probably didn't get the right thing here...like the Special Breakfast Sandwich. It was, after all, 1PM on a beautiful and sunny day, and frankly the last thing I wanted was a breakfast sandwich that includes cheese and buttermilk biscuits.  So in going down the sweets path, I chose to try the Donut Muffin, Almond Swirl Muffin, and Chocolate Chip Cookie.  Out of the three, the Almond Swirl Muffin was my definite favorite.  With a twist of citrus in it, this was absolutely delicious.  I really wanted to like the Donut Muffin, but it was dry and crumbly (maybe it had been out for awhile?) and I wasn't determined to try any more of it after it fell apart in my hands.  The cookie wasn't anything to write home about, and wasn't compelled to finish it either.  In any case, I enjoyed finding this local spot and would love to come back with the intention of trying the breakfast sandwich.
author: Lisa I.

description:
Beignet Sunday!!! Come on a sunday cause these babies are $1 each! They're big and fluffy and they come in a brown paper bag, ready to be shaken and served. These pillowy dough balls were delicious and warm. I also had the donut muffin which was a sugar donut shaped into a muffin...it was surprisingly very good. I ate the whole thing while waiting for the beignets. I was coming from breakfast, so I couldn't try the breakfast sandwich but it looked amazing. I will be back to try it.

I love the location of this bakery.It is right next to the beach, and you just wanna sit outside and enjoy the scenery and the food!
author: Vy T.

description: Seriously, what more can be said about this bakery. So so so good! I've had the maple scone, beer muffin, and their brownies-- pastries do not disappoint! Ive only tried their "regular" breakfast sandwich, which is anything but regular or ordinary. The biscuits are so moist and buttery and the star of the show, the bacon is so thick and flavorful. I could go next time and just order bacon and be happy. I can't wait to go back soon, but this time try the "special" breakfast sandwich! I always recommend this bakery!
author: Reina C.

description: Breakfast sandwiches are great. Worth the drive I think. The cinnamon bon was heavy and decadent.
author: Dan K.

description:
Starting your day out with Devil's Teeth is like waking up before your alarm goes off and realizing you still have an hour to sleep. It's simply pleasant and dreamy. 

Don't get me started about the pastries...mouth watering. Especially the Cinnamon Rolls. 

The breakfast sandwiches are SO good, add a little of their house hot sauce and you're golden. Your day will be brighter than the sun. 

The coffee is just delish and it's so damn hot that when I get to work I can look forward to enjoying it an hour after reality hits me. 

Everyone that works there is so incredibly nice and you can just tell there is such a diversity in personalities. Kindness is the key to great business and I'll tell you one thing, a grumpy Starbucks employee is the last person I want to encounter at 7:00am. ;)

Thank you, Devil's Teeth. You guys rock!
author: Chelsey S.

description:
wow...can't believe I've never been here until now!  Too bad it takes 30 mins+ from our place (Ferry Bldg area) to here...anyway, review below:

I got the cinnamon roll, the carrot cake, doughnut muffin, and bacon carrot muffin.  Just had the first two thus far and the cinnamon bun and carrot cake were really, really good...neither was overpowered by sweetness. The roll had a ton of cinnamon flavors which a lot bakeries seem to replace with sugar and more sugar and the carrot cake had prob the most amount of carrot flavors (not to mention visible strings of 'em) we've ever had. 

Def. will be back to try their biscuit sandwiches which the gal helping me said it's their top seller. I shall do next time followed by Polly Ann's for dessert...sold!
author: Ben M.

description: I usually really like this place, but this morning I got a sandwich (BLT) that was very very poorly made. Pink hair gal, please put more ingredients in the sandwich.
author: Steve K.

description: I came with friends and ordered a sandwich right after they did. Theirs came out, then 10-20 other orders came out and it became clear mine had been forgotten.  Once this was realized I asked for them to please make my sandwich. After waiting another 20 minutes I realized that wasn't happening then asked again. Finally they agreed to make it but were out of the biscuits at this point and the sandwich was really disappointing. No offer for a refund.
author: Caitlin M.

description: Best phuqin brownie in SF and the line out the door is not too bad compared with the hipster bakeries in other parts of San Francisco.
author: Jan P.

description:
I love their Special Breakfast Sandwich and I highly recommend getting it.

Their sandwich has eggs, bacon, cheese, and avocado. Although, they ran or of avocado when I was here and substituted it for tomatoes.

I also bought their bacon cheddar muffin, which was alright. It was hard and cold.

The huge downside is the wait can be up to an hour, which is a huge pain.
author: Rick O.

description:
Biscuit sandwiches are a score! 
Baked goods & beignets are a meh! 
Long lines and if you are in for the right reason (aka biscuit sandwich); won't be disappointed.
author: Alex P.

description:
Although the food WAS good, no more.
DO NOT GO THERE!!!

It's been awhile since I've been here, but today will be my last. I was charged for dog treats, but my wife said they are free. If you need a reminder I had the red cap with the Puerto Rican flag and NY Yankees logo. Maybe that's the issue, not a Yankees fan.

I ordered 3 breakfast sandwiches to bring home. I waited patiently. When two order behind me were served I asked when my order would be ready. I was told it was in the oven and it would be about 5-10 more minutes. As a NYKER I  started the clock. Ten minutes goes by and I see another 3 orders behind me go out (count is 5 orders behind me have cleared). One of those orders had 4 similar sandwiches. I'm annoyed now. I asked for my order and was told that it wasn't ready. I explained how more people behind me have been served than the amount of sandwiches I ordered. I said, loud enough to be heard "if another order goes out I want my money back ". So he goes to tell the staff which meant they all had to give me a dirty look. Fuck that shit. If you are skipping people to feed your friends first or whatever the hell was going on. 

Done.

P.S. quality was not good this time either. Poor service  + poor quality = crappy experience
author: Eric V.

description: Had the greatest breakfast sandwich,family bakery with delicious cakes and sandwiches probably gonna drop by again!
author: Aysesu B.

description:
Reasonable wait, delicious breakfast sandwich. Imagine the McDonald's mcmuffin. Now completely stop imagining that garbage cause this place is on a whole different level. Definitely give this place a try. I don't remember exactly what the name of the sandwich i got, but it's basically the devil tooth special or something with biscuit and their sauce. 

I also got the cinnamon roll, which was huge and very tasty, but a bit too sweet for my personal taste. Did not take away from my experience but just be warned that this cinnamon roll is next level sweet. My gf loved it though :).
author: Lawrence L.

description:
Do you like coffee? 
Do you like pastries? 
Do you like breakfast? 
What about lunch? 
Good customer service?

This place has ALL of that. Devils Teeth is by far and away my favorite bakery in all of San Francisco. They have my favorite type of coffee roast- Bicycle Coffee. It's SO good. They also are known for their one dollar Beignet Sundays which are incredible and tasty. Also, really awesome brownies, cinnamon rolls, carrot cake, etc. 

The location is perfect! It's way out in the Outer Sunset next to the beach, and it's so nice to get a yummy treat and take a nice walk along the water. The staff here are super friendly and the service is very fast- even when it's packed. Speaking of that, most weekends are very busy. Do not let that discourage you, it's 100% worth the visit.
author: Alex B.

description:
Get to this place BEFORE 9:00am or you are Totally screwed!!  You will wait in line for the REST of your life here - because, unfortunately - everybody Finally found out how AMAZING Devils Teeth is.  I went here for about 6 months and could eat here every Saturday morning with only about a 5 minute wait in line. 

Then one day, either every one moved to the Sunset and found Devils Teeth - or they must have been on TV or ended up in an F Load of Blogs because the crowd here is hellish.  

Although I am sad that I lost my secret spot, I am happy that they are now getting the recognition they deserve.  BEST BAKERY in SF ! 

My Favorites: 'Bomb Ass' BLT's, Oatmeal Cookie's (with Cranberries not Raisins), Ice Tea (Yah, I said it - Ice. Freakin. Tea), Lemon Bars (that are made of crack and you will literally buy 4 instead of 2, and you and your girlfriend will eat WAY more than you should and feel sick for a while but it won't stop you from going there the following Saturday and doing the SAME THING !!!)  and Beignets on Sundays !!  

They even have FREE DOG TREATS that Bentley LOVES !!!  Tip: they smell really good, but don't try to eat them just because you are curious why your dog likes them so much and they look like oatmeal cookie chunks, they ARE NOT oatmeal cookie chunks, and you will feel slightly ill maybe 45 minutes later, but then that feeling goes away - but you've learned your lesson and realize the dog treats REALLY ARE just for DOGS !!!  This is what I've heard :-/
author: Rachel G.

description:
The local pointless hipster coffee place.

They are always understaffed... So you can always count on a 30-4o min wait for your food

Let's talk about the food... Good and average for a premium price

Everyone loves their breakfast sandwich, but I find it to be very dry and lame... It's mostly just a lot of bread and some crappy eggs and old bacon.

I've had better breakfast at Bob Evans man

So why do people flock here?

Because they called it 'Devils' whatever and do things to make it seem 'exclusive' or more special... By making it a 1 hour experience to wait & order... Then wait another 30 min... Then wait to sit on one of the 6 seats... 

Here's the rub... IF you actually cared about your employees OR your customers, you would A) staff it appropriately so your employees aren't always apologizing about the slow service... And B) pre-cook more food. I mean let's be honest, the stuff there is average at best... So why pretend like it's all made to order?!

It's breakfast people, not hipster rocket science.

One star because I've been there 5-6 times and never once received my food in less than 45 minutes. That just sucks 

Anyway, I'm clearly not cool enough or patient enough for this place so I'm gonna steer clear and go across the street to Sea Biscuit for a legit experience that costs less and tastes better.
author: Sunset W.

description:
Found this gem via Yelp. We were looking for something quick and simple. 

We ordered two special breakfast sandwiches, a peanut butter chocolate chip cookie, an acai mango lemonade, and a freshly squeezed orange juice. 

The drinks were great, the cookie was great, but the real star of the show were the special breakfast sandwiches. The biscuits were amazing, so buttery and flakey. The eggs, the cheese, the aioli, the avocado, and the bacon melded together perfectly. 

It was such a simple breakfast but it was just done perfectly. I wish they were on Eat24. 

TDLR; Go here and and the sandwiches, cookies, everything. This place is dank.
author: Brian T.

description:
Devil's Teeth Baking Company is a special spot in the Outer Sunset that is not to be missed. I was taken here by a friend who got me hooked on their sandwiches, made with freshly baked bread, full of texture and taste the love put into this bread is evident in every bite. The real popular draw here is the breakfast sandwich, house made biscuit-scrambled egg-bacon-cheese...get the ultimate breakfast sandwich for avocado and other fresh veggies. 

The menu is small but that is a good thing. Limited amount of items allows the opportunity to make every dish well and to ensure the same quality and high standards are given to each customer. That is something I love to see and appreciate when it is so forthcoming. 

I saw the lasagna dish being consumed for the first time today and by its looks alone, masterful. For another time, today, I got the Chicken Curry sandwich and a coffee. Right amount of spices really kick this chicken salad up a notch from what would be considered normally as a plain sandwich concept. 

A small shop with a big heart I have not had a bad experience here yet. Friendly faces greet you while the staff works hard behind the counter making delicious eats. For weekend visits I advise to be friendly and be sure to bring a patient attitude cause there will be others waiting on line to consume the goodness from this local bakery. 

******Special Note: The public seating area out front is perfect for outside eating. Hopefully the weather is good. If not? Well, you can't have everything. Always choose the ocean.******
author: Nick C.

description:
What a great bakery in Outer Sunset. Because it's not conveniently located I've only been there twice, but I remembered how much I loved it when I recently went back. If you happen to be near Ocean Beach or in Outer Sunset, Devil's Teeth is a great place to pick up some eats and take a stroll along the pathway on Ocean Beach. On a sunny day the view is divine. Don't bother when Karl is out to play though!

Expect Devil's Teeth to get quite crowded on the weekend for a brunch rush, even though they are pretty quick to get your orders out. The pastries like donut muffin - duffin? - or their famous, gooey cinnamon bun you can get fast, but the biscuit bfast sandwich will take a while to come out, just because they have to make and warm it in the oven.

The cinnamon bun really is giant, seriously, as big as my face. I think it took me three days to finish it. The breakfast sandwich is so decadent just because the biscuits themselves are so rich and fluffy on their own. They have a parklet outside for seating, but other than that not too many places to sit and eat.
author: Kate M.

description: Cool spot limited seating inside and some benches outside. Could be a wait but that's only because they're busy making you amazing food. Had a cookie, was awesome, banana strawberry muffin, was awesome. Got their "special sandwich" and you already know it was awesome.
author: Mister M.

description: I LOVE this place! The food - UH-mayzing!! So fresh & so good. They're so chill and friendly and happy to gather your items. If you're in a good place or want to be in a better mood, come here! Grab a piece of chalk and draw your heart out outside while you wait for a warm mean or drink.
author: Candice N.

description:
Waaay out in Sunset District with miserable parking. But, whats new? It's San Francisco. We found this little hole in the wall sandwich shop about a year ago. It was run by a group of women who made delicious lasagna. 

Well, the women are gone and so is the lasagna. Appears the restaurant got popular, made money and got sold. New group of happy and efficient youngsters run the place now. It's OK, but just OK. 

Too bad about the lasagna probably too expensive to make. Good (OK) sandwiches and good quiche, but they have lost their charm.
author: Skipper J.

description:
OMG best breakfast sandwich ever. The line was pretty long but after I saw the pictures of the sandwich on yelp I was determined. It moved very fast! The place is pretty small, there isn't much indoor seating but there's a few benches outside so its perfect if the weather is nice. I ordered the ultimate breakfast sandwich and two beignets. 

The beignets came out first. Super hot and fluffy! My family is from Lousiana so I'm pretty serious about my beignets. These did not disappoint! They were fluffy and not too doughy just like they're supposed to be. Be careful of the powdered sugar, it gets everywhere! 

Now onto the main star. The breakfast sandwich was delish. My friend and I both agreed on the fact that its definitely something you can make at home but the ingredients they use at Devil's Teeth are such good quality that you're homemade sandwich would never compare! First, the biscuit its on is amazing. Perfect flaky, tasty, everything you would want. The bacon, avocado and egg are packed in there and topped with a garlic aioli. Definitely a great breakfast on the go. The staff was also really nice. I'll definitely be back!
author: Jessica B.

description:
I live right up the block from here. This review is for the pastries-

What I have tried:
donut muffin
beignets (Sunday only)
cheddar bacon beer muffins
cinnamon roll

As a huge cinnamon fan - both the donut muffin and the cinnamon roll were satisfying.

I have gone back just for the donut muffins. 

If you go right when they open there is hardly ever a line. Wait until 10 AM and you are screwed with a line on the weekends. Order a sandwich during peak and expect to wait up to 30 minutes for it. My friend visiting from NY thought it was the best breakfast sandwich she had ever had. 

Come here when it is slow and you are guaranteed a great food experience!
author: Travis B.

description: Amazing friendly staff, best breakfast sandwich in town. Also highly recommend their carrot cake.
author: Yazan Z.

description:
I have been going to this little place for about a year now.  I love their products. 

However that's all I love. 

Their employees are rude and lazy. 
Every time I order something that requires them to make it I must expect to sit around for a minimum of 30 minutes for it to be ready. 

They also do not make fresh simple syrup regularly. I went to put some in my Arnold Palmer and the entire bottle had black mold inside and out. 

I've been going here long enough to know I should not go there anymore.
author: Kelsey J.

description:
When we went it was a pretty long, but the line goes by rather quick. We ordered a special breakfast sandwich which consist of two eggs scrambled, with pepper jack cheese, applewood smoked bacon, avocado, and their famous lemon-garlic aioli on their homemade buttermilk biscuit. I rarely eat bacon but this sandwich taste really good with that one bacon, it was really flavorful, crispy and not oily. The biscuit was not dry. The only down side was the avocado. It was very watery and it didn't take good. 

We also order a slice of apple pie. It was part of the left over broken pie so they gave us two slice for the price of one. The person helping us broke it even more so the pie was on the house. It was a total plus getting the apple pie for free but I did not enough eating it. The apples were really sour and the crust was really hard. I would not want to try it again.

One time that makes me want to keep coming here was the service they provided. Super friendly, and they try to remember your name.
author: Sury C.

description:
We were looking for a quick place in the Sunset to grab a coffee before heading to Sutro Baths and Land's End and ended up here after seeing how ridiculous the line was for at Andytown.  Instead of getting our caffeine fix though, we decided to try their special breakfast sandwiches and a couple of their muffins after hearing everyone else in front of us order those.  

Their special breakfast sandwich may sound a little pricey for what it is ($6.75) but its totally worth it and very hearty and filling.  Everything in between the flaky biscuits complements each other really well from the thick, crispy cuts of bacon to the melted gooey pepper jack cheese and the creamy avocado slices.  We also tried their doughnut muffins which I wasn't too big a fan of... it had the texture of something like wet sand, its crumbles apart if you try to tear it apart, but still had decent flavor.  I also tried their lemon bar which I thought was a perfect balance of tart and sweet, not one taste overpowering the other.  

Overall though, I was pleasantly surprised to come across this place after having no expectations.  If I lived in the area, I'd for sure be a regular just for their breakfast sandwiches.
author: David C.

description:
It's been awhile since I last devoured a cinnamon roll from this darling bakery. 

I was craving one this past weekend and so I picked one up. 

I only ate a portion of it. 

Even microwaved it seemed dry and just wasn't the built up cinnamon roll that I was imagining.

Devil's Teeth Baking Company has some quality pastries and baked goods - but if you're looking for a hearty cinnamon roll - I'd recommend somewhere else. Devil's Teeth Baking Company's lacks icing - as well as the soft doughy bliss that I crave in a beautiful pastry.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
The food here is amazing! We got a couple of the biscuit sandwiches and it was seriously the best breakfast sandwich I have had. I wish I had tried more - I guess I'll have to go back! Yes, there was a line on a Saturday morning, but it actually moved pretty quickly. Street parking was super easy to find nearby. Staff seemed pretty friendly. 

I'm docking a star because the place is pretty small and cramped for how popular it is. It made standing and waiting for your order difficult because you were always in someone's way. Seating is also very limited - it would've been nice to have a place to sit and enjoy the food we just bought.

I'll definitely be back next time I'm in that area!
author: Alexis D.

description:
Breakfast sandwich, BLT, grilled cheese, cafe latte and maybe 3 different sweets on a late Saturday afternoon so maybe that's why parking was no problem? 

First time here and I would come back for their sandwiches and a hot drink. The three sandwiches were delicious and the fresh greens (arugula +) in the BLT didn't wilt and it was all still good several hours later. Very very tasty with great bacon. Biscuits for breakfast sandwich. A hearty and crunchy sourdough(?) bread for the others. I tried two out of the three and our little girl of the group said she loved her egg+ sandwich. 

The vibe and service are way better than average for SF. For me, it's the way they projected competence with an efficient and tightly run operation. Or it could be the serious but kind demeanor, salt&sun kissed hair and skin, and busy-but-not-loud character of it all. 

Sandwiches were a 20-minute wait and few flinched when given that news -- like it was to be expected. Honestly, I wasn't expecting to have to wait that long; the big difference here was that VIBE. I was happy to hang loose because I could feel the wait would be worth it. It was. Thank goodness.
author: Mo O.

description:
Really love local businesses, especially in this part of SF. DT was good but not mind blowing like everyone talks about. For the prices they charge you have to expect an out of this world experience. 
 
Sugar muffin reminds me of a thicker sugar donut. 
Strawberry/banana muffin was very good but also small. More like bite size. 
Their famous Cinnamon roll was a but too rich for my taste. Almost like a sweeter version of cotton candy. 
Blueberry scone w/lemon glaze was pretty dam good. 
Chocolate bear claw is pretty unique and very good. 
Breakfast sandwich w/aioli sauce was a but ehh. I like the avocado but thought the aioli tasted a bit anchovy and overbearing the meal.
author: Cee B.

description: Omg the special breakfast sandwich really is everything you want it to be and more. The aioli and avocado are a great creamy addition to the eggs and bacon, and the biscuit is just perfect. They also have $1 beignets on Sundays so we got a couple of those (they are really tiny so be prepared) and they are made to order, so they were perfectly fresh and soft and warm. We waited in line for about 25 minutes before we ordered, and then we waited probably another 15 minutes before we got our food. Total 40 min during peak Sunday brunch - not bad!
author: Amy Y.

description:
Trekked out to the Sunset after hearing great things about Devil's Teeth. When we walked in to check out their offerings, my friend who has a lactose allergy politely asked the girl who approached us if they had any dairy free options. She said she didn't know, and turned to ask the rest of her co-workers if they had any idea. They said no and she turned her back and began engaging with her coworker in front of us, putting an end to the conversation. The coworker then loudly said, "this is just a regular bakery.  this isn't a San Francisco bakery." 

Taken aback, we all looked at each other and decided that we weren't exactly welcome here.  Neither me nor our other friend have dietary allergies so we could have ordered something, but didn't feel right supporting a company who hires rude employees with poor customer service skills. It wasn't so much that they didn't have offerings for certain dietary needs but their attitudes in response to a simple question. Will definitely not be trying Devil's Teeth, even on my own.

and P.S., last time we checked, we are in San Francisco.
author: Colleen C.

description:
What a cute little bakery ! My bf brought us here to pick up some goodies before a picnic a GG Park, we got some sandwiches and tasted some of their sweets! Everything looked really good and the staff was very friendly. I got the (curry spiced) chicken salad sandwich and my bf decided on a grilled cheese. 

While we waited we sampled the brownies and choc chip cookie, sooo yummy !! They prep in open space which you can see, I like that !! The prices were very reasonable compared to most bakeries in SF.

I loved my sandwich but my bf wasn't in love with his grilled cheese. They offer add ons the grilled cheese which he prob should have done, ohh well .. next time!!
author: Hetal P.

description:
A trusted foodie friend highly recommended this place, especially for the carrot cake, but unfortunately right as they were closing (~3:50pm on a Saturday), they were out! 

No wait, and our stuff came out fast, including the coffee. Super friendly staff. 

Must-haves: Ginger cookie!

* Ginger cookie - 5 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/devils-teeth-baking-company-san-francisco?select=QkCRzZTR6Cfg6odTFBONvw#-p5G410k-Xb5VtyZTO6RhQ
Everyone's fave, intense and genuine ginger flavor. Plus, very soft & moist. My bf claims this was the best ginger cookie he's had in years. 

* Donut muffin - 3 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/devils-teeth-baking-company-san-francisco?select=QkCRzZTR6Cfg6odTFBONvw#bHJnGnwEKzHdZFQgHZpRiw
cross-section: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/devils-teeth-baking-company-san-francisco?select=QkCRzZTR6Cfg6odTFBONvw#6dvHhXlsPab2J_3NDIKxyA
More something to get for the novelty of the idea. It was on the dry side, and didn't have any special toppings/flavors (mostly brown sugar/cinnamon from what I can tell). Not terrible but not a standout either.

* Bacon scallion cheddar muffin - 3.5 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/devils-teeth-baking-company-san-francisco?select=QkCRzZTR6Cfg6odTFBONvw#QkCRzZTR6Cfg6odTFBONvw
cross-section: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/devils-teeth-baking-company-san-francisco?select=QkCRzZTR6Cfg6odTFBONvw#lg1WVXQfTNfmAOsZN3T85w
Since it was the end of the day, I'm going to assume that this tastes *much* better when it's fresh. It was a bit stale and dry, though I do really like the flavor combo - an ever so slight sweetness to the eggy batter plus the savory bacon and fresh chives. That being said, a *really good* bakery should have things that are at least fairly fresh at all times. This tasted like it'd been sitting out for half, even the entire, day.

For next time: Lemon bar, carrot cake (if they haven't run out!).
author: Ziyan C.

description: Soft flaky buttermilk biscuit goodness, crispy savory bacon, tasty scrabbled eggs with cheese. Why are you not here yet? That was the regular breakfast sandwich I got and it sure did hit the spot. Coffee was good, but I would say the winner is in the breakfast menu and pastries. The lemon  bar was the best I've ever had too and the person helping me got me the corner piece. How'd they know? The crust was soft and chewy and the lemon part was not super sweet but not but had a good balance.
author: Arik A.

description:
A friend of mine mentioned she wanted to drop by here. I told her I had heard of this place and have been meaning to go. Another friend of mine checks in here quite frequently so I texted to ask what I should get. She recommended a donut muffin and, because it was Sunday, $1 beignets!!! 

First visit consisted of 6 beignets , a donut muffin and 2 iced chais. 

Oh beignets, you are so delicious especially because Devil's Teeth makes them fresh and hot when you order. Picked at the donut muffin, but couldn't finish it. Sweet, but a tad dry.

Upon second visit, $1 beignets again. 6, a hot coffee and 1 iced coffee.

Devil's Teeth carries Bicycle Coffee Co and it is STRONG. I love it.

Devil's Teeth, you and your $1 beignet Sundays are probably my favorite way to end the weekend.
author: Susy C.

description:
We rushed, in fact we ubered and rushed, from midway up Golden Gate Park, to the Devil's Teeth Bakery, in just the slightest of hopes that a cinnamon bun might await us for our efforts. Alas it wasn't to be, but we did grab a few other treats to cheer ourselves up.

This place is great; great staff, great location, great coffee, and of course, great baking!

I ended up with a browning, some kind of apple cake, and a chocolate cake to boot, a great tasting filter coffee, and at such a short walk to the beach, a great view of an early March sunset over the pacific.

It's probably a spirit endemic to this area of San Francisco, but the staff were all super friendly, and completely relaxed. They had the doors open for a while after they closed so we could listen to their music while we sat on their deck, it was more than pleasant, it was down right enchanting.

If you're ever in the area you should stop in, if not for their signature rolls, but for their great place.
author: Jack W.

description: The food is hard to beat and they have some unique items. Not much place to sit, so plan on picking it up and taking it back home or to the beach. The donut muffins are to die for. The lemon poppyseed also was very good. There is a line out the door but it moves pretty quickly. The food is delicious and the price is right. I highly recommend
author: Greg G.

description: Always love coming here when I'm in the city. Get my breakfast here then head to the beach and enjoy a nice meal and a nice view.
author: Andy R.

description: Amazing baked goods, great coffee, and a great special breakfast sandwich. Highly recommend Devil's Teeth!
author: Jordan C.

description: I came to check out this bakery on a sunny day and I was not surprised about the long line. I tried the bacon beer cheddar muffin, the special breakfast sandwich and their beignets. AMAZING! My favorite was the special breakfast sandwich. The biscuit is flaky, buttery and complements everything else in the sandwich very well. The beignet was fluffy, warm and delightful. I will be back next week!
author: Elmira Z.

description:
I love how convenient it is having this all American bakery in the heart of my hood-- the sunset! Another happy, cheatmeal place to add to my list. 

All their baked goods looked and smelled amazing. There's always a line out the door early mornings in the weekends. People love chilling in the outdoor space with their breakfast brunch treats and coffee. Service is friendly and quickly. The atmosphere is rustic and quaint. 

Chocolate chip cookie was pretty good -- chewy and huge. I prefer dark chocolate chunks, but they use milk chocolate. 

The cinnamon roll is more like a Cronut, croissant cinnamon roll. Every bite explodes with butter and sugar. Talk about spiking your insulin! Still a yummy treat, but would pass on it the next time. 

I would try the peanut butter chocolate cookie and breakfast sandwich next time. That duo definitely looked amazing!
author: Ellen W.

description:
Huge breakfast Sandwich.  
Really Good if your starving, but also large enough to split for 2

Very friendly Staff
author: Justin G.

description:
I was willing to wait in line at Mr. Holmes but when I called on MLK holiday they told me they had oven trouble and was only selling donuts all day.  So, back-up plan.  We went to Devil's and got there before the line got really long. They have a parklet out front for diners but there are only stools inside, packed tightly if you want to eat inside for about 6 persons.

The order dude was really friendly and had a good memory of what you ordered. The cashier needs to find another job. She behaves as if she hates people and doesn't want to be there as if mom forced her to work at the restaurant.
It's a small operation with only 4 employees constantly on the move. The 4th person is busy making all the coffee.

We tried:
1. breakfast biscuit sandwich - $5.50. Large serving of scrambled eggs on a huge moist biscuit.
2. Special biscuit breakfast sandwich $6.75.  The better of the 2 sandwiches and Hubby agreed as we went home and cut them in have and shared the 2 sandwiches. This one has avocado, less eggs but jack pepper cheese and a special aioli sauce which makes the sandwich flavor so much better.
3. Cinnamon bun - a large bun smothered with carmelized sugar so crunchy on the edges and moist inside with good cinnamon flavor.  I would have preferred less sugar in it.
4. Parmesan kale scone - A very good tasting scone with kale in it that you can't really taste.
5. Cheddar bacon onion muffin - if you like savory and salty, this is the one. It sort of reminds me of the baked bacon green onion buns you buy at Asian bakeries but this has more texture and a lot of bacon bits. 
All the above for $29.  You have to wait for them to cook the sandwiches which are made to order and takes 15 mins or longer to prepare. Just stand there and surf your cellphone like the youngsters and you'll be fine.
author: Ry T.

description:
A bit odd when ordering if it's your first time. They need to figure out a better way of processing orders especially when this place gets busy early noon.
Quiches are pre made and are ready to go once they heat it up via microwave.  You get a thick slice of (2 slices) toast. Everything to go are compostable. Inside and outdoor seating.
author: Harry G.

description: This place is amazing. I got the biscuit sandwich with bacon, egg, and cheddar cheese. What I love about it is their biscuit is super flaky but not too buttery. Usually when you eat a biscuit sandwich you feel like you ate a pound of butter but I didn't feel that way once I finished it. I also got a cinnamon roll to share. OMG that thing is huge you could share it with 4 people. It's really heavy and dense. After this brunch I was in a food comma, but totally worth it. I highly recommend this place but the line gets long but worth it.
author: Catherina W.

description:
Funky. Funky.

Weather worn benches filled with weather worn people.

Dogs.
  
Kids writing with chalk on the sidewalks.

I could see the waves crashing on the beach from where I was sitting. 

All that was missing was a 1960's Volkswagen Van.

The coffee is excellent--Bicycle Coffee.  Free Trade....I think??

I had their cheddar, bacon, beer muffin.  It was good--moist and fresh.  The pastries looked wonderful--next time I'm there I'll have to give them a try.

The coffee station needs a bit of help--the milk and sugar area is too small and the garbage cans next to them reeked today.  

Very nice people working there and overall a very mellow experience.   They are definitely not trying to impress with any current sense of design, marketing or business sense.
author: Thomas D.

description:
Came here on a Friday afternoon and got the special breakfast sandwich.. It was delicious! Bacon, avocado, lemon garlic aioli sauce, jack cheese, egg, all in between buttermilk biscuits.. Very flavorful and mouthwatering! 

Need to come back and try the rest of their menu.
author: Sherry T.
