description: I don't know what diabolical ingredients Devil's Teeth puts in their cinnamon buns, but they were hellishly delicious. This is not your average cinnamon bun, folks. Gone is your typical soft, doughy interior. It's replaced by a stiff, buttery, pastry-like dough and each layer is coated in a sticky, caramelized sauce. I get that this description is odd...you'll just have to try it yourself. This sinful concoction is $4.25 but it's humongous, a good 5" in diameter. Layers upon layers of sticky fiendish deliciousness to share...or hoard for yourself! Oh, I'll never look at another cinnamon bun the same way again! I'm in the devil's grip for sure.
author: Clarice W.

description:
Visited SF for the weekend and was told that I MUST try the breakfast sandwich here. This place was relatively far from our hotel, so we took a lyft, and it was well worth it. The line goes by fast, but it did take a while to get our food. 

All in all, take a little time out of your day to check this place out because you will not regret it.
author: Jenn S.

description:
How have I not reviewed this amazing place? Dunno, must just be so busy eating. Everything is outstanding, except the wait that usually accompanies, so bring a good friend to chit chat with. The ginger cookie is probably the best I've ever had, I make it a point to get a few whenever I'm in SF. I try to make them last, but........
Just starting thinking about them and how good one would taste RIGHT NOW with a cup of coffee. 
Seriously amazing biscuits as well.
author: Ann K.

description: 4 stars for just their special breakfast sandwich and biscuits holding it all together were also very nice.  The only con about this place is that it is tiny so it's not a sit-down type of place.  Also, there's always a line because it's so small, but nothing too ridiculous because it seems to move pretty quickly.  The prices are definitely reasonable so that was definitely a plus.  If this was in LA, I would have to stop myself from coming here every morning.
author: Lily T.

description:
After a rough week, my girlfriend and I felt it appropriate to leave the nest on a beautiful Friday and grab some breakfast, just because we could.  She suggested Devil's Teeth and I was instantly sold on their ratings, so we headed over bright and early-ish for some freshly baked goodness.

We each ordered a breakfast sandwich which head egg, cheese, and bacon on a homemade biscuit.  We also ordered a cinnamon bun, which we intended to take home, but ended up enjoying right outside on their parklet in front of the shop.  Both were so delicious, and I ended up with food coma first in the morning, perhaps not the best way to a productive day.

Despite being quite busy, service was very friendly.  There was a hiccup when we were overcharged, but it was quickly corrected after I noticed the problem.  The little mini-park was a great feature outside and is super friendly for kids and pets.  I can't wait to come back and try their muffins and coffee!

Food: 9/10

Service: 8/10

Price: $

Atmosphere: 10/10
author: Joe M.

description:
We very recently heard about this place and went there for the first time this morning to get the cinnamon bun. Mission accomplished!

As we were told to expect, there was a line outside this small place with twentysomethings, young families, hipsters, and possibly off-duty surfers, but the line moved fast enough and the people and their doggies and kiddies seemed nice enough. Likewise with the staff.

We only got the decadent cinnamon bun - big, super sweet, very buttery, and quite tasty - shared it, but didn't even finish it (though we certainly will later). 

Also had their special iced tea (green tea with flowers and some tropical fruit: strong and no sugar, thus perfect).

OK, then, we'll be back to dive into more treats (lemon bars, choc chip cookies, etc.) and possibly some food (avocado on toast?).
author: Veg V.

description: Holy sh*t! This place is delicious. I first heard about them on Instagram (follow @sanfranciscopulse, they post delicious looking food from all over the Bay Area), and I saw a photo of the special breakfast sandwich and instantly knew I had to come here. Went there on a Saturday around like 11:30am. Line wasn't too bad when my boyfriend and I got there (when we left the line was out the door). They take orders quickly, but the wait is probably what kills people. I personally didn't think it was bad and had a feeling it would be a little wait even before I got there (we waited around 15 min). My boyfriend and I got a peanut butter chocolate chip cookie to split while we waited. I suggest getting something to snack on while you wait, it helped control the hangry. The cookie was bomb by the way. We both got the special breakfast sandwich. It was so amazing. The biscuit is just so buttery and amazing, and the garlic aioli was out of this world. I would highly suggest getting this sandwich. They don't have much seating inside, but they do have a good amount seating outside. I will definitely be returning to this place and trying everything because everything looked incredible.
author: Rebecca M.

description:
Food wise: 2
Service: 1
Total: 2 stars

Came for the breakfast sandwich. Because that's what you're suppose to get. 
But they didn't have any or biscuits.
Okay. 

Don't get the quiche. Or come here at busy times. My friend and I came at 2p. It would've been better if the service wasn't as terrible as we experienced it. I mean, true, it was busy-bit could they at least smile and acknowledge if two persons have been in front of the register for at least half an hour? Or ask if there was a problem? We were being respectful of what seemed like busy, and not trying to get in the way of all of the workers being flustered that there was a lack of biscuits...they continued talking about the lack of it to each other. Anyway, apparently our order was mistaken for lasagna. Not sure how lasagna and quiche get mixed up verbally, but it did. We finally did get the free space to ask the woman at the register - who did not look happy to be there or for me to ask her about the status of our quiche; she sighed and turned around asking who took our order. Someone did come over and said he forgot, mistakenly rushed our "order," lasagna (Which had been out for about 15 mins), opened the fridge, threw two pieces of quiche (small I might add) in to a Togo container into the microwave, pulled them out after reheating them, took one out of the box, places one in another Togo box, gave one to each of us and said here you go. 

He insincerely offered us a cookie or a muffin to compensate for our lengthy wait. (Even though there were wasted pieces of lasagna.......)

To add to our first experience, I burned my fingers on the bottom of the Togo box because the quiche was over heated. So what could've been a 7-10 minute wait, ended up as 50 mins, and not a positive experience. 

I get the whole busy factor and my friend and I waited, smiled, stared at each other, did the whole patient thing-but we weren't assisted or assured of our order. 

Thanks, Devil's tooth. Happy New Year to you too.  Bye, Felicia!
author: John Michael R.

description:
I enjoyed all my baked goods I ordered at Devil's Teeth Bakery...turkey lasagne, beignet (Sunday's only), donut muffin, and brownie.  

The most unique baked good here is the donut muffin, delicious cake-like muffin dusted with cinnamon and sugar.  The beignet was quite good, light and not oily at all, but definitely needs to be eaten immediately when hot.  Don't wear dark clothes when eating these beignets!  #powderedsugarface/shirt/jeans

The turkey lasagne is a generous serving of layers of noodles, turkey, spinach, red sauce, and cheeses.  The lasagne can be ordered heated or unheated.  I'll be ordering lasagne again next time, great lunch selection.  

I'll need to bring friends next time so I can also try the breakfast biscuit sandwich, which is one of the flagship items, served all day!
author: Wendy S.

description:
4.5 Stars

Sunday Funday has just been renamed Beignet Sunday. Freshly fried pillows of dough generously dusted with powder sugar for $1 each...need I say more?

But don't put all your eggs in one beignet basket. Indulge in some other treats. Whatever you try, I doubt you'll be disappointed. 

Take the cinnamon roll, for example - flaky yet chewy with hundreds of sweet, buttery layers. Absolutely delicious. (Tip: ask them to warm it up for you).  Or the lemon bar - tart & sweet with a hint of salt. Great texture. Although, IMO, it could have been just a little more tart...

Maybe it's because I stayed away from chocolate, cookies & pastries for awhile that caused me to devour these treats with such eagerness that I should have been embarrassed, but honestly, everything was just so good that I didn't really care...
author: Rose A.

description: Love this little bakery in the sunset! They have $1 beignets on Sunday and their workers are hella sweet. I tried a latte and the apple danish and they were delicious! The line was pretty long when we got there but it went by fast. Next time I'm going to try the special breakfast sandwich!
author: Katie P.

description: We took a trip for the day and found this gem on Yelp. We ordered one of everything and enjoyed all the baked goods. I would have to say the sticky bun was my favorite. My kids enjoyed the peanut butter and chocolate chip cookie.
author: John I.

description:
i ordered the special breakfast sandwich. it was good, but the problem was i couldnt taste the egg. fluffy biscuit. tasty aioli. savory bacon, creamy avocado. but i couldnt taste the egg. one should be able to taste an egg in a breakfast sandwich.

i still enjoyed the sandwich but just a tad disappointed that the egg wasnt awesome. so 3 out of 5.
author: Jason C.

description: I can't believe it's taken me this long to get to Devil's Teeth for a super breakfast sandwich, but damn if it wasn't worth the wait. Early weekday morning is the perfect time to go- no lines and that laid back, local vibe. My breakfast sandwich was absolute perfection and obviously made with care...the pepper aioli was supreme and the staff was super friendly and welcoming. I'm hooked!
author: Justine D.

description: Breakfast sandwich is amazing! Treat yourself! Eggs, cheese, thick cut delicious bacon hot inside the best biscuit you've ever tasted.
author: Ryan K.

description:
Great stop in a non-touristy neighborhood. Laid-back, surf vibe, within walking distance to Ocean Beach. There are a few seats inside at beautifully shaped wooden bars, one against the front window. The parklet out front is awesome to hang out in--thick, wood-slatted benches and a boxed mini garden. We went around 11am on a Friday and it was busy, but they move the line quickly.

The baked good options are mouth-watering and there are too many to choose from! I had to restrain myself in order to prevent a sugar-butter coma. At the expense of diversity, we both couldn't help but choose a donut muffin. Oh sweet symphony of dense yet soft crumb goodness dusted with sweet sugary heaven. Ahhhh. Perfection. 

We also ordered a veggie lasagna and soup (white bean) and grilled cheese combo. This is where I had to take a star off. The grilled cheese had too little cheese for the thick slices of bread, the soup was a little bland, and the lasagna, while flavorful, was a bit gloppy--too much cheese here. We didn't finish any of the lunch items. Others comment on the breakfast sandwiches, and I can say I kept looking at the perfectly toasted, plump, puffy biscuits resting on a tray in the front--they looked amazing. Regardless of our thoughts on the lunch items, I'd still fully recommend a visit for the baked treats.

We also ordered an iced tea and an iced chai--both delicious, especially the chai.

The bakery is also big on recycling and composting--very cool. Very friendly and helpful staff. No attitudes here.

Clean unisex bathroom that also just so happened to have my patronus painted on the wall= awesome. I'll make this a little treasure hunt by not telling what it is.
author: Lesley C.

description:
Rude cashier and manager. I bought and paid for two sandwiches while not busy. 
Took 20 min to get only one and I noticed they forgot the 2nd while walking home.
I went back to ask if they had made a mistake and the Manager was very rude and obnoxious.
She , without offering any apology told me that there is only one person making sandwiches and tha I have to wait longer.
Finally she gave me the 2nd sandwich without saying anything and giving me mean look.
I have spend lots of money at this place and eventhough their good are nice, their attitude is not welcome in our neighborhood. Maybe they should move to NY or Civic center where they can find their soul mates.
Not ever going back!
author: Al S.

description:
Good is good / portions are super inconsistent - I get disappointed with that 
Cinnamon rolls look great but not my cup
of tea. 
The ginger cookies are TDF
I've yet to try the lasagne - next on the list
Lots of other treats
author: sherri s.

description:
After a night of continuous consumption of $5 dollar margaritas and stouts (wtf was I thinking btw), I found myself stumbling to this place at 9 a.m looking like a hot mess. 

I got myself the Special Breakfast Sandwich with a cup of strawberry iced tea. 

The store some how managed to get super packed after I ordered and I waited roughly 15 minutes before I got everything out the door. 

The sandwich was bomb.com!! It was the most amazing thing ever after my liquid diet the previous night. The biscuit used in the sandwich was pretty flaky, eggs were cooked to perfection, aioli had a nice hint of lemon and garlic, and the avocado was super buttery. 

The sandwich was pretty good but it was on the heavy side for the first meal of the day. I think this is a pretty good sandwich to share or you can be a fatty like me and power through to eat the entire thing. 

Coming back! Hopefully on a Sunday since they have $1 beignets!
author: Anna H.

description:
Beignets have shrunken in size since the last time I've come around and prices have gone up a bit... Maybe due to the SF minimum wage that went up? They have to cover the cost somehow?

The breakfast sandwich with the perfectly baked muffin and fluffy scrambled eggs (a must), carrot cake and coffee are all great. 

Also ($1) beignets are only served on Sundays.
author: Liz N.

description: One of our go tos on weekend mornings. My boyfriend generally orders the special breakfast sandwich and I order the quiche slice. The sweets we've tried have all been good too. Come early to avoid the line and since they do sell out of items.
author: Kelsey F.

description:
Went here for breakfast on a Wednesday, man was it good! My brother and I walked over around 9am and were trying to decide between the breakfast sandwich and the "special" breakfast sandwich. Decision? SPECIAL BREAKFAST SANDWICH.

Loved it. The sandwich is perfectly balanced with the aioli, bacon, eggs, cheese, and bread. It didn't taste heavy and went well with my coffee. The line wasn't too long when we arrived and received our food fairly quick despite the constant line of locals ordering food to-go.

Definitely come here to pick up breakfast pastries and to try the breakfast sandwiches!
author: Nick C.

description:
I moved to the Outer Sunset recently and have been wanting to try this place for a while. Post-gym one Saturday morning I decided to treat myself to their special breakfast sandwich! I got there around 10am, and yes, there was a line, but I figured, shoot, I walked 10 blocks to get here, might as well line up and try it out! 

I would say, worth the wait. AND worth the additional calories I didn't work hard enough to burn. So tasty. That aioli on that buttery biscuit along with the avocado and crispy salty bacon..Oh man. I'm salivating just thinking about it again! It's pretty hearty as well, so I wasn't hungry until way later that day. I tried the cheddar, beer, bacon, and green onion muffin as well? It was okay. I would go back to try the other baked goods, but I would definitely go back for that sandiwch, AND try to go earlier than 10am, especially on the weekends. 

They have a bit of seating outside and also one of those parklets so you can chill outside and enjoy the sun (when available :P) with your dogs and fambam. 

What a treat. Until next time, Devil's Teeth. :)))
author: Mariel A.

description: Love this place! We had the cinnamon roll and the special biscuit. Not much room inside but they have an outdoor seating area that lets you enjoy the neighborhood and people watch. A little pricey & a long wait but what can you expect from a Saturday in San Francisco?
author: Jenny E.

description: A cinnamon roll and blueberry scone were huge and delicious!! I enjoyed them with my co-worker and my husband. A chocolate cake was alright...it would be my fav texture of the sponge was soft and moister than that. 1 minus star was for not caring my donut coming out from the bag and slightly rude customer services...sorry...
author: K T.

description:
Walked in and got a lemon bar, chocolate cake slice, banana cream pie puff, and two cinnamon buns.

Lemon bar: 
Not too tart/tangy. Good flavor and nice and chewy. 

Chocolate cake slice:
Really rich and moist. I thought the frosting was too sweet though. 

Banana cream pie puff:
I had high hopes for this because it looked so good, but it wasn't anything special. It was just ok. The outer shell was just so bland and hard. 

Cinnamon buns:
Were 2 for the price of 1 since it was close to closing time I'm assuming. Anyway, not a huge fan of cinnamon, but these were probably my favorite out of all the pastries. So soft and fluffy. Not too sweet. 

Price:
$13

Overall, I was expecting better than average, but I just wasn't impressed. Maybe I need to come in on a Sunday for a beignet...
author: Fallon P.

description:
Great take out breakfast place for under $10.  Must haves: 

-Special Breakfast Sando  $6.75 The avocado mixed with the famous lemon-garlic aioli makes it.
-Beinets $1 (Only available on Sundays)
author: Herb K.

description:
Oh I hate to write this because I frequent this place, but I'm hoping you see it in hopes that you'll be cognizant and make adjustments..

Today it took you guys 30 minutes to get me one grilled cheese sandwich.  I asked about it after 15 minutes of waiting, and waited another 15 afterwards.  I understand that it was close to lunch time and there were multiple orders, but no one should have to wait 30 minutes for one grilled cheese.
author: Mike E.

description:
Yelp reviews are off the charts on this place so we drove into SF for their special breakfast sandwiches and beignets before our walk at Land's End.  We ordered two sandwiches and four beignets and paid at 9:30 AM.  We got our sandwiches at 10:20 and our beignets at 10:40!  
My recommendation is that you do not waste your time.  The food is good but the service is the worst I have ever seen.  People were lined up asking about their orders and complaining about the wait.  They ran out of drinking water, cream and napkins.  I had to use toilette paper for napkins because they had no napkins.   How this place is in business is a mystery.
author: Carlos B.

description:
All this talk of their breakfast sandwich!  Really?  It's just a breakfast sandwich, I thought.  It's not a reinvention of a croissant in the form of a donut or anything.  (Ha ha ha).  But, since I love bacon, & eggs, & biscuits, I had to try it.  Then there's the fact that they do Beignet Sundays.  I loved them right then, before I'd even been there yet.  

The 411...

It was Sunday.  There's a line.  I'm hoping beignets won't be sold out.  But the line moves quickly...10 minutes & we were inside.

A couple more minutes & we're in front of the display case, where someone will take your order.  I asked if they still had beignets.  I was told that they make them to order.  I love them more.

The goods we ordered...
Cheddar beer bacon green onion muffin.  Absolutely delicious.  It was still warm from the oven, & I ate almost all of it before we reached the cashier for chrisake.  I'm only human.

The cinnamon roll.  It's one of their specialties.  I thought it's only right to order one.

3 beignets.  I showed a lot of restraint here.  I wanted to order 10.  They're only a buck.  It's Beignet Sunday!

Breakfast Sandwich.

A cafe au lait.

After we paid, we had to wait for the beignets & the sandwich to be made.  No big deal.  10 minutes or so.

How everything was...
The breakfast sandwich.  House made biscuits.  They are perfect.  This was so good, I understand all the raves.  Absolute home run. 

The cheddar beer bacon green onion muffin.  Remember I consumed most of this before even reaching the cashier?  Well, I consumed the rest of it after the cashier, before we sat down to wait for our orders to be made.  It was that good.

The cinnamon roll was delicious.  It's not a conventional cinnamon roll w raisins & white icing.  But it's buttery cinnamon greatness.  

The beignets.  Geez.  Piping hot, doused w powdered sugar.  They give them to you in a paper bag that they actually added a scoop of powdered sugar to.  Then you shake them all up...
Heavenly.  Dangerously heavenly.

The cafe au lait was spot on.  It was the perfect accompaniment.  Serious.

I was thoroughly impressed w these guys.  They're crushing it.

Apparently the lasagna is almost legendary.  I will keep you abreast.

5 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description: Came in at 10am on a Monday to order special breakfast sandwich. They didn't have avocado AGAIN for the third time. In fact, I heard 8 people after me order same thing. It's interesting because they still charge the same price even though the most expensive product(avocado) isn't added. Bait-n-switch much? Horribly inconsistent sandwich taste and consistency, not to mention the long lines. DO NOT RECOMMEND
author: mikhail s.

description:
I came here after the kaiser permanente half marathon hella hungry, waited in line, and devoured the special breakfast sandwich!! So in the starving situation and craving for some savory and fatty goodness, that breakfast sandwich hit all the right spots!

It was a nice and sunny day and hella race runners also decided to come here. The line was out the door (the place is small so it wouldn't take many for the line to be out the store). The line moved pretty quick and the wait was reasonable, given the situation of hella people. We sat in the parklet right in front of the shop.

If I were to come here which is not that often at all, then I would just have to get the real deal you know! which is the SPECIAL BREAKFAST SANDWICH (buttermilk biscuit, applewood smoked bacon, avocado, pepper jack cheese with lemon-garlic aioli).

The biscuit itself is delicious. Nice and flakey and freshly made. Freshly made things always taste even better! The scramble eggs were tastey with the right amount of salt and pepper, perfectly cooked which was not too dry or soggy. They were actual scramble eggs as if I made them myself =) They used actual avocado pieces, not that pre-mashed up avocado spread. The bacon was nice and crispy so it gave a bite to the sandwich and it wasn't oily either.
author: Shirley M.

description:
A friend from out of town was staying with us and surprised us the brain-foggy morning after the Stern Grove Festival with some truly bomb treats from Devil's Teeth :)  

He brought back two breakfast sandwiches, a giant ooey-gooey sticky cinnamon roll, an equally gooey hunk of monkey bread, and the yogurt + granola. I usually am not a fan of monkey bread but I couldn't get my grubby hands off the caramelized crunchy top crust thingy (technical term).  The granola is so, so good on its own, and made even better mixed in with the lemony Greek yogurt and bananas.  Seriously, I'd bet money that I could eat that for breakfast every day and not get tired of it.  Later I stole a solid five bites of my boyfriend's breakfast sandwich, and I can still taste that buttery flavor. Yum.

Definitely try this place - it's worth it!
author: Emily M.

description: We braved the line on a Sunday and ordered the special breakfast sandwich and cinnamon roll. We are both vegetarian and they substituted tomatoes for bacon in the sandwich (housemade biscuit, pepperjack, avocado, soft scrambled eggs, and garlic lemon aoili) which was FANTASTIC. The biscuit itself would be worth buying and every other aspect of the sandwich was well executed. While we enjoyed the cinnamon roll, it was not the best we've had and we'd skip it next time (we'd opt for the sticky bun from the close by outerlands next time).
author: T K.

description: The best cinnamon bun of my life! Breakfast sandwiches are on point. Great place to order some delicious food and sit outside on their benches or walk down to the beach.
author: Allison P.

description: really liked this place though I only tried a few things
author: Michael A.

description: They have great food here. Really enjoyed my breakfast sandwich today. Took off one star because of the young Bearded Russian cashier. He was rude, did not smile, and had a really bad attitude. When the food was ready, he just threw the food on the counter and gestured annoyingly at the customers to come get their food. He is a bad reflection on your wonderful bakery. He should really change his attitude or find another job where he does not have to deal with customer service. All the other employees I have encountered have been friendly and helpful.
author: Chester L.

description:
Line was long, but moved quickly. The cashier seemed peeved that I wanted to add an iced coffee at the end and also extra peeved when I asked for a box for my pastries. 

Overall, I think they're OK. I prefer Tartine and b. patisserie over them.
author: Kimmie B.

description:
I've been to devil's teeth bakery a handful of times over the last two years. Overall, I the staff is super friendly and the atmosphere is a great reflection of the neighborhood. Must get: special breakfast sandwich. It's like a breakfast sandwich had a baby with some biscuits and  gravy in a hippie commune. Super indulgent, calorifically fantastic. However, you need to be ready to wait! This is not a grab and go cafe. I waited close to 20 minutes for my sandwich to come out on a Thursday morning (short-ish line). Forget about weekends. And they don't answer the phone to accept phone ahead orders. Also, the baked goods are not super impressive. I've had the strawberry banana muffin (overmixed, underbaked), lemon blueberry scone (WAY too sweet, oddly flat texture), the donut muffin (way too sweet), and the sticky bun (too sweet, but better when warmed up).

TLDR:  5 stars for atmosphere & breakfast sandwich, -1 for long wait, -1 for so-so baked goods
author: Shannon J.

description: OH EM GEE. I LOVE THIS PLACE. The breakfast sandwich was light and flaky, but substantial and savory, with perfectly crisped bacon and creamy avocado, melted cheese and fluffy eggs. Their coffee cake was delightful with a delicious fruit and crumb topping. Their bacon, beer, and cheese muffin was so. good. I didn't quite care for their cookies as much (average, but not bad). Stick to the savory stuff! I wish I could eat here everyday. The lines are long, but they move relatively quickly. Parking can be a pain, but that's a given in SF.
author: Ivana H.

description:
Where has this been all of my life?  I read an article on the top bakeries in the world to try, and this was one, so I drove over to the avenues from Sausalito!  It was worth it.  I had a latte, and the special breakfast sandwich with the bacon, avocado, aioli and pepper jack cheese.  Line out the door, everyone was happy, there were dogs..
They were making beignets to order and everyone ordered those.  How delicious.  I am going back, definitely!
author: Lisa M.

description:
Hands down one of the best bakery's in San Francisco!

Amazing sandwiches and pastries, those $1 beignets are to die to for. Its a superb stop on my way to the beach, the scene is super hip and cool and the staff is friendly and usually fast.

Chocolate cakes, sandwiches, muffins..... Everything is amazing!
author: Angel J.

description: Lived in outer sunset my whole life & never been to Devils teeth until yesterday. Their baked goods taste really good but the white guy at the register was such an ass. I went up to the register with what I ordered and he gave me attitude, rolling his eyes asking how can he help me. I'm like "im just going to pay for these". And rolling his eyes again like "and what are they?". My total comes out to $7.05. I give him a $20 and try to look for 5 cents cause I didn't want to get 95 cents back. So I gave him $20.25 and he got confused with a quarter so he gave the quarter back to me & gave my change $10.75. But I gave a $20 so it should have been $12.95. I was freaking out from the line behind me that I didn't even catch it. So basically the cashier ripped me off $2.20 and was being an asshole the whole time. Way to go. I ended up catching my ripoff while still in the store but there were so many people I didn't want to cause a scene. I'm paying card next time if I ever come back, didn't even know that was an option since it was my first time.
author: Gladys R.

description: I'd heard a lot about this spot...I had the Breakfast Sandwich, which was amazing: a rich, dense buttermilk biscuit with eggs and cheese...very filling and a perfect way to start the day.  We also had a Cinnamon Roll, which I thought was pretty good.  They have a huge selection of items and I'd definitely go back for the Breakfast Sandwich and try some other pastries/desserts as well.  The place is small and very popular so arrive with the proper expectations!
author: Ken G.

description:
I ordered the special breakfast sandwich "on a biscuit", I unwrapped a sandwich without a biscuit but with thick dry bread. Blonde lady who took my order didn't mention If they ran out out of biscuits. Where's my biscuit? Biscuit.
I also came on Sunday for beignets and they were burnt. 
Fuck ya'll.
author: Marian B.

description:
The good: 
for a Southern expat, this place is a godsend.  Perfectly delicious flaky biscuits and beignets when you get that no-place-like-home-need-comfort-food-now craving.  Quiches and lasagnas are not to be missed.  Super strong espresso type coffees, if you are a fan of those, otherwise be warned.  

The bad: 
extreme hipster vibe can get to be a bit much for us, but since it is a takeout place, I can overlook that. This formerly sleepy locals only place is now crowded much of the time: count on waiting in a long line on Sunday(beignet day- extra wait time if you order those).
author: Lorraine V.

description:
A co-worker told me about this place, being all the way out towards the Outer Sunset. 
Came here on a Wednesday morning, not much of a wait. Got a special sandwich, bacon cheddar muffin, cinnamon roll, and a coffee cake to bring home to the fam.
Sooo good. Definitely a place to try for their breakfast items, and baked goods.
author: Chris C.

description:
During my short stint of waking up for 6:30am workouts, I found this little bakery because it was open early and close-ish to my area. I had no groceries to make breakfast and supermarkets around the area weren't opened yet, so I came here and ordered one of their Special Breakfast Sandwiches. It had scrambled eggs, bacon, and avocado on a english muffin. The sandwich was definitely hearty and probably canceled out my efforts during pilates, but it was damn good so I have no regrets. Even though it's so early in the morning, the employees are always super friendly and cheerful. 

TL;DR: It's a great place to grab breakfast before you hop on the N or 71 for work, or after an early morning work out. The employees are nice and make you feel good about starting your day.
author: Helen Z.

description: Really good BEC but I waited 26 minutes for it. Worth it if you're fine with a wait.
author: C.R. O.

description:
I'm here just so I could write a review about their BREAKFAST SANDWICH. Get it. Seriously. It is packed. It is a warm homemade biscuit with FLUFFY scrambled eggs, cheese, bacon, avocados, and some serious sauce. I was supposed to share it with my sister since it was so big but NOPE, I ate it all. 

I would give devil's teeth 5 stars for their special breakfast sandwich but I also got their cinnamon bun which I was not a fan of. So -1 star. The cinnamon bun was SOOO overly sweet that it made my tooth hurt. Also it was over baked and hard. I felt like I was seriously eating a sweet rock. 

Tip: Beignets on Sunday. Hot, fluffy, and tossed in sugar. What more would you want on a Sunday?
author: Janet K.

description: I would really like to give this a 5 but.. because of my experience, I will give it a 4. My BF brought me here since it's walking distance to his place. We went here 2x but we didn't get to buy anything the 1st time because of the LINE. Well, we went on a Sunday so go figure, right? The week after, we came by for a late lunch. The line wasn't too bad so we got to order right away. So my issue was that - they run out of bacon. WHO RUNS OUT OF BACON?!! NOOOO!! If you serve the special breakfast sandwich with bacon, you would have unlimited supply right? The Special Breakfast Sandwich comes with: two eggs scrambled, with pepper jack cheese, applewood smoked bacon (which again, they run out of) avocado, and their famous lemon-garlic aioli on our homemade buttermilk biscuit. $6.75 I still opted to get it because of the rave reviews. You would think that they would lower the price a bit because of the no bacon, right?!! NOOOOO!! My BF and j were a bit disappointed but I have to say - the sandwich was really tasty. The combination of the aioli with the saltiness of the biscuit and eggs was a MATCH MADE IN HEAVEN. SOOOO GOOOD!! It might be a bit pricey but, I might have to go back and order it again and again. Hopefully next time I come, there's unlimited bacon y'all!!
author: Anna Y.

description:
$1 beignet Sundays
It's super super powered sugar heavy in a small brown bag. It's yummy for $1 but the wait for it after paying is usually very long. Mostly because EVERYone is ordering a beignet on Sundays and you have to wait for the batch to be done.

Breakfast sandwiches
They're also delicious. And last time I went, the wait for one (after paying) was 25 minutes. I'm hungry. Ain't nobody got time for that! Unless I do have time for it. Then I'll wait. It's good.

Lemon bar
Mmmm! I gave it a try once and I'm ever so glad I did. It's just the right amount of tart and the texture is amazing.

Doughnut muffin
Eh. I don't know, I'm just not a big fan of fusion baked goods. I like doughnuts. I like muffins. But doughnut muffin? Ehhh.

Come an hour before they close and some of their baked goods are discounted. Score!
author: Sandy T.

description:
I really wanted to love love love this place. It's cute, it's local, and it's near a great running path. I am not saying all their dishes are "OK" only but based on what we ordered on this day, it was OK.

The people are super helpful, patient, and friendly. This is nice to have in a neighborhood outfit.

Breakfast Sandwich - egg, cheese and fantabulous bacon in a biscuit. The biscuit has the awesome buttery taste of biscuit but not the texture. I'm just a little bit flummoxed.

Vegetarian Quiche - The crust tastes good and I could see that it was flaky but the layers kind of caked together by now.
author: Kislev A.

description: I loved the breakfast sandwich I just got but...i ordered ( and paid for) the special one and didn't check it till I got home...they gave Me the normal one..the normal one was quite good as well, but I was looking forward to the special one so I'm disappointed. It was busy, so it's somewhat understandable, but I'm a bit salty because of that...service was friendly!
author: Marco L.

description: The coffee is mediocre, the breakfast sandwiches are amazing and I'm a huge fan of the donut muffin! BUT having to wait at least twenty minutes (more than 30 mins on the weekends) for eggs on a biscuit is way too long, hence the two stars. If they can dial in the speed I'll give them five stars.
author: James M.

description:
If you're looking for buttery artery clogging biscuits this is the place! This place is more of a grab and go since there wasn't much sitting place, just a few benches outside. If you want a quick in and out hit up mcdonalds up the street because it did take around 10 minutes for our food which I didn't mind at all knowing they make everything fresh when you order it. 

I came here with a friend last Friday to grab their famous breakfast sammy. I ordered the regular breakfast sandwich, with each bite I could feel the butter oozing out of my pores washed down with greasy bacon and eggs. I also grabbed a brownie for my sister, she was not impressed as it wasn't fudgy but more cakey. My friend ordered the special breakfast sandwich, she also agreed about the butteriness but wasn't a fan of such a rich sauce so early in the morning. Overall really good biscuit/ breakfast sandwich but not for the faint of heart.
author: Julie C.

description: They ran out of bacon and was offering a tomato as a substitute. Huge disappointment after waiting in line for 25+ minutes.
author: Jared S.

description:
Why did I just discover this bakery???
I love that I can bike to this place and get some freshly baked goodies.
Their Curry Chicken Salad is the BOMB! Will definitely come back to get more of those.I love the nuts, the big chunks of chicken and celery that they put in this. 

We ordered the Blondie, Cinnamon bun ( huge and doesnt have overpowering cinnamon flavor which is great) totally sinful and the Carrot cake. All were super delish. It was perfect to bring as dessert and breakfast items for our picnic to Stinson beach.

I might have to try their breakfast sandwhich which everyone was ordering when I was there.

This place will definitely give you a TOOTHACHE!
author: Claudine V.

description:
The $5 breakfast sandwich really is a great deal, and quite tasty. The gal who works the register is a hoot too.

It is great that I live so far away, that way I can't go every Saturday.

The line on Saturday wasn't nearly as bad as I expected, so just go and enjoy.
author: Amy W.

description:
Food wise, oh my god!! You will be hard pressed to find a better breakfast biscuit sandwich. I've had the regular and the special, and I actually recommend the regular. Crispy, delicious biscuit. Crispy, brined bacon. Gooey cheddar cheese. Peppery eggs. Mm mm it's heaven, get in there and try it! Busy and slow on weekends, but well worth the wait.
These people never pick up the phone! I drove halfway across town, realized I had left my purse in the bathroom, and proceeded to call twice. It rang and rang and no one answered! I would suggest making sure someone grabs the phone; could be something important! (They had my bag):p 1 star knocked off because of my frustration with phones.
author: Lily S.

description: Tried the maple nut glazed scone and the special breakfast sandwich-DELICIOUS! The flaky biscuit and spread is what made the sandwich and the crispy bacon! The scone was equally yummy.  Outside seating is awesome on a nice day too. Check it out !
author: Shelby D.

description: Good, but always a hassle because it is so packed. I have been coming here more or less since it opened a couple of years ago and what is most disappointing is that their breakfast sandwiches have noticeably shrunk in size recently and their biscuits are not as good as they used to be. All of this while keeping the prices the same or possibly even raising it (I'm not sure). Anyways, it is a good spot, but it is not worth the hassle of waiting in line for a while, then having no place to sit afterwards.
author: Brett P.

description: The long line was unjustified, the sweet goodies were good, but that is redundant. Coffee was good, my lemon bar was great and the cinnamon roll was different than the kind I'm used to but still great. Just not worth the wait. Not good for anti hipsters.
author: Yarina V.

description:
You know something is good when you're willing to drive quite a distance to get there. This is one of the best bakeries in SF. I live in San Mateo and work in Downtown SF, so I am rarely out at Noriega and 45th avenue. This place is worth the trip to me for three things: Special Breakfast Sandwich, quiche, and the cinnamon roll. Their special breakfast sandwich is quite possibly one of my favorite things I've ever eaten. When I was a kid my favorite thing to eat was a bacon, egg and cheese biscuit from McDonalds. This is similar, but made with real food. The biscuit is ridiculously and the sauce they put on it makes me absurdly happy. The quiche is one of the best I've ever had. It's only rival in my opinion is Tartine's quiche. The cinnamon roll is extremely rich and I can't finish one on my own, but it's good for snacking on the rest of the day. 

This is a small place with little seating inside, but outside (which can be a bit cold due to fog) there is lots of seating. The staff is very nice and efficient. Also, they make very good coffee!
author: William O.

description:
If the reviews weren't enough or the line of people waiting for their sandwiches outside didn't clue you in...here it is one more time.

BEST BREAKFAST SANDWICH IN SF.
author: Sean W.

description: I'm not sure what all the fuss is about.  We waited for 1 hour and 15 minutes today to get the "famous" breakfast sandwich and were fairly disappointed.  It was obviously very good, but not 1 hour and 15 minutes wait good.  I still can't believe I wasted a good part of my day waiting for a f*cking breakfast sandwich. Ridiculous.
author: Keith P.

description: great coffee, and best biscuits!
author: Mimi T.

description:
Special sandwich is unparalleled. I substitute bacon for greens. We get a cup full of the special sauce and smother the dang thing throughout the meal.

Been here quite a few times & just wondering - did the biscuit get smaller, or did we just get an off batch? :( 

Raspberry pop-tart was nice n flaky, tasted mostly of lemon. 

Lemon bar was delectable - great balance of thick lemony custard and crumble crust. 

If you like German pretzels, opt-out of the cheese jalapeño pretzel.
author: Jacque C.

description: Looove this place. Amazing pastries and coffee. Great outdoor seating. Close to ocean beach. Easy parking.
author: Erika J.

description:
Breakfast sandwich (special - $6.75) was 5 star, but the coffee was like 1 star, so I will give it three stars.  The biscuit was amazing--why don't other bakeries and restaurants serve their breakfast sandiwches on biscuits?  So delicious!  But as I mentioned, the Americano ($2.75) was pretty bad--past the point of lots of cream having any effect. 

It's also not that convenient of a place to eat because the line is really long and there is nowhere to sit.  Definitely only worth it if you live nearby, or if it is a nice day outside, as when the fog rolls in, the temperature drops precipitously. The street parking in the neighborhood is easy though!
author: Alison L.

description:
HOLY STICKY BUN!!!!! Definitely worth the drive across town. It was impossible to finish by myself but I brought it home and finished it for dinner :)

We didn't wait the 20 minutes for the Special Breakfast Sando but instead when for the savory Turkey Sausage Quiche which was AMAZING!! Make sure get some of their salsa too, great spicy flavor.  

Thank you!
author: Talia R.

description: Cinnamon rolls as big as your head, coffee is always smooth, and they have the best chai in the neighborhood. The employees do look burnt out sometimes, so I hope they're getting enough food and breaks. But I try to tip well to show them appreciation. One gripe is that the atmosphere is too surfer vibey sometimes, so I usually take my stuff to-go. I know that kinda comes with the neighborhood.Oh well.
author: Shaina R.

description: Delicious breakfast sandwiches and pastries!!  Worth the trek out to the outer sunset and make sure you get there early as this place is very popular!
author: Nima A.

description:
My fiance was born and raised in the Sunset.  He takes much pride in it and loves and has a soft spot for all the old businesses in the area such as Polly Ann's.  I think he's open to change, but not necessarily gentrification.  But then again, pretty much if you're a hipster you'll love it, otherwise, not so much.  Hipsters already invaded the Sunset with Outerlands, and now it's Devil's Teeth Baking Company.  I had to do some convincing, but I finally got him to go with me to try their breakfast sandwich, since I've heard it's so good.  

We got there around 8:40 this past Saturday and there were already people inside and eating outside, but no wait in line, and not too busy looking.  It picked up right before 9 though.  We placed our order, we shared the Special Breakfast Sandwich ($6.50) and I got a lemon bar ($3) for later as well. The Special Breakfast sandwich is two eggs scrambled, with pepper jack cheese, applewood smoked bacon, avocado, and lemon-garlic aioli on homemade buttermilk biscuit.  The regular breakfast sandwich just has cheddar instead and doesn't come with avocado and the aioli sauce.  Save the extra $1 and get the original.  They make the sandwiches to order, which is great, but the wait was so long!  We waited for at least 20 minutes for our one sandwich.  That's like a restaurant wait time!  The buttermilk biscuit is so moist and flavorful, but that's all you taste in the sandwich.  We couldn't taste the aioli, the bacon, the avocado or the cheese!  They put out samples of their brownie which I must say I tried and was so moist and decadent.  

Later on, I finally ate our lemon bar which was great, but just like the breakfast sandwich, we felt it was a little overpriced for what it was.  I think it's safe to say that customers should just stick with their sweet baked goods.  Sorry, but there's so many other bakeries that serve savory eats that are worth the calories and the cash (i.e. Craftsman & Wolves).  I may come back to grab something sweet, but was so disappointed on the overly hyped breakfast sandwich.  2.5ish solely for the lemon bar and sample of the brownie.
author: Cat C.

description: The special breakfast sandwich is delicious with a large homemade biscuit that melts into your mouth and flavors that make you feel all warm inside! It is definitely a meal of it's own but worth every penny!
author: Madison U.

description:
Sunday to-do list
- wake up.
- check the couch for loose change, at least $2+ worth. 
- pick up a couple of hot, fresh, sugared BEIGNETS from Devil's Teeth. 
- sleep.
author: Maya S.

description:
special breakfast sandwich is all you need to murmur to have an unforgettable meal. 
lemon aioli pepper jack cheese avocado bacon. the biscuit is incredible! do try the pastries i'm a big fan of the cinnamon doughnuts, maple scone and love the banana walnut bread also!
author: Charles C.

description:
Swoon. This place is amazing for breakfast and I love the set up because unlike other awesome breakfast places there's not really a huge wait (long line but it moves fast) and they don't run out of their best items like other hot spots. 

We got the cinnamon roll and the breakfast sandwich. I LOVED the sandwich and would come here everyday for it. The cinnamon roll was also insane and heavenly! While its super delicious, it's a bit overwhelming (super rich and cinnamon-y which are both great things!) so I'd recommend splitting it. 

Ps the price is amazing! Totally worth 5 stars.
author: Jocelyn S.

description:
Ugh....a 30 minute wait to be told that breakfast sandwiches will be another 30 minute wait.  There's one girl on a tiny stove frying eggs, just like mom made at home.  

Got some pastries instead, all very dry.
author: Phillip S.

description: Great little bakery. You got to try their Ginger Cookies and Donut Muffins.
author: Nicholas L.

description: I totally recommend this bakery it was impeccable I ordered the special bagel, raspberry bar and iced espresso. Everything was delicious! I am definitely coming back!!!
author: Jamie M.

description: Awesome place close to the beach, sunday beignets are bomb. Cool staff! Gets busy. Go early.
author: Peter H.

description:
Friendly staff, delicious-looking (No, I didn't indulge) baked items. A gut-loading handmade sandwich that looks like it'll put me out for a few days.

I went with a relative who grabbed a baked item. I attempted to order a half-calf Americano but **they don't have decaf espresso**. I ordered a decaf coffee but unbeknown to me the coffee took 6 minutes to brew because it was a pour-over it took nearly 8 minutes to make the drink. I wish they'd mentioned that prior to taking my order. Nothing special about the coffee and not worth the wait.

Overall a good experience because the staff and people waiting in line were friendly. If you don't like crowds, don't go on a weekend or holiday.

*Post Post: 
I changed my rating from a 3 to 5 stars because someone from the company reached out to me and offered to give me a free coffee after reading my post. A great business takes care of its customers. Thanks!
author: Chris S.

description:
BEIGNET SUNDAYS!

Finally got to come around for Beignet Sundays! I got so excited. I didn't know that there's essentially only one flavor for beignets, but even when I heard that, I was too excited for beignets to have any change in mood. These are definitely worth waiting until Sunday for. If you need some sort of motivation to work through the week, dreaming of these beignets will help! So fluffy and light...I could eat so many more if I had bought more and kept them to myself hahaha
author: Bonita K.

description:
Best damn cinnamon buns on the planet.

Oh, and their gigantic breakfast sandwich (like a giant greasier and more delicious Bacon Egg McMuffin) will set you on the right foot for the rest of the day.

Lines as expected. Go make a friend. Pack some extra bites for a beach picnic. Enjoy one of the places that'll make you love the Outer Sunset.
author: Anthony N.

description: You can't go wrong with Devils teeth.  I've had pretty much everything they bake and have never been disappointed.  But the best day to go is Sunday.  Ordered the breakfast sandwich special.  Scrambled eggs, jack cheese, applewood smoked bacon, avocado, smothered with a garlic aioli on a fresh baked biscuit, F'n amazing.  Followed it up with fresh made to order beignets and coffee and I'm in a food coma.  The staff is great, friendly and the laid back relaxed atmosphere makes for no finer a Sunday morning.
author: Sabe A.

description: Came back for once again... Beignet Sunday! But also got the breakfast sandwich and special breakfast sandwich. These sandwiches are seriously the bomb!! It's got perfect amounts of egg, biscuit, bacon, and cheese and its huge!!
author: Jingxi Z.

description:
OH MY GOD. Best chocolate cake ever. Biegnets brought me back to NOLA. And I can't wait to come back for what looked like the most delicious breakfast sandwiches in the world.

I wish it weren't so far away....
author: Jess C.

description: I LOVE this place! It's a bit small but it's guaranteed to be packed on the weekends, especially on $1 beignet Sundays. Their Special Breakfast Sandwich comes with bacon, avocado, pepper jack cheese and so much more on one of their homemade flaky biscuits. They also have giant flaky cinnamon buns that are sweet and delicious! The people who work here are really friendly and chill. Definitely a great hangover brunch hot spot.
author: Grace C.

description:
We've been here twice now thinking the second time it would be better but honestly you can skip it. Super hyped up biscuit sandwiches that are dry, crumbly and have no flavor. Even the scrambled eggs have no flavor. This place does not know how far a little salt and pepper can go but I digress, back to the review. 
Each time we got one regular biscuit sandwich and one special. We had no idea about the $1 special on beignets on Sunday's and this my friends would be the only reason to come back because they were delicious little pillows of fried goodness! 
However, for the crowd and to wait in line for a half hour, only then to wait an additional half hour for the sandwich, not worth it. Also, the cashier had a little too much attitude for my taste.
author: Victoria T.

description:
For the love of breakfast, this place is amazing. Their breakfast sandwiches are amazingly delicious. And they're all made to order. 

The line can get pretty long sometimes so expect a wait. I find that the busiest day to go is on a Sunday, which is the only day as far as I am aware they serve beignets. 

The atmosphere is super chill and their staff is super friendly. Once you order your food, you can sit in the parklet outside. The staff is even generous enough to bring the food outside to you. 

So what are you waiting for? Go and grab yourself the Breakfast sandwich and a cup of coffee or tea. Maybe even a pastry. 

Once again, if I hadn't said it enough, get the breakfast sandwich! and try their housemade hot sauce. You won't be disappointed.
author: Lisa H.

description:
Fantastic bakery in the sunset. You have got to try their Special Breakfast Sandwich (not just the regular kind). Make sure to get a good squirt of their homemade hot sauce on it as well.

Pro tip: bring someone here for lunch then go a couple blocks down Noriega to the ocean and walk along the seawall while watching container ships pull into the bay.
author: Thomas L.

description:
It is definitely time to update my review. I believe I gave a five star about 3 years ago when this place just opened, and a five star remains. I do note that they have definitely mastered the warm biscuit breakfast sandwich :) I also think the size has increased. I consumed it at 10:00 a.m. and was full until 2:30 p.m. There were plenty of eggs in that thing, cheese and bacon. The biscuit was nice and fluffy and dense at the same time. It was just delicious! I think they've increased the price by 50-cents since three years ago.

The line was OUT the door Sunday morning. I have a feeling they're going to expand at some point. Definitely love this place.
author: Vanessa K.

description:
I've had many great meals at Devils Teeth. But I went yesterday and it was the last time. 

We ordered a soup and two BLT's.  The soup was warm on the edges and cold in the center. Really? the flavor was fine. 

The BLT's were inedible. They put mustard on it which was deflating. But more disastrous, each slice of bread was an inch thick, about an inch thick of lettuce, the tomato was half an inch, and the bacon was piled high. So if you find pleasure contorting a four inch sandwich in your mouth, then this is your spot. It was a parody of a sandwich. And though I tried to eat it deconstructed. The lettuce was caked with mustard, and the bacon was so salty we just through it away. Also the mayo was only on one slice of bread. imagine an inch thick of dry bread under salt with bacon.  

I left complaining and had 3 friends mention they haven't found it any good lately either. 

What happened?!!!

I hate writing a review, but I tried to email them and there is no way to find their email address on there website. So sorry Devils teeth. You're blowing it.
author: Bryson G.

description:
I genuinely don't understand the hype of this place. I'm not exactly a guru of baked goods, but I also know good food and nothing about this place is special, at all. It's just another bakery with the same stuff as anywhere else except for 1 thing: THE LINES AND WAIT TIMES ARE RIDICULOUS! 

I live 3 blocks away and never bother because I can expect at least a 20-30 minute wait for a stupid breakfast sandwich every.single.time. This morning for example, I was one of the first people there and waited over 30 minutes for 3 breakfast sandwiches while I watched their staff spend more time standing around gabbing than doing actual work. 

When I asked what was taking so long, it turned out my sandwiches were sitting there the whole time but they didn't notice because they were too preoccupied with their conversations. 

In the end, I can't say anything bad about their food, but I can't say anything special either, and combined with the crowds, unnecessary wait times, and apathetic work staff I can't say I'll ever come here again.

I would rather drive out of the city for breakfast than walk 3 blocks and deal with this place. That should speak for itself.
author: Marty E.

description:
REALLY yummy breakfast sandwiches. Really.
Haven't had the coffee yet. 
Brownie and milk = a delicious treat to get there!
Sundays mean $1 beignets (fluffy fried dough and powdered sugar).

Pretty much only outdoor seating, unless you go at a slow time.
San Francisco long line warning! As per usual.
author: Danielle C.

description: The best breakfast sandwich in the sunset hands down. Many well priced sweets to choose from and delicious tea and coffee choices. The special breakfast sandwich is the only thing I've ever purchased and that won't change. It's absolutely delicious. A fluffy buttermilk biscuit surrounds egg bacon avacado cheese and a creamy lemon garlic aioli sauce. It's addicting. Expect a line out the door but never too long of a wait.
author: Nicholas M.

description:
This review is for the new blonde girl, she is so lucky I didn't ask her for her name. 
I walked in to order a coffee, thai ice tea and a donut muffin.  When ordering, the girl had a very confused look on her face like she was battling a hangover and didn't gather her brain cells to comprehend the words coming out of my mouth.  I honestly had to repeat my order several times.  When the incorrect order finally arrived, my sister was literally in her face spelling out the words hoping it might help her with her visual skills, but non the less the little witted blonde dolly didn't fail to surprise us.  It took a few tries before our drinks came out! While I was walking out of the store, excited to pull my  "donut muffin" out of the bag to bite into, I ended up pulling a strawberry muffin! How could she mess that order up, I even pointed right at it.  Obviously, this girl is disoriented!

Sorry Devils teeth, hate to tell you but two thumbs down for this staff pick!   On the other hand, the cashier is a real champ who apologized for her colleague, that definitely shows great team effort, kudos to you girl..
author: April N.

description:
Random name, but great food! My husband and I tried the special breakfast sandwich and the cinnamon roll. Both were AMAZING! Highly recommend and would definitely go back. In terms of beverages, the coffee was good, but I would pass on the hot chocolate. It was nothing special. 

Just a warning, the place is super small and super crowded. Expect to wait!
author: Faith C.

description:
Base solely on the single drip coffee and one bite of their pipping hot beignets,  devil's teeth baking company was awesome.

I grew up just down the street and was pleasantly surprise to find this little gem minutes away from my house. Visiting from LA i'm happy to see there's this awesome cafe, so close to home. Four years of studying at UCLA as an undergrad has made me a coffee addict..and the coffee here totally hit the spot.

Strong, intense flavors and definitely worth the wait. I wish I had more time to try the other delicacies. That would just have to wait for my next visit home.

TIP:
parking in the area is hard to find. If you live close by, WALK. If not, try looking around the neighborhood side streets. There is a nice sitting area right outside to enjoy the $1 pipping hot beignets on SUNDAYS!
author: Diane T.

description: Had their breakfast sandwich, so good! The other baked goods looked so delicious it was hard not to buy more. Seems like a good place, thought can't speak for their coffee, only the food!
author: Kelly D.

description: Delicious breakfast sandwiches!! The regular comes with egg, cheese, and bacon  sandwiched between a biscuit. It's a little pricey for just a sandwich, but it's worth it considering the fact that I left with my tummy full and craving satisfied. Can't wait to come back to try the special!
author: Betty T.

description:
I finally made it back here and I was not disappointed!!!  Breakfast sandwich = mouth joy.  They got an expresso machine! Mocha a little too sweet for my preference but still good. 
Had to get their famous sticky bun and shark cookie too! 
I Love Devils teeth!
author: Chelsea D.

description: Basically, the best bakery in the Sunset. However, that does not actually tell the story of fresh baked goods, both sweet and savory. A community coming together while drinking coffee, and do not miss out on Beignet Sunday.
author: B L.

description: Such an unassuming place that offers some of the best baked goods in town!  Each time I go I try something different and believe me- everything is outstanding! My faves include the chocolate cake, the cinnamon roll and the peanut butter cookie.
author: Lisa W.

description:
Literally THE best breakfast sandwich you'll eat in SF, or maybe anywhere. 
It'll keep me full for most of the day. It's egg, avocado, aioli, and bacon between warm house made biscuits. DELICIOUS!

There is a wait if you come on a Saturday or Sunday morning, but it moved pretty quickly and is definitely worth the wait. 
The donut muffins are pretty good and they can hold you over until you get your sandwich. 
I got the cinnamon roll once and I thought it was too sweet so I couldn't finish it. 
The beignets are great and worth a try! 

You're a block away from the beach, so I like to grab my sandwich and take it to the beach on a nice day.
author: Elizabeth K.

description:
Saturday, 10:30 AM.
To beat the line on the weekends, I got here before 9:45 AM. 

Quickie:
+ Food quality
- Hygiene
+ Customer service
+ Turnaround
* Vibe
+ Menu variety
* Layout

And then...?
Devil's Teeth Baking Company (DTBC) is on my regular rotation when I visit SF. I can't believe I missed this before but apparently they make their own hot sauce?? 

**********
Stuffed my face in:

1. Special breakfast sandwich
     + Home-made biscuit and sauce elevates this sandwich.
     + Good use of the avocados! 

2. Chocolate chip cookie
     - Too brittle, would prefer a softer middle.
author: Chuck N.

description: Everything I have tried here is amazing. Thai iced tea, special breakfast sandwich, and an orange roll is what I got last time I went and everything was delicious
author: Hayley D.

description: Food and coffee are good but the kitchen staff makes food at a snails pace. Took 45 minutes to get a breakfast sandwich.
author: Surfer J.

description:
Beer muffin!

Blondies!

Beignets

Sight Glass hand drip and yummy pastries


It's a real joy to write about small businesses in this western side of SF who GET IT.
a super quality product that tastes good and makes you want to come back for more. this is one of those special places in the sunset ocean beach area.  whether sweet or savory, DTBC gets my 5 star call. so far everything i have had here has killed my taste buds. 
can't say enough.
digging into a monkey bread now...
DTBC's version of a sticky bun.
WOW!
author: Jeff W.

description: This was on my list of places to visit when we were in SFO for my daughters birthday. After all the great reviews we thought it was going to be fantastic. We all had the breakfast biscuit sandwiches. They were good. Then we bought 4 different types of cookies for snacks for later. Not the best cookies,  just ok. The coffee was also sub par. We can check it off the list of places to go, but probably won't go again.
author: Jeanette A.

description:
I went there yesterday in the morning and got the cinnamon roll. 

Honestly, probably one of the best cinnamon rolls I've ever sunk my teeth into. It was huge! I only wish there some sort of frosting to it as well. I don't mind though because it was super good and soft.
author: Christian R.

description:
I came here in a recommendation of a donut shop down the street, twisted donuts yum. Basing my review in coffee, pastry and breakfast sando and meat lasagne.

Coffee- They no longer serve blue bottle, I didn't miss it. They have almond milk and used another independent coffee roaster. Bicycle coffee??? I forget. I got an almond mocha. They use Scharffen Berger chocolate. Nice taste, not too sweet and you could still taste the coffee flavors

Pastries - beignets were piping hot and scrumptious, only Sunday's though. Cinnamon Roll reheated at home the next morning was outrageously delicious. Also had Choco cake, moist and loved the icing. I could tell they use quality ingredients. Next time trying the pie.

Breakfast sando. Nice buttery biscuits nicely seasoned with salt and pepper make the sando. Plus the bacon they use is good quality.

Meat Lasagne - yes, after all this I bought the meat lasagne to go because I did not want to cook later on this lazy Sunday, plus it's playoff Sunday! fresh vegetables and good quality meat they use in this lasagne were well balanced and after reheating in toaster oven at 325 for 25 min, perfect!!!!  Add in my Texas Toast and this is perfect meal to compliment my Downton Abby!!!!

Would have gave it 5 but I didn't feel this place was as clean as it could be as I saw a dog near the pastry rack and and the juice selection or lack of juice selection was not there.
author: Chi K.

description:
brownies.....donut muffins....beignets....and...the Best breakfast sandwich ever!!! And as if the regular breakfast sandwich wasn't good enough....they came up with the special! love it!!!!
the cult following is proof of how good the breakfast sandwiches are!
author: Jackie A.

description:
This place was delicious!! 

I came on a Saturday, a little before lunch, so the wait was not too bad. It was technically still breakfast so we got two special breakfast sandwiches, a cinnamon bun and two bacon cheddar  muffin. Yes, this was for two so we definitely ate with our eyes first  but I can't lie, everything was delicious and we finished everything!!

The SPECIAL breakfast sandwich was insanely good and that garlic lemon aioli simply MADE this sandwich! eggs scrambled, with pepper jack cheese, applewood smoked bacon, avocado, and lemon-garlic aioli on homemade buttermilk biscuit. Makes your mouth drool doesn't it?? Everything compliments each other so well, you want to finish the whole thing, but honestly, look at the picture... the sandwiches are huge!! And worth every penny. The sandwich comes out hot, and if there's a line, fair warning, you'll prob have to wait a while for it. But like how it was worth every penny, it was worth the wait.  In one bit, you'll taste the nicely, perfectly crisped up bacon, with the cheese melted beautifully with the scrambled eggs, with a nice bite of the avocado and tying it all together with the light taste of lemon and strong taste of garlic from the aioli with a biscuit that you can honestly just eat on it's own, really, just get the sandwich.

Now, the bacon muffin is every bacon lover dream, it's bacon and cheddar mixed in a muffin batter so you can have the wonders of breakfast to go!

Cinnamon bun fits perfectly in this to go box, perfectly baked with a nice texture and definitely not too sweet and you will not finish it in one sitting.

I will be back to try everything else. BTW 7x7 recommended their beignets and I had every intention on getting it, but I got distracted by everything else. Lol. I'll be back!
author: Hepsie C.

description:
We got to Outerlands 30 minutes after they opened & 30 minutes too late.... Huge wait and we ended up looking elsewhere for something tasty this weekend morning. 

Soooo glad we did because we stumbled upon this gem! Special breakfast biscuit sandwich x 2 and coffee cake to go. Homemade biscuit was so good, not too rich. Tons of avocado and fluffy eggs and bacon. I usually find this kind of item too overwhelming and end up having just a few bites but I finished the whole sandwich here. So satisfying. 

Coffee cake was topped with pecans and I swear there were some apple or pear bits too. Again not too heavy. Texture was more like a muffin than what you might expect from the usual velvety coffee cake.

ALSO lemon blueberry scone!!!!!!! So lemony. So flaky and perfect. Loved it.
author: Lisa K.

description:
The cinammon rolls here...YUMMM! Not your average cinammon roll that's smothered with a bunch of sugary cream cheese topping. It's just straight up cinammon roll-- dense middle but fluffy and a little bit of crunchy goodness that continues to wrap around into a delicious bun.  I think the little bit of crunchiness comes from the brown sugar crystals they use in between the layers. It's really big though so I usually have to finish one in two sittings. Half for breakfast, and the rest for dessert after dinner :)  

I really liked their soup of the day, which was cream of broccoli!  So yummy and savory.  The coffee is good here too. I was surprised that I had to wait for 20 minutes there for the coffee, but I think I might have just been unlucky and was in between the times when they were waiting for the next batch of coffee to finish brewing. I went there on a weekend morning and there was a line, but their employees are pretty efficient in taking the orders quickly so the line moves fast.  Totally wanted to try their red velvet cake, carrot cake, and scones, but that'll be for future visits!
author: Stacey C.

description:
How lucky am I that my second favorite coffee spot in the city happens to be a few blocks from my apartment?  

Not only does this little bakery do a mean cup of joe, it also throws down some terrific breakfast pastries!  Definitely go for the beer/bacon/cheese/scallion muffins!  The kale scones are solid as well.  Looking for a good sour dough round, well they've got you covered (whole or half).

Truth be told tho, I've always gone early.  Rumor has it that later hours (and especially on weekends) the line can be long.
author: Josh M.

description: These folks know how to do it and they do it right!  Get there early or prepare for a line. It's worth it no matter how you enter. Definitely get a breakfast sammie and try out some of their desserts! Everything is made from scratch and is so yummy! I've been here about 10 times and just getting around to writing a review, shame on me! Great little restaurant with minimal seating, really like 3 little tables and some outside seating area. I usually grab and go. Give them a try! Love them! Very friendly group and I love to spend cash here. Ha! That breakfast sammie is killer! They are so worth it the last time I was there SF police gave a me parking ticket.
author: Tiffany M.

description: Extremely long line, but sandwiches are worth it! It's a pleasant experience to grab a sandwich on a sunny say and head to the beach after. If you're not that hungry, one sandwich is absolutely plenty for two people. The bread is extremely dense but has a great flavor. The other ingredients are super high quality - from the eggs to the avo to the cheese and especially the bacon. Be careful, though, the sandwich can be quite messy. Parking is never an issue around the neighborhood, but seating at the cafe is an issue. Be prepared to eat it somewhere else if it's too crowded!
author: Allison L.

description: The special breakfast sandwich is amazing, the chipotle aioli and biscuit are unique twists that set this sandwich apart. The peanut butter chocolate cookie is delicious as well! The atmosphere and full coffee menu make this place one of my favorite spots in the Sunset.
author: Christina P.

description:
I sure am relieved I don't live anywhere near this place or I'd definitely be enormous!

The breakfast sandwich comes on a piping-hot buttery buttermilk bisquit with cheddar, fluffy scranbled eggs, and bacon (or tomato). These things are super yummy, super filling, and super affordable at 5$ each. Just do yourself a favor and go for a nice run on the beach beforehand so you don't have to feel guilty about consuming 9238975 calories ;)

The peanut butter choc. chip cookie was yummy (i prefer it over the chocolate chip)and twas size of a baby's head. Definitely good for sharing.

All the baked goods look mouthwatering. I'll be back to try other stuff next time I'm in the hood!
author: Nina M.

description: I LOVE lemon bars, and their lemon bars are heavenly. From their breakfast sandwich all the way down to their chewy oatmeal raisin cookie the size of my face are yummy. But when I really want something sweet, I'd go for their cinnamon roll which is perfect for 2! Will be back very soon.
author: Tiffany C.

description: I am happy to support local businesses, especially any that make such tasty beignets (which they only make on Sundays).
author: Alvin A.

description: Everything here is just wonderful! The setup, the food and the crowd. My personal favorite was the lasagna, one of thw best I've ever had. This is definitely a stopover you'd love when you visit San Francisco.
author: Carlo G.

description:
I have been coming here since the first month they officially opened. I actually used to come every other day!  AND YA KNOW WHAT? 

I am very sad as to how Devil's Teeth Baking Company has turned out now. Pretty much all of their sandwiches have been upped in price by about $2 and their cleanliness has went down a bit. Only the baked goods are somewhat worth the price now. I'm not sure if it's because San Francisco is getting more expensive now, but it's still a huge increase compared to the type of food you're getting. The coffee is okay, looks like the selection got better.

Overall this place was always a bit pricey to begin with but it seems like it got a bit too high for the type of food you're getting. There's a lot of other competition in the baked goods and breakfast department. So keep your options opened!
author: Brian C.

description:
Beignet are half size. Again. Serious bummer. I was so excited and now ... Nope.

Inconsistencies are very disheartening. I patronize the bakery for joy, for neighborly kindness and for my own pleasure. Today, I'm just bummed.
author: Nik D.

description:
I just had a love affair with that breakfast sandwich. 

No..really.  

Even if the reviews on here really talked it up, I don't think I knew what I was getting myself into.  The biscuit it comes on would be fantastic by itself, but with the wonderful addition of breakfast goodness, it becomes a breakfast sandwich like no other. 

I liked it so much, that even though it is about a 10min drive for me...I seriously considered getting back in my car and going to get another one.

Needless to say I'll be back...probably very soon.
author: Sawyer F.

description: This place tastes like a middle school bake sale. The cookies are dry and too sugary and the biscuit used for the breakfast sandwich falls apart immediately.  It's gross. Go across the street to Noriega Produce and grab a croissant and yummy snacks for the beach instead. Or go to Trouble Coffee on Judah and 46th and get the cinnamon toast.
author: Meghan B.

description:
Love! 

I highly recommend calling in your order as this place can get pretty busy. The breakfast sandwich (scrambled eggs, cheese, and OH MY BACON, in a buttermilk biscuit) and the lemon bars are a must!

I wish the coffee and espresso drinks came in larger sizes, but its still good.

One cautionary word of advice, you may end up spending more than you think you would because everything is so yummy. On any given visit, my order can get up to $40, and you start to question where you went wrong, and if you really need all those pastries. The answer is yes... you really do need all those pastries.
author: Stephanie C.

description: Lines always out the door. Rude staff (looking at you lady working the sandwich station). It's no wonder their employees have been quitting lately. One star for their breakfast sandwich.
author: Tyler P.

description: Order the special breakfast sandwich. Fluffy eggs thick bacon melted pepper jack cheese avocado and lemon-garlic aioli sauce all in the best biscuit you could ever imagine. Flaky but dense. The pastries have my mouth watering as I wait to order and even the dog treats look better tasting than anything I've ever cooked. I'm bringing my dog next time so I can get a treat to try for myself
author: Courtney S.

description:
My favorite neighborhood breakfast/ pastry shop. What's for breakfast? breakfast sandwich from devil teeth pop up in my mind so often. I guess I'm addicted to it. 
Biscuit, crispy bacon, egg, cheddar cheese, and ask for extra avocado, simple delicious. 
Sorry, they do NOT have expresso machine. But cafe au lat is good enough for me. 
Another must have, cinnamon roll. I'm not a cinnamon person, but I like their cinnamon roll.
author: JustinE Y.

description:
I'm from out of town and my friend that's a local to the neighborhood showed me this gem. I absolutely loved it. I ordered the special breakfast sandwich and a cappuccino. The secret to this sandwich is definitely the biscuit and the lemon garlic aioli. Great service, good variety and lovely ambience. 

Perfect place to grab a casual breakfast!
author: Jenny D.

description:
I ordered Cinnamon Rolls and Donut muffins. Even though I'm not a big fan of bakery, I gotta say that all of them is literary gorgeous and delicious!! And, the employees are so nice :)

After reading all of review in Yelp, I decided to go there early around 7.30 a.m. Thus, I have no problem. So, if you want to avoid crowded people, I'd rather say that you'd better then come early.
author: Bom N.

description:
Two Words: Cinnamon Roll

Come here, do it, and thank me later.....done
author: Niyera D.

description: The food is amazing but lost major stars w me when I was forced to pay full price for a refill on ICE TEA!!!! Really
author: kim n.

description:
Holy hell, Devil's Teeth doesn't mess around. A tiny place that serves up the best breakfast sandwich I've ever had. 

The best breakfast sandwich I've ever had.

Yeah, the rest of the baked goods are tip top too.
author: Marcus C.

description:
O.M.G. Everything is amazing.

Special breakfast sandwich = delicious. Buttermilk biscuit as the sandwich bread??? Yes, please! I'm from the South. I LOVE buttermilk biscuits!! I prefer this to the regular breakfast sandwich as the regular can be a bit dry without the aioli and avocado. Plus, the aioli is just yummy and really adds some good flavor to the sandwich!

Cinnamon roll = overindulgent decadence. But awesome. It's basically diabetes in a roll. I can't have these very often, but when I do, I'm in love, and in a coma afterwards.

The Kale Parmesan scones are yummy and a nice savory alternative to the sweet rolls and scones.

Their lemon bars and other fruity bars are yummy, too!!

Quiches: delish!

Obviously, you can't go wrong with basically anything you get. And the employees are helpful and friendly. 

So glad this place is in my 'hood!!
author: Pauletta K.

description:
Hmmmmm.....mixed feelings here. Have had the breakfast sandwich on my list try & have heard it's bomb...maybe I went on an off day?

Breakfast sandwich was on a homemade biscuit with cheddar cheese, scrambled eggs, tomato & avocado--sounds pretty solid, right?

The sandwich looked fantastic and is a good portion for the ~$6 price tag. The bakery is cute & the staff were friendly and efficient.
