The biscuit was really good, a little salty but moist, flakey & flavorful. The eggs were dry, chewy & overly peppery--as if they were microwaved & reheated (fail). The sliced tomato was fresh & thick cut. The mashed avocado had turned, was sour & needed to be scraped off. So, there it is.
author: Cec D.

description:
I had some serious time to kill while my daughter was at the dentist. As I was driving straight down on Noriega Street, I found this little bakery near the beach. The little place is currently one of the top new businesses at the moment. 

First thing I saw was the Blue Bottle logo on the glass counter. I started with a cup of that for $2.00. The coffee is brewed one cup at a time like the other BBC locations. 

Every item is baked in the bakery, located in the back, with fresh local ingredients from scratch. I got here at midday, and not many baked items are left. But one item that caught my eyes is the Doughnut Muffin. For $2.50, the pastry tasted like a doughnut with the shape of a muffin. The cinnamon and sugar coated topping blend with the dough make the treat very unique. Doughnut Muffin: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/elgE2cUhKotsLoBUdghexQ?select=4som3AQCEggchxaoqGU09w

I also bought a $2.50 Blondie Bar for my daughter after her Novocain wears out. "Looks like she may have to go again soon." Blondie Bar: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/elgE2cUhKotsLoBUdghexQ?select=5PnkWN1caXtuzD-pcLJL2w

Anna, one of the workers, was really nice to me. Her friendliness will compel me to come back and try other fresh pastries and lunch. I need to get my ass over there earlier for more selections.
author: Matt G.

description:
I absolutely LOVE it here!  E V E R Y T H I N G  here tastes SO GOOD! 

A few things I have tried are: 
-Beer BACON Cheddar muffin...  tastes as GOOD as it sounds!!!
-Lemon Blueberry scone... is among one of my faves... big & juicy pieces of fruit that bursts with flavor... atop a sugary crust with hint of lemon... amazing.  
-Ginger cookie... has HUGE pieces of tender & chewy ginger candy.  
-Chocolate chip cookie... chocolately. 
-Lemon bar... lemony. 
-Carrot cake... good balance, not too sweet, tasty cream cheese frosting.
-Cheesecake... is the most DEELISH & creamy cheesecake I've ever had!  The cheesecake factory could learn a thing or two... just saying.
-Single cup brew... serving Bicycle coffee,  L O V E  the single-brew by cup coffee!
-$1 beignet Sundays!  ...can't lose with $1 beignets!  ...just bear with the long line and wait a minute before consuming because they are HOT! 

Okay, I guess I've tried more than just a few things.  (^(oo)^)

CONVENIENCE: **** [Located in the Sunset district, a locals' spot, 1-hr. street parking or park in residential.]
AMBIANCE: **** [Tiny shop, limited seating inside, outdoor seating available if not raining or foggy.]
SERVICE: ***** [Super fast, always friendly... lots of smiles... everyone appears to genuinely enjoy working here.]
PRICE:  $  [Most items under $5, but it's so hard to leave with just one thing!!!]
OVERALL: ****/* [5-stars... no doubt!!!  For food, taste, drinks... it's AWESOME!  A GREAT place for locals that live in the area... a quick place to grab & go... a plethora of wonderfully delightful bakery items!] 

DO expect to leave with more than what you expected to pick up...
DON'T worry... EVERYTHING is DEELISHUS!  
Nuff said. 

[#29 of 100 YELP CHALLENGE 2013]
author: Lily Y.

description:
I really don't understand what the hype is all about. The biscuit was the driest that I have ever had. It tasted like it was missing butter and other ingredients. I could make this easily way better! The line was out the door and I waited 20 minutes for my basic breakfast biscuit sandwich. The egg was tasteless too. I didn't finish it. Not worth the calories. Not worth the wait either. 

Yuck. I wouldn't come back!
author: McKenzie L.

description: I don't write reviews much, but I do read them quite frequently.  I have to say that I disagree with one of the reviews for this bakery.  Every time I've been here, I've been treated like family.  The gal up front, Lil, greets me with my name and puts my order in as we are chatting.  She always has a smile and is nothing short of friendly and humorous.  I'm in a good mood when I leave because of Lil...and, of course, my coffee and amazing breakfast sandwich.  I can see she prides herself in getting to know her customers and their orders.  Read all the good reviews!  They are true.  The bad "one" seems to be a plant with an agenda.  You will not be sorry you went to Devil's Teeth.  Enjoy, and tell Lil, Mia sent ya :)
author: Maria A.

description: You need to come here! The cheddar green onion bacon muffin(I don't think that's the full name) is amazing! It's packed full of love. Love meaning tasty things. This is like the Ben and Jerrys of muffins. Loads of toppings! I want to sit here until I'm hungry again so I can grab another one.
author: Grace H.

description:
I ordered a lemon cake (with blueberries!) from this place, and not only was the cake beautiful and well made, it was also downright delicious! I wanted to also point out how helpful and accommodating the staff was when I called in the order! I ordered the cake on a Monday evening (right before they closed--I felt so bad!) and I needed it by Wednesday morning. Usually they ask two days in advance for special orders like this one, and Tuesday they were closed, so I was expecting it wouldn't work out. Thankfully though, the gentleman that was helping me asked the manager to see if it was still doable and to my genuine surprise they said that it was ok!! I was super stoked! So thank you Devil's Teeth! You pulled through and I appreciate it!

Also, the scones are to die for. Best ones I've ever had, hands down.
author: H M.

description:
Excellent raspberry and lemon bars.  I'm not someone who is big on sweets, but they have the perfect combination of sweet and flaky.  
The curried chicken salad was delicious and filling.  My husband had an egg sandwich which he really enjoyed.  I loved it and will be back.
author: Nikki A.

description: Over hyped long wait for burnt food. Got the BLT and Grilled Cheese. Both of the sandwiches bread and bacon was very burnt and hard. Was not worth the 30+ min wait. They need a better system people's orders were getting skipped. While waiting watching the workers handle the food seem very unhygienic. Seen 1 girl handling raw bacon into a baking pan and then went to touch other stuff without washing her hands or wearing gloves. And came back to handle the raw bacon again. Wish I can give 0 star.
author: Betsy X.

description:
Packed , Efficient, Friendly 

Came in just to get a coffee but had to try a pastry 

Try the "donut" muffins
author: Evan W.

description: They have the world's best cinnamon buns! Their staff is very nice and accommodating.
author: Jessica S.

description:
Went in today and ordered some pastries and breakfast sandwich.  

Our office goes there because of proximity but damn this place is super inefficient and gross.  I asked the counter girl "What's this?" She runs around asking and no one has the answer.  She then proceeds to sniff the muffin and guess.  Oatmeal/ pecan something Eh.... ok... 

Saw the guy make my breakfast sandwich and proceed to use his fingers after holding a pen to scoop my eggs with his finger.  Ew!

This will probably be a the last time.  This place gets worse and worse every time I come in.
author: hannah t.

description: Excellent Special Breakfast Sandwiches served on warm and fresh homemade biscuits with avacado, scrambled egg, bacon, and special Chipotle aoili like sauce. Everyone highly reccommend to put their homemade salsa in the sandwhich too. It was so delicious that every time I visit San Francisco I come here in the morning. Very filling and delicious.
author: Michelle G.

description:
Do NOT do business with this bakery!!

I placed a special order several days before a special event.  Traded emails with the head baker CONFIRMING the order and the pick-up date.

They completely blew it off.  No cake.  40 people coming to a big party in two hours and no cake because of the complete incompetence of this bakery.

I will NEVER NEVER NEVER trust this business with even one penny of future orders.
author: Stephen Y.

description:
It's like a Chicken-Hawk-Bitch. 
Well, tell you why
There is a MORON who is very rude and needs serious help:
She may not know how to count
She may not know basic math
She thinks it's OK to see the customers wait 
She thinks it's OK to not to care for the customers
She thinks it's OK to work very slow
She thinks it's OK to be rude 

Come the FXXX ON
That's why the line in so long.
Because the bad ordering system and the MORON CASHIER !

The business is very loosely run 
The long line is not because the cooking time.
FXXXin' Hell, It's all because the ignorant bastard.

Coffee is not good.  Ever.  
Attitude is often lacking and service disorganized. 
Over priced in general.  
A lot of their baked goods, but just are not tasty anymore because of the service. 
Why should I go back to get the lousy attitude?
This Devil's Teeth got a big cavity.
No Thank you, Low Life Bitxx!, period.
author: Nobu K.

description:
Breakfast sandwiches and beignets to die for! We wondered whether it was too carnal to drive to Outer Sunset for some baked goods.  Our hedonistic desires were fully satisfied at Devils Teeth. This is not artisan fare, a la Tartine, this is fulfilling, substantive goodness. 

Sundays they offer hot, fresh beignets for $1. You can't beat the delicious, warm puffs on a drizzly day. The breakfast sandwiches are made on the best biscuits I can remember. Don't forget to add the house-made hot sauce to the sandwich biscuits, the sauce is tucked away above the water pitcher and utensils. There will be a wait for the sandwich - but don't you want your eggs hot and fresh?!?

The warm cinnamon rolls are fantastic as well, just gooey enough without being sugar-laden like the mall varieties. We liked the coffee cake, even a day old it kept its moisture. 

Don't be deterred if the line goes out the door, they move quickly. The service was friendly and the cashier thanked us for waiting in the light rain. We will be back and you should make a date with the devil too.
author: Jason M.

description:
CINNAMON ROLL.  

It is unlike any other cinnamon roll that I've ever tasted.  So sweet, so bad for you, but OMG, SOOOO GOOD.  5 stars just for this.

Without the cinnamon roll, I would probably give 4 stars.  I did not like their beignets but everything else I've tried has been pretty solid.
author: Vanessa C.

description:
yup I like it like everyone else. Delicious baked goods, a pretty killer b-fast sando, cookies A+. 

The coffee service is a bit slow when they get slammed but honestly you should ALWAYS expect to wait at this place. It's that good.
author: Joseph M.

description:
The Special Breakfast Sandwich is truly special. I'm not a fan of sandwiches and I LOVED IT! Buttermilk biscuit, avocado, bacon, egg, garlic aioli DROOOL. 

My friend and I were lucky and arrived when there wasn't too long of a line. They had a pastry window with a lot of different selections that I wanted to buy togo for later but I never ended up going back in because the line grew and never lightened up again.

I will def. go back to have the bf taste the special breakfast sandwich and let myself try some of the goodies in the window.
author: J-nine I.

description:
_what I ordered:
$6.50 (I think; correct me if I'm wrong) for the Special Breakfast Sandwich! I love everything about this sandwich and recommend that even if you don't live in sunset, you go get this RIGHT now! Their homemade biscuit is soft in the middle and nice and crunchy along the circumference - mouth-watering.

I also grabbed a doughnut muffin for later which proved to be a wise preemptive decision on my part! 

_atmosphere:
The place looked like a bunch of good friends cooking up a storm in the kitchen together! It was great to see them working at it; super quick and nice. There are a few stools inside where you can eat but there's a great parklet just outside that is lovely. If we weren't in a rush, I would have enjoyed the breakfast sandwich out there.

I am definitely going back to try some of the other goodies and highly recommend it.
author: Natsuki M.

description: One of the best places in SF. I have drunk many cafe in a few countries and here is one of them i am impressed because i can feel the coffee deliver something that make me happy. :)
author: Pat R.

description:
The review is for their chocolate cake:

My roommate was having boy problems and she looked so bummed and was moping around the house. I felt bad so one day after class I stopped by here to see if the bakers had any suggestion as to what I should get her. They looked at each other and all agreed I should get her a slice of chocolate cake.
They were sweet and totally understanding that sweets are total ways to make someone feel better.
My roommate loved the cake! She said it was moist and not overly sweet bit right on point! Obviously it didn't make her bulletproof for boy problems but it gave her a nice little pick me up.
Thanks guys!
author: Eff B.

description: The best biscuit sandwich I've found in SF! Also great and upbeat staff of the few times I've visited on a weekend morning. There's always a line but I've never waited more than ten minutes...which is about the time you need to decide which pastry NOT to get since you'd want them all! They also serve great coffee. This is now my neighborhood breakfast spot even if I live a few neighborhoods away!
author: Michelle R.

description:
Their special breakfast sandwich is the bomb.  Enough said.
Oh, but the line can get really long. So there might be a long wait time.
But the staff is very friendly.
author: Phillip G.

description: yep - the breakfast biscuit sandwich is as advertised.  I am not in the avenues often.  When I am, this is a must-stop
author: N T.

description: The line is worth the wait. I had the breakfast sandwich and I didn't eat it til I got home. It was wrapped in foil and when I got home from their location to san bruno, and took a bite, the bacon was so crispy! Like super crunchy, not soggy or soft at all. I was shocked. The Cinnemon roll was very different from what I have had ever before (like cream cheese frosting etc. It was almost like a caramel Cinnemon roll. It was very addicting and hard to just have a couple bites. I would definitely come back to the place again.
author: Elaine A.

description:
I have a new place I want to teleport to when I want to feed my inner fatty... and it is called Devil's Teeth Baking Company. 

One of the people who work here was nice enough to come talk to my hs students about going into pastry/culinary careers (THANK YOU MEGGIE) 

DTBC round 1 (HS students ate:)
cheddar bacon biscuits 
brownies
lemon bars 
pastries galore 
students TOTALLY loved it and want to save the world 1 pastry at a time and run food truck  business 

DTBC round 2 (I ate:)
went there (yeahy!!) to see things for myself 
Small location but quick service :)
Breakfast-
Bicycle coffee (it was amazing)
BLT with extra garlic aioli.. IT IS THE BUSINESS. OMG... so good!! 

I wish this place was closer to santa cruz.... or I could teleport to sunset. 
Will be back soon!!
author: Vicky T.

description: I love a place where you can relax and have a long conversation with friends without being bothered by work. When the register lady is doing that with the customer in front of you, not so much. Crappy, loud, annoying service always makes your food taste bad.
author: Vicente G.

description:
Visits: 1st
Rating: 3*
Service: Excellent
Dishes: Special Breakfast Sandwich; Beignets; Cinnamon Roll

Everything we ordered was ok good. The beignets perhaps were the better ones we've had in a while, although not the best.

¤ Special Breakfast Sandwich (3.5*). There was a lot going on in this sandwich. Fluffy whipped eggs with bacon, cheese & many other ingredients in between buttery country biscuit buns. I'm not so much into country biscuits, so that dinged some points off for me. But overall, the complex flavors worked & was good.

¤ Beignets (4*). One of the better beignets we've had. It was light & airy with an almost sourdough chewy texture without the sourdough taste. And of course the deep fried doughnut exterior. The powdered sugar adds a slight sweetness. Good stuff.

¤ Cinnamon Roll (2*). Had to try it since so many reviewers were raving about it. For us, it was just too hard & way too sweet. It's hard & slightly dry. The top browned sugar crust is very sweet. As if a large amount of sugar coated then baked until the sugar caramelized on top. If that sounds good & not too sweet to you, then perhaps it's your thing. I'll pass. It's also very dense. Almost broke our plastic fork trying to eat it. So be extra careful with that plastic fork.
author: Daniel T.

description:
This place is an all-time favorite. The food is unreal and the staff is fun, outgoing, and frankly people you want to hang out with. 

I bought $57 worth of goodies for my wife (we live in Nashville) - they packaged them up and wrote a love note on top for her. 

If you're in SF and don't experience Devil's Teeth, you're missing out.
author: Ryan B.

description:
One of my favorite places to get lemon bars. Their lemon bars are flakey and gooey at the same time. A mix between cookie and bar. 

Their breakfast sandwiches are very good. The special sandwich is much better when it comes to biscuit and condiments ratio and the garlic aoili is delicious. 

The donut muffin is nothing too special, it tastes like an old fashion donut with a cinnamon sugar flavor but shaped like a muffin..
author: Polly W.

description:
The coffee is strong! Exactly what I needed after playing chauffeur for the bf on B2B weekend.

I ordered the beignet since it was only a dollar. It was just okay. I may have waited too long to eat it. 

The bf enjoyed the breakfast sandwich. I was in the mood for sweet.

The cinnamon roll was my fave. I will definitely have it warmed up first. Yum! 

Will definitely be back when visiting Cheryl Q!
author: Lena H.

description: Oh my god I killed their breakfast sandwich! It was so good . And their coffee was very affordable and tasty
author: Mariana D.

description: Pretty sure I just gained 5 lbs, and I don't even care. The biscuit on their special breakfast sandwich is second only to my grandma's biscuits. And that cinnamon roll was a sweet, chewy, decadent masterpiece. Perfect, delicious carbs.
author: K W.

description: YES! This place was awesome! Line was out the door when we arrived but it moved very quickly so don't let that stop you. We ordered there Special Breakfast Sandwich which was full of deliciousness, I swear this has to be my favorite now. The biscuit was cooked very well and stuffed with egg, bacon, avocado, pepper jack, and lemon aoli! Super heavy definitely something to share. Also tried their cinnamon roll which was good, don't compare this to cinnabon bc there was no cream, but it was yummy! Sweet but not too sweet, strong cinnamon flavor intertwined in the roll too.
author: Alyssa M.

description: Sticky Buns!!! I love my cakes and cookies and morning pastries and this is absolutely ridiculously delicious!
author: skip g.

description: I went to this bakery because of the your reviews.  I am not sure why they get 4.5 stars, also 1 dollar signs.  both reviews are wrong.  first, clean up your kitchen, it's pretty obvious that you don't clean.  also don't sell day or two old bread/pastry, again clean up your place, it's filth. Your prices are 2  dollars signs, not one.  also use clean filter and clean water on your coffee,
author: Mason C.

description: I seriously do not get the hype. The service was awful- impersonal, impatient, and rude. It took over 40 minutes to get beignets and they were overly dense and terribly burnt. Not delicious. The cinnamon roll was also burnt and just not good. We didn't even eat 1/4 of it. Our lattes came out practically cold. We took them home and reheated them on the stove, but geez. For $26 and such a high rating, you expect to have a better experience than this. Terrible. Definitely will not go back. Ever.
author: Melissa S.

description: I'm not sure why this place has such high reviews, although I didn't get to try the cinnamon rolls or beignets (they didn't have them when I went) so maybe that would have made a difference. Everything is solid, but I wouldn't make a special trip out here for anything. I had their special breakfast biscuit sandwich, a brownie, and a couple of other pastries. It all tastes like what I can make at home, but I guess if you don't have time to make homemade goods then this place might be for you.
author: Jen K.

description: I would have given them 5 stars, but I was utterly disappointed to drive over there all the way from Marin to stock up on the best lasagne I have ever tasted. To be told they don't make it anymore. Are you kidding me people?!!!! It's famous, everyone talks it up, and now it's gone forever. So. Darn. Bummed. Pleeeeeeeese bring it back!
author: Kara V.

description: My favorite sunset breakfast gem. I always do the breakfast special add mixed greens. Great lasagna and other options, pastries and drinks as well. Sunday beignets are to die for ...
author: Mariam T.

description:
This is what I do. You can do it, too!

1. Order the breakfast sandwich -special, and a coffee, or another caffeinated beverage of your choice. Odds are you will order something hot, because it's the Sunset! and reliably cold.

2. Eat, savor, devour, aforementioned deliciousness. Afterwards you will tell yourself that you are not eating for the rest of the day, pretty much.

3. Fall back into line and get one or two pieces of the strawberry pie to go. Your taste buds will thank you later during the day. Remember to take a fork!

4. Head to Land's End and burn off that fatty breakfast goodness, and take in the beautiful sights of the Golden Gate and Pacific coast

5. Undo hard work put in at the trails by eating strawberry pie and and enjoying the sweet tartness with each bite

*Steps 3, 4, and 5 may be interchanged according to preference.
author: Jaclyn L.

description:
If you're heading out to Ocean Beach on a weekend morning, Devil's Teeth is your first stop. They serve delicious coffees and pastries for very reasonable prices and really put a lot of work into the quality of their products. Maybe a little too much, as the wait for a breakfast sandwich is 25-30mins at 10am on a Saturday.

Their cinnamon rolls are phenomenal. No white, goopy frosting, but instead just soft cinnamon gooeyness. They're really quite filling too - one of these guys is a sufficient breakfast alone.

Yogurt parfaits are really good here - you grab a container of plain yogurt from the case and they add fresh banana slices and give you a bag of their house-made granola to add as you eat your way to the bottom of it. 

They offer $1 beignets on Sundays, so you buy a couple to tide yourself over while you wait for your sandwich on the series of wood benches outside.
author: K M.

description: This place is one awesome find. They have of the best breakfast sandwich I've ever tried. Cinnamon rolls is really good also, but you must eat it warmed up. As for the workers there, they're very attentive and very cheery.
author: John C.

description: I rarely give five stars but this beach adjacent bakery deserves them all. The donut muffins, beignets and the amazing cinnamon rolls as well as their homemade biscuit breakfast sandwiches each deserve five stars. But the new breakout star is the maple pecan scone . Go get it now!!
author: Mark N.

description:
Three words for you:

Special breakfast sandwich.

Shhh. Don't ask questions. Just get it and eat it. Trust me. 

Just so good. I saved half for later in the day and yep, still delicious.
author: Dolores L.

description: Never disappointed in anything I get here.  Breakfast sandwich is good.  Coffee is good.  Cheddar onion muffin with various other things in it: very good.
author: Christina S.

description: Cute spot for brunch! We ordered the special breakfast sandwiches(SBS), the bacon muffins, and fresh juice. The SBS was so delicious that I just couldn't stop pigging out on it  the bacon muffins were good too, but I definitely recommend you heat it up at home, cuz it taste so much better when it's warm. Very affordable price for brunch. The only down side ? There's only outdoor sitting area, with no table. We ordered it and walked over to the ocean beach to enjoy it instead. Hope you get to try this place when you visit ocean beach !
author: Maggie L.

description: You just can't go wrong with the Special Breakfast Sandwich. One of the best breakfast sandwiches I have ever had! Their cinnamon roll is amazing too! (Pro tip: ask for the cinnamon roll to be heated - tastes 10x better when warm!)
author: Trisha D.

description:
One of the best breakfast sandwiches I've had ... and only for $5! 

I came here on a saturday morning and it was packed! However, the line moves pretty quickly. The employees are pretty helpful and nice given they are constantly running around. We ordered a latte, americano, and two breakfast sandwiches. They warn you ahead of time that the sandwich will take around 15 minutes. I thought this was pretty helpful just in case I was in a rush. 

Seating here is very limited. There is a small bar inside with a couple of seats. There is seating outside where they have a little garden with benches. It's very similar outdoor seating to Trouble Coffee. Our coffees came out pretty quickly. We sat outside and waited for our sandwiches. 

The coffee was good! Nothing too special but definitely better than your average coffee shop.

Breakfast Sandwich: Biscuit, Egg, Bacon, and Cheese! The Biscuit was so fluffy and buttery. There were thick cuts of bacon inside. The overall sandwich was pretty big! I was not able to finish the whole thing .. even though I really wanted to. 

Perfect place for breakfast on a sunny day if you can find a seat. You can always take it to-go since its wrapped in foil. I want to come back and try their curry chicken salad since I saw a lot of people eating it. 

Tip: there are free doggy treats at the cashier!
author: Thatcher H.

description: So delicious! Had the special breakfast sandwich- generous size and filled with yummy goodness, filled me up! Took sometime to get it since they cook it when you order it but worth the wait!cookies are also good! Definitely recommend!
author: Karen L.

description: Omg...so freaking yummy. This place has long lines (roughly 20-30min when I went around 10am) but was definitely worth the wait. Their coffee was good and breakfast special was fantastic! Small biscuit breakfast sandwich but very dense and filling. Big guy + their special = happy bloated customer
author: Johnny N.

description: Expect a line because this place is really popular with the locals.  I've seen this place for a few years, and decided to walk in and try the beignets and coffee.  The beignets were piping hot and amazing.  I'll be lining up again to try more stuff when I'm in the neighborhood again.
author: Barnaby W.

description: Ok... Hands down the best carrot cake I have ever had! This bakery is a jewel in the heart of the sunset!
author: Ed R.

description:
How have I not written a review yet?  The carrot cake is TDF. The breakfast sandwich is humongo and made fresh. You just have to try everything and find your favorites.

I usually don't add stars for service or friendliness but they are just so incredibly awesome that I added a star. One time I was starving and stopped in for a yogurt parfait. Turns out they had just closed and everything was dark. The owner very graciously accommodated me (a stranger) but refused to take money. Another time, my baby knocked over my yogurt parfait and made a giant mess. I started cleaning it up but a staff member told me very nicely not to worry about it. THANK YOU, THANK YOU! As a mom, it's so difficult to juggle everything that I'm very appreciative for people who get it. 

Location: The benches outside (parklet) are wonderful and very family friendly. It's just a few easy blocks walk from the ocean. It's across from a very nice grocery shop.
author: Marina N.

description:
Devil's Teeth is doing the devil's work cooking up a storm of deliz goodies.

-breakfast(breakkfast sammie, quiche, muffins, scones, yogurt parfaits, etc.
-lunch(BLT, chicken salad, veggie soups)
-Sweets & Desserts (cookies, wedding & birthday cakes made to order, raspberry/lemon bars, blondies, brownies, pies, alfajores, cheesecake, banana cream puff, etc.

pour: bicycle coffee (12 oz, 2.5) drip (3.5)
-smooth, semirobust dark roast, on the edge of acidity.
-well worth the 2.5 
4 stars

crumbs:
-pastries look tasty too but didn't have room for one more.....
-fast, plesant, efficient service.
-little sit down room inside
-plenty of parklet sitting on the street.
author: Victor G.

description: My good friend took me here on my most recent trip so SF. She lives nearby and goes here often. Service is great, staff is friendly. They seem to have a limited menu, but the breakfast sandwich is amazing. The biscuit is good size and flaky. Eggs were cooked fresh, bacon was thick and crispy and cheese was melted deliciously. I will definitely go back on my next trip to the bay area.
author: Dave C.

description:
I've tried coming here so many times. I got here either on a day they were closed or they were closed for the day. So lame. 

Anyways, I was able to get a lemon bar ($3) and a doughnut cupcake ($2). 
The lemon bar is literally the size of a square post-it. They're delicious and if you like the crunchy part, as for a bar that has edges. So sad that they're kinda steep for $3/each. 

The doughnut cupcake I gotta say is creative! It reminds me of a sugar cookie. Yum! 

BTW, their chocolate chip cookie isn't anything amazing. Trust me, I'm on a cookie madness. 

I would say to definitely try Devil's Teeth Baking Company. They're fun and creative. 

I would rate them $$ not $ since they're baked goodies are kinda $$.
author: Jess W.

description: This place is the closest thing to heaven. The breakfast sandwich is perfection. Also, BEST cinnamon bun I've ever had. Ever.
author: Sarah G.

description:
Ordered a carrot cake for my boyfriend's birthday. Not only did they make my cake for Saturday when I had asked for them to make it for Friday (which luckily wasn't a huge problem), but also they had lost my cake when I went to pick it up, and they had to go find it and then deliver it to me.

The ended up refunding me the cost, so I can't be too upset, plus the cake was truly delicious. I'll probably order from them again.
author: Tony G.

description:
SO YUMMY. I always get the breakfast sandwich (eggs, cheese, and tomato-instead of bacon, on a warm biscuit) and I am always satisfied. Ingredients are fresh and it is very filling. I have tried several of their pastries as well, and they are also pretty darn good. Sometimes the line can get a little long on weekends, however, it is also a very small store so it appears to be worse than it is. The staff is very friendly and efficient--never making me wait more than about 5 minutes for my order.

I don't have a dog or child of my own, but it seems like a fun morning outing. Many people walk their dogs there and tie them up outside while they order their meals. Most seating is outside on wooden benches so your furry friend can hang out with you AND you can even get them a freshly baked doggie treat from inside! As for kids, there should be at least one item that they'd enjoy on the menu. Also, Devil's Teeth supplies chalk to draw on the sidewalk with outside so there is plenty to keep a kid of any age, or a 20-something like myself, entertained.
author: Timorei A.

description:
Long lines on weekends especially during breakfast/brunch time(around 20 mins wait for your food) Not too much seating available unless you don't mind sitting outside in the cold.

I had the breakfast sandwich, which was pretty good! The bacon was crunchy and eggs were perfectly cooked. Personal preference, but I felt the biscuit was a little too thick for me. The donut muffin did not meet my expectations, but their cinnamon bun more than made up for it! Overall, would go again - just not at 11AM on Sundays.
author: Helen W.

description:
Ordered a Lemon Cake for a friends baby shower. Cream cheese frosting.

Should have ordered two. One to eat on the way over.

Everyone brought a dessert as a theme. Mine was the biggest hit....even with all the macarons from the East Bay and the mini cupcakes from the Marina:)

Will order again. For dinner:)
author: Dani K.

description:
It's 3.8 miles around Lake Merced so I consider the Breakfast Sandwich my reward(depending on how many times I circle it). 

Places like this remind me that San Francisco is almost like two cities-the west and the east. On the east side staff don't always look you in the eye but the people at DTBC are just the kind of people you would like to see to start off your day. I'm a creature of habit but one day I'll have to order something other than the Breakfast Sandwich. It's probably the only place you'll see ingredients that run the range from kale to beer. 

I really like the cute miniature bookstore too. Nice to pick up a read if you are lucky enough to have the day off on the beach. Sounded like they were playing Death Cab for Cutie's new album when I came in.
author: Lisa R.

description:
Over due edit.  I can't leave it at two stars when I go there ALL the time.  The breakfast sandwich alone is usually 5 stars, and I dream about it when I'm not eating it.  
Plus I got a nice email from one of the owners addressing my whining, and I appreciate that.
author: Kean S.

description: So it goes like this. My friend got me all hyped up on Devil's Teeth and we finally head over about 12 noon today. Line out the door but the Special Breakfast Sandwich with 2 scrambled eggs, bacon, avocado and lemon garlic aioli is rumored to be worth the wait. We wait 15 mins + 10 mins in line, receive our sandys and head home only to discover our sandwiches have no aioli and no avocado. Me so sad. Gave them a call about their mistake , which I understand because mistakes happen, and owners sister "Lil" offered us free breakfast on her tomorrow. Awesome crew! Donut muffins and strawberry pie are good also.
author: William R.

description: My boyfriend and I make a special trip out to the sunset for Devils teeth.  Everything they make is delish but the breakfast sandwiches are dank.  The cinnamon bun is like crack.  Plus they always have a jar of free freshly baked dog treats.  Which my pooch devours with in seconds.  Since this place is so good, be prepared to wait in a fat line on the weekends or lunch time.
author: Linh L.

description: The breakfast sandwich is outstanding but everything else sucks! Service is very pretentious and unfriendly...I almost felt like it was a privilege to stand in line for a latte they couldn't make. Unlikely to come here again
author: Siobhan B.

description: The breakfast sandwich is a must. If you get the original be sure to try it with the house made hot salsa. Every pastry behind that glass looked delicious. I would definitely return to this spot on future trips to San Francisco.
author: Mike J.

description:
Came here to meet up with a friend.  She was raving about their egg sandwich and I was intrigued.  
Breakfast sandwich.  Yup.  It was good.  Bacon (can't go wrong with that). Eggs.  Cheddar.  Fresh biscuit.  Wrapped in foil and put in the oven to melt the cheese.  Delicious.  It's worth the few minutes you have to wait for it.  
I've been raving about it and I don't know why I haven't gone back.  I've tried to replicate it at home, but not the same.  Close.  But not the same.  
I will definitely have to come back to have it again and try their other goodies.  It's a great treat to myself.
author: Claire J.

description:
All the five star reviews are a lie. People who eat there haven't eaten at enough places to make a good distinction between whats meh and what's great. Ordered the chicken curry sandwich. You don't put mayo and curry powder to chicken, mix it up and call it chicken curry. Zero stars for taste and dry. They didn't even put butter or olive oil when toasting the bread. 

Lets get to the soup. We had the bean and tomato soup. No flavor and cold right from the fridge. What a waste. 

Now the dessert. Got the carrot cake. Yogurt frosting. Yucks. Where is the cream cheese. And if you put yogurt at least don't overdo it. 

Chocolate cake : Bitter. Flavors didn't come through as expected. The packet they put it in was oozing with butter. 

Overall zero stars. People get a life and stop writing wrong reviews.

There's nothing devilish about this place. Just plain rip offish.
author: Ronald S.

description:
I wish I discovered that I lived SO CLOSE to Devil's Teeth before. I used to drive by and wonder what it was...but now I can munch on yummy DOUGHNUT MUFFINS, scones, cookies and the very sought out, Breakfast sandwich. I waited 20+ minutes just to get one on a Saturday afternoon (never doing that again) to fulfill my craving.

I definitely recommend checking out the bakery during an off hour and not on the weekend when they're super busy and the Sunset is packed with hipsters. But if you do stop by on a Sunday, get there early for their fresh beignets. They are fresh and piled with powder sugar, so good.

I think what puts them over the top is their down to earth and friendly staff. 
This is a must try if you're ever in The Sunset.
author: Leah F.

description: The thing here is to get things you can't get elsewhere. For me, those things are the breakfast sandwich, donut muffin, chocolate cake, carrot cake, and cinnamon roll. But what am I saying? You can get these things anywhere, can't you?? No. First, homemade biscuits with deliciously seasoned eggs, thick bacon and cheese is hard to find that's done well. The donut muffin is a light muffin with a good dusting of cinnamon and sugar. I like the chocolate cake here because it's a good, homemade cake, not fancy, just like I would make at home. The size is generous too. The cinnamon roll is carmelized on top, pretty sweet and a perfect size to share. Oh, and the lemon bar is moist and tangy. You better get there early or take a couple of hours off on a weekday morning.
author: gabby m.

description:
My only issue with Devil's Teeth is how decadent and delicious its sandwiches and pastries are. 

I'm a sucker for breakfast sandwiches. Devil's Teeth's rendition comes with generous helpings of cheese, eggs and bacon, piled into two enormous and buttery and perfectly crumbly biscuits (did I mention you can upgrade this and add lemon aioli and avocado?). I felt like I'd consumed 1,000 calories in one sitting -- dirty and fat, but also oh-so-happy. 

The coffee is decent and there is wonderful outdoor seating -- very conducive to large groups or just a friend or two. Definitely a solid addition to Noriega St. 

Do watch out -- the lines get long, especially for their world-famous beignets.
author: Tiffany W.

description: I've thought about the special breakfast sandwich for almost a year. A friend took me here last June and now I'm back! It was fabulous! It was in my hands in less than five minutes. (We were there a little before 9 on Sunday.) I thought the biscuit was a little dry and the avocado was only on one half. However, I'll still be thinking of it until next time!
author: Katie D.

description:
I don't usually like biscuits, but this one in the special breakfast sandwich is delicious!  We usually come here on a Saturday morning to enjoy breakfast before going about our day. The other foods they have in the display cases are drool-worthy and I am always tempted to get something, but stick with the normal breakfast sandwich.

Everyone's super nice, but the lines are long and some of the customers are irritating. They have outdoor seating, which is nice, so you can enjoy food in the sun. The inside is too cramped to sit in, let alone stand. Their ordering system needs to be more functional; I had to yell my order out from a few feet away because people are busy standing in front of and staring at all the yummies in the display window.
author: V M.

description:
I was really glad to have stopped by this place.  The special breakfast sandwich is a must-have!  We also ordered the regular breakfast sandwich but I think it is definitely worth adding $1.25 for an upgrade.  For some reason the regular one was really bland, and since it came with the delicious biscuit, it was a bit dry without the avocado or the sauce added to the special version.

The donut muffin melted in your mouth!  I couldn't tell whether it was a fried muffin or a baked donut rolled in cinnamon sugar, but anyways it was THAT good.

The cinnamon roll was a bit pricy, but it was HUGE.  I think they made a good call not adding any cream cheese frosting so it was not overly sweet.

I also ordered the slow dripped coffee.  I guess it was actually the only thing I didn't enjoy as much.  It has a more "sour" after-taste that perhaps would be just right to some people, but not me, since I always drink my coffee black.  However, it might be perfect if you like to add some milk/creamer.
author: Nikki N.

description: Pretty, pretty, pretty good. The cinnamon rolls are off the charts! Breakfast sandwich is good, not great (the biscuit is a little dry and black pepper in eggs is a no-no) but hey... Super friendly staff good tea options too. Coffee is the one bummer (bicycle coffee for you single origin sour coffee geeks) but two thumbs up otherwise
author: Rex L.

description:
Whether you're there for sweets or for more savory-type items, this place has it all. It might seem out of the way, as it's tucked away deep into the Sunset near the beach, but it's worth it. No question about it. 

I love the openness of the store, as you can see directly back into the kitchen and watch as the staff cooks, bakes, and prepares different foods. The majority of the staff are young adults, so the atmosphere has a pretty young and laid back vibe. This is not to mention that the staff ifs incredibly friendly and helpful as well, so there's another bonus. It's a fairly small shop that can get very crowded during peak hours in the morning and especially on weekends. Also, try not to show up moments before they close because they'll most likely have run out of just about everything!

THOSE CINNAMON ROLLS THOUGH. Hearing great things about them was what first brought me here a few years back. And yes, I've been coming back ever since. Those cinnamon rolls just melt in your mouth and can satisfy any sweet tooth. They're so big too! So you can always pass it around to let others try a bite (or not if you really want it for yourself...no one will judge, don't worry). 

Aside from their cinnamon rolls, I love their bacon scallion cheddar muffins. YUMMM. Their breakfast sandwiches are SO GOOD too, so definitely choose either of those two things if you're craving something that's more savory and breakfast-like because you'll be a happy camper. Other favorites of mine include the lemon bars and the carrot cake.

Maybe you're coming here after a long day at the beach with your family, or perhaps you're stopping by here on a weekday morning on your way to work, or maybe you're just choosing to spend your sunny Saturday morning reading a book while sitting right outside of Devil's Teeth with a cup of their coffee and a few of their pastries. Whatever it is, this is undoubtedly one of the better bakeries in the city that is perfect for just about everyone.
author: Aaron W.

description: I'm not the first to note this, but the breakfast sandwich here is delicious! When I want to spend a quiet morning near the beach I come across town to Devil's Teeth for the the regular breakfast sandwich: bacon, scrambled egg, cheddar, and a crumbly biscuit. The one thing that could improve things would be good green chile or jalapeño, but they always seem to have Cholula hot sauce and that's good too...
author: Eric S.

description:
LOVE this place.  Excellent breakfast sandwiches.  On a nice sunny day, it's fun sitting on their parklet, then head on over to the beach!  Remember, they are only open during the day!  This is mostly a breakfast spot, though they have some more lunchy time items that I have yet to try!

Also, the baked goods are amazing.  I loved the sour dough loaf and I really loved their raspberry bar.  It was sweet, but not too sweet, buttery, sticky, and crumbly.  mmm wish I had one right now.
author: Alison H.

description: If you're looking for a 1,000 calorie + breakfast sandwich, look no further. Their special breakfast sandwich is unreal and the perfect hangover cure. It is so stinkin good. I am a sucker for good biscuits, and theirs are huge and delicious. The aioli sauce they put on the sandwich is delicious and the bacon is nice and crispy. The sandwich is huge and really reasonably priced. Only downside is that the line gets pretty long, and if you are there hungover, it is loud.
author: Gabrielle C.

description:
Some fresh goodies from Devil's Teeth Baking Company always brights up my foggy lazy Sundays in the outer Sunset. Lucky for me, Mr. Dubs seem to always walk in hungry and we've seriously tried most things on the menu. I wish I could say that I love everything on the menu but I think Devil's Teeth is a hit or miss. 

Hits

- Lemon Bar (must try. It's perfectly sweet and not too tart)
- Brownie 
- Blondie
- Beignets
- Parfait cup (it was surprisingly super filling)

Misses

- Donut muffin (looked better than it tasted)
- Cinnamon roll (waaaay too big and sweet)
- Breakfast sammie (a little too bland)

There's a long list of other things that we've indulged but I can't seem to remember everything. (old age? I hope not!) I've been told that the muffins are delicious so they're definitely on my list of must try. I don't think there's anything that is "bad" on the menu, some are just better than others. The common denominator is that everything is fresh!

I highly recommend bringing a jacket though because the wait for certain things can be quite some time and true to the ocean beach area, it can get quite chilly.
author: Tiffany U.

description: Had the breakfast biscuit!!! So yummy home made flaky biscuity goodness with egg and ham inside...OH YES!!!! If you only eat one thing here try the breakfast biscuit sandwich!!!
author: John A.

description:
I've been wanting to come for awhile after reading about it in several blogs.  Yesterday I steered my car westward toward the Great Highway. Lots of street parking. Cute storefront located several blocks from the ocean.  There's a small parklet directly in front of the bakery.

Inside a few high stools and a counter that face the street. But it's more of a grab and go place.  On a sunny day, you can sit at the parklet, but sunny days in the Outer Sunset can be hit or miss.

I selected two items -
*donut muffin - like a cake donut.  Sugar and cinnamon and everything nice.  3:30pm snack time.
*cinnamon roll - I had 1/2 at 9:30pm.  Anytime is a good time.

This morning I had the other 1/2. Warmed in the toaster oven.  Still buttery and yummy.  

I need to steer my car westward again!
author: Shirley N.

description:
Great place off the beaten path! My ideal 'Californian' bohemian coffee house. Unpretentious and delicious.  

Get the special breakfast sandwich with egg, bacon, pepper jack, avocado and a garlic lemon aioli on a fresh biscuit--nom, nom!

The latte came sugar free if you need it sweetened you'll have to add some. Also had a huge chocolate chip cookie that was yummy too. 

We drove over from union square to eat here and it was well worth it. 

Not much seating, everything comes wrapped to go.
author: Sarah V.

description: A bright light in the cloudy outer sunset.  What a cool vibe around this place.  Plus the food is absolutely amazing.  The breakfast sandwich is easily my favorite in San Francisco.  Can't wait to try all the little goodies but primarily come here for the breakfast sando and it never disappoints.  Super friendly folks behind the counter, cheers!
author: Daniel C.

description:
This place is undeniably awesome. 

Every time I come back to SF, I make sure to stop here on a Sunday for their beignets. 

Today I went overboard and got beignet's, raspberry bars, a ginger cookie, strawberry muffin and cinnamon roll. 

All were amazing, especially the beignet's and ginger cookie. 

I would and do go out of my way to stop at this place.
author: Justin B.

description:
Special breakfast sandwich is the bomb! The price for that is pretty good too. 

The pastry selection has a set of standard ones and others that rotate, ranging from $2-$5. I love the cinnamon rolls here as well. 

Place is packed on the weekends, but the lines do move quick. 

If you're bringing friends around the city, this is a really cute SF place on the way to the beach and zoo!
author: Peter T.

description: Fantastic sourdough bread, great corned beef and pulled pork sandwiches, awesome service. Highly recommend this place!
author: Jamie J.

description:
Best beignets in town and only $1 a piece on Sundays. These are the main reason I come but they also offer and amazing freshly made breakfast sandwich with bacon, eggs, and cheese on a homemade biscuit. I have also tried the cheddar bacon muffin which is quite tasty.
There is a great little parklet in the front where you can hang out and the beach is only a couple blocks away.
author: Maria M.

description: A little bit pricey but consider we got a bunch of stuff for free at the end of the day, it evened out really nicely.  Really friendly employees.  It could be a bit out of the way from the main part of SF, but if you're towards the west side of the Golden Gate Park, stop by for some great treats!
author: Steve L.

description:
Devil's Teeth is a small bakery & cafe on Noriega & 45th Ave. With just half a dozen counter seats inside (& a few benches outside), it draws a crowd much bigger than the space can accommodate. 

I arrived bright & early Sunday morning (9 am is bright & early) & lined up amongst still-sleepy Sunset denizens. 

Devil's Teeth does a wonderful quick, portable breakfast. My breakfast sandwich ($5)--fluffy scrambled eggs, thick-cut crispy bacon, cheese & the avocado I had added ($.75) all barely contained in the buttery, flakey biscuit. So seemingly simple, but I could never get a breakfast sandwich to be that decadent & delicious on my own. Everything was on point. 

The cinnamon bun ($4) is humongous. Sans frosting, the caramelized gooey stickiness negates any need for frosting. Dense, but soft bread. Extremely rich & chewy-- felt like it could seriously knock out some dental work! 

I sampled their lemon bar at the counter--more sweet than tart--I loved it. 

Devil's Teeth gives me a reason to venture deep into the Sunset.
author: Fancypants X.

description:
I wish they had a lawn in front of their store.  

Their food is the kind of food that makes you enjoy every bite.  The kind of food that makes you want to lie under the sun and chillax.  The kind of food that will make you smile no matter how you're feeling.

I've only been here on Sunday's and let me tell you, it gets busy.  Although there seems to always be a line, it moves quick.  Prepare to wait maybe 20-30 minutes- perfectly resonable for good food!

Get the breakfast sandwich.  The first time I had it, I split half with ym bf.  If I had known it was going to be that good, I would've gotten my own.  Yeah, it's the kind of that makes you not want to share.

The beignets were ok.  It could've been sweeter, and it was a little to greasy for me.

The sticky bun is HUGE.  Its like a block of cinnamony goodness.  

I haven't tried everything yet, hence the 4 stars.  But food and service are spot on so far.
author: Linda N.

description: I brought friends here last week since I haven't been in a while.  Short wait on a Friday morning, great service & still super delicious!  Get the breakfast special sandwich and cinnamon roll!!
author: G W.

description: This place is fantastic because they do an excellent job at both sweet and savory, and you have options for small bites and filling things. The lines can be rough, especially on the weekends, but it's worth it!
author: Nathan S.

description: I'm not a lover of breakfast (I know, I know) but this is the best breakfast sandwich I've ever had in my life - I got the special which was eggs, bacon, lemon aioli, avocado and pepper jack cheese on a biscuit, it was out of this world! Coffee was also pretty delicious - and we got a shark cookie for our son who devoured it in 2 minutes flat. We went at prime brunch time - 11am on a Saturday - and we waited 10 minutes for our food, if that. Plus that ocean view, I tell ya...
author: Megan V.

description:
I really loved this place when it first opened. I would walk by with my dogs and wonder what is this place going to be? Devils teeth didn't make me think of baked goods, now it does. The staff is awesome happy and helpful. The baked goods are well delicious, it would have been 5 stars except for the fact that the last few times I've noticed a decline in quality. Biscuits, dry and not as flakey as they once were. Not just one time but probably the last 4x so I've stopped ordering the breakfast sandwiches. Sticky morning buns are still amazing. A friend recently walked over while visiting and brought back the breakfast muffin, cheese, bacon and shallots. What could go wrong? Well there was no seasoning. The bacon looked as if someone ripped the pieces up so some pieces were crumb sized
While others where huge! I can't complain about bacon! But I just did. Please devils teeth go back to strict quality control.
I need those biscuits in my life again.
author: Nena L.

description:
Food: 
1) Breakfast sandwich: The chunk of scrambled egg in this sandwich was thicker than the putting two English Muffins together! The cheese and bacon accompanied the egg perfectly! The English Muffin was really soft and nicely toasted! I really liked the sandwich!  
2) Cinnamon roll: Really sweet, ooozing with the delicious aroma of butter and sugar! It probably made me again 2 lbs just looking at it and another 5lbs eating it but it was sooo worth it! 

Ambiance: 
Really small cafe! Just taking one step into the door and you are pretty much at the counter to order. There is outdoor seating on these wooden crate-like benches and indoor seating along the wall. The decor really reminded me of the coast or a beach. There is a shelf of books you can buy for $5 each! There are some good, cheap books there!

Service: 
Order at the front and grab a seat/water/utensils on your own. 

Price: 
Breakfast sandwich was ~$5 and the Cinnamon roll was  ~$4. Pretty cheap for a good FULL meal!

Overall:
I would LOVE to come back and try their lemon bars and other bakery items! Looked so delicious!
author: Amiee H.

description: Breakfast at Devil's Teeth was well worth the trek. The secret is out and the line is long, but on a sunny morning this bakery is a great spot to sit and people watch. I strongly recommend visiting on a Sunday AM for beignets.
author: Lars A.

description: I love this little area on Noriega in the Outer Sunset. Devi's Teeth is a great drop-by for coffee and a pastry any time of the day. There's a nice outdoor seating area that is very nice on a sunny day. We came in for a quick grab-n-go breakfast before a day trip to Napa. Coffee, tea, bacon and scallion muffin, and kale and cheddar scone. The muffin was awesome. It was light and crumbly, what it lacked in grease, it made up for in flavor. What more could you ask? The kale scone was a little lackluster. The muffin was definitely better.
author: Sherry L.

description: Get the cinnamon roll. Take it home and microwave it for 1 minute. Eat it with a spoon. That's what 5 stars taste like. Honorable mention to the breakfast biscuit sandwich and friendly staff.
author: Tom D.

description: Great place to get a breakfast sandwich if you don't mind waiting 30 minutes for said sandwich while standing crammed into a tiny space with a hoard of people who are jostling against and pushing past you.
author: Jana B.

description: Came in on a Sunday afternoon and the wait was around 20-40 minutes for the original biscuit. I must say the sandwiches ended up being bigger then I anticipated. Def worth trying once! The biscuit to egg to bacon ratio was a bit off for me but regardless was delicious!
author: Jen A.

description: Best breakfast sandwich I've ever had. Staff is really wonderful and hard working too. Plenty of seating, although it's mostly benches out front so bring along a jacket to shield you from any cold ocean air. We came around 11am on Sunday and waited for almost an hour, so we'll try to come by during an off hour or a less busy day. Still, can't beat the food if you've got a little time to kill.
author: Riley B.

description:
After my initial 2-star review, the owner contacted me to apologize. I appreciated this gesture and decided it was only right to give them another chance.

I went back on a Sunday morning at 8:45am and there was already a line. The owner's sister, who was manning the cash register, thanked everyone for waiting and that we would be served soon. I ordered the coffee cake and cinnamon bun, both of which were excellent. There was also no wait since they were already made, which makes a big difference. The woman who took my order was friendly, as was the owner's sister. 

All in all, I've changed my review from 2 stars to 4 stars. It was a huge difference from when I came a few weeks ago.
author: Allan L.

description:
I went over there today to pick up a few Cinnamon Buns that I am addicted to. They are so large I can only eat half.  The second half revives nicely the next day by putting it in the microwave for 25 seconds. 
Today they had lemon, blueberry scones. I have not had one before. I bought one on impulse and it was one of the best tasting "things" ever.  I ate the whole thing, couldn't stop till it was all gone. 
Friendly service. I am a senior but most of the customers appear to be mellinials. I avoid going  there on weekends as the line is usually out the door.
author: Joan C.

description:
Really stumbled across this place.  I came to the city the past two weekends to go crabbing with my boyfriend.  Last Sunday I really needed to use the restroom and had to yelp some type of coffee place that was open around that time.  (It was around 6:50AM).  This location popped up and I figured with the walk I'd be here around opening.  Then as I was walking here I decided to read up on some of their items and got excited on some of the recommendations I read.  I ended up ordering a Special Breakfast sandwich, a lemon bar, 4 beignets, a cafe au lait, and a hot cocoa.  The drinks didn't stand out but the food did.  beignets and sandwich were made to order.  Beignets weren't cafe du monde quality but it was good stuff.  Apparently only on Sundays and $1 a pop.  I opt for the Special Breakfast sandwich (regular was around $5.50 and Special around $6.75?  Something along those lines).  The special was the way to go.  That garlic aioli and avocado, yum.  Bacon was perfect.  The biscuit was ok...my only other memory of biscuit sandwiches were from Pine State Biscuits in Portland and that place blows everything outta the water so it was an unfair comparison.  Lemon bar was tasty.

We came back to go crabbing this past Sunday again.  This time we did not arrive until 9AM and there was a hefty line.  And since most things are made to order it took a good 30 mins from ordering to getting my sandwich.  Once again got the special breakfast sandwich, lemon bar, two beer bacon cheddar muffins, veggie quiche for my friend, two coffees, a latte and a chai latte.  I didn't care for the chai latte.  My friend said the quiche was tasty.  The breakfast sandwich was still as good as ever.  Opt out of the beignets which I later regretted.  I ate the muffins later in the day (around 5PM) and they tasted good.  I can only imagine how great it would be fresh.  You can taste the beer, I'd imagine this would be bomb with chili.

Since I needed to use the restroom again I returned solo around 3PM.  No lines this time.  They close at 4PM so most of their items were sold out.  No more beignets, no more biscuits so whomeever came for a breakfast sandwich had to get it with sourdough bread, no more coffee cake or carrot cake.  They had plenty of lemon bars and beer muffins.  I instead opt to try to chicken curry salad for lunch.  It was tasty.  But felt they had too much almonds so wasn't my favorite.  

This place is definitely going on my list of places to return if I'm ever in the area.  Great spot.
author: Kim D.

description:
WHO DOESN'T LOVE THIS PLACE?!

A weekend breakfast/brunch staple and everybody knows it. (= Be prepared to queue.) 

But(!) you won't even mind the wait because when they scream out your name and you receive that buttery and warm biscuit-breakfast sandwich--filled with fluffy scrambled eggs, cheese and lard fried bacon--for a brief moment, your life feels complete. 

On top of having the best biscuits in the West, the service is awesome. On top of THAT their cinnamon rolls are super decadent. And on top of THAT their sourdough bread is like a carb-hug. 

If you're into iced coffee, but not burn-your-throat-cardiac-arrest-cold brews, maybe you should stay away. It's not for the faint of heart.
author: L Stephanie L.

description:
Just a little note that you guys should work on making your coffee and lattes stronger. Unfortunately, I had to dock off one star because the coffee isn't very good here. Baked goodies are your strength, coffee not so much. I got a single cup drip coffee yesterday morning, and it tasted so weak and watered-down. It also took at least 5 minutes to wait, and I understand since it's a busy Sunday morning. But I could make a stronger cuppa Joe in 3 minutes with a bolder taste and not watered-down. My sister ordered the latte the last time she came here, and she was very unimpressed with the taste of the latte. In her words, "I've had much better." I'm going to have a tough time convincing her to give your coffee another shot!

On the bright side, your lemon bars are A-MAZING, so two thumbs up for those!
author: Joanne K.

description: This place is legit! Believe the hype and get in here for the breakfast sandwiches! Make sure to get here early or you will be standing in line down the block!
author: Mark S.

description:
A friend had told me about Devil's Teeth - she said it was a great bakery and cafe, and I hadn't had the opportunity to try them until I was tasked with getting the boss a birthday cake.

Two words for this review: MIND. BLOWN.

Cute little place on Noriega in the outer sunset, just sitting there as humble as can be, but let me tell you, their cakes are out of this world!

I emailed in my order of a 2 layer half sheet cake - chocolate with buttercream frosting and raspberry filling and picked it up on my way in to work (thanks to their awesome opening time - 7am).

My co-workers and I were all very exited to try the cake, and we waited all day for my boss to get out of his meetings. 4PM rolled around and we broke out the cake, sang happy birthday, and I began slicing that caloric masterpiece!

EVERYONE wanted seconds. Most chocolate cakes are chocolate flavored, but this was a *real* chocolate cake. It was so rich and decadent... so moist it was almost falling apart as I doled out slice after slice...

The people were amazing to me, offering to help carry the behemoth cake out to my car, packing the cake carefully, ordering was easy, and the end result was a tin foil wrapped piece of cardboard with every last bit of frosting and cake scraped off of it.

If you need a cake for ANY occasion, these people know what they're doing, and I'd expect it's reflected in the cafe front as well! 

Definite MUST TRY! Will be going back here time and time again!
author: Rebecca B.

description:
With all due respect to Blue Bottle and Sightglass, there's just something special about a freshly French Pressed cup of Bicycle Coffee and Devil's Teeth Breakfast sandwich
. . . or their beignets
. . . or their cinnamon rolls
. . . or their muffins
. . . and how can I not mention the blondies?

You know what?
Just go there and taste for yourself.
author: Dan B.

description: A yummy place but I felt a bit taken advantage of at my last visit. I I purchased 6 biscuits to go which usually run $1.50 as per their board which is not updated.  Instead of the usual $9.90 or change, I was charged $13.90 and told that was just the way it was . It was told to me that the price 'at the register' were $2.  While I love the biscuits and think $1.50 a fair price (what was advertised), the change without it marked made me feel like I was doing something wrong by asking about the price, as I wouldn't have purchased as many otherwise. Please either update the price list or the register.  It made for a soured experience, though the food is good.
author: Miriam P.

description:
Amazing food. Amazing humans. And a great asset to the Outer Sunset. 

I make it a point to visit Devils Teeth anytime I am in the City. Their Special Breakfast sandwich is worth the commute out. And their muffins and scones are to die for. If you come for lunch, either lasagna is very tasty, and I'm sure their other items are just as well.
Don't let the line deter you. They run smoothly and will get you your fix in no time.
And if you're not in a rush, hang in the parklet right outside and listen to the waves as you nom down some great grub.
author: Dalton V.

description: If you want to wait 25mins for a breakfast sandwich, this is the place for you. You'll extra enjoy it if you like rude employees. The food's good though, and the chick that double cracks eggs single handedly is pretty epic. One star for food, one star for her.
author: Jennifer A.

description: Got the regular breakfast sandwich instead of the specialty breakfast sandwich on accident.  We were wondering where the lemon garlic aoli sauce was in the sandwich while we were eating it.  The sandwich was still surprising really good.  The biscuit is what makes the sandwich and the bacon js nice and thick.  You definitely need to add hot sauce or ketchup as there is no sauce in the sandwich.  Can't help but think how good the specialty breakfast sandwich will be next time we come back!  The fresh strawberry in the Strawberry and Banana muffin was delicious.
author: Victoria A.

description:
If you're looking for an EPIC BREAKFAST SANDY, this. is. it.

Oversized fluffy buttermilk biscuits stuffed with cheese, scrambled eggs, bacon, and avocado if you so choose. Which you should, by the way.

Yes, there is a line, but it goes fast and this epic breakfast is certainly worth the wait.

I highly recommend ordering the sandwich with their special aioli and avocado. I tried both this and the plain one and the one with aioli was definitely better.

I also purchased beignets which were piping hot and covered my jeans in powder sugar snow. While good, I can never quite find any to measure up with Cafe du Monde's.

Furthermore, come for the biscuit breakfast sandwich WITH aioli and 'cado, prepare to wait, and then have your mind blown by the delicious simplicity of it.
author: Rachel L.

description:
I hate to be the Debbie Downer here, but the staff makes me take this place down to a three.  They were loud and laughing with each other and not really into waiting on the customers. It was very oft-putting.  And they didn't even bother to announce my food was ready, and after waiting a long time, I finally asked, is the lasagna ready????   and someone waved her hand over to a box that had been sitting there awhile, oh I think that's it.

Weird, right?  It sure seemed like a fun place to get paid to goof off with other employees!

I did enjoy the $6.75 slice of lasagna.  And the BLT was good too.  Chocolate cake was okay.

I wouldn't bother going out of my way to eat here again, the food wasn't that great or much variety offered.

It was a super hot day today in San Francisco and we walked along beautiful Ocean Beach prior to stopping by here,   The  Muni 71 is right across street.
author: Foodlover B.

description: Best yummy breakfast coffee sweeties on the west side. The best oatmeal cookie we've ever tasted and I'm not big on oatmeal treats of any kind! Breakfast sandwiches a must, especially after surfing the cold waves! Kind servers, no pretentiousness.
author: Sasha B.

description:
After someone bringing over one of their cinnamon rolls( which I thought was really awesome) I finally figured these guys out. If you catch them in the pocket they are awesome but if you get things that are left over or old....it aint so hot. 

I guess my point is to go when they are making fresh stuff so you will get their awesome products
author: David G.

description:
We got this tremendous recommendation for Devils Teeth Baking Co.  So we went and I thought the food and ambiance location etc was really a 4 star.  OK food, friendly enough staff, OK prices, prompt enough service.  Very crowded when we were there.  Can't really figure why this place is so very popular. It was fine, but not super 5 star fine.  Just fine.

 I had to deduct a star for 3 reasons. 

 First they have a very strange procedure when you get your food. The food order taker and the cashier have NO communication.  You HAVE to remember what you ordered so the cashier can charge you the right price.  I forgot what my date ordered so I took a guess and the cashier had to look up my order to charge me. So, in other words, either order something expensive if you are dishonest and announce a cheaper purchase to the cashier, OR memorize exactly what your date ordered or else you look like a fool.  

The second, and bigger reason for me removing a star, is the staff have no idea what is in their food.  I suspect they cook with hydrogenated oil and/or hydrogenated oil is in their pre-ordered breads and muffins.  Note that hydrogenated oil makes processed food taste habit formingly heavenly, but kills Americans (but not Europeans, Canadians or Japanese because it is a banned substance in these more advanced countries, look it up in the internet).  If they knew whether this substance was in their list of ingredients, I would be tempted to give them more stars.

Finally, since the place is crowded and the music is very loud, the server either needs to shout really really loud when they call your name, or turn down the music. They can save a lot of time and aggravation.
author: alfredo n.

description:
Came on beignet Sunday and ordered the breakfast sandwich special and 3 beignets. The sandwich just came out of the oven, wrapped in foil. Now, heat and foil didn't register in my mind so I just grabbed the sandwich and immediately had to drop it on the counter. 

After recovering such a feat, there's an outdoor seating area and a bench in front of the shop to enjoy and devour their powdered beignets and breakfast special. Will definitely come back
author: Jessica Z.

description:
I'm seriously in love with Devil's Teeth.  No really, I am.

DONUT MUFFINS!!!  Are you kidding me?  Holy.  I never make a trip here without getting at least one.  I bring em home for my family and they love them too.  The muffin is like eating a cake donut, always soft and moist.  They're rolled in cinnamon sugar, which also reminds me of churros!  I love churros.  If you haven't been to Devil's Teeth yet, you need to get going, NOW.  If nothing else on the menu entices you, just get a donut muffin.  Get two.  Get three.

The cinnamon rolls are also to die for.  They're buttery, gooey, sticky, sweet.  The rolls fill up the entire box they come in.  I can't eat one of these by myself.  My family and I shared one roll.  I ate my 1/4 of it in pieces, it just tasted better that way.

Lemon bars are also amazing..and they're bigger than your hand.  

Another reason to try Devil's Teeth?  THE BANANA CREAM PIE CREAM PUFFS!  Okay I know not a lot of people like banana cream pie, but I do.  So seeing them in a cream puff blew my mind.  When I saw these I knew I had to get one for my dad to try since he loves banana cream pie, too.  I had a few failed attempts at picking some up though, they sell out quick!  When I was finally able to get them I was so happy.  My dad isn't big on sweets but he ate the whole puff!  They don't skimp on filling either!  The creamy custard filling is sweet, but not too sweet, lots of bananas, too!  The cream puff its self was nice and fluffy, not dense at all.  I hate dense cream puffs.

AND TRY THE BREAKFAST SANDWICH.  I had no idea what I was in for when I ordered this monstrosity of a sandwich, seriously..its the size of a soft ball.  I saw other people sitting outside eating it so I figured it HAD to be good.  And oh is it good.  The sandwich comes on a hot, fresh biscuit with thick slices of bacon, cheddar cheese, and scrambled eggs.  I love anything with cheese and bacon to be honest.  The biscuit was SO goooood....sweet and buttery, crumbly but not TOO crumbly.  

I've yet to make it for beignet Sunday.  I tried once but they were all sold out.

Devil's Teeth is truly a gem for the outer sunset.  The staff is extremely warm and friendly.  If you come by towards the end of the day they cut up whatever cookies or brownies that won't be sold to put out as samples!  I also love how pet friendly they are!
author: Steph D.

description: Passed by here one time got curious bcz I saw a long line outside and got curious. We bought the breakfast sandwich.... SO GOOD! The biscuit is buttery and flaky! Then we got the carrot cake which is SO HEAVENLY it melts in the mouth! We also tried the Blueberry scone.... OMG to die for!!!! I went back again, bought more carrot cake for a friend and aunt, blueberry scones, strawberry banana muffin and donuts!!! I will DEFINITELY BUY again here!!!
author: Jessica F.

description: 3 words... Special Breakfast Sandwich! The hype on these bad boys is legit deserved. So fricken delicious. The cinnamon roll is also bomb AF!
author: John V.

description: Absolutely amazing & delicious!!  I came here yesterday with my grandparents and bf, and we were blown away with their lemon bars & cinnamon rolls.  Best I've ever had!  This bakery has fair prices for huge portions, you will definitely not go hungry.  Cute atmosphere as well.
author: Kristi S.

description: Their Special Breakfast Sandwich is bomb! Their garlic aioli had me dying of satisfaction. I can easily say this is one of the best sandwich i've ever had and i will for sure be back whenever im in town. Service is good,no complaints there. I also like the fact that they have an open kitchen so you can see exactly what they're doing with your food.
author: Reeya R.

description:
I'm not super into baked goods, but if i was I would come here for them.
That being said, they have the best drive thru turkey lasagna ive ever had. You definitely cant tell your eating turkey. Its just a big fucking box of lasagna goodness. Eat that shit.
author: N O.

description: Best $6.75 (super) breakfast sandwich to be had in SF! You get a large fluffy biscuit with eggs, bacon, avocado and cheese nestled in the middle, wrapped up in foil. If you weren't super hungry, you could easily share one between two people, and pick up one of their tempting baked items to round things out. Staff are also really friendly and chill. You can eat at the little bar seating they have, or outside at the parklet. Or just bring it to the beach, only a few blocks away! Not a lot of bike parking, but there are one or two posts near it.
author: Linus W.

description:
The ginger cookie is my current favorite. Soft, gingery goodness.

Note to Self, after trying ginger cookies at other places, only get these at DTBC.

PS: They have free samples at the register. Try those first, it might help with your selection.
author: Cathy K.

description:
This place is a really cute place and it is always jammed pack. I have been here around four times? Twice I have ordered something and the other two times, it was because my friends really wanted to see what it was like. I really like how there is outdoor seating. However, it is still super packed in AND out. And super busy. With so many people filling orders, kudos to them for being able to match the pace. 

- Iced Chai - super, super yummy. It has a really nice kick to it so for people who really hate ginger or any form of spicy, this isn't for you. I really like how the flavors are all there and it's a well rounded drink. Have ordered it twice and have not regretted it. 

- Cinnamon Roll - This...is a monster of a cinnamon roll. It is about the side of an average coaster (for cups). I don't think I could close the lid on my container because it was so big. It was really good and it could definitely be shared with friends. However, since I was so greedy I ate the whole thing and after the...fifth? bite it was too sweet for me. Almost cloyingly so. For my palate, I usually like things less sweet. 

BEIGNET - I had one...so...beignet. It was good. I really liked how I had to shake the powdered sugar in the paper bag to get it covered. It wasn't...amazing. But it was good. It had the right sweetness. Texture was good. However, I noticed for one of my friends because she got six of them, she had to double bag (which costs an extra 10 cents). So in terms of being able to travel with a lot of them or saving them for later...probably not a good idea. 

--

-1 star = overly sweet cinnamon roll + pastry containers. And lack of good seating. 

Overall, love this place! Can't wait to try more of their pastries :)
author: Karen Y.

description:
Beignets on sunday for a dollar? I'm in. 

We also tried the cinnamon bun - i think it's good, but by the we got to the end up of it (we ate it from the inside out) it was just way too sweet. and really hard to eat. It kept on getting stuck in my teeth. The donut muffin was delicious though. Definitely a must get there.

Got coffee. Boy ordered the single drip instead of the french press (got a lesson on the differences on how they taste..) For the non coffee lovers,  the chai latte is pretty good.

Also breakfast sandwiches are delicious.
author: Nina Y.

description: Great pastries and good hot cocoa. My friend ordered a birthday cake there and it was delicious. Long lines but worth it :)
author: Lidia M.

description:
Oh my goodness! 

I have NEVER given a five star rating to any place, and finally I ate somewhere worthy of it! 

Thai iced tea, lemon bar, bengiets, and special breakfast sandwich were dynamite! I wish I lived in the area so I could eat here all the time! 

Worth the wait, and th prices are fair for the quality of delicious food! :)))
author: Mary J.

description:
Okay.. this is a must review!!!! 

A few months ago, I was volunteering for the local community organization to hand out flyers on propositions. I stopped by Devil's Teeth and got some lemonade, but there was a huge line.  Since I was short on time, I was unable to do research on what to eat.

Thankfully, my wife looked into it and we came back with my sister in law.
