THIS PLACE IS PACKED!!!! and there is a good reason for it!

-Friendly service! Oh yeah.
-Great food. $1 beignets(sp?) on Sunday. Also I had the special breakfast sandwich.
-Great service... but since it is busy, a few minutes wait should be expected.
-Price is good. $5 for a breakfast sandwich... but it is filling.

Busy, so seating can be tough. Luckily there are benches outside, but people like to hang out while they eat and maybe chat too much!
author: Roger A.

description:
Here's an update on my neighborhood bakery:   Devil's Teeth still has delicious choices that never disappoint.  Their staff is always friendly, courteous, and have warm smiles.  My complaint is the lengthy time to get breakfast and go.  This morning I ordered two breakfast sandwiches and 35 minutes later I was still waiting.  I was forced to drive my 8th grader across the park to school, WITHOUT our sandwiches in order for him not to be late.  Thanks to 7-11 on the way, my kid was able to get something to eat before school; of coarse, it was lower quality than Devil's Teeth.  
Several minutes later, after dropping my son at school, I came back to Devil's Teeth and picked up the sandwiches I ordered an hour earlier.  
So here's a suggestion, if the sandwiches are going to take longer than usual, give us a "heads up" when ordering.  Had I known, I would've pick up something like their yogurt parfait or even a pastry for my kid.  The cashier did apologize and said they "had huge orders before [mine]."  So let me know that when ordering.  I'll make a different choice, appreciate the warning, and keep coming back as a happy customer.  
Actually, I'll still keep coming--just never again in the morning!  Understand that this is not a matter of not giving myself enough time--which I did!  It was just inordinately long to have to wait 35 min for two breakfast sandwiches.  But their great tasting food and cheerful attitude will bring me back.
If you want to avoid crowds, don't come at peak hours because their clientele has been steadily growing.  Sorry Devil's Teeth but I'm taking away a star temporarily.
author: Angie A.

description: I enjoyed my breakfast sandwich and iced chai tea, but was it mind blowing and something I NEED to have again if I'm back in the area? Probably not. I do understand why others like it so much, and yes, the quality is better than other places, but the wait is too long for my liking. For offering such a small variety of options, I would think that it would be easy to produce biscuits, scrambled eggs, cheese and bacon quicker.
author: Monica V.

description:
Its a bit of a trek to get here but it is so worth it!  BLTs, curry chicken salad, brownies, blondies, assorted muffins, etc...its all here!  My latest favorite is the bacon, beer, cheddar and green onion muffin. Yum!  Great density, moist and full of great flavor.

But today was all about a special order.  A beautiful, delicious birthday cake that was a hit with everyone at work especially the birthday girl!  Definitely will have to get more cakes from here.  So glad Devil's Teeth is around.  But also very glad its not too close to me because this is another place I would probably be at everyday and quite a few pounds heavier!
author: J. P.

description:
Special Breakfast Sandwich, friendly people, decent coffee, amazing baked goods, relaxed atmosphere...pretty much sums it up.

The space has limited seating, but outside is a public parklett where you can relax and soak up the fresh ocean air while munching on a fresh baked lemon bar.
author: Nathan E.

description: Decent coffee, friendly workers, and good (but very sweet) pastries. Lots of sidewalk chalk outside for me to play with. I mean kids. I mean chalk for the kids to play with, not kids for me to play with. You know... whatever.
author: Andy O.

description: My bf and I came early right when they opened and was second in line! We tried their breakfast biscuit sandwich (sooo good we got three), a cinnamon roll, bacon cheddar beer muffin, donut muffin, and a kale Parmesan scone. Everything was fresh and delicious. My favorite was the kale scone and the donut muffin. I thought the cinnamon roll was WAYYYY too sweet and rather on the hard/dry side. Nonetheless we will be back for those breakfast Sammies
author: Linz C.

description: Neighborhood staple. Special breakfast sandwich and the carrot cake are my go to items.
author: Sophia N.

description: Yes. This place is a Yes place. Yes I'd drop by whenever I need a cup of morning coffee in Outer Sunset. Yes I'd love to wait in line to get a piece of Beignet on Sunday mornings. And oh yes, whenever I don't want to prep my breakfast, I'd be willing to walk a few blocks to get their The Special Breakfast Sandwich. Yes I will go back as many times as I live in Outer Sunset.
author: Nathan C.

description:
I've been here twice and after two really great experiences, I'm officially declaring that I will be back!

The first time, my sweet tooth wasn't awake, so I opted for some soup. It was good, but nothing earth shattering. However, today, the Manpanion and I dropped by after an early morning rendezvous at the Japanese Tea Gardens (gotta love free admission, gotta hate that you have to be there around 9-ish to take advantage).

We ordered the special breakfast sandwich (for him), ham and bacon quiche (for me), and a cinnamon roll (for us). Oh my, where to begin... His breakfast sandwich was delicious. Since it was the day's special, it consisted of bacon, eggs, pepper jack cheese, and avocado that was lovingly embraced by a buttery biscuit. The Manpanion has a healthy appetite and isn't much of a breakfast person. However, if he says he loved this sandwich, this should give you an idea of how hearty  and satisfying it was.

I had the ham and bacon quiche and it was pretty hefty too. Granted, it wasn't as big as the breakfast sandwich. However, it was really meaty - I'm talkin' chunks of bacon and ham. It wasn't too eggy or dry. The meat, eggs, and veggies were all nicely balanced. Also, it wasn't over-doughed! It's a total winner in my book!

Finally, we split a cinnamon roll. I'm not usually big on these things, but since the reviews claim that this is all the rage, I figured it wouldn't hurt to try. HOLY JEEBUS! This roll is unlike any other roll I've had. When I think cinnamon roll, I'm thinking overly sweet frosting on top of dried cinnamon bread. This is definitely NOT the case here. The roll was soft and buttery (you must get this heated up) and the glaze was absolutely perfect! It wasn't overwhelmingly sweet and it simply melts in your mouth. I'm fantasizing about my next trip already.

Oh yes. You have a couple of fans here and we'll definitely be back!
author: Joanne R.

description:
(See pics) Updated review. OMG I finally came back and what did I miss all this time? Beignets Sunday!!! They were so wonderful as I popped the fresh HOTTT fluffy pockets in my mouth! And I ate 3 all at once.

They also switched to Bicycle coffee which was quite flavorful as the taste was more of earthy tone. I love local roasters where they generally use smaller beans and a lighter roast. The aromatic flavor bursts in your mouth as you savor each drop, and you close your eyes and let the coffee flow to all your senses. Also love their Cafe au lait.

Oh and of course the banana cream puff, beer muffin that is made with cheddar, bacon, beer and green onion were both delicious.

My friend who introduced me to this bakery found out I didn't try the cinnamon bun and was nice enough to go out there and got me the gigantic delicious rock candy style sweetness! It was even better when you re-heat it in the oven or microwave, creating the sugar edges swirls.

Love the parklet where everyone can enjoy the treats with their dogs and not having to leave their loved ones outside lonely.
author: T L.

description:
- food: simple, very good biscuit breakfast sandwitch and beignets 
- atmosphere: limited seating but a spacious parklet out front
- staff: remained calm is spite of being super busy
- price: expected, especially for a popular place

additional info:
- they had a long line on a sunny, Sunday morning
author: J. B.

description: We love Devil's Teeth. My bf and I make it a point to stop here and pick up treats. The cinnamon rolls are awesome. The beignets are really good, and the oatmeal cookies. Basically everything is really good.
author: Amber F.

description:
Who knew that the outer sunset was the place to be????

We heard of their awesome breakfast sammies in 7x7 and it did NOT disappoint. So delish. I got mine without bacon and added tomatoes...yummo!!! The eggs were so fluffy and warm- they will warm you up on any day when the fog is too much to handle. Blue bottle coffee just made everything that much better. Strong and super flavorful. 

The desserts were just looking beyond amazing but we were too full. Till next time. I will have to come back for $1 Beniets!! 

Oh and free organic dog biscuits for your four legged friends??? My little guy just ate em right up!!! 

Great great neighborhood find.
author: Michelle I.

description: Fire fire fire. Translation hella good. I'm giving my biscuit sando a 10 out of 10. I almost went back and bought another one.
author: Jason f.

description:
I LOVE YOU DEVILS TEETH!!!!!!!!!!!!!

The line? Always moves fast, not a big deal

The breakfast sandwich? Best on the planet ... No joke, not exaggerating ... They have found a way to perfect it!

The other baked goods? Incredible!  I saw another Yelper state the cinnamon roll was a lil too sweet and gave 4 stars, srsly gurl? What did you *think* the cinnamon roll was going to be? 

The coffee? It's good too! My fav is their regular drip, and I love Americanos, and before you ask yes, I've had Trouble and Andytown ... but with the breakfast sandwich, a peanut butter chocolate chip cookie, and a regular cup o coffee (with brown sugar and cream) my morning is at level AMAZING 

Oh and since it's in the Outer Noriega Microhood, take that bomb sh*t to the beach! Seawall seating is a few blocks away
author: Ali S.

description: I love their breakfast sandwiches, cookies and I'm addicted to their beer, cheese, bacon thing. My dog loves their treats. I wish they sold them! I'm not a fan of their line; there's usually a line to order at the counter, then no real spot to wait for your order. It's very crowded with young families and their dogs. The couple of head of me came in from Santa Cruz to check it out, so tourists, too.
author: Susan B.

description:
I can only speak to the breakfasts sandwiches and the beignets. Over-hyped! 

Sandwiches: we tried both versions. The plain one without the aioli/avocado was smaller, but for both, the eggs were overcooked, the baking powder taste came through in the biscuits, and dry! For the amount of time you wait amongst the parents who think they own the sidewalk and let their kids run around, it's better just to make this at home or head somewhere else altogether.

Beignets: you can't beat the price, as they're only a dollar a piece on Sunday! Unfortunately, they are terrible. They're greasy, dense and greasy. I took one bite and they had to go in the trash. 

Service: they are really nice people. Despite the crowds, they're organized and patient. 

The other pastries: they all have a homemade feel. I'm sure they're super tasty. . .But I love going out to places that elevate the homemadey-ness because otherwise, I would just make it at home.
author: K. S.

description:
Whoa! Can't believe there's a bakery this good in my neck of the woods. 

The currant scone ($3.25) blew me away. And mind you, I don't even like scones. I guess I can't say that anymore.

Made to order beignets ($1 ea., Sundays only) are great as well. Then of course there's the breakfast sandwich ($5). Man the bacon that's in it is fantastic. It's sandwiched between two biscuits, a slice of cheese and scrambled eggs. I just wish there was more cheese in it.

The staff is super friendly and the place is down to earth. Bar top seating. There's a seating area out front as well. Prices are on point. 

Just go early because they do run out of stuff.
I'm coming back next Sunday!
author: Andy W.

description:
YUM!!!! 

I went here on beignet Sunday and of course ordered two, piping hot delicious treats! I also had the Breakfast Sandwhich and it was so good!

There are a variety of exotic breakfast treats to try too- muffins with bacon and beer, and pies and cookies. I'm really VERY impressed with this Bakery and plan on visiting again on my next trip to SF!
author: Gracie L.

description: Pretty dang good cinnamon rolls. Reasonably priced all around. I suppose the wait was expected given how good they are.
author: Kevin S.

description:
This place is so great. From start to finish- great vibes - and Lil ( apologies for the misspelling)creates such a great vibe. So positive and energetic. Our first time here and will definitely be back.

The Beignets +Breakfasts Sandwiches + Thai tea- so great.
author: Katie L.

description:
I love the Sunset District. Many of my favorite neighborhood eateries reside here.  A pleasant addition to the neighborhood is Devil's Teeth!  I came here with my dear friend Jonathan W. to indulge our sweet ol' teeth on their $1.00 Beignet's during what they call Beignet Sunday.  

Upon walking up to this new spot, I first noticed a chalk-colored sidewalk just outside of the bakery.  There are benches on both sides of the entrance door, and buckets full of jumbo chalk for little kids and big kids alike to enjoy! What a cute little idea!
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/elgE2cUhKotsLoBUdghexQ?select=u6hi_2E4mG3g5g-k20RmVg

Devil's Teeth has such a cute beachy feel to it, with a company-name surfboard mounted on the wall, to the uneven wooden counter tables. I love the laid-back feel.

So Beignets!  Freshly baked Beignets made to order for only a $1.00.  We ordered 4 between the two of us.  They arrived pipping hot in a brown bag, and coated with powdered sugar. Anything covered in powdered sugar is a plus for me!  However, I prefer my Beignets to be lightly sprinkled on the top with sugar, rather than having them completely drowning and overpowered.  There was a tad bit too much powdered sugar complimenting my order, and at times it became hard to enjoy the dough itself.  But none-the less, I very much enjoyed these sugary sweets! And for a buck each, I will definitely be coming back on Sundays! 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/elgE2cUhKotsLoBUdghexQ?select=aJv2mCV-jzADNb4HdaAQxw

I also ordered a Banana Cream Puff and Lemon Bar. The puff itself was very light and airy, as was the cream inside.   I would have liked if the banana was incorporated into the cream or as a custard instead of just being what it was...which was just sliced banana in the middle.  Lemon bar was delish, with subtle hints of lemon, and definitely not over-powering at all.   
http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=_D5iURFvYU2VSoWfkn5TnQ&userid=uMpWu7hSowxC2v25Nv9wbg

A nice little touch, Devils Teeth also offer free doggie treats to their customers! And the really terrible thing about this, is that the doggie treats looked and smelled just as good as all of their other treats! I was so tempted to steal me one of them doggie treats for myself also.  =X 

Lol...*Calm Down Cassie!, There's plenty of sweet treats to go around, no need to dig into the doggie sweets just yet!* 

In the end, 4 Beignets, Banana Cream Puff, and Lemon Bar set us back about 10 bucks. Not bad, not bad at all...I will definitely be back!   Thank you dear Jonathan W. for yet another fun time rotting our already cavity-infested teeth!
author: Cass J.

description:
Great breakfast sammie - with excellent bacon!

Also, cinnamon bun was like candied deliciousness.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Love it.
- Beignets are great. The come out very hot and fresh
- Breakfast special sandwich (eggs, cheese, bacon, avocado) is great.  Biscuit is awesome. Lower calorie options as well.
- Big parklet in front.  Lots of seating even when busy.
- Bring your dog.
- Line out the door on weekends looks bad but moves fast.  10-15 min.
author: Alan B.

description: It hurts me to leave this review, but I am finally so exasperated with the service and there is no way to send an email based off the website, so here it is. The food is good, the location is wonderful and employees are nice. I really like the funky vibe. Great biscuits. However, the crew always looks dazed and confused. I don't usually mind since this is a service job, but am guessing there is no consistent system in place so that people know what they're supposed to be doing and exactly how. For example, my soup is consistently cold, which I've pointed out a few times already, but it never changes. Most places know exactly how long something needs to be heated. Some employees tell you soup comes with bread, some tell you it comes with bread or biscuit, some say no biscuit and no one actually offers either unless you ask. Sometimes your sandwich comes out right away, sometimes it takes 30 minutes. I get that occasionally it's really busy, but 30 minute for a grilled cheese? Ok, that's all I've got to say.
author: Moonbird G.

description: Man they make the best desserts. There is always a line, even super early in the morning but it moves pretty quickly. I think the bake goods are better than the special sandwich but that could definitely be because I don't eat bacon or cheese.
author: Jessica S.

description:
Get the LEMON BAR with a side of donut muffin.
If you have to chose one of them, I would say the lemon bar but if you arent a fan of lemon-y stuff, then get the muffin. Up to you. You will be satisfied either way. 

Oh its deep in the heart of the sunset so if you are going all the way out there, you should go and have brunch at Outerlands. Sounds like a good afternoon. Youre welcome.
author: Cicely T.

description:
After I started running my own cafe, I still try to find time to try out some delicious local eateries that I can share with my friends. This is definitely one of them!

I have come on two separate occasions and tried 3 different items. First I came in and the chocolate cake with peppermint frosting caught my eye. I ate the first bite and it was so moist! The peppermint frosting wasn't too sweet and the cake itself was just right in taste and texture. Not too much chocolate, just enough of everything. If I had to nitpick, I would want the peppermint pieces a little more fine instead of big chunks, but that is being super nitpicky. 

The second time I came in and had to try the donut muffin and the cinnamon roll. The donut muffin is like a donut on the outside with sugar and cinnamon shaped like a muffin and with muffin-like consistency baked inside. DELICIOUS. I wish it was bigger! The cinnamon roll that everyone raves about was good, but surprisingly for me was my least favorite out of all 3! Don't take this the wrong way, it is still really good but I would go back for the cake and donut muffin first!

Will come back at least once a week to satisfy my devil's teeth craving!
author: Wilson T.

description:
Ok this place had pros and cons for me. The cons.... I really got grossed out at the fact that none of the workers are wearing gloves while handling our food. Like everyone is barehanded. Another thing is the free samples are in a dish and anyone can just dig in there and get them. considering this places has a lot of surfers and dog owners I didn't see one person was their hands. Another thing was just like a few of you guys the nice ca hire for got my order. She did offer me a complimentary treat and profusely apologized but it was the principle , ya know.

Now to the good. That garlic alioli sauce the use on the breakfast sandwich is 5 stars. That is some great sauce and I highly recommend trying it.
author: Tareau B.

description:
These folk are one of the bright spots in the Sunset...indeed, in the City. Yes we have places I've "heard amazing/mixed" reviews about that have long long lines and rude service, but why I ask you, would I go there when I know what is good at Devil's teeth.

Let us start with this.
One-Accessibility. I don't care how good you are if I can't actually get parked and inside, you don't exist. Devil's Teeth has decent street parking, at most you may have to walk a block. 

Two- Service...this place has the service of a wonderful mom and pop bakery. Because mom and pop are involved. They are there and they train their people well. Counter staff are helpful, go out of their way to be helpful. 

Three- Charm...who doesn't love a parklet in front and a chalk assortment to color on sidewalk. I don't have a dog but I'm pretty sure I've seen water bowls as well. The tiny inside has a neighborhood indie bakery feel.

Four- Food you might actually bake yourself with it's comforting goodness, but would rather find made for you already so you don't eat a whole batch of anything in one sitting...safer if you ask me.

Favs- Peanut butter chocolate chip. Big luscious chips not overly sweet. Just the perfect amount of saltiness. Never hard...perfect crumb.

Apricot (not sure second word? oatmeal? almond?) Scone. Again the crumb is just right. I've even had one in a bag I forget til two days alter and it was still mighty good despite the age. 

Fresh soups are amazing. Pies are delicious. Chicken Pot pie is decent. And while I haven't had one in a long time, at one time I adored their raspberry bar, not too sweet, good crumb topping and their blondies. Not even sure if they still make the blondie. 

Nearby other great spots, Overland One hair, Noriega Produce etc.

Needs no improvement. not anywhere.
author: Susan F.

description: My new favorite! I love the special breakfast sandwich and the coffee is yummy too. It takes a long time but it's pretty popular and good, so I guess the expectation is that you might have to wait a bit for something good. Love it!
author: Laurel M.

description: This place is baked amaziness!!! I had the special breakfast sandwich, and it is the best I've had in my life! Fresh biscuit bread, thick stack of scrambled eggs, pepper jack, aioli, and smoked bacon! Perfect combination for a great sandwich! I also got the cinnamon roll to save for later (but I couldn't contain myself and ate this delicious piece of sticky heaven on my ride home). Very cute little store front. I love the shark tshirts here too. Lots of outdoor seating or small indoor seating. I will definitely be back!!!
author: Jessica O.

description: Insanely good! Their apple turnovers are out of this world. I only wish they had a flaky buttery gluten-free croissant and I'd be a daily customer.
author: Sohrob T.

description:
Tiny tiny place that knows how to run one hell of a bakery/cafe! Their cinnamon rolls are HUGE!! I mean seriously, they give it to you in a little box that it fills up completely. It's $4, but holy crap, it's DENSE and won't be like any other cinnabuns you've ever eaten.

Another thing: $1 BEIGNET SUNDAYS. omggg I've had original Cafe du Monde beignets in New Orleans, and these get pretty damn close. They make them for you FRESH only when you order them. Hot, fluffy, covered in powdered sugar. Yes.
author: Andrew T.

description:
As every other review has said - cinnamon buns and breakfast sandwiches. I came here for the coffee and left with two delicious items because they just looked/sounded so good. Being a typical fitness crazed San Franciscan, i now feel like a disgusting reference from Louis C.K.'s cinnabon rant. 

It was all worth it though. I splurged for the avocado in my breakfast sandwich (because what is anything without avocado?). If you're craving a heavy, greasy or sugary, heavenly breakfast, look no further. (Plus, the service is super duper friendly - something that always adds a special touch!)
author: Natalie G.

description:
No longer a hidden gem, Devil's Teeth has become out the door popular the past two years.  I tried pretty much everything on the menu and can say this much, these folks can bake.  Sugary, gooey, leave your fingers sticky but your mouth wanting more good.

Breakfast sandwich biscuit, quite possibly one of the best breakfast sandwiches in the Bay.  Made to order these folks don't mess around, soft fluffy biscuit with eggy swine deliciousness inside.  Brownie with powdered sugar, lets just say you eat one you will wish you bought two.  Then we come to my favorite, the lemon bar.  You get a nice hit of sweetness from the powdered sugar with a hit of pucker from the lemon.  Wash all down with a drip coffee and you are in business.  

As sharp as the Devil's Teeth are there are a few shipwrecks along the way.  The breakfast bun I got was rock hard for some reason.  I went through two plastic forks trying to eat the first third and gave up.  I ended up having to throw it away unfortunately.  Beignet Sunday I was a regular for bi-weekly.  However I notice as the popularity has grown, the quality of the product has slightly slipped.  Best way to describe, I ordered three my last trip out.  One was regular size, the second was 2/3 the size and the third literally a third the size.  Imagine layers of a square wedding cake top, middle, and bottom.  So disappointed!!  I really miss Beignet
Sunday and hope the consistency gets fixed 

Overall this place is a must stop for anyone visiting the city, I'll still rate it well because some of the stuff is just addicting.  Easy parking, cool little parklet and ocean just steps away need I say more.
author: Grubnoisseur Y.

description:
Devil's Teeth have an extensive menu filled with goodies but I purposely came here for their desserts.

What I have tried:
+ Chocolate chip cookie - as big as my face! Soft, chewy, buttery, and filled with chocolate chunks. Sounds like the perfect formula for a cookie, no?
+ Raspberry bar: with a crumbly top. Perfect sweetness and tanginess. I can even taste the seeds from the raspberries. I wonder if they use fresh raspberries...
+ Donut muffins - literally mini donuts shaped into muffins dipped in cinnamon sugar. Perfect for on-the-go snacking.

I still want to try their gigantic cinnamon rolls but I didn't see them the last time I was in there. Hm, must check it out again someday soon!
author: Annie S.

description:
This place is so, so good. Saw it when I was in town and based on the reviews I had to try it and it was so worth it. Got a breakfast sandwich (I recommend adding avocado) and a donut muffin (possibly the tastiest thing in the world). There's definitely a line in the mornings, so be prepared to wait a little bit, but they move pretty fast. They'll hand you a playing card after taking your order and call out that (2 of clubs, 9 of hearts, etc) when your order's ready. I didn't get to try the Beignets (which I'm really sad about), but $1 on Sundays? That sounds fantastic!

Love this place, definitely need to try it if you haven't yet!
author: Cassandra F.

description: We live nearby & hadn't really tried this place so took the plunge. There's always a big line & it crops up a lot on "rated" lists. Well, there's not a lot more to say than, like a lot of places in this city, Devil's Teeth is all hype, no substance. The wait on the sandwiches is just unacceptable (especially without any warning) & the wait is simply not worth it. It was just a completely average sandwich on slightly warmed but not toasted bread. We also had two completely average cookies. They really need to sort the mechanics out too - it's just rude to keep people waiting all that time & customers were missing items, receiving their orders at completely random intervals & enquiring about where the hell their sandwiches were the whole 45mins+ we were there. There are lots of places to get sandwiches & baked goods in SF. Believe me, this is not one of the best.
author: Fi M.

description:
Dem beignets dooooe. Sundays theyre a dollar and theyre amazing. I live up the street and I love going here and seeing the foot traffic they bring in. Yea the line gets long on the weekends, but obviously thats because its a dank place and everyone wants to be there. 
When its a nice day, the outdoor seating is perfect and you can enjoy their deliciousness of a breakfast sammich. 
It's small, but I think thats what makes it so great. The people are always friendly, and they have dope pastries, try the donut muffin----you're welcome.
author: Alyssa O.

description:
Bue Bottle Coffee - good.

Donut muffin - good, more like a muffin than a donut.  i was hoping that it'd be more of a donut than a muffin :) 

cinnamon bun - soft and ooey and sweet.  a bit too sweet for me. 

cool vibe and baristas.  definitely a gem in the Sunset.
author: Yayu L.

description:
Such delicious breakfast biscuits and sandwiches
Staff are nice
Cool little hole in the wall spot
Highly recommended!
author: Lou B.

description: All I can say is pretty darn good.  I had the cinnamon roll after I had the coffee cake and donut muffin thinking that this place couldn't get any better, however, the cinnamon roll took me on an adventure of epic proportions, I felt like I was on a cinnamon roller coaster, a cinnacoster if you will.
author: Ricky R.

description:
The office manager at my company lives close to Devil's Teeth so I've been spoiled getting these delivered to me. But this Saturday, I made it to the store.

First impression,SO MANY PEOPLE. They have a nice seating area outside and it was a beautiful day out, so understandably, there was a crowd. Wait wasn't long if you just wanted some pastries or coffee. The wait, however, was particularly long for their special breakfast sandwiches. 20-25 minutes (a third of the crowd was waiting on their hot order.)

So how was it? Cinnamon roll was HUGE and extremely sweet. Good in moderation. Even my boyfriend who has a serious sweet tooth couldn't finish it in one go. In terms of the breakfast sandwich, it was good. Super greasy but good. For both items, I definitely recommend sharing it with someone else
author: Joanna H.

description: yum yum breakfast sandwich. not 5 stars just because i had a brownie and was not chocolaty enough.
author: Natalia E.

description:
This. place. is. amazing.

Everything is delicious!  I am so happy I live near by because I can satisfy my donut muffin addiction.
author: Liza B.

description:
Awesome breakfast sandwich, great pastries, homey atmosphere. But skip the cinnamon roll.  HUH?!?  Read on!

Love the ambiance. Nice casual homespun atmosphere with all menu items written on the chalkboard above the counter.  You can see the bakers and their kitchen right behind the display and cashiers.  Definitely a family-style operation, with their kids watching sometimes too! Their cakes are done with a homemade casual flair. You can see that in the icing.. Cute!!

Of all the items that I've tried so far, I love their $5 breakfast sandwich the absolute best.  Served on a modestly sized tender flakey muffin you will find a big mound of fluffy scrambled eggs, a slice or two of bacon and a bit of cheese.  PERFECT. YUMMY.

Seating isn't plentiful on the inside, unless you add in the benches in the street outside. The benches are a nice touch on a sunny day, but you'd best come prepared for foggy overcast in this part of town!

Unlike most of the reviews here, however, I am not a fan of their trademark cinnamon rolls.  Maybe my expectations were sky-high, but the rolls just seemed far too greasy and slathered in butter for me to like.  Imagine a cinnamon roll with the tender thin-layered flakiness of a croissant, lots of butter and a brown sugar crust.  Sounds great, eh?  Unfortunately, it still tasted to me as if was drowned in a vat of melted butter.  OK.. Did I say BUTTER?? sure, I know croissants are made with lots and lots of butter, but I only got 20% through their roll, and I am usually a fan of the greasy/sugary stuff!  Well, sadly, this roll ain't for me, but enough people seem to like this.  

For my fourth visit, I tried out their $5 Turkey Sausage Lasagna. I took it home to eat for dinner. Delectable.  The portion was quite generous, but not quite enough for two meals.

Come here for everything! Good stuff.  Just skip the cinnamon roll..
author: Harry W.

description: I got the special breakfast sandwich and a cinnamon roll and went down and ate it on the beach. Great way to start the day. The breakfast sandwich takes a little while to get but is worth the wait. The cinnamon roll is good but kinda gave me a stomach ache, its really rich, great to share with a few people.
author: Mike B.

description:
Every since i came back from my North Western food tour i've been dying to fix my biscuit cravings!

I was told by a drunk lady that Devils teeth had the best breakfast sandwich and she was right... at least over here. 

The breakfast sandwich consist of fresh biscuit with egg, cheese, and bacon. Think of it a Mcdonald biscuit, but bigger and with fresher ingredients. The biscuits were huge, i prefer mine a little bit more saltier. They give you a lot of eggs, but two strips of bacon. 
Although i enjoy Mcdonalds breakfast sandwiches, DT was just as enjoyable and probably healthier. 

Aside from their breakfast sandwiches they also offer bakery goods. I recommend try their mini banana creme pie. The banana creme was perfect and nicely portioned, but there chocolate engraved crust was hard and felt like a frozen cookie. Cinnamon rolls were also pretty hardcore. Really really cinnamon-ony. 

Over all this is a great morning place to get a quick bite. Although its really way off the radar imo. at the end of noriega st. Staff is really nice and friendly. The cooks are really cute too. 

I plan to come back. Stay awesome blossom guys. 

I dont know why i just said that...
author: Ryan R.

description:
4/4/2015
The wait time for the food has improved dramatically including weekends at noon.  I'm happy.  Keep up the good work!  4 stars.


=============
It was the first time I tried a beignet and I was not impressed.  It was just okay.  I should really go into these things without any high expectations.

The breakfast sandwich was ok to good.

I had to wait more than 30 minutes before I got my BLT.  The wait is too long.  But the BLT was good. Thick slices of bacon, lovely thick bread, etc.  

On a different day i tried the onion bacon cheese muffin and it was just ok.  a bit dry but thumbs up on the bacon bits.

The cinnamon bun is a Yes!


3.5 - the wait time is what really brings the rating down.
author: Animal K.

description: I would go a thousand miles for a knock out breakfast sandwich on a biscuit.  46th and Noriega feels like a thousand miles, but man, is that mix of crisp bacon, fluffy eggs, melty cheese, aioli and huge chunks of avocado. This doesn't even speak to the seven other goodies I wanted to try.
author: Jeremy G.

description:
My friend and fellow yelper Vikki K. actually brought me a huge cinnamon roll and a cup of blue bottle coffee.

I've been meaning to make my way downtown to try blue bottle but I never got a chance to and when I told Vikki that I wanted to try it, she suggested Devil's teeth baking company. 

Before I got a chance to go out there, we had plans to go to a Giants game early in the afternoon so she grabbed me a pasty and a coffee.

The coffee was really strong and really good. Probably the best coffee I've ever had. She also told me that it was drip coffee, which is known to be stronger than most.

The cinnamon roll was very big and sweet and sticky like it's suppose to be.

Everything was delicious and I can't wait to actually go into the establishment and try their lasagna and other items they have.
author: Tiff C.

description:
The special breakfast sandwich is a MUST here. You can get the regular version, but it doesn't come with avocado and their special aioli sauce. The quiche comes in at a close second. 

Whenever I come here, I can't help but want to order everything in the display case. It all looks so damn good!!

I forget which day of the week it is, but they offer beignets. Not bad, but I'd take their chewy ginger cookie over it any day!!!

TIP: they have a cute parklet outside their shop, but it tends to get crowded on nice days. Also, Sanfranspycho just opened next door!! Double awesome sauce ;)
author: Kristen C.

description: Ordered whole pecan pie via email for $20.  DELICIOUS.  Getting many more over this holiday season!
author: John H.

description: I wake up craving that special breakfast sandwich EVERYDAY. There is honestly nothing like it. The biscuits are so fresh and perfect and the sauce is mouthwatering. There will never be a better breakfast than the special breakfast sandwich.
author: Melyssa L.

description:
For the last five months, I've eaten here about once a week. You may add a side of avocado to anything. Anything! 

Curry chicken salad
Grilled cheese --- YES THE BEST 
Side salad - comes with sliced tomato! :) 
Cranberry scone
Lemon glazed blueberry scone - my fave! 
Banana berry muffin
Donut muffin
Bacon cheese muffin
Chocolate cake
Carrot cake 
Beignet
Biscuit
Breakfast sandwich - with biscuit or sourdough
Bowl of eggs
Dry toast
Side of bacon - super thick cut 
Meat lasagna
Banana pie
Strawberry pie
Peach pie
Lemon bar
Brownie
Cinnamon roll
Ginger cookie - chewy Heaven
Chocolate chip cookie
Peanut butter cookie - kinda dry and crumbly
French onion soup - I think all their soups are made vegan
Au lait - don't ask for a latte bc they only have drip coffee - no espresso
Arnold Palmer
Thai iced tea
Iced coffee
Drip coffee
author: Jacquee P.

description:
Worth a trip.  Most people seem to come for the breakfast sandwich, which is pretty good.  I recommend the regular breakfast sandwich over the special one, which contains aioli, pepper jack cheese, and avocado.  The aioli doesn't work for me.  I prefer the regular version with their own hot sauce.

The ginger cookies are good and worth trying.

The carrot cake is the best I've had in San Francisco.  I order carrot cake everywhere I can, and it's usually cold, dense, and rubbery.  It's quite different at Devil's Teeth.  The frosting isn't too sweet.  I don't recall there being nuts or raisins in their version, and that's too bad.  I also like a little more spice in my carrot cake.  It's still good though.

The cinnamon buns are popular too.

As another reviewer noted, the checkout process is a little slow.  Perhaps it would be more efficient if the associate who takes your order also rings you up.  Also, their point-of-sale system seems to be overly detailed and time consuming.
author: Lucullus L.

description:
This place is amazingly dangerous. I go here far too frequently to get their special sandwich with a tomato substitution. Everything they bake is just incredible from their butter and mouth watering lemon bars. Everything they touch is magic and tastes like fairies danced on it. 

If I ever die of a heart attack, I will happily know that part of that was from the amazing choices I made in eating these delicious foods. 

I am sad that they aren't open Tuesday and I love the fact that they consistently have a crowd. Obviously they are doing something right. 

Their staff is also helpful, friendly and fantastic.
author: Andrew K.

description: In a city with world class bakeries, im appalled that this place has 4.5 stars. Baked goods are average at best and service is terrible. Run by a bunch of teenagers that don't seem to care about anything besides getting through their shift. No sense of urgency. Below average cleanliness.
author: John L.

description: Got the special breakfast sando - buttery biscuit goodness all piled up with eggs, bacon, avo, pepper jack, and a tasty aoli as the finishing touch. So good
author: Eugene S.

description: What a great spot for a bite and coffee. Friendly people too!
author: Jason P.

description:
Breakfast sandwich is awesome. The cinnamon roll is amazing and so different from any I've had before. Mushroom & bacon quiche also yummy. But what was best is they are quick and everyone was nice and the place was clean. 
Recommend this place when the line is out the door even. Moves fast and the service is best when busy.
author: Max R.

description: Came here on a Monday morning, had the breakfast sandwich and the special breakfast sandwich both were delicious. Extra thumbs up for doggie treats at the counter, my doggies woofed them up:) I'd say this was one of the best, quick and pet friendly places I ate at in my most recent trip to San Fracisco. Close to the beach so grab something and go for a walk.
author: Kellie S.

description: I don't think i have ever experienced a better breakfast sandwich. I would drive hours to this place....oh wait....sometimes I do. The staff are extremely friendly and love what they do in the kitchen (magic) and their food, beyond belief. I can't wait to go back
author: Lindsi J.

description: I used to love this place. Even despite the crazy lines. But I went on Tuesday of this week and realized they weren't making the sandwich fresh as usual. They just added the toppings already cooked and heated it in the oven. This time around. My bacon was burnt to a crisp. Sandwich was drenched with aioli which I love aioli but when it's literally all over the outside of the biscuit. It's overwhelming. On top of that. They usually give a hefty amount of eggs. I barely got any. If this is their new way of making their sandwiches. I won't be back again it's not worth the 30 min wait.  They also got a new cashier that's really rude. I'm not sure if it's intentional but I heard a customer explain they only got 3 sandwiches and the cashier said very snarky "yea that's why I asked you". Not even a smile and sorry. I've been going to this place because of the nice welcoming atmosphere and great sandwiches. But if this is the new direction. I won't be going back. Not worth the half an hr wait for ..come on guys..a sandwich? If it was still made fresh. Maybe. Not to mention the "cook" in the back was eating a banana, cooking our food and touching her cell all without gloves in plain site.
author: Lauren S.

description: I come here for one thing and one thing only and that is the cinnamon roll. It is absolutely to die for. The best I Have ever had and it's huge!!! It's also very reasonably priced for the amount that you get.
author: Emily G.

description:
Devil's teeth is definitely my favorite bakery in San Francisco. I've tried the following:

- donut muffin
- lemon bar
- cinnamon roll
- $1 beignets on Sunday's
- special breakfast sandwich

Everything is amazing! My favorite items on here is the lemon bar and the breakfast sandwich. They have the best lemon bar! a buttery layer of shortbread crust and not too tart (unlike Tartine Bakery) dusted with powder sugar. The special breakfast sandwich is huge! The biscuit is buttery, flakey and it's stuffed with eggs, cheese, bacon, avocado and lemon aioli sauce. Amazing! I think about coming here each week but they close so early (4pm). That's probably my only downside.

Please stay open till later, Devil's teeth!
author: Laura T.

description: Yeah buddy!, rolling like a big shot. Bacon, beer, cheddar green muffin...still love the special breakfast sandwich.
author: J M.

description: We are suckers for a good breakfast sandwich and find them hard to come by... That said the Special Breakfast Sandwich is absolutely delicious! Perfect mouthwatering mix of flavors and textures with the crispyish thick bacon, soft avocado, slight heat from the pepper-jack and creamy goodness of the lemon aioli... You will leave satisfied! And they are large if you want share:) We also tried the beingnets... these make for a wonderful appetizer while you wait the HOUR for your egg sandwich. Far superior to Brenda's and not quite Cafe Du Monde but well worth it!! Lastly the doughnut muffin... Essentially a slightly more moist and fluffy cake doughnut covered in cinnamon sugar, since we love cinnamon this too was a hit! All in all we will certainly be back, though on the earlier side to avoid the wait!
author: Kelly C.

description: Love their breakfast sandwich in the morning.  Best way to wake up and walk to the beach with our snack.   I wish there were a few more breakfast options in the morning, but you can't go wrong with really anything there.
author: Edgar C.

description:
Everything, everything, everything is delicious. The daily soups, the bread, and most importantly the baked goods are fantastic. 

Offers savoury scones and breads to sweet sticky buns and fudgy brownies! The textures are where they really nail it. Great flavour mind you, but the texture is where the chemistry is. Flakey, creamy, fluffy!

My only complaint..the prime-time lines. The weekends are insane and I'd rather not wait. While it's delicious, my work and my waste line would not permit me to stand in one place for so long for a delectable baked good. 

Overall, fantastic.. Oh and for those out of the neighbourhood and driving, parking is easy!
author: Brighid F.

description:
Came in this morning at around 10am and there was already a line almost out the door. I'm thinking wow this place must be good.  Ordered the coffee, breakfast sandwich and of course the beignet (only on Sundays).

The blue bottle coffee was good and hecka strong - but I still think the coffee at House of Coffee is better. 

The breakfast sandwich which is a biscuit stuffed with eggs, bacon, cheese was disappointing. The biscuit was indeed very moist but yet too moist....it just mushes up when you bite into it. It was missing the flaky texture and most importantly it was bland/tasteless!  Would I order it again? No. 

The beignet was just OK. It was very doughy and not fried long enough. Maybe that's the way it should be? Not sure since this is my first time having it :P But I'm willing to try it again! 

They have a row of seats facing the street for customers that opts to eat  their goodies there...but I would recommend not as it's somewhat chaotic since they have an open kitchen with a very small space. The workers there seem to be scrambling around doing multiple things at once, other customers standing right next to u waiting for their food...so eating there would not be ideal.  

Overall 2.5 stars. The food was definitely disappointing but maybe it was what I ordered. They offer tons of other baked goods that I do wanna try. And on a positive note, I love that they have samples of the scones, cookies, muffins etc at the cashier.
author: Cathy M.

description:
I had been reading and hearing about Devil's Teeth Baking Company for months, but just never had the time to go. A customer at my job even brought my co-worker and I some of their beignets on a Sunday, and I was impressed and intrigued. Then I went on a low carb diet for a while, and could only look at photos of their goods kind of like some kind of food torture porn. I vowed to one day get their special breakfast sandwich, and this morning was that day. It came out fast and hot and I definitely had some kind of outer-body experience while eating it.

It came with perfectly soft scrambled eggs, bacon that wasn't soggy and chewy - but nice and crispy, with melted cheese, lots of avocado, and some kind of lemon aioli sauce on a gigantic buttermilk biscuit. I ate the whole thing with vigor and it set me in an oddly happy cheerful mood. That breakfast sandwich has magical powers. It's inspirational. I should probably build a canoe now. Or a home for orphans. Maybe set free some lobsters at the grocery store.
author: Catface G.

description: Everything is delicious here. We ordered the special breakfast sandwich, cinnamon roll and the beignets are definitely a must try. The staff is friendly ...the wait is really long on a Sunday but definitely worth it.
author: Mary N.

description:
Happy Beignet Sunday! 

So I ordered beignets, they wrote my name down, and called me up when my beignets were done. Well, after a couple orders, let's just say - Jason and Don both know my name quite well...

"Shirley, did you get your SECOND order of beignets?" 

"How are those beignets, Shirley? Good?"

"Come back again, Shirley"

If my face turned red, it was hidden behind the brown paper bag with the hot beignets! Wait, whats that on the front of the bag? Ohhh, crap - it says "Shirley" written in bright red ink! Grrreat.

Nice and crisp on the outside, smothered with powdered sugar, doughy on the inside - made to order at a dollar each. Can you see why they're so addicting? 

Happy Beignet Sunday, Jason & Don - see you next week!
author: S Y.

description: I literally just ate here, I'm pretty sure I am going to go into cardiac arrest after eating their cinnamon roll/honeybun monstrosity. Food was super amazing and the service was exceptional. Go here and do yourself a favor
author: sean s.

description: Awesome breakfast sandwich!  But their Sunday beginets got smaller.  My 8 yr old kid wakes up at 6:30 am on Sunday mornings (then proceeds to wake us up) to get there as soon as they open, only to find his favorite beginets have been reduced to half their size. We've been going there every Sunday for almost 2 years.  We will still go for the breakfast sandwich and my kid will probably still get up early on Sundays because its become a family tradition.  Please bring back the regular sized beignets!
author: Gina M.

description: This place is fantastic, but be prepared to wait in line! The specialty breakfast sandwiches are delicious (can't believe no one else uses biscuits like this). I try to pick up the sticky cinnamon buns and brownies for my Grandpa, it makes his day. If it's a weekend, you'll be waiting awhile though, so bring a book.
author: Ash B.

description:
Now that Sundays are no longer devoted to fresh piroshky, Devil's Teeth has declared Beignet Sundays. The beignets ($1 each) are fried to order. They're soft, hot, small pillows covered in powdered sugar. 

Devil's Teeth's baked goods look rustic. Bars (blondies, brownies, cheesecake, coffee cake, lemon bars) are flat looking, the cookies are big and the muffins are small. You may also spot bread, pie, quiche, cupcakes, monster cinnamon rolls and more. They have breakfast sandwiches, soup (sometimes) and whatever they feel like making. I haven't seen the cupcakes there yet but they aren't made every day. Blue Bottle Coffee (drip only) is served.

* Donut muffin ($2.50) - soft muffin coated in cinnamon sugar, very nice, more muffin than donut like: http://media4.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/sk_8GYNpN6BlN7zpVTxsjA/l 
* Lasagna ($5) - huge square, it's plenty cheesy and saucy but the noodles were too soft and the big chunks of turkey sausage were dry, I like how the sauce was a tiny bit spicy
* Ginger cookie - plenty of ginger flavor but too soft and not chewy enough for me
author: Lolia S.

description: The best part about Devil's Teeth Baking Company for me was their location nearby the coast.  The iced coffee and iced chai tea we had were good and the breakfast sandwiches fine but the lines seemed a bit long and the server (and service) a bit slow.  Anyways, the seagulls at the nearby beach happily finished what we couldn't.  Wish we could have tried the beignets.
author: James H.

description:
This bakery reminds me of your typical hole in the wall mom/pop shop in a beach town...but the food and price is atypical not to mention the coffee.  1 star deduction for limited seating.

If you're around the area for a quick bite to eat AND delicious pastries, Devil's Teeth will not disappoint.  If you fall for the sample bait at the counter, I guarantee you'll get hooked.  

Check out a picture of the the bakery from across the street to get an idea if seating and breakfast biscuit during your next siesta.  $5 bucks for a huge breakfast this good is a deal.
author: Charles Y.

description:
Don't let the location fool you. Just because it's in the outer sunset doesn't mean it's any less crowded than a comparable bakery in the mission.

Baked goods are nothing special.
author: Dave N.

description:
when my friend mentioned going for a breakfast sandwich, i was like... "what ev er".  But in endeavoring not to hurt her feelings, i said, "sounds great!".  

Little did i know... it was amazing.  this breakfast sandwich is worth travelling to the outer sunset alone.

In fact, i'm going back tomorrow.

picked up some baked goods too, and they were as delicious.
author: RD r.

description:
I came here three times this month.  It's good.  I'm a fan of the breakfast sandwich.  Flaky biscuit with eggs, cheese, and bacon.  It doesn't get much better than that.  They can also substitute the bacon with a tomato if you're a vegetarian.

The coffee is good, about a medium to medium strong.  I've had the beignets too, and it's a good deal for a dollar, but only on Sundays.

It manages to cater to families, dog owners, surfers, hipsters, and everyone in between.  It's in an easy-to-park area.  There's ample seating on benches outside.  Customer service has been great each time I've come too.
author: Debra C.

description:
I convinced my friend to walk with me to this place after our annual trip to the SF botanical gardens. I ordered the donut muffin, the  ginger cookie, and a banana cream pie puff to-go. There were some tables inside the bakery and a nice, clean bathroom which I used precisely twice. All in all, the store didn't give me an overly-cramped vibe though it was small and would be a nice spot to down a cup of coffee along with your pastry of choice.

I expected the donut muffin to taste like a donut in the shape of a muffin, but it pleasantly surprised me by being crumbly and rich on the inside like a buttermilk cinnamon muffin and crispy like a donut skin on the outside. The ginger cookie was soft, thin and of a generous size. You could really taste the bits of ginger infused in it. It was really fresh but nothing mind-blowing.

The banana cream puff was my least favorite. The outside tasted rather stale and the inside had too much whipped cream and not enough banana flavor. Mine had a chunk of chocolate in it but it would've been nicer if it was spread evenly throughout. I had it to-go and the store didn't even give me the proper bags to carry the baked goods, so the cookie and the muffin were in precarious positions. I had to go back to ask for a box.
author: Alice L.

description:
Woof!  Came in to the city to play in the waves and of course, my owner takes me to this place before we head back to the "burbs".  I'm wet and he makes me sit in the car....but luckily, he parks in front....BUT, I see a line out the door, and it's only 2 in the afternoon????  A bakery???

I guess he forgot the lesson of never going to a market...let alone a bakery if you're hungry!  (2pm and running on the beach will do that to you).  So he gets a lemon bar (very tasty) brownie (great texture) raspberry bar (like a granola bar) doughnut muffins (better zapped & warm...later eaten with vanilla ice cream) strawberry muffins (light & fruity) and the two things that everyone was smiling at last night....the banana cream (chocolate banana cream, light & smooth!!)  puff & cinnamon roll.  (the glaze inside was like candy!!...zap it for 20 sec).....

Ok, so he brings all this out to the car and all I get was free doggy treats!   WOOF!  They were great!  I hope he stops by there again so I can have more treats!!

*We were going to have lunch at Outerland, but they to had a line out the door!
author: Autzen H.

description:
Still a fan.  Chocolate cake that is as good as it gets!  Sometimes the  basics when done well hit a home run!  Grand Slam, here.

Donut muffins still my favorite breakfast treat from this great bakery.   I miss the apricot scones.
author: Debbie T.

description:
Hands down one of the best breakfast sandwiches I've eaten in sf. Coming from New Mexico, I feel green chili would make everything that much better, but despite this absence, the devils teeth excels. 

I also love/hate them for their $1 beignet coated in powdered sugar. The wait was moderate- very tolerable given that the provide street chalk to occupy customers.
author: Max R.

description: Devil's teeth Baking co is next to the church of surf. This place is awesome. I have not tried something here that I didn't love. Breakfast sandwiches here are huge and made on the biggest biscuit i've ever seen. Workers are super mellow and nice even  though its always crowded here . Check this place out next time you're at ocean beach.
author: Toan T.

description:
Our host strongly recommended their cinnamon bun so we came yesterday which was Tuesday. We were so bummed when we saw the sign 'closed'. 

Yep we came back today to taste their famous cinnamon bun and breakfast sandwich.

They lived up to their reputation.

Everything was made from scratch and prepared in house.

I usually don't like cinnamon buns because they are too sweet to my taste. But theirs was more flaky and densed with flavor and finished with the right amount of sweetness with sugar and cinnamon. Delicious! If you are looking for ones with white icing on top, you should just go to that cinnabon place. 

My husbad loved breakfast sandwich. Biscuit and eggs were fluffly and buttery but not too much. Meant to order the special one but by mistake got a regular one. Still good.

They don't have espresso drinks. Only brewed coffee menu and chai latte.

Cafe au lait was delicious.

Staffs were cheerful and friendly. Highly recommend this place
author: Joanna P.

description:
Breakfast sandwich heaven! After three tries on three consecutive weekends to snag the $1 beignets on Sunday (advice: they usually run out by 2 PM) I finally succeeded only to have the beignets completely overwhelmed by the breakfast sandwich. Two nice flaky biscuits with scrambled egg, cheddar cheese and bacon between.  A hearty meal for only $5. We discussed how they could sell these in the Mission for $10 and people would still think it was awesome. If I wasn't so full I would have ordered another one. After that the beignets just couldn't compete. They were still good but my mind kept returning to the breakfast sandwich. Not as light as I prefer and a little chewier but it could be that they had cooled down while I was eating the breakfast sandwich.

If you miss the beignets they do have other pastries which are worth getting once you're already here but not worth coming across town for.  The coffee service can be very slow.

The space is small but they have a nice parklet outside where you can enjoy your treats. Be prepared for Outer Sunset weather and pack a puffy jacket!
author: Jean K.

description:
I force a run through golden gate park.  Now, I can feast on the breakfast Sammie. This bakery makes me happy. 

Free samples and free dog treats also add to the super duper ness of this place.
author: michelle D.

description:
The only downside to this place is that it's no longer a neighborhood secret! Can't take away stars for being too delicious and popular, but it is a bummer to see a long line on the weekends when all I want is a cookie!

What's good:
-the carrot cake... that has turned me off all other carrot cakes, because no other carrot cake will be as deliciously moist as the cake here. and the frosting is just right, not too sweet, not too rich. best carrot cake I've ever had. oh and it is a HUGE slice.
-cookies...chocolate chip, oatmeal raisin, ginger. they're all so good, soft, and full of flavor.
-chocolate brownie
-the breakfast sandwich!!! with bacon. in between a biscuit.

pretty much everything i've had here is good, but the carrot cake, cookies and chocolate sandwich keep me coming back.
author: Jessie C.

description:
I've been here many times now and I'm totally a fan. Here's what I've ordered in the past:

lemon bar- yum
monkey bread- yum
cinnamon roll- yum but a little on the sweet side
chocolate cake- yum- dark and rich flavor
carrot cake- meh- I've had better
breakfast sandwich- yum
special breakfast sandwich- yum

Staff is always friendly and moves the line quick. There's limited seating inside but a nice sitting area outside.
author: Jo S.

description:
The breakfast sandwich. The breakfast burrito. Even the breakfast pizza. These bastard children of the traditional breakfast plate are the handheld versions of the classic combinations of eggs, cheese, bacon, bread and anything else you want in there. 

I've read up on my fair share of food science and there's an entire technology industry behind the experience of eating, and typically it's implemented and geared toward what and how children eat. Take the Lunchable for instance. (Reported recently in New York Times Magazine.) When figuring out how to move into that moment when the Mom is too rushed in the morning to build a brown bag lunch, Kraft looked at what brings joy to a child's eating experience somuchso they'd then request the Lunchable over the brown bag, which is a win-win for everyone. That joy they had derived from the snap of the crackers on the top & bottom of their mini sandwich, and it was determined the two part handheld & crunch, along with the sound of eating the cracker with the hearty parts of it, created a complete experience that some think is behaviorally addictive. 

So guess who ate Lunchables four days a week in grade school? The behavior and allure of sandwiches isn't going away. I look at a plate of eggs, bacon, toast, and maybe a tomato or avocado and I think it's dull, and the fork is a weapon of mass consumption -- and I also fear that dreadful possibility of the fork catching a gum or tooth. Thus, the breakfast sandwich is right where I want to be. The breakfast sandwich at Devil's Teeth is right within my want, and around the corner. In-house buttermilk biscuits split open with scrambled eggs, thick cut bacon, pepper jack cheese, some sort of sauce, tomato and avocado evokes the very early days of nourishment for me. Even the grease from the biscuits is appreciated. 

From construction workers, to children, to cops, to walking couples sharing it, to me, this damn thing goes way back and is a staple of the Outer Sunset. And we haven't even talked about the Donut Muffin.
author: Jon A.

description:
Blue bottle coffee?! Large and cheap pastries?! I'm there! 

My friend and I yelped 5 star places in the neighborhood and Devil's Teeth Baking Company popped up.

I stopped by yesterday for a cup of Blue Bottle Coffee and it was so delicious. They only have one size that's $2.50 which isn't bad at all. I wasn't craving any sweets at the time but I plan to visit very soon to try everything they have. 

The staff is extremely nice and about three people welcomed me and asked if I've been helped when I only visited the bakery for 10 minutes. They used an iPad and a Square to ring up customers which I think is really cool.
author: Vikki K.

description:
I love you Devil's Teeth. I have to stop by at least once a week to get the chicken curry sandwich. Seriously, that sandwich is so addicting and I'm in love with it! Other highlights include; breakfast sandwich, lemon bars, and donut muffin. Actually all their baked goods are lovely.

The staff is always friendly, nice parklet outside to sit at and munch, amazing food. What more can you ask for?
author: Megan K.

description: Great hipster addition to the neighborhood. I know this place is popular for the cinnamon buns, but I really don't like cinnamon, so I had to try other thins. I got the quiche (potato and bacon) and raspberry tart which were both really good, fresh, but nothing out of the ordinary. The place also has a great parklet where you can sit outside and enjoy the day. I want to come back and try the beignets.
author: Nikita K.

description:
The problem is me and Irish don't deal with crowds very well.  At All.   And really, being in the Outer Sunset this isn't much of a problem for us.  

Until we go to Devil's Teeth.

You'll need to step over children lying on the sidewalk and dogs begging for food, you'll need to put up with other customers pushing their way for a better spot in line, which spirals out the door.   Then you'll need to wait kind of a really long time for a breakfast sandwich.

It's one of the Outer Sunset's Places to Be Seen on Weekend Mornings.  Go.  Be seen.  I hear the donut muffins are good. 

I can't blame Devils' Teeth for our personality disorders, but I'll be at home cookin' up bacon, 3-minute eggs and hash browns in my jammies.
author: Meg W.

description: Line was sooooo long but I think it's because it was Sunday beignet day (which were really good). I thought the price of the beignets were pretty steep at a dollar per beignet. I also got a special breakfast sandwich which was good, but after trying my husband's regular breakfast sandwich I liked his better, and it was also cheaper. The biscuit they use is the best part. It is seriously amazing. And huge.
author: Amber W.

description: Minus 1 star because of the long ass wait and grumpy employees. Other than pastries are good.
author: Kathy P.

description:
I really like this bakery.  The quality overall is certainly there.  Some things I love.  Some things I don't.  

LOVES:
+Best carrot cake EVER
+Fantastic cinnamon rolls (best heated in a toaster oven after you get home)
+Breakfast burritos (only on certain days, but they rock)
+Cheesecake--not heavy and sickening
+Breakfast sandwiches on a yummy biscuit
+To my knowledge they use unbleached flour

Don't Love:
-Chai is too spicy for my taste
-Muffins are small and kinda dry
-Same things most of the time.  I would like them to change it up with some new items on a regular basis.
-Closed on Tuesdays and closed by like 4pm.  Boo.
author: Lizzie R.

description:
FRESH PASTRIES!!!
(4 stars)

Typed in "beignets" because I was craving for some of close proximity to Daly City. At first, the name did not stand out as a pastry shop and more like a catering company. Decided to check it out.

- Pastries, fresh & yummy
- Prices, affordable
- Service, friendly staff
- Ambiance, small (no space to sit)

I saw Blue Bottle coffee beans being sold and whenever i see "Blue Bottle" I automatically think PLUS POINTS - best damn coffee beans i've ever had!!! And behind the glass casing were the pastries. My frist thoughts were BEIGNETS??? and then sampled some of their pastries. Looks like I was not the only one inquire about the Beignets because others were asking the same time I was asking (about 4 other people). Sunday = Beignets. Since it was Saturday and there were no Beignets being served, it would be rude to walk out without trying their delicious looking pastries.

HEFFER-STYLE STATUS.

Apricot Oats Scone ($3.25) - of all the fresh pastries, I went with this one. Wasn't too thrilled with the price of the scone and was shooting for a buck cheaper - thinking i could get a few organic vegan scones for about that price. I've had all kinds of scones but never an apricot oats scone. Very picky with my scones and they have to be very fresh and crumble in the mouth on each bite. SCORE! Loved the scone. I'd be willing to fork over $3.25 for another one of theses anytime!!!!

Glad to have found a great pastry spot near Ocean Beach to get a little something something sweet. Sweet treats and watching the surfers and kite surfers kick ass on the waters = good day.

Will I be back? Sunday are beignet days. Must try.

Until the next review....
author: Jane A.

description:
Outer Sunset represent! 

Not sure what's spurring the resurgence of cool lil' businesses in the Outer Sunset, but I don't care if it keeps attracting delicious spots like this one. 

Blue bottle coffee. (Yes!)

Blueberry and banana muffin. (OK, so how do they bake the muffin so that the blueberries stay plump and juicy? They literally gushed juicy blueberry goodness in my mouth when it bit into the muffin.)

Comfort-pastries like the cinnamon rolls, bread pudding and b-fast sammies - will keep me coming back until I've sampled one of everything. 

Open kitchen setting. Simple no frills. Just solid. 

Welcome to the hood.  What a great neighbor you'll make!
author: Stephanie I.

description: so far, everything i've tried there was excellent. brownies? fudgy and delicious. cookies? terrific. lemon bars? awesome. i have more to try, but so far, so mmm mmm good. to Devil's Teeth, my inner fat kid thanks you.
author: Mike C.

description:
This cafe brings such a fresh, hip vibe to my neighborhood and I love it. The pastries are super delicious, and the beignets are truly awesome. I ordered about 20 of them to bring to a brunch potluck and they were a huge hit! Fresh beignets for $1 each.. great deal!

Although lots of people rave about the breakfast sandwich, it was a bit too heavy for my taste. I would love it if they offered the same on a croissant or roll instead of the buttery biscuit. My favorite things are their delicious blueberry yogurt parfait with house made granola, the donut muffin, and cookies. yum yum yum!
author: Jasmine M.

description:
A good neighborhood bakery walking distance from my house? YES! 

My favorite items in order of yumminess:
1. Blueberry Scone with Lemon Glaze - Do you know how hard it is to get a good scone? This one is moist, sweet, and the edges are crispy. It is seriously one of the only good scones I've had in the city. 
2. Carrot Cake  - the cream cheese frosting is yum.
3. Breakfast Sandwich - sometimes they have it with avo..it's great.
4. Cinnamon Roll - it's huge. Awesome with some black coffee.

On the weekends, I bring the kids to just hang out on the parklet outside.
author: vicki c.

description: Decent food, but overpriced and the lady was really rude to me. Didn't apologize or say anything when I waited 15 minutes for a breakfast sandwich while everyone cooking in the back were just waiting around talking.
author: Bruce J.

description:
Maybe too hyped up?

I decided to try their cinnamon bun and donut muffin because there are so many positive yelp reviews and its near my house. 

I thought the cinnamon bun was just okay. its sticky and semi crunchy but i think Cinnabon is much better!

Donut muffin was dry. Love the sugar but it was just okay too.

Service was okay too. The line was long but i think because all the workers were too focus on baking/prepping in the kitchen than having ONE person mandating the front and take orders. 

I probably wont come back but i love the fact my neighborhood has so many different food options.
author: Carol Y.

description:
Shared a breakfast sandwich...it was good...a solid combination of bacon, eggs, and cheddar on a decent biscuit - nothing special (ie I'd rather eat a McGriddle).

I was super excited for the beignets, so I ordered two for myself...they came out piping hot. I shook the paper bag they came in to try to distribute the powdered sugar before opening the bag and taking a big wiff of donut awesomeness...or so I thought...omg the beignets smelled horrible...like someone put fish in a fryer, and then forgot about it until noticing a burning smell. I took a bite, just too see if by some miracle the beignet was still good, but sadly it wasn't. The texture was off too...dense...I finished it because I was hungry and then threw the other beignet in a garbage can.
author: Jeffrey D.

description: These guys get it right for a solid breakfast sando. Great for hangovers.  If you are going on a weekend, you better be in there before 9am or you will wait for 30 mins.  Its cool, just take a walk to the beach and when you are back that hot bacon egg and cheese biscuit will be waiting!
author: Zack H.

description:
the roomies and i were craving for some dessert the other night, so I started yelping. devil's teeth popped up in the search. and of course I knew I had to check it out.  

blue bottle coffee, breakfast sammie, banana cream pie, lemon bar, currant scones, banana blueberry muffins, beignet sunday's, and oh so many other delish goodies... AHHHHMAZING. 

Jason is absolutely marvelous! super sweet and down to earth. I'm so glad this joint opened up in my neighborhood. I'll definitely be a regular here! :)
author: Ann T.

description:
Best biscuits in the entire universe!! This place is amazing!!
..but i sure do wonder where that cool hot guy with the slick hair went ? He is the only guy I've seen with a tie dye baseball tee!!! btw this cutie made such amazing SBS!!!!
author: Andrea T.

description: Came out here in search of breakfast without a gigantic line.  There were enough people to tell me it was delicious without being a deterrent.  Breakfast sandwich was a solid win -- super fresh and hot and delicious.  Tried a beignet, and that that good too.  The latte was a bit of a letdown, but you can always grab one at your favorite place and then cruise over here for food.  The baked goods looked wonderful -- I hope to come back to try something else!
author: Calee S.

description: Our friend who lives near Devil's Teeth insisted we stop in here for their scones and breakfast sandwiches. I loved the little parklet out front and my kale parmesan scone. Our friend was right, the scone was so light and flavorful, they take scones to another level. My husband's breakfast sandwich was slow in coming, but he swore it was worth the wait.
author: Debra R.

description:
This place ROCKS!   
I found out about it when a friend posted pics through facebook.  I grew up in the outer Sunset so the neighborhood holds a special place in my heart.  

I stopped by a few times to check out their goodies and EVERY single thing I bought was delish.  Seriously the best carrot cake ever.  Their brownies are decadently rich and addictive.  I love their breakfast sandwiches. 

My husband loved the ginger and oatmeal cookies.  Their chocolate chip cookies are just as great!  

Everyone is super friendly.  Parking is easy.  With the last few pounds I need to lose after having my son, I think I'm going to have a problem shedding them after discovering Devil's Teeth.  Their baked goods are addictive.  You have to stop by and check it out.
author: Christine P.

description: one of my fave places for friendly delicious breakfast bakery n sandwiches. for your best mood on Saturday/ Sunday morning oh and everyday
author: Ka V.

description: Last time I went they ran out of the biscuit and the guy made me their breakfast with banana break. Which I LOVED IT! Seriously best thing ever.
author: Yulin K.

description:
I've only had their cinnamon bun and I love it. It's dense and just different from any that I've ever had. 
$4 a pop. 
I will be making my way there soon to try out something new.
author: Lovely L.

description:
This is such an awesome gem of a place!  Like others have mentioned their breakfast sandwiches are just exquisite! So simple, yet sooooooooo good! 

Their donut muffin thingies are to die for!!! They aren't overly sweet, just enough to satiate that sweet tooth. I really want to go back on a sunday to try their beignets! There really isnt much room to sit inside, however, there are a couple benches outside you can enjoy your treats at.
author: Gina G.

description:
*****SUPPORT THE LOCAL SMALL BUSINESS JOINTS*******

In some distant fantasy, I could see myself working here.  Complete with a faded apron, a loose bun fastened with a NO.2 freshly sharpened pencil, flour dusted on my cheeks, hipster glasses, and a stained american apparel t-shirt layered over some ripped jeans.  It's either that or me in my overalls with hand prints of chocolate all over my butt.  Needless to say, I had a baking fantasy here.   The small shop with it's equally small staff evoked comfort.  

Someone created recipes, the colors, the featured items, the lay out.  Someone poured their heart and soul into this joint.  I could feel that, or my empty stomach.

Expectations suck, but here are some that are true.

There will be line, and you will be 7th person to late.  Don't worry, they will have something you like by the time you get to the register.

It won't be quiet.  Don't expect to have a romantic chat over your lemon bar with your honey, save that for home. 

You will leave with more than 2 items.  Besides the donut muffin, cheddar bacon biscuits, scones, cookies, and breakfast sandwich, I guarantee you will leave with at least 3 options.

Waiting is part of your experience. Don't show up in a rush, no one wants that vibe in this establishment.

Attendance on Sunday is a must. Dude, they have beignets on Sundays. If that isn't reason enough, then you should be in church.


This is a bakery folks,   A long bar/table allows 4-5 patrons to sit and enjoy their goodies. A shorter option  seats 3 but that will put you in the waiting area next to the "condiments."  I tried sitting here while I waited, but I nearly had people in my lap.  



I ordered:
the breakfast sandwich. Bacon, eggs, cheese, on a biscuit. DEATH. I nearly walked home.
a donut muffin devoured with with my tea.  Sugar sprinkles all over my fingers and pants.
In the bag, I ordered a lemon bar, a beer-cheddar-bacon muffin, and a scone. 
I share.  I'm the girl you want sleeping over on Saturday because odds are I'll go fishing for something yummy on Sunday.

Yup, I'll purposely restrict myself or walk blocks and blocks along the Great Highway to consume treats. Must. Stick. To. One.
author: Flor D.

description: Had the grilled cheese and soup combo. Grilled cheese was bland with a poor cheese-to-bread ratio and the soup was too watery for dipping. The soup was tasty on its own though--loved the tomato chunks.
author: Fay W.

description:
Ok, the brownies are fabulous, you've got me there.  But other aspects are really lackluster including the staff who seem so thoroughly vacant about the "little" details like their hours and what they have that day that it's hard to imagine what's going on there.

For example, I once had a strange interactions where I asked for a whole quiche and proceeded to watch for 15 minutes while two employees debated whether it was cooked enough to sell.  It did not inspire confidence that they could not decide (eek!).  If you're in the area, I prefer Rolling Out, which has an awesome owner and great cinnamon rolls too.  And if you're closer to Arizmendi, well then, by all means...

I haven't dealt with the famed wait (and quite frankly, wouldn't for this place).  This review is for midday trips, with no wait time.
author: Leigh F.

description: This place needs to give out order numbers or create some type of system for when things get busy.  I'm sick and tired of waiting over half an hour for my orders and seeing people who ordered the same thing as me at least 10 minutes after me get their orders before me.  I've been told several times that "someone else took [my] order" even though I stood near the counter and never heard anyone call my name.  I'm not deaf and have an easy American name, so it's really annoying.  I don't plan on coming here again.
author: M. N.

description:
The best beignets in the bay area, only $1 on Sundays. I was fortunate enough to have these delivered fresh and piping hot, omg they are to die for! 

Perfect texture coated in powdered sugar, not over oily either which is common in these deep fried babies. Usually after a couple I'm over the grease, but I actually consumed all contents with in the paper bag. 

Hopefully, one of these days I'll be able to wake up early and make the trek here for more. Other menu items look delicious as well.
author: Julia C.

description: Great little bakery and coffee shop! I've been trying the coffee shops around the outer sunset area to find one I like because I just moved here - this and Andytown are my favorites. Best part about this place is their breakfast sandwiches. Really yummy. Flaky biscuit, fresh eggs, crunchy bacon.
