Their coffee is also good and I love that they have doggie treats so you can get your dog a little something too. A place that caters to dog owners is the best (in my book.) They also have a counter to sit at and books to read/buy which I thought was a great touch. Sometimes there's a little line but they work fast, so you won't be waiting long. Delicious, excellent service and pup friendly!
author: Kathleen D.

description: Probably the best basic breakfast sandwich I've ever had (and I'm from the south where there are more biscuits than pickup trucks, so that's saying a lot). Also had a hot cinnamon roll which was killer. The coffee was a bit too fruity for my tastes and the presentation/appearance of the food wasn't as beautiful as you'd hope for, but the flavors and textures made up for that. The staff was very friendly and it's got a great parklet to eat your treats in  Definitely worth a return visit.
author: Allegra H.

description:
Breakfast Sammy
Coffee
Cinnamon Roll

Breakfast Sammy-I decided to go with 4 stars because the objective of this trip was to get one of those messy yummy breakfast sammy's, which was pretty good. A biscuit, egg, cheese and bacon in a foil wrapper is just what to eat when the outside is ripped at the seam's with people waiting, sitting and chillin'. see dissapointing coffee notes below...

Great outside wooden seating and landscaped trees and flowers on the sidewalk...a anomaly for SF...buuutttt the coffee....ahhh man the coffee.

Coffee-I get the wave of organic, natural craze but I like my coffee with cream and sugar and like there to be room for such amazing accoutrements. 

It's just like anything else, your unique and so are your taste buds. I don't judge others for liking black coffee but when you pay $3.50 for an iced coffee, 

$3.50 I SAID, Yes, $3.50 for what would be an equivalent of a Tall at SB and I would have to either pour out some of the precious 4 ounces that I probably received in my sad coffee or drink it without cream which is something I would sooner do in my nexxt life when I"M DEAD!!

I am super serious about my:
1. Coffee
2. Eggs Benny
3. Cocktails
4. Steak

No deal on the coffee!

My coffee was so terrible that I just couldn't drink it. That's a no-go for me. 

Cinnamon Roll-Not your typical soft and warm gooey roll. No, it's easily half a pound of dough and emulsifed butter and brown sugar which tasted great, but just not what you would think of when buying into a cinnamon roll. It's not on Jenny Craig's or Weight Watchers point system so only the brave who care not about waist lines or bloating. You've been warned.
author: Jessica M.

description:
Small and cute spot in the avenues...GE
ets pretty busy in the early morning. A small line always forms out the door, but they grt through relatively quick. They staff works super fast and are friendly.

They have a great buttery hot and delicious breakfast sandwich!!! Drip coffee to die for and a vast selection of baked goodies!!! After having the lemon bar my friend craved another for days... Kinda glad I moved a bit further away otherwise I would be there all the time and blow up like a blimp.... but when in the avenues....its a must!
author: Krystal T.

description:
Long hipster line on sunday brunch time, but that's to be expected. Beignets were fresh and not too sweet, how I like them, hot enough to burn your face off. J thought they were fine, but not "destination beignets," a hilarious, yet worthwhile achievement denial. Her biscuit breakfast sandwich was solid and good. 

Their outdoor area, more a statement about how well they fit into one of my fave newly growing areas of SF, is wonderful. Blissfully sharing seating over good coffee with kids and pets porking around in a sea breezed sun shining morning is good memories.
author: micah f.

description:
This is such a wonderful place! 
Great food and even better service. The woman who owns it does a great job of making you feel warm and welcome in her bakery.
I work across the street and was so excited when they opened. Now I can't stay away!

They have the best coffee in the sunset, and I'm not the only one who thinks so. Everyone who stops by has nothing but good things to say about Devil's Teeth. 

Their sweets are delicious, as well as their other delicacies. My favorite by far is the chicken salad. Super amazing. And they have great turkey lasagna. 

I could go on and on, but I'll let you find out for yourself. Check them out! :)
author: Lauren L.

description: When one eats their breakfast biscuit and thinks "damn, these are the luckiest pigeons and birds in town getting to feed on these crumbs," you know the food is great.
author: Lisa A.

description: I'd heard good things about this place and on my way back from Lake Merced, I popped in to look around. I had something chocolate here, and it stirred something inside me. Like oh shit, now I'm gonna have to eat everything here. Because it's so cute and right next to the surf shop and there are dogs and cute surfer boys and a parklet and just steps to the beach and wow that chocolate cake. Highway to the danger zone. Yes, you have to sing that last line.
author: Vivian H.

description: This place is great! There are many baked goods, coffee, lattes, sandwiches, and soups.  I've only had the special breakfast sandwich (which is a must get), lemon bar, and latte. So far, I have not been disappointed and I always crave that special breakfast sandwich.  Make sure to get the special, not the regular!
author: Loi L.

description:
I'm upset with Devil's Teeth. Upset because they have finally cracked my previously unbreakable willpower. I can wake up at 7am every day to exercise before work. I can decline or carefully portion out sweets. I can painstakingly measure and prepare healthy meals for myself every day.

But today. Today! My coworkers brought me pastries for my birthday. I am now sitting here, looking at what's left of my cinnamon roll. The rest is sitting happily in my belly (soon to become a different type of roll). So I'm upset. But if I have to indulge -- and indulge I did -- I'd want it to be something just as decadent and delicious.

I've been here before, and can attest to a few other things. Breakfast sandwiches are a bit greasy, a bit heavy, and super satisfying. The donut muffin is based off of cake donuts, not the fluffy kind -- just so you know what to expect. Curry chicken sandwiches are tasty and seem healthy. Beignets on Sunday are deeelish. Location is unbeatable and service always great.
author: Julie D.

description: Carrot cake was rich. Decent size for 3 bucks. Ate it while waiting for my sandwich. A pretty lengthy wait at that. But once I got my special breakfast sandwich the wait was warranted (kind of). I wouldn't come on a weekend because line and wait would be silly. But try and get lucky on the weekdays. I waited about 20 minutes for my 1 sandwich lol. Somewhat silly.
author: T G.

description:
A great recommendation from a friend and yelp reviews!! It is located in outer sunset which was where I was staying, so decided to check this place out. 

I normally don't get cinnamon rolls, but this is not your typical white cream on top cinnamon roll, it is much better. OOey and Gooey and gigantic. It was all so good! 

I also got the raspberry bar and that was very good as well and gigantic. It was fresh and tasted great. 

They had a chocolate cake, carrot cake, lemon bars, muffins, and other great sweets which I know I will be back to try it ALL. Just kidding..maybe a few visits. 

Great pastries, good size, and good price - you can't go wrong here.
author: James L.

description: I don't know what to say, everything here is f***ing delicious. Get the breakfast sandwich, get the cinnamon rolls, the iced coffee, everything. Jesus. I bought a t-shirt so I could represent.
author: Christine K.

description: Stopped here on our pm bike along Great Hiway ... Very good apple turn over and choc chip cookie...excellent selection of baked goods and sandwiches.. What we like is the ' scene' on a sunny afternoon.. Local folks and surfers.. Not the hipsters and tourists of Valencia street.
author: Robert B.

description:
Delicious baked goods!

The first time I visited, service was not good. The lady behind the counter didn't greet me, she wasn't smiling - she kinda just stood there and waited for me to order something. Maybe she was having a bad day... but it showed - which is not good. 

But the last few times coming here has made up for that. Service was excellent. The girls are welcoming, friendly, and have smiles that make you smile back. =)

I love the samples that they leave out on the small plate on the counter. I always take two or three. =P

Out of the things I've tried so far:
My favorites: carrot cake and raspberry bar.
Pretty good: chocolate chip cookie, alfajore, and cinnamon bun.
OK: lemon bar, chocolate cake, and brownie.

-1 star because the girl picked the alfajore with her bare hands and then casually took my money. I'm sure she was touching money all day, so that was really unsanitary!
author: Jen H.

description: Awesome breakfast sandwich! I had the special, and it was honestly the best breakfast sandwich I've ever had. The biscuits were warm and buttery, the bacon was super crisp(almost candied!), and generous helpings of egg and avocado. A great way to start the day!
author: Jeff C.

description:
As the kids say these days, "Yum!"  I finally got a chance to try this place with the cool name that I've been driving past for quite some time now.  Honestly, I thought it was just a bakery, not a place with "real" food, so I hadn't made an effort until my dining buddy gave me the full scoop.

Our attempt to get a quick breakfast sandwich was foiled by the 15-minute wait that we were greeted with on a late Friday morning, but it was well worth it.  I ordered the basic breakfast sandwich, which comes on a light, albeit flatter than normal, biscuit and includes very crispy bacon, the crispiness of which is unparalleled in other breakfast sandwiches.  Seriously.  It was completely crunchy, not crunchewy like most bacon, without being overcooked the way it turns out for me when I attempt the same feat at home.  The biscuit also held together through the entire consumption of the sandwich.  Often biscuits just start crumbling as you eat and make a mess, so kudos for getting it right.  Highly recommended!

I also got a couple of pastries to go:  a hefty slice of zucchini bread (visually beautiful, but a little less flavorful than I expected), and a substantial slice of chocolate cake (also visually beautiful and very tasty, though it doesn't taste any more special than generic chocolate cake with canned icing on top.)  This isn't meant as a criticism; it's just that when I buy something "ordinary" from a specialty shop, I expect it to taste different than what I could find elsewhere or what I could make at home (hence four stars instead of five).  While I wouldn't order these two pastries again, I'm eager to try some of the other items in the case.

Their coffee is also really good (not sure what brand it is).  I would have preferred there to be more than just one size (a medium, by most standards), but the wait for the food gave me time to finish one and order another, which was $.50 cheaper since I now had my own cup.  The price and quantity of two coffees roughly equaled  a single larger size at other shops.

The convenient parklet out front went through a couple of cycles of packed/half full/packed while we were waiting, but not wanting to eat off of our laps, we instead drove a few more blocks to the beach and ate standing at the sea wall with a perfect view of the ocean and a large number of surfers.

I'll definitely be back to try more yumminess from Devil's Teeth!
author: Tim D.

description: Everything I've tried is good here.  The breakfast sandwiches are very filling.  The chocolate cake is so moist.  Cookies are big.  I even like the coffee.  There are a few seats inside, but there is a parklet with benches right outside.  Gets packed on weekends, of course.
author: somel y.

description:
Love this place.  Been dropping in Sat and Sun ever since opening day -- simultaneously proud and ashamed to say.   The pecan cookie sandwiched with a schmear of dulce de leche is an otherworldy must try.  

At some point, it's too many little single-use paper boxes to throw away.  Time for a dedicated Tupperware container just to bring those treats home!
author: K W.

description: 2 words: BREAKFAST. SANDWICH.  So so so good.  My friends and I stopped by after a surf sesh.  Lots of people there, so it takes a while, but we sat outside and relaxed.  The food was worth the wait!
author: Aya S.

description:
BIG MISTAKE...
                       ...HUGE MISTAKE!!

A couple of friends were headed to Devil's Teeth Baking Company after our WW meeting and invited me to join them.  Yep, after going to Weight Watchers I headed right to the bakery.  Sort of the "Do and Undo" weight loss plan, but I digress..

I'd heard all about the killer cinnamon rolls, raspberry bars, and brownies.  I decided to try the breakfast sandwich.  A buttery, flaky biscuit overflowing with melted cheddar, fluffy scrambled eggs, and perfectly crisp bacon.  YUM!  It was the perfect morning sammie for me!  Oh yeah, did I mention it's 5 bucks??  BARGAIN!  I also ordered the "donut muffin".  That little nugget was heaven in a bag...it's a buttermilk donut covered with cinnamon sugar and baked in the oven (I think).  

I'm glad I don't live in the Sunset...this place is a bad habit in the making!  On another note, there's an amazing produce store across the street, so the WW in me, doesn't have to feel totally bad for veering off plan for an occasional treat!
author: Kim A.

description:
purty good pastries.

this review is long over due. 

I first tried Devil's Teeth Baking Company at the Grill on Fillmore- I tried their brownies which were addictive to say the least.

So upon finding out the actual store front of Devil Teeth Baking Company at Ocean Beach, I immediately made a visit. The store itself was a small shop filled with glass windows showcasing various amounts of pastries, sandwiches, and specialties-and of course my fave - the brownie. 

He ordered the coffee, egg sandwich, and for myself a brownie - a total amount of a little under $12. I thought a bit pricey for not as many things and such a drive too. But I kinda think thats kinda why Devils Teeth Baking Company is so unique.
author: C M.

description:
I'm updating my review from 3 to 4 stars, because the owner was involved enough to reach out to me concerning my experience at Devil's Teeth. Clearly, customer service is taken seriously and feedback is appreciated. Thanks! 
I live outside of the area and will be sure to stop by for a second chance if I visit San Francisco again.
author: Julie S.

description:
My uncle posted a picture of a breakfast sandwich from here and I said to myself, "I have to devour that sandwich." 

So on this wet, foggy, Saturday morning, I get off work and drive to the beach to grab this epic sandwich that has enticed me through Facebook. 

When I arrive, I am surprised how I have never noticed this place driving by or heading to dinner at Toyose next door. But alas, I am here and am ready to order. 

Normal choices of drinks to choose from and I go for my usual glass of milk. I got greedy and ordered a breakfast sandwich and a special breakfast sandwich. For a moment, I felt embarrassed ordering two sandwiches to eat. But I justify it by me working out the carbs during Kickboxing later and for my awesome opinion to form so I can put it on Yelp. 

Let me start with the location- 

Nice little bakery with wooden bars and stools. I appreciated the Green Apple books for sale for $5 at the store. The glass case is filled with pastries and cakes and bars. What I was dying to try but resisted was the cinnamon sticky bun and the lemon bar. But my goal was for the sandwich, so maybe ill do a review of those next time. 

Drinks range from coffee drinks and in the fridge I saw some fresh squeezed orange juice, a berry/mango juice, coconut water, carrot juice, and some other drinks that didnt catch my attention. I was tempted to grab the orange juice, but I went for the milk instead. 

They also sell T shirts, and sweaters representing the bakery. 

Now onto the Main Attraction....

Breakfast sandwich- melt in your mouth, buttery, cheesy goodness. The biscuit was so flaky and delicious. It reminded me a toasted croissant, but much denser and delicious. the eggs were perfectly made- basically a heaping cooking spoon of eggs that was cooked I assume in low heat with melted butter. The biscuit, cheese were cooked in the oven and bacon was pre-made on the side. It would have been nice to have crispier bacon for added texture, but hey, it is still delicious. Solid Solid Sandwich. 

Special Breakfast Sandwich- Its what the breakfast sandwich is made of plus avocado and this ranch type sauce with a bite and pepperjack cheese. This sandwich had rich flavor with the sauce and the pepperjack cheese. It compliments the biscuit and gosh, I feel like I cant go back to any other breakfast sandwich out there. 

Ill be honest, I ate those sandwiches driving home. I didnt gorge myself though, I ate half special breakfast sandwich and part of the regular one. It was truly delicious and Im glad I found this place. 

I assume the lady who I briefly talked to was the owner. She seemed very welcoming and like any true San Franciscan, seems to know everyone and anything about SF. She seems to have very good relationships with her customers and I assume that the "regulars" that frequent her bakery become more than customers. They become friends. 

Anyway, I feel bad for not introducing myself, but eventually I will go back, tackle the sweet portion of the bakery and maybe have a nice conversation with the owner. Good Job for having an awesome bakery in the neighborhood and I wish the cook a good job and good luck at the Fire Academy.
author: A L.

description: These cinnamon rolls are amazing!!! Great texture and the perfect level of sweetness. If you have a sweet tooth or love baked goods or just love eating this is a must try!!! Make sure you bring a friend- rolls are huge and you'll want to share
author: Kimberly W.

description: Made a trip out here from near the Haight for their "famous" cinnamon roll - huge, delicious warm cinnamon roll was really, really good! Worth the trip!
author: Bob P.

description: Patiently waiting for a simple BLT sandwich I over heard the following. "What are you a dirty poor immigrant?" Causing me to look up from my iPhone to see who would possibly would be saying that in the sea of white folk I was surrounded by. I'll refer to them as WYP (white young and privileged) to save space. Three WYPs laughed at their red headed friend who I guess was short on cash. But that's not why I'm giving them 1 star it's because they took our order, we paid and waited as everyone behind us got theirs. Finally, after 20 minutes we inquire just to find out the order was never made. We waited another 10 minutes to get a dried out BLT with over cooked bacon and no mayo. The tragedy a BLT with no MAYO! WTF! Just to be cleared the cashier even asked and we clearly stated our desire for mayo. Go at your own risk but I get the impression if you're part of the WYPs your golden.
author: Gee C.

description:
Cute little bake shop near the ocean breeze. Perfect to grab your cup of blue bottle and pastries and go for a nice walk.  
Lots of baked goodies. I just went straight for the apricot scones and cinnamon rolls. Indeed cinnamon rolls were flaky, buttery and sticky!  Good sized too for gluttony me.
Apricots in the scones added texture and chewiness! A good scone but not mindblowing in my opinion.
Got a good vibe from this place..yum!
author: Linda T.

description:
4.5 stars

I love this place.  I have eaten here many times now and am never disappointed with the food. I love the breakfast sandwich and usually select that, but have also had the cinnamon roll, breads, muffins, scones, and cake.  I still want to try their lunch food.

The only downside is that in my opinion their coffee is just ok. They use Bicycle Coffee Company, who I appreciate as a business, but i just don't love their coffee.  This isn't a reflection on Devil's Teeth, just a personal preference. Trouble & Andytown have better coffee in my opinion.
author: Christy L.

description:
I live around the corner. How have I not been here before today?

I ordered a small coffee and the breakfast sandwich. Let's talk about this sandwich...

Cost: $5

The top biscuit. Oh so flaky and delicious.
The large piece of cheddar cheese. Oh so cheesy. 
The eggs. Oh so fluffy and delicious.
The bacon. Oh so crisp and delicious.
The bottom biscuit. *See top biscuit*

This was an awesome sized portion. I ate it at 10:30 and I skipped lunch.  Well worth it.

Definitely will be back.
author: Ed M.

description:
I visited Devil's Teeth Baking Company for the first time, this past Sunday.  I have heard great things about their $1 beignets (every Sunday) and so my boyfriend and I made the trip over to outer Sunset.  We came probably around 10:30 a.m. and the place was packed- the line was literally out-the-door.  (The place itself isn't huge, so out-the-door means at least 10 people in line). The line did move pretty quickly, so we ordered a few beignets and a coffee.  

They serve bicycle coffee, and a regular coffee was about $2.  It was good- not amazing, but pretty good.  The coffee was a good balance to the decadent beignet.  The beignets are freshly made and so they come out hot!  They're served covered in powdered sugar, and in a brown paper baggie.  It can get messy, so beware.  I ate it in their nice outdoor seating area, in front of the shop and so the extra powdered sugar just flew away onto the street. 

It seemed like there was a delay in the beignets because it took about 15 minutes for them.  I was getting a little bit impatient towards the end of the waiting, but it was very much worth it.  I'd order them again.  I noticed that a lot of people ordered their breakfast sandwich, maybe I'll give that a try too.

Notes:
-They have samples by the register.  I tried a sticky bun or pecan roll of some sort- and it was good!
author: Samantha L.

description: How the FUCK does it take literally TWENTY FIVE MINUTES to make two breakfast sandwiches when there's no line at this place??? Ridiculous.  Otherwise exquisite sandwich.
author: Grizzle J.

description:
It's a sin not to take advantage of a rare hot day in San Francisco, so that's exactly what Jena C. and I did the other day.  Despite living within walking distance, I hadn't made the trek until now.  I didn't realize they had a little parklet outside, so that made it fun to sit in the sun and shoot the breeze.

But how was the food, you ask?  Holy crap, it was amazing!  We both had BLTs, and I ordered their lemonade.  The BLT has thick cut bacon, freshly baked and toasted sourdough, and nice fresh tomato and lettuce.  At $5.00, it was a hefty portion (just barely finished it).  You'd have to pay $7-10 downtown for something of this quality...if you could find it.  The lemonade was perfectly refreshing, neither too tart nor sweet.

I also bought a cinnamon roll to take home ($4, about 4"x4").  It was excellent, but even better reheated.  And, of course, I had to try a couple of the sample cookies... the ginger cookie was unbelievably good, and I'm usually a chocolate chip junkie.

However, I highly recommend that YOU not go, so that the sourdough (or anything else I'm craving) won't be sold out by the time I get there.  Oh, I will be back...
author: Jennie K.

description: I'm a breakfast sandwich fan and after having eaten the special breakfast sandwich at Devil's Teeth, I can say that I have a gold standard by which all other breakfast sandwiches will be judged.   Holy smokes!  The biscuit was perfectly fluffy & buttery.  Every bite brought me closer to nirvana.  It was a thing of great taste.
author: Diana D.

description:
I would have never known to try to this place had it not been for the article on sfgate.com.  It's also across the street from Noriega Produce, so I had to stop in to check it out since I was already there.

I decided to try a couple of items, in the name of science and to help out my fellow Yelpers, of course.  :)  

The oatmeal raisin cookie is divine!  Yup, there's quite a bit of butter in the cookie, but that contributed to the crispy texture of the thin cookie.  There were just enough raisins and plenty of oats.  The cookie was fresh and still warm!  Delicious!

The other item I ordered was the cinnamon bun, which I'm still working on.  It's kinda big.   Like the size of my hand.  BIG.  It's darker than your typical cinnamon bun and I was a bit worried it was overcooked.  Nope, not in the least.  The caramel is just dark, providing a rich, deep flavor to the light yeasty dough.  I didn't find it overly sweet at all, which is a plus.  Since I wasn't eating it right away, they recommended I heat it up int he microwave for 30 to 40 seconds and I wouldn't regret it. Heed that man's words if you get the bun to go!  

They carry an assortment of savory and sweet pies, cheesecakes, cookies, brownies and bars, muffins and beignets along with a breakfast sandwich.  The staff was super friendly.  Parking is a breeze on the street.   

This place is a welcome site after (before and during too!) a run/walk on the Great Highway!  That's right, it's called carbo-loading!!
author: Melissa L.

description:
Oh good lord. This place has been in my dreams ever since I tried it last weekend. The cinnamon roll = heaven. The breakfast sandwich. Oh, that breakfast sandwich. Flakey biscuity goodness with egg, cheese and thick cut bacon. Oh mama. 

I only tried two of their breakfast items, but I cannot wait to go back and try more. Their coffee was good (Bicycle), they have a great parklet outside for seating and it's close to the water. Perfect for a sunny morning outdoor breakfast treat and then a walk on the beach.
author: Jena C.

description:
Bicycle Coffee Co. 
Breakfast sandwich
BLT Sandwich
Donut Muffin
Cinnamon Bun

Can't go wrong with ANY of those options. In fact, just get all of them. Screw your diet, all that biking, surfing, yoga. Just splurge. Devil's Teeth is totally worth it. The coffee is spectacular. The breakfast sandwich is a beautiful mess of seasoned egg, crisp bacon, and melted cheese, smashed in between a dense, buttery biscuit that is sure to lead to atherosclerosis later in life. But it doesn't matter. Enjoy life now. Worry about sky-high medical bills later. The BLT sandwich is also a solid choice (although nothing special).

Finish off your meal with a donut muffin, dusted with a very liberal amount of brown sugar. But the cinnamon bun. Oh ho ho...that's where it's at. 

Please, walk down Noriega to the beach or something and burn off the calories before returning to your sedentary lives. The food here is HEAVY. But it is very much so worth it.
author: Dan K.

description:
A very friendly group of people. I do mean group because I was shocked when I seen all the people baking in the back, a staff of at least 5 bakers.
The food is pretty tasty and draws in a good crowd, just not sure how the neighbors like people literally sitting in front of their steps.

Their coffee didn't taste like Blue Bottle quality, tasted watered down, and at $2.50 seems steep.
author: M C.

description:
I'm a New Englander through and through. I will probably never live anywhere outside of New England for in my humble opinion it is the perfect place for me. What does this have to do with Devil's Teeth? The fact that it has been nearly a year since I found myself on Noriega Street in the Sunset District of San Francisco. Nearly a year since I had the best breakfast sandwich I have ever tasted in my thirty years on this planet and I'm really starting to miss that place. This small bakery is right up there with reasons for returning to Northern California, reasons like the Marin Headlands, winding coastal roads, the wonder of the Golden Gate, and Yosemite National Park. I would return to SF, perhaps not for a Devil's Teeth bacon, egg, and cheese on a biscuit alone, but certainly I would not return home again until I got one, and perhaps another or two for the road. (oh and a killer tee shirt)

THE GOOD: Everything besides the fact that it is over three thousand miles away from my house.
THE BAD: Its really far away and just because I've been really nice the wait time can be a bit of a bitch, but it is worth it.
THE UGLY: Nothing.
author: Dan F.

description: Stay away.  I live a block away I want this place's amazingness (breakfast sandwich is all that it's cracked up to be and then some) to myself.
author: Farooq K.

description: Someone asked me the other day: "What's the best breakfast sandwich in the city?" Without hesitation, I replied: "DEVIL'S TEETH BAKERY OMG!" If you're ever in the outer sunset looking for a tasty breakfast or baked goods, you have to check this place out. Awesome vibe and even better food.
author: Joe C.

description:
This place is heavenly.  I don't think I've ever had a single item here that wasn't awesome.

The BLT is amazing.  The breakfast sandwich is apparently amazing (I don't eat eggs, but the biscuits are delish and my friends always cream their pants when they eat this).  The cinnamon rolls make me question whether I died and have been living in a dream, a la that terrible movie Vanilla Sky.  The beignets are great little snacks.

This place is totally worth a visit, whether it's out of your way or not.
author: joe p.

description: I came here around 3:30 on Sunday, 30 minutes before closing time so they were all out of biscuits. I still really wanted to try the special sandwich, so I chose sourdough bread. My god it was delicious. I might continue to keep it with sourdough because it was that good. Friendly service, good food, the baked goods looked delicious but I didn't get a chance to try them.
author: Shira S.

description: I loved this place when I was in SF. I'd go there every morning. The coffee was a little on the expensive side but their pastries totally made it worth it.  The staff was super helpful and friendly and I can't wait to visit again. If you have a sweet tooth, get their cinnamon roll. If you're more of a savory person, try their bacon and beer batter muffin. Both great options in my mind! Also, their is a great parklet just outside their business to hang out at and enjoy your coffee/food.
author: Joe P.

description:
They have a great hearty breakfast sandwich of eggs, cheese, bacon in a golden flaky biscuit. Samples of a few of their baked goodies are near the register so watch out - you'll be tempted to add another item or two or three to your order on checkout. The brownie and the donut muffin were particularly good. 

In addition, they offered lemon bars, cookies, scones, cakes and lasagna all for a decent price considering this is SF. They have Blue Bottle coffee which was quite bitter that day. Young, fast, friendly, efficient staff run the place. A definite five stars in my book.
author: Esther A.

description: Yeah, tasty treats...just wish they had some tables. I love the baked goodies and especially the Breakfast sandwich! Yeah, the line is long...but go there with a friend or meet somebody while you are there...it's a social spot for sure!
author: Jason S.

description: Best breakfast spot in the area, but you gotta get there early. Food was great and so were the pastries. Biscuit sandwiches were huge and delicious. Lattes were small but good. Only drawback, no seating so you gotta take it with you.
author: David G.

description: I know most people probably go for the baked goods but I had their lasagna (veggie) and it was simply amazing ! Huge piece, super tasty, and loaded with veggie and cheese . Seriously best ever
author: Jennifer R.

description: Good food here but they could definitely use some more staff. I waited 25 minutes for my breakfast sandwich. Watched it sit on the counter for 10 minutes while they dealt with a cake order and by the time I got it, it was cold. I've come here a lot but won't return soon.
author: Peter J.

description:
Moved out of the Outersunset a few months ago and has hanging out near my old haunts and heard there was a place serving blue bottle.  I was surprised and delighted. Sea Biscuit across the street is good for mimosas and shooting the shit with locals, but the coffee blows (sorry SB)
I was so impressed walking into this bakery, all the goodies you could ever want sitting out in a case. Simple. Beautiful. Homemade. Clean. Part of me is happy this place was not open when I was living here because I would likely put on 15 pounds. Lasagna, Quiches, Breakfast sandwiches, chicken salad, and all the sweet baked goods you could ever want.
author: Chelsey G.

description: I consider myself a breakfast sandwich (bfast sand) connoisseur and I have to say, Devils teeth is probably the best I've ever had. The crowd here is always so quirky and SF and they have an awesome, unique pastry selection, but the bfast sands are where it's at. Usually a long wait for to go stuff but worth it. And they have samples!
author: Carly M.

description:
I've been getting their sweets for awhile but finally tried their BLT. It was as bonkers and I heard and lived up to its deliciousness. Their sandwich bread is perfect! Also tried the curry chicken sandwich and was pleasantly surprised. 

Gonna keep coming back here :)
author: Adrianna M.

description: OMG ... I am not a breakfast person but I am going to start eating breakfast...in love with the Special Breakfast Sandwich! Yes, it is that GOOD! or should I say GREAT!!!! Came on a Thursday at about 11ish.... lucky for us no lines, but as we sat down, lines started forming but they try to be efficient and the line did dissipate but then it started forming again.... GREAT place, smells great, taste great... the donut muffins... YUM light and not at all greasy, lemon bars... addicted... Took one of those SBS home and it is still so yummy 6 hrs later.... but like all food, best to be eaten hot!
author: Jay S.

description: Best breakfast sandwich I've ever had. And probably the best breakfast in general available in the sunset. I love living near this establishment.
author: Dakota S.

description:
That doughnut muffin? Yeah that's the devil. And the devil sure as hell knows how to make a crazy ass muffin. 

On a side note, don't eat one an hour and a half before a cycling class. The muffin likes to "linger" to remind you that no matter how hard you peddle, it says "You still ate me, I'm not gone yet!! HAHAHAHAHA!"

Good place to go when I wanna feel fat and fill up on carbs. Cuz you know, girl's gotta have her fat days. It's nice having a bakery in the neighborhood, even if it's a bit of a walk for me but guess that would make up for any yummy desserts I ate. Work it off walking home. 

5 stars.
author: imelda j.

description:
Hello again dear Devil's teeth.  I've missed you.  You were the only place I insisted on eating at during my short visit to SF.  I've literally dreamt about your BLT on a biscuit since we last met.  And I sit here, almost a week later longing to taste you again.  I'm okay with us having this long-distance romance because I know you're bad for me, but I can't resist.  

You once again deny me a taste of your beer/cheese muffins, I guess it's just not meant to be.  But you do accommodate me with that big crispy buttery biscuit substituted in the BLT that keeps me wanting more.  I generally hate lasagna as they are usually such a mushy mess, but your turkey lasagna is beautiful with distinct layers of flavor.  I'm a texture person and your goods thrill me with the right stuff. 

 I remembered how last time I did not get much because everyone inhaled all your goodies before I could have more than a sample.  This time I did a shameful thing.  I turned my back from my husband, shielding away my little cardboard treasure box that cradled the richness of your chewy caramel sticky roll, I ate quickly but my small sighs and mmmmms did not go unnoticed.  He asked me "whatcha got there?" with curiosity and suspicion.  panic creeping in as I replied in a voice too high "nothing!  I got nothin!" and I further tried to shield the roll from his view.  It was too late.  He saw the sticky bun and snatched it from my hands, I tried to explain this was the only way I felt that I could have some before it was all gone, but I could tell he felt betrayal.  This is what you've done to me Devil's Teeth!  I don't even know who I am anymore!  I bought a donut muffin for the husband (I don't care for donuts, even when they masquerade as other pastries or baked goods) but he had to have both. hmmmpfh!

I also enjoyed your big molasses-ey ginger cookie, but I would actually warn it is kind of too big.  It took me 3 days of nibbling to finish it.  It was delicious to the last day, stayed chewy and the little pockets of ginger chunks were a welcome surprise.
author: Sj C.

description: If you are looking for a quick, easy and delicious breakfast, this is the place! The breakfast sandwich is simple but amazing. Great biscuit with crispy bacon and perfectly cooked eggs for a great value. The pastries are good as well. Do yourself a favor and try the doughnut muffin.
author: Matthew L.

description:
Devil's Teeth is in my neighboorhood.  I'm an SF Bay Area native, and have been in the Sunset particularly for 5+ years.  Devil's Teeth was pretty much an instant hit.  I suppose people can't deny quality food - simple and done right.

Some of the delicious treats I've had here:  (and would order again and again)
- Breakfast sandwich--two eggs scrambled, with cheddar cheese, applewood smoked bacon, on our homemade buttermilk biscuit. 
- BLT
- Chicken curry salad sandwich
- Banana cream puffs, carrot cake, chocolate cake, etc.
- any cookies, muffins, scones, etc.

I still need to try the lasagna, pies and various other baked goods.

It's best to grab 'n go, and that's also the beauty of this place.  But there is a parklet right outside if you want to take a seat and immediately consume your food.  
Arizmendi also has the same kind of setup with simple food done right and a parklet outside.
author: Kay N.

description: Wow great and fresh cinnamon rolls,really gooie and carmelized , quiche is fantastic, and the banana cream pie is just right. The thin layer of chocolate is just right. Love this beautiful city and all it offers. There is a small area with bench seating and chalk for kids too play and draw.
author: P C.

description:
Love having a bakery with such amazing food in my neighborhood. When it first opened it was usually pretty quiet but it has become very successful and typically has lines now. The service is great and the employees seem like they enjoy working there. Not many places to sit inside but the parklet outside is great on nice days.  

Everything I've tired is incredible, but my personal favorite it the lemon bars. They are consistently amazing and everyone seems to love them. Coffee had always been good as well, though sometimes it can be bit of a wait. 

Only four stars because one time I went in and the owner or maybe manager was yelling at an employee on the floor in front of everyone. Seemed pretty unprofessional not to pull them into the back if you had a problem with their work. Made me feel a little uncomfortable to be in there, almost like I was interrupting something.
author: Rebecca O.

description: I forgot the name of this place after I ate the best Cinnamon Roll ever! I've been raving about it to friends but the name of this place always eluded my memory. Six months later, I remembered the name and here I am. The Cinnamon Roll... that's what I will go back for.
author: Natansh V.

description: The donut muffin, which is what I'd bookmarked them for, was underwhelming. Too messy to eat, and I should've asked if I could have it heated up, because cold, it was not great. The breakfast sandwich, however, was really good, and is what bumps it up to 3 stars -- probably wouldn't go out of my way to get it again, but if I were relatively close, it would definitely be a great quick and easy breakfast option. The biscuit for the sandwich was what made it stand out - not too dense like biscuits can tend to be. Perfect balance of fillings (bacon, cheese, egg). Add some hot sauce and you're good to go :)
author: Kathy L.

description: Special Breakfast Sandwich - Best in breakfast sandwich in San Francisco. The added bonus is that it is only $6.75. That alone warrants a 5 star review, but the rest of the baked goods, just delish. The cinnamon role, beignets, donut muffins - all winners.
author: Bret B.

description: Their Special Breakfast Sandwich is the most amazing breakfast sandwich I have had yet. Line was out the door, but they wait wasn't too bad, and I enjoyed a big chocolate chip cookie for breakfast in the meantime. This business is potentially a 5-star in my mind, but I want to try more of its pastries before I upgrade my rating. Definitely worth trying out. The only problem is the location. Its pretty far out there, my friend drove me, I wish this was closer to a main Muni line or somewhere in Downtown SF.
author: Bryan M.

description: I have a sweet tooth for Devil's Teeth! This bakery is incredibly popular as there are always people buying some baked goodness. Really now....what is not to love? They have a great selection of breads, pastries, cakes, pies, cookies, cupcakes, sammiches, quiches, and more! This is me: Enter DT. Look at all the goodies. Drool drool drool. Must eat. Must eat. I usually go for the sweet instead of savory. Great neighborhood bakery to pick up bfast, lunch, dessert or a treat just 'cuz.  The ladies behind the counter are very friendly as well.
author: Liv A.

description:
If it's your first time here, you should definitely take your first bite of their sweet beingets. It's kinda like a donut, but from heaven. Be careful when you take it out of the bag though, bcus I'm pretty sure my fingers got burned from it being too hot. But it's a good thing, considering that it's proven fresh and it came straight from the oven. It's sweet, soft & puffy, and really messy. Don't forget about the cinnamon rolls too. One of the best I've had. 

BLT & breakfast sandwiches? I'd admit I thought both sandwiches were kinda small for the price I paid, but looks are definitely deceiving. It's fresh and super compact & portly, full of bacon and diabetes. If you wanna redeem yourself from this greasy guilty pleasure, there's a fresh produce market across the street so you can buy yourself some apples.
author: Lauren L.

description: Manager reached out after my last visit and was very apologetic. Giving this place a better review now.
author: Boaz N.

description:
I finally had the breakfast sandwich and it was so good but so heavy in the stomach. I couldn't eat anything for the while day! The biscuit was light and Flaky but didn't crumble which was good, lots of cheese and egg and Bacon.
I think I'm over the cinnamon bun I was so obsessed with. Had a few bites the next day its a bit too buttery and sugary for me now, time to try something new
author: Karen T.

description: The product is excellent the wait is 45 minutes if you want a cup of coffee or a baked good. Go there FULL because you will be starving by the time you get your breakfast sandwich.
author: thea v.

description: Food is amazing but service is awful. They forgot my order and I had to remind them. All while they had 10 or so workers in the shop mostly talking to each other. I won't be back. Terrible first impression
author: James W.

description:
My stepdaughter is 17 this weekend. She's a savvy customer, with really good senses of what she likes and what's good. When we talked about her birthday cake a couple of weeks ago, she told us exactly what she wanted: "Just a solid chocolate cake." 

I had no idea at the time how hard it would be to find one of those in San Francisco. But Devil's Teeth makes one -- and it is one hell of a good cake: deep devil's food cake layers with a rich, fudgy frosting (we got the ganache). 

It's exactly what she wanted. It's perfect.

The traditional bakery (a neighborhood place that makes bread, pastries, sweet things, and special-occasion cakes, on a daily basis) is harder and harder to find, at least in my home city. It's been replaced by dim-sum-plus-bakeries, and gourmet outposts with high prices and restricted hours. Devil's Teeth might even be one of the latter, not that I care at the moment. This cake is so good, I don't even care that I had to drive way across town and pick it up before 4.

It helped that it was a beautiful sunny afternoon, with that salty tang in the air and the feeling of summers long past. Devil's Teeth Baking Company has my cake, and my number. I will totally be back.
author: Anne B.

description:
New Favorite Bakery - Devil's Teeth Baking Company.

$1 Beignets on Sundays are to die for. I've never had better beignets...for a $1. Think about it...McChicken or Devil's Teeth Beignet? Bag of Doritos or Devil's Teeth Beignet? I rest my case.

I also love love love their breakfast sandwiches. Avocado. Cheese. Eggs. Awesomeness. The rich combination just melts in your mouth as you scream for more, more, MORE!

Oh...and I have to mention that their cinnamon rolls are out of this world as well. I'm used to eating $1 cinnamon buns from the local donut store that satisfies my hunger but definitely not my palate. Their cinnamon rolls can be shared amongst 3 people and will not only fill you up, but create a new sweet tooth for you that keep you yearning for more.

And the staff here are amazing. Great and friendly people. 

What more can you ask for? 5 stars.
author: David W.

description: Best breakfast sandwich in recent memory
author: Dustin P.

description:
If I lived out here, I'd probably be a regular. But, I don't and it's not quite good enough for a special trip across town.
I liked the scones, cookies were huge and looked good, beignet were hot and sweet and CHEAP. Lemon bars really really good ( probably the best thing I tried.) BUT sadly, coffee was not good, which was a shame.  Good baked goods deserve good coffee.
author: El B.

description: A little bit out of the way if you don't live in the hood, but very much worth the trek. The special breakfast sandwich is delicious and their coffee is the business (Bicycle Roasters). Get a shark cookie while you're at it. Can't wait to try other items (donut muffin, cookies). Staff is friendly by SF cafe standards and their prices are great.
author: tanuki c.

description:
Beignet Sunday may become a regular thing. Be willing to wait though, they're cut and cooked to order, then put into little paper bags with powdered sugar for you to shake and distribute the sweetness to your hearts content. Delicious. 

We also tried:  
-the bacon-beer-cheese-chives muffins were good. Best heated with butter. 
-the donut muffins were ok. It tasted like a good cake donut covered with cinnamon sugar. 
-sour dough bread is very good. Not too sour, with good density and lovely crust. We got a half round. Next time it'll be a sandwich loaf. 

Also next time: a breakfast sandwich. They were flying over the counter as fast as the coffee and beignets.
author: Christi R.

description: After all the hype I really expected more, at least from the beignets on Sunday. But I went late and they seemed to be sold out of many things. The donut muffin was pretty damn good. The beignets we're just ho hum, way too much powdered sugar, but perhaps that's the style, basically a deep fried snowball. But all up, it's a great spot near the beach, with a really nice parklet, friendly staff and a solid coffee/tea offering. I'll definitely give it another go around.
author: casey c.

description:
Breakfast sandwich was super good. According to the friendly staff member, it is their most popular item on the menu and after trying one out for myself...I understand why! It's deliciousness in every bite. It was cheap too considering how much eggs, bacons and cheese you get! Only $5 + tax. 

The only downside would have to be the seating arrangements.  Not too many chairs inside, maybe about 5-6. However, there are a couple of benches outside. 

Will definitely be coming back for the breakfast sandwich again!
author: Lisa L.

description: So happy we are here on a Sunday for the beignets, freshly made, comes out hot, needing a napkin to hold, so delicious! Love that I live just 8 blocks away!
author: Cindy L.

description: Prepare to zombie out on kale parmesan scones! This place is a little bit of heaven. Like, they actually know how to, you know, BAKE. If you don't like to wait for your food to be prepared from scratch with real, wholesome ingredients, you can go elsewhere. If you want to bliss out on pastries or egg-bacon-avocado biscuit sandwiches with everyone else on a lackadaisical seaside morning while you sip your coffee, this is your place. And BTW, if you're in a hurry, there are always fresh, ready-made cookies, cakes, scones, and muffins to eat if you choose not to wait. ;)
author: Aubrey H.

description:
BEST BREAKFAST SANDWICH

Big fluffy, buttery biscuit with fluffy scrambled eggs, two THICK slices of BACON and melted chedder cheese!?!?! What more could you ask for? maybe more bacon? I'm pretty sure if you ask for more, they'll give you more.  The breakfast sandwich is huge as well, its not some tiny little sandwich from Mcdonalds or Burger King, this breakfast sandwich is the real deal.  It's a great way to start the day, or get your daily dose of bacon.  It's also really cheap, I can't remember the exact price, but I'm pretty sure its $5.  For the price, it's well worth it.  You will not be disappointed. 

Oh yeah they also have a lot of baked goods as well.  The chocolate chip peanut butter cookie is very good, bacon beer muffin is very good as well.  They bake their own bread, they use it on their sandwiches and they sell it by the loaf and half a loaf.  The bread is very good, a nice crunchy crust with a soft fluffy inside.  Makes a great sandwich.  It literally spits on all the slice breads they sell at markets, I'm not quite sure if I could ever go back to the packaged sliced bread.  

BEST BREAKFAST SANDWICH - get it
author: Darren W.

description: The special breakfast sandwich was pretty good, and pretty gianormous. You can't really move after you eat it. I really like the sauce and cheese, but I think it's missing sausage. I thought the biscuit McDonalds uses is better. However, the quiche and cinnamon roll were excellent even reheated in the oven.
author: Matthew P.

description:
OK when hung over and desperate.  The general disorganization and long wait for basics keeps me away when I am sober.  Most of the time I have to go in after 15 min to check on the status of my order.... 

My suggestion - time to revamp the interior and make some more space so that your racks of pastries are not a dividing wall from the milk & sugar bar.  Also go to other small bakeries & cafes to learn how to keep an organized ticket for the kitchen.  

One other downside is that there are hardly any GF options.  I think the following options sum it up: Granola with milk or granola parfait, bowl or eggs (icky name) or soup.  Did you miss out that most bakeries reap $ from GF folks by charging them more for something simple like a cookie?  

I will admit that the parklet was a nice addition to the neighborhood vibe.  The people all seem nice enough they just need some guidance.
author: Mary J.

description: Stopped in off the street. Fantastic coffee & massive breakfast sandwich. You won't be unhappy you stopped in. Everything looked delicious.
author: Katie W.

description: Fabulous cinnamon rolls and breakfast sandwiches! Also had the German apple cake, and it was delicious as well. Great bakery! Don't miss this one
author: Amy H.

description:
Been here ONCE but it made one heck of an impression on me, so I would definitely come back. 

First off, I LOVE that there is a one hour parking zone nearby (harder and harder to come by in San Fran-freakin'-cisco). Ding!

OK, the food: On this particular day they had a special breakfast sandwich featuring bacon, avocado, cheese and eggs. It took a bit of time to get but my first indication that this would be worth the wait was noticing the heft during the all important sandwich hand off. Not only was this sandwich hearty, it was well put together (I hate crumbly, dry biscuit sandwiches that fall apart when you try to eat them). 

I also had a couple of bites, of the ham/bacon/tomato cheddar bacon quiche. Yeah I know I wrote bacon twice (http://www.caption-of-the-day.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/02/thank-you-little-piggy.jpg). I can still taste the bacon as I write this (drool). Very meaty. Very satisfying. Bacon :)

We split a cinnamon bun. I've had bad experiences with these before (at other places): diabetic shock inducingly sweet on top, dry-as-a-used dish sponge on the bottom. Not one bit the case here. The bun was sweet but not overly sweet. and the bread was warm, soft, moist (oooh!), and buttery. Mouthgasm!

I'm not much of a breakfast person because I like to be smart about my money (my friends say cheap, but I say smart), and I usually end up feeling ripped off at breakfast places. I felt very satisfied by this visit. It was well worth it.
author: Jose U.

description: Funky cool little spot.  Carrot cake.  Lemon bars.  Egg and Biscuit sandwich.
author: Eliot Z.

description:
Just TOP NOTCH high quality bakery items, breakfast & lunch sandwiches, at extremely reasonable prices.  Lines on the weekends go around the corner, but they move fast, so it really is worth the wait.  Eat outside on the benches/tables w/ your dogs!  (My favorite companions.)   
- breakfast sandwich: bacon,egg & chedder on buttery biscuit - YES (you only need one, and will finish the rest for lunch the next day) 
- bacon, cheddar & beer muffin: excellent, filling, yes you can taste the beer! They do have green onions & slices of jalapenos in them too, which I pull out because I'm a wuss, but they add extra kick.  And they go fast. 
- peanut brittle - better & cheaper than See's. 
- chocolate cake - rich, moist, decadent, amazing.

Here's how nice they are - my bf went to get me some comfort food since I was sick, and they were out of the muffins, so they sent him home with a big, fat piece of choc cake to make me feel better.  And they don't know me!  Soooo nice.  Plan to eventually try everything.
author: Charly K.

description:
Bicycle Coffee anyway you like it almost. And plenty of smiles from the cute guys and gals here. The staff has great love for their food and a keen lively spirit. Their scones, cookies, quiche -- all top notch.

Visit here often - it's worth the drive cause there's always parking... plus you get to walk along the ocean!
author: Ron W.

description:
Devil's Teeth brings life and delicious eats to the Outer Sunset. And a place for you to sit a while in the form of a parklet. It's nice to have people sitting outside in our neighborhood. It's also very Sunset, with the name representing the Farallones, which appear to look like jagged teeth.  

I would highly recommend purchasing a cake here as well.  For $40, they will bake you an amazingly delicious cake, and decorate to your specs. We requested a rainbow and goose, and it looked amazing!  Normally, I bake my own cakes, but in a pinch, Devil's Teeth does the trick!

My favorite Teeth items are: scones, breakfast sandwiches, ginger cookie, brownie, and donut muffin. I absolutely love their cinnamon rolls, even though the buttery center is even more buttery than I would normally like. I will not take stars away for too much butter. That's insane.  

Let's get more stuff like this out here, but don't tell the hipsters.
author: Ashley S.

description:
Definitely worth the trip out to Ocean Beach! Was in search for a delicious, highly rated breakfast sandwich, and found it! I wish the biscuit was slightly less dense, but that didn't detract too much. On one of the sandwiches ordered, asked for no bacon and they offered a tomato instead, which would have been perfect! Except we didn't get the tomato, so minus one star.

Had a sample of the donut muffin at the register, will definitely get one of those next time!
author: Paul H.

description:
Breakfast Sandwich. WOW.

My roommate and I couldn't even form proper sentences in the duration of our breakfast. The biscuits, aioli sauce, avocado, jack cheese, bacon... I could go on forever but I'll stop now. You get the point.

Must spend the extra $1.50 for the Special. It's simply not the same without it.

Their cookies, cakes, tarts, scones, and muffins are equally to die for. 

Be warned: This is a place that will quickly become a guilty pleasure.
author: Lesley S.

description:
I'm new to this whole posting reviews thing. This is officially my first after being a long time Yelp user.

This review is mostly for the breakfast sandwich. It's essentially perfect. I like to go around collecting stories of the best this or that. This place absolutely has the best breakfast sandwich. 

The biscuit is dense, yet flakey, the way a biscuit should be. The bacon, oddly, is a perfect mix between thick, but crispy. I love bacon just as much as the next guy, but I hate the new trend of overpowering people with bacon. This sandwich does not do that. Everything in harmony, nothing in excess. The cheese is great, based on taste, I believe it to be cheddar, likely of the sharp or medium sharp persuasion. It melts straight into the egg, which is fluffy, yet substantial. The egg is perfectly seasoned. Overall the best breakfast sandwich around. It's not much to look at, but are you going to frame it or are you going to eat it? Exactly....

I've had a few baked goods there. They are fine. Not necessarily exceptional, but good. This is not a commercial establishment, it's clearly a small operation, so don't complain about the wait, just go to a fast food joint instead because you clearly hate your mouth. And like they say about the most interesting man in the world: if you don't agree with him, it's because you are wrong. And if I had to guess, I would guess that he would love this breakfast sandwich.
author: N A.

description:
OH. MAN. I have tried some sorta tasty treats from Devil's Teeth in the, but last week I have discovered THE BEST of the shop! 

Rasberry Bar
(I was iffy about buying this... BUT I AM SO HAPPY I BOUGHT THIS ARGHALDWARF I think it's my new favorite treat!--it even tasted good when I got sick later that weekend, and nothing tastes good when I'm sick!) It has this dense cookie-like base sandwiching the fruitiest, sweetest (not the icky, overly sweet-sweet), freshest tasting rasberry jam you ever did have with this ridiculously awesome, thick, chunky crumble on top. I want...

Apricot Scone
I am like a scone nazi. I am so freaking picky about scones. I have never had a decent scone anywhere. There has only been one scone recipe that I've liked my whole life and nothing could compare to it. Until I tried DT's apricot scone. It's got CHUNKS of apricot and pieces of like granola or something in it. It's a freaking tea party in my mouth. Currant was equally yummy, just not quite as fresh-fruit-filled-feeling.

Shark cookie
Since DT has sharks basically all over their store, I should have figured that their Shark Sugar Cookies would be phenomenal. They are perfect. Iced, yes, but not sickeningly so. Crispy, yet doughy and fresh? Oh, yes. Rock hard or stale and stick-to-the-roof-of-your-mouth-cake-y? Never.

Peanut Butter Cookie
Perfect. This cookie makes peanut butter taste so good (and it's already basically ambrosia on its own). Texture is spot on--not dry and crumbly, chewy but not annoyingly so, and its thick enough where you can dig your teeth into to get that perfect "sink your teeth" feeling

Can't wait to try the lemon bar and banana cream pie-puff next :9
author: Alice R.

description: So delicious! The biscuits for the breakfast sandwiches are ridiculous! Lemon bars and beignets are great! And the coffee, especially the French press, is great too!
author: Liz R.

description: Beignet Sunday's. Just a nice place to be on a sunny, Sunset, Sunday afternoon.
author: Timothy L.

description: I'm glad the goodness of the breakfast sandwich I bit into this morning wasn't just a dream. I totally get the hype over it and have officially rendered this a weekly routine. I tried to come yesterday so I could try the Sunday Beignets, but it was crowded as expected and my dogs didn't look like they had the patience to wait in line with me. Hopefully I'll get to try those soon. In the meantime I shall return for the beauty that is their biscuit egg and bacon smothered in housemade hot sauce.
author: Puka N.

description:
Really, really, really good bakery and coffee shop. Grabbed a beignet (one of the cheaper menu items) and my friend snarfed one of their enormous breakfast sandwiches. Both of us liked their coffee. Friend ended up sharing the breakfast sandwich with her girlfriend since it was large enough to be a two-person item.

A bit of a line snaked out the door, but it moved quickly, and more importantly, the counter staff were fast and friendly with handling each of us in line. Given it was a sunny day with little wind, we made use of their sidewalk seating and played with everyone else's puppies. Would easily recommend a visit to here. I'd like to go back one more time to be able to give it 5-stars. Street meter parking was decently available.
author: Paul F.

description:
Beignet Sundays! Be there or be square. Made fresh when you order, these hot mini fried donuts dipped in powdered sugar is absolutely mouth-watering delicious. So bad for you but so good. It is only $1 each and only available on Sundays. 

I also had a blondie (brownie) and it was really soft and moist. A lot of customers seem to order the breakfast sandwich. I will have to come back and try it as well as their coffee. 

Can't wait for next Sunday so I can eat more beignets!
author: Terry D.

description: I was staying at an Airbnb nearby and decided to get some coffee before going sightseeing. The coffee is good, probably the same quality as most coffee shops but the best part was a sweet potato and pecan pie that they had. Just the right amount of sweetness and absolutely delicious. Stop by for the atmosphere and their baked goods!
author: Niraj P.

description:
Being that this area is very limited of food options, I really adore that this is here! Devil's Teeth allows me to choose from sweets to a nice lunch. The service is sweet and but I always make the mistake of going on TUESDAYS! They are closed on TUESDAY! However, the door was open today [Tuesday] but since I saw an open door, I walked in (I forgot what day it was). I was immediately drawn in because I heard them playing BIG Punisher feat. Joe - I'm Not A Player (I just crush a lot). RAD. Then, reality snapped when I saw them unloading and I said, "aww, you're closed?" And got a.. "yeah, we're closed". That was MY bad, but check this place out!

*Continue* to stay kind to your customers and keep providing us with the goods and tunes, can't go wrong!
author: Sweets N.

description:
For vegans and those observant of Kosher, don't eat the "dog treats"! They contain bacon.

The beer/cheddar/chive/bacon muffins were excellent. Can't wait to have more form here.
author: Ray D.

description:
One year later and I find myself writing an update review all while wishing I could give Devil's Teeth more than just 5 stars! 

I still come here which says a lot for this establishment since I'm Ms. Non-committal when it comes to food joints. Though they changed their coffee from Blue Bottle to Sightglass to now Bicycle, I still appreciate and applaud them for wanting to better themselves. Coffee is quite important! 

Here's what I normally horde...purchase from Devil's Teeth:

- A cup of their French Press coffee
- Beer cheddar onion bacon muffins (yes, plural) 
- Breakfast sandwich if I'm hungry (but I'm always hungry!)

And if I allow myself to have sweets, I purchase:
- A scone, any scone
- Monkey bread 
- Lemon bar
- Blondie

If you haven't been here yet, what in the world are you waiting for..? There's even sidewalk chalk for big kids like me!
author: Heidi C.

description:
Hit or miss. The free samples up by the register are a great idea, and as far as I could tell, they put out their best products - good for them! I love the logo, so I was surprised to find myself a bit disappointed by the bakery's aesthetic. The open kitchen was interesting, but the industrial-sized cans of spices and tomato sauce are not so appealing. A stereo was tuned to a bad, bad oldies station instead of the typical hipstery Pandora station I would have expected. I was pleased with the variety of offerings, but they did seem variable, to my taste at least.

***** Donut muffin - perfect. The muffins are on the small side - more like what I make at home, rather than those coffeeshop monstrosities. For the donut muffin, this provides the perfect surface:interior ratio to provide enough sugar&cinnamon on the outside to flavor the luscious donutty inside. This brought back memories of cinnamon-sugar cake donuts at childhood apple pickings. Spot on.

**** Breakfast sandwich - superior biscuit with made-to-order eggs - great. I would have preferred the cheddar cheese to be shredded, which would allow it to melt rather than sit lump-like on the eggs. The bacon was undercooked for me.

***Lemon bar - this was unlike any other lemon bar I've had, and not really in a good way. It was almost entirely crust with a very thing layer of lemon on the top, dusted with powdered sugar. I would have preferred it to be more lemony, both in volume and flavor.

Chocolate cake - this came in slab form, with a thin layer of chocolate cake topped by a thick layer of chocolate frosting. The frosting was very chocolatey and rich, while the cake was fairly forgettable. I would have preferred if this cake were a little fancier and layered.

** Cinnamon roll - tough dough without much going on. I'd have preferred it to be fluffier and richer. We actually tasted this and promptly abandoned it, which is pretty unusual.

If I were in the neighborhood I'd stop by, but I won't go out of my way for it again.
author: Lisa K.

description:
My first time here on Sunday after reading some great reviews.  I tried their breakfast sandwich and a cinnamon roll.  The breakfast sandwich is as good as everyone says it is.  And I'm not a fan of biscuits much.  They usually tend to be heavy, salty, dense and not very tasty.  But this bfast biscuit is awesome.  Light and flaky and tasty.  It comes with eggs, bacon (thick and very little fat), and cheddar cheese.  Yummm....for $5.00.  I will go back for sure and become a regular from now on. 

Their cinnamon roll ($4.00) was not very good.  Too dense and heavy, though the cinnamon is quite good.  It is thinly rolled dough wrapped into a large square (over 4 inches across).  The icing is bland and doesn't add much to the overall product.  I will be sure to try some of their other pastries in the future.  Even though I really went for the cinnamon roll, and it was disappointing, the breakfast sandwich more than made up for it.

The service was fantastically speedy and polite for being so early in the morning.  Clearly these folks are not night owls like me....lol.  Which in this business is a good thing.  I've heard that there are morning people out there who wake up early and shine brightly.  This confirms those rogue reports.
author: Kevin R.

description: i'd like to know why i've called 25 times the past three mornings and the phone has been completely ignored. i obviously have an important question and need a response.
author: Thao T.

description: This small bakery already had a line running out the door at 10 in the morning, which I took as a good sign. I tried the DONUT MUFFIN and CINNAMON ROLL, which totaled up to about $7. Both were great! I'll have to come back to try the Breakfast Sandwich!
author: Tiffany N.

description:
Out of control amazing food, coffee, and sweets, with super nice people working there!

My favorites:
Special brekkie sandwich $6.50
Lemon bar $3.00 
Raspberry bar $3.00
And... Pretty much all the cookies
BROWNIES
Um... I know I'm forgetting everything else.
EVERYTHING IS DELICIOUS. 
Oh! Cinnamon roll!
And I'm waiting to try the beignets. 

Or if you're trying to be super healthy you can just ask for a piece of toast from a freshly baked loaf of bread -- and get avocado and tomato on it. Yummmm

Great coffee too. My wife and I come here multiple times a week. It's our home away from home by the ocean.
author: Toby B.

description: Special breakfast sandwich=perfection. The lemon poppyseed scone was also delicious! Don't be discouraged by the long line...it moves quickly and is definitely worth the wait!
author: Emma B.

description:
Winner.

Not quite. I was thirty minutes behind the fastest runner. But the guy behind the counter, after seeing my Bay To Breakers medal, encouraged me to say I won anyway.

Could have done that. But I was too distracted by what else the guy behind the counter was doing. Filling my bag with:

- Donut muffin (wow delicious)
- Homemade granola (wow portion size)
- Chicken curry sandwich on homemade bread (wow grapes and nut pieces)
- Blondie brownie (wow cookie dough)
- Bicycle coffee (wow smooth)

I might not have won the race. But I won with the post-race meal.
author: Jason B.

description:
First, off I could have done without the attitude from the guy taking orders. That alone spoiled the whole experience. And, I'm pretty sure nail polish on anyone working in a place that serves food is a health code violation. Just saying.

They had items like brownies, lemon bars, cheesecake, and cookies but nothing unique stuck out. I would've liked to come back to see what else they have on other days but first impressions go a long way with me.
author: Lisa G.

description: I love how happy the baristas here are. The coffee is not the best that I've had, but their selection of sweets is the reason I keep craving this place. The beignets are fluffy and amply coated with confectioners sugar. The lemon bars are to die for (though they can get sickeningly sweet after a few too many bites). And their pies are perfection. Seating is limited, however (essentially no indoor seating because the inside is always packed full of people; only seating is outside in a makeshift park), making it rather inconvenient for doing work or reading. I would come here for the sweets and casual hangouts with friends.
author: Mimia W.

description:
BEST BREAKFAST SANDWICHES EVER
i am hooked! 

The people who work here are so sweet and polite....I am obsessed with this place! I come almost every weekend and I bring anyone who comes to visit me in SF.
author: Annie C.

description: Changed my review from 1-star to 3 because of the owner's quick response to the review and situation. My husband went back today and got the baked goods. He said service was a lot better and he was in and out within 5 minutes (granted this was at 9am on a Sunday). I'd be willing to give it 4-stars, but would have to wait till we order something comparable to last time's order (grilled cheese and soup) to see how things have improved.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
It's Sunday, that means beignets!

Made to order & buried in a pile of confectioner's sugar, these little pillows of goodness were slightly overcooked & a little bit too dense; but they weren't oily or heavy.

Now that I've gotten to try some of the sweet treats, maybe something savory is next.
author: Karen S.

description:
I recently found this place on Yelp and since I was in the area and it was beignet Sunday (I love beignets!) I decided to give this place a try.  I ordered a breakfast sandwich and a couple of beignets.  The breakfast sandwich ($5 and not that big of a portion) was yummy and so were the beignets ($1 each and a good size).  Everything in the display case looked really good, and I would love to come back and try something else as well as come back for the sandwich and beignets.

Not quite 5 stars though - there is no organized line and people who came in after me ended up cutting either knowingly or not.  If this gets sorted out (and I hope it does!), and any other items I try later are as tasty, I can see myself adding another star.  Still, definitely worth giving a try if you are in the area or even to make a trip out here.
author: Carnita M.

description: If you know what's up, I needn't say any more. Best breakfast sandwich in San Francisco, hands down.
author: Anon E.

description:
Great place! The staff is super nice every time I'm there. The coffee and all the baked goods are amazing! If you are in for a cal-fest I recommend the breakfast sandwich. They even have a yummy carrot juice and fresh squeezed oj.  
My friend had a cheesecake made that will knock your socks off!!!

GET IN THERE!!!
author: Sara S.

description:
Down for Devils Teeth anytime.

Went with a couple colleagues; we arrived just minutes before they closed.  I had been praying that they didn't run out of carrot cake.  Reverently praying!

NO CARROT CAKE.  I don't see carrot cake in the display case.  I set into Plan B - try the banana cream puff, then get really gluttonous and get a slice of the pear berry pie...and then stop as I see my co-workers glance at me with cocked eyes. 

Then THEN MY FINGERS HIT THE GLASS.  Literally.  My right hand flew up and my nails hit the glass creating a stinging sound, resounding through the air.  

"CARROT CAKE," I almost whimper, but it's loud.  Through the glass, I see a lone piece of carrot cake sitting on a baking pan.  

"Can...can I get that slice??"  

AWWWWW YEAHHHHHHH.
author: Michelle L.

description: Great place to grab a bite for breakfast or lunch. My go to is usually a bacon cheddar muffin and a scone, both of which are delicious. The breakfast sandwich is always a good choice as well and their BLT is the perfect choice for lunch.
author: Chris M.

description:
Figures after we moved from the Outer Sunset a great bakery would open up.  This is a great bakery.  Not high-falutin' like Tartine (now there's a solid grip on the palettes and hearts of baked-goods lovers) but totally excellent dude in it's own way.

Let's say - BISCUITS! Wahoo!  Let's say - CHOCOLATE CAKE! Wahoo!   Let's say - CARROT CAKE! Wahoo times two!!  

The only thing we've tried at DT that wasn't a 5, but could be without much change, was a recommended chicken salad sandwich.  Generous and in the right direction, but a bit one-dimensional flavor-wise.  Guys, we're open to doing some food consulting and we'll accept bake goodies as payment!

Seriously, this is a major revitalization for ol' Noriega Street near the Ocean.  There's even a great parklet out front.  Perfect!
author: Bob K.

description:
Devils' Teeth is awesome.
From the breakfast sandwich, to the pastries to the parklet in front- this place delivers.
author: Dan K.

description:
4.5 Stars - 1/2 star off for lack of seating 

VIBE 
This place is busy. But really cozy. It seems like everyone congregates here on a weekend morning. Even on a Monday morning, people were hanging out. 
Staff are friendly and perky but not in a saccharine way. I like the outdoor bench. You get a sense of community there. 

I ATE 
First, I came here for the $1 beignet special on Sunday morning. WORTH IT! Donuts are small but HOT out of the oven. Yum! 
Then I came back for the breakfast sandwich. Egg? Yeaah. Melted cheddar cheese? Yeaah. Fluffy biscuit? Yeaaah. It's very hearty and filling for breakfast and under $6. Perfect. 
Note: if you're eating this on the Pacific ocean, you may have seagulls as your dining mates. 

OBLIGATORY CATCHY REMARK 
If this is what hell tastes like, I want to shake hands with the devil.
author: Natalie T.

description:
Places like this are not as unusual in the Outer Sunset district of delightfully chilly San Francisco as they are everywhere else in the world. But that won't stop me from recognizing that Devil's Teeth, too, deserves five stars.

After doing the 1.5 mile swim from Alcatraz and a 7 mile run over the Golden Gate Bridge and back, my sister drove me out here on the way back to her house. Still with my running shorts and race bib on, we parked on the street and got in line. It was an Outer Sunset type of line, too, squeaky clean people in fleece and young beach bums with smiles, everyone standing about a foot apart, no one in a hurry but the line naturally moving fast on its own. With nowhere to sit and dine in, there was no din of conversation, no clacking of computer keys, no extra crowding from people hovering around looking for butt parking. This In word, perfect. 

There were trays and displays of endless pastries and breads that the city is known for churning out, like the fantasy factory in the clouds that it is. Soup steam and eau d' quiche also wove through the air, but powdered sugar, floury contours, and tantalizing aromas didn't distract my focus. All I wanted was a scrambled egg, bacon, and cheddar breakfast sandwich in a biscuit. 

In the middle of a line, a man started chatting to us, with a young boy and girl tucked in under his arms, and his smiling wife steps away. He asked me what event I'd just finished. He congratulated me, saying he was training for this or that run or swim or bike or all three...I told him my sis was going to run the marathon the very next weekend for the fifth time, and the whole family went into ululations of admiration. 

After that healthful socialization, we were up to bat. Soon, I had two heavy biscuit sandwiches in foil in my grubby fists, and we raced home. Risking the cooling of the sandwich, I raced to shower the salt crystals of the bay water and my own sweat off my body before devouring the gigantic biscuit sandwich.

I was clean, relaxed, and satiated, savoring every last savory composite crumb of four perfectly balanced elements (fatty meat, dairy, more dairy, and carbs). The total effect also had a hint of sweetness, whether imagined or residual from the bakery's sugar dusted atmosphere or from interaction of the ingredients with the Pacific see breeze blowing and into every corner of the house. 

Perhaps the elation of finishing a race, seeing my sister, and being in an awesome area heavily biases me towards my praise for Devil's Teeth. Then again, that the business enhanced my already perfect day, is a big deal when most transactions at heavily demanded businesses often bring you crashing down to Earth. 

If someone asked me to choose between Devil's Teeth and Java Beach (separate review), I would give the same reply I do when someone asks me to choose between McDonald's and Burger King: Mickey D's for breakfast, and Burger King for lunch.  

Next time, I'll sample some sweets and coffee drinks, which I know will be great based on smell alone.
author: Jia J.

description: Their special breakfast sandwich is bomb! I can never finish one because it is so rich with from the avocado, flavorful aoili sauce, and buttery biscuits that everything is sandwiched by. The cinnamon roll is also yummy if you heat it up.
author: Christine P.
