description: Mmmmm mmmmmm!   Donut muffin -  need I say more? It's sugary donuty deliciousness in the shape of a muffin. Yum!  And yes, yes I do order one even when I get a breakfast sandwich. :) The breakfast sandwich is divine. It's a nice size biscuit which is piled thick with bacon, cheese, and scrambled eggs.  The biscuit may be a little dense but it's perfect so that it can serve as a sandwich without completely falling apart.  There's usually a line on the weekend mornings and there's usually a wait for the delicious sammies, but it's very chill and totally worth it.  They have lots of other delicious baked goods but I honestly just get the same thing every time.  Someday something will tempt me but for now, I'm good. :)
author: Amy J.

description: I decided to go back to the Devils to baking company this morning 21 May. We ordered our usual two breakfast sandwiches and a coffee we expected to wait a bit but we did not expect to wait 30 minutes for a small cup of coffee to my surprise the man making coffee cared more about his phone and the music being played and serving the customers I will not be returning until this is fixed what a disappointment
author: Thomas S.

description:
WOW

Rain or shine, Devil's Teeth has been a local destination for months. It already gotten a cult-like following from those that are "in-the-know." On several occasions, we visited and ordered different things and enjoyed EVERYTHING!

Some highlights:

Cinnamon bun/roll - definitely a must have for anyone who hasn't tried it yet. Usually, these always make me aim for the parts with the most sugar and flavor in the middle, but they soak up the entire bun here so that you dont have to aim for any part of it. Just make sure to grab and fork and knife to avoid sticky fingers.

Broccoli & ham quiche - a new item on the menu. They'll ask if you want it heated up and it's perfect for eating right away. It's savory yet feels healthy because there are some veggies in it.

Currant scone - buttery, flakey and good for a few days after. On our last visit, we bought 4 to last a couple of days. Simply delicious!
___
MAR '12 Health Score - 90
Parking: if parking is tough on Noreiga, look to park in the bus stop areas on 46th. It's perfectly legal, but people dont seem to know.

Oh, and I never have to feel guilty about using credit card at a small place like this, because they are modern and use Square.
author: Dennis L.

description: Came here at like 10am on a weekday and it was surprisingly busy. This place, along with many other local 'hipster' coffee shops have adopted the rustic style with the chalkboard menus, metal and wood decor, and compostable utensils. Anyways, food was solid and service was friendly. Special breakfast sandwich was so good, the lemon-garlic aioli and avocado was to die for. The bread was made of buttermilk biscuits so it was extra flaky and warm. The cinnamon rolls are large and sweet, definitely try it out. The one thing that I wouldn't recommend is the mango acai juice, it was pretty flavorless.
author: Ryan L.

description: Tried their breakfast sandwiches for the first time. Awesome! The price of $6.75 might get me a little more food at Denny's, but there is a reason they are popular at Devil's Teeth. The staff was very friendly, and there was a steady line. When I received a feedback survey from them through my email, I kinda mentioned it took a while to wait for the sandwiches and they surprisingly, generously gave me a refund! Class act. With this kind of service and great quality of food, Devil's Teeth will constantly make Buzz Feed's best places to eat in SF. That's where I first read about their breakfast sandwich, glad I did. I'm coming for more.
author: Joy E.

description: Just tried this place on a Saturday morning. Not too crowded, and not a long wait. Friendly, quick staff. Downsides are that the menu is a little limited, although very well priced for SF. Also, they don't have indoor seating (just a few bar stools) so if it's raining, be prepared to sit outside or in your car.
author: Tiffany M.

description: Nom nom nom!!!  Enough said!   Def a must have when you are in the area, or even if you are not!  The breakfast sandwiches are the bomb and the bun is a biscuit so even better!   You can't go wrong ordering this when you come here.  They are big sandwiches so you won't go hungry!!  My bf and I both tried the regular and special breakfast sandwich and they were both yummy but we prefer the regular one (special one has a aoili sauce and avocado).  The coffee was ok, definitely passable but I am quite picky with coffee and I liked it better here than "Trouble Coffee".  The wait wasn't bad at all and I went both on a Sat an Sun.   I also had the doughnut muffin which was also very good!  Next I want to try the cinnamon roll!!  I'll def be back at this place!
author: Lauren S.

description:
I can't believe it took me almost a year of living in the Outer Sunset to finally make it to Devil's Teeth. And actually I wish I never had because everything I ate was beyond awesome and I'm going to get so fat now. It's so close to my house. Uh-oh

The quiche is delish, and the breakfast sandwich comes on an amazing buttery biscuit. So good. All the baked goods look great, and they always have samples waiting for you. I'll be a regular customer and soon I'll be overweight.
author: Hannah B.

description: Cruised through on the way from the Zoo to Muir Woods and grabbed a few things. The Cinnamon Roll, Donut Muffin, and Coffee Cake were all very, very good. We had the cinnamon roll much later, cold (no microwave), and it was still delicious.
author: Robin B.

description: This place is awesome. Everything is super good here. I haven't been disappointed with anything I've eaten here and I've tried almost everything. Best thing here are Beignet Sundays. So light and tasty, you can't have just one. Other faves include: monkey bread, sweet potato pecan pie, breakfast sandwich and donut muffins. Coffee is really good too at a fair price. You'll find me here once a weekend.
author: Allan A.

description:
The Cinnamon Roll. This is unlike any cinnamon roll you've had at the mall or from a tube. The center is soft, warm, and everything you expect from a quality bakery. It's the outside of the cinnamon roll that amazes me. The edges are chewy stick-to-your-teeth morsels of what must be the food of gods. The combination of sticky outside and soft inside, the mild sweetness of cinnamon and sugars, and the epitome of bready goodness makes this cinnamon roll the best anywhere. Only $4 (even) for your giant slice of god food.

Oh, did I mention they also serve fresh Blue Bottle Coffee, some of the best coffee you can get in San Francisco? Pair this with the cinnamon roll for an energizing and delightful (and filling!) breakfast.

As a general rule, you want to come before 11am if you want a good shot of getting a cinnamon roll - they sell out FAST.
author: Gun-Ik P.

description: Great way to start your day with a breakfast Sammi, quiche or pastry. Very popular neighborhood joint with quality items. Great staff with outside seating and the beach is a short walk away. The cinnamon rolls are the bomb and our chocolate cake was on point, not overly sweet as other bake shops. Like I said it's a great way to kick start your day. Forgot to mention they have Blue Bottle coffee for that caffeine fix.
author: T L.

description:
I heard about this place from a co-worker and decided to give it a try.  

Today was my first time here.  I ordered:

1 beignet (Beignet Sunday) 
1 cinnamon roll (from other Yelpers recommendation)

Shifting around in the busy store waiting for my cinnamon roll to be heated up, I didn't know if my name would be called or what, so after waiting a bit, I just got back in line to pay.  

The cashier came back with a box and said 1 beignet, 1 cinnamon roll.  I paid and left.  Later did I find out that there was no beignet in the box!  It was what I was looking forward to trying.

Sure, $1 is nothing to cry about, but from reading other reviews about this place, I would agree that this place needs to review and streamline it's process.  Things just seemed disorganized.

As for the cinnamon roll, way too sweet for my taste.  Too much syrup/brow sugar.  Needless to say, it didn't go down well.

Bad first experience or is this the norm, I don't know, but I don't think I'm coming back to this place.
author: Alex N.

description:
Today was my first visit here and as soon as I walked in I was welcomed with a sweet Hello and then was asked if I'd like to have the rest of the Cinnamon Buns!! Awesome! They were delicious!!!!!!!! Aside from that I ordered a Brownie and a Blondie. The brownie was made perfectly! Decadent semi-sweet chocolate that was soo heavenly to bite into! And the powered sugar generously sprinkled on top made it even more enjoyable! Yummm... The Blondie was sweet, soft and crunchy all at the same time. Inside were crunchy walnuts and white chocolate chunks. I felt the white chocolate chunks really complimented all the elements in the Blondie. For both treats came out to $6, worth it! And 4 cinnamon buns for free, deal! Very yummy! Apart from the awesomeness of being offered the free cinnamon buns, the staff were welcoming and very helpful. 

Definitely going back!
author: Fran M.

description: Crazy about the doughnut muffin, all sugary and cinnamony.  Beignet Sundays will become a regular habit, too.  So happy to have stumbled upon this in the 'hood.
author: Carol C.

description: Not only does this bakery have the most amazing baked goods and breakfast sandwich you just have to try, but they make amazing custom cakes! I had no idea they made such amazing birthday cakes and am so happy my husband thought of this place for our daughter's Mickey Mouse Clubhouse themed birthday! Absolute delicious and beautiful!
author: Marlene M.

description: We jogged here on Sunday (arrived around 1pm). Was told half an hour wait for breakfast sandwich and/or scrambled eggs, so we decided to try something else. Veggie quiche was one of the best I've ever had. Lemon bar was very good, and the brownie was super dense (not for my taste, but maybe for yours). The beignets were also really tasty (Sundays special). Will definitely come back again for the quiche :)
author: Christina C.

description:
This area really needed a bakery, and I'm glad this one appeared. First of all, their portion sizes are Claim Jumper-sized, which is awesome. Another key to their success is their variety of savory and sweet options.

Things I've had so far include their blondie, breakfast sandwich, and cinnamon roll. Also, several samples of their chocolate chip cookies. Their blondies are great--they make them the old-fashioned way, with pecans and white chocolate chips. But I think the cinnamon roll really takes the...cake? (I know you all hate me.)

Their breakfast sandwich is pretty much an egg bonanza. Truth be told, the buttery biscuit slices have a tough time holding the thing together. But don't let that get in the way of how good it tastes--just use a fork and knife. Veggie tip: You can get sliced tomatoes on it as a substitute for bacon if you wish. 

This cinnamon roll is different from any other one I've ever had. You'll have to accept the fact that there is no icing or any form of frosting on it. After regaining your equilibrium, take a closer look. You'll realize that it doesn't need any frosting because the entire thing is caramelized--giving each bite a sweet, crispy start before diving into the buttery dough. And believe me, what they lack in matters of frosting, they make up for in butter. Oh, and make sure you get it heated up. You would be a fool to think otherwise.

Word to the wise: use caution if you're enjoying your treats while sitting outside in the parklet. Those pigeons mean business, and will get right up in your face.
author: Rachel F.

description:
I have found my breakfast sandwich soulmate. *air hump* Buttery flaky muffin holding all the goodness together, fluffy scrambled eggs, crispy bacon and an abundance of melted cheese. MMMMMMMM. Oh, did I mention they're available during ALL hours, none of this "Available until 10:30 a.m." crap? *swoon*

Desserts: 
-Cinnamon roll: this thing is massive, incredibly sticky and delightful. 
-Raspberry bar: you will smell the butter from the topping as soon as you go 1 ft. near it, and the raspberry filling is chunky, sweet and tangy. And it's so rich and huge it took me half a day to finish. Unless you're fat. I wish I was fat, so I could finish it in one sitting.
-Scones: flaky and flavorful.
-Cheddar bacon biscuit: very peppery and flavorful, but on the dry side. Next time pass.
-Cream puffs: airy, light, not too sweet.
-Lemon bar: WOW and I thought the raspberry bar was good, this thing is amazeballs. If you're a huge fan of lemon (and I am) this is perfect tarty citrus goodness with a buttery under layer. MmMmMmMm...

Okay so I have to get this out now: I don't like Blue Bottle coffee. It tastes bitter to me no matter where I go to get it. Is this some kind of joke that people are playing by telling me it tastes good??? Welp, it tasted the same here as from other places I've gotten it. So I guess if you like it elsewhere, you'll like it here? ...I feel like I'm taking crazy pills.

[EDIT: I was just informed they don't serve Blue Bottle any longer.]
author: Stephanie M.

description:
I come here for the feel and chillness of the space. I come here for the awesome public sitting area right outside that can get kinda cold... cuz you know... you're in the sunset. And I come here because they don't freakout about dogs since I only come here when I walk them.

Coffee:  Its good, I like it, but may be too sour for certain people.
Blueberry Banana Muffin: Kinda bland, but I love this.
Breakfast sandwich: Holy COW, there are a lot of eggs on this thing and not enough bacon.  Tip: slather this baby in ketchup. I thought it was OK.
Lasagna: Yummy, good portion for the price.
author: Linda W.

description: Breakfast sandwiches are awesome. And the cinnamon rolls. Very friendly environment & fast paced.
author: Alyssa A.

description:
This place is crazy. Crazy good. Really different kind of cinnamon bun. I read its a recipe from someone's Ukrainian great-grandmother. God bless her if that is true. Its like a kouign-amann and a cinnamon roll had a baby. Really good. 

The beignets are more like zeppoles. But ain't nothing wrong with zeppoles. And served all day. All day being til 4pm on Sundays.

Lasagna was pretty good too. Good price also. Worth a trip.
author: Augusto M.

description:
Believe the hype, Devil's Teeth Baking Company churns out some awfully delicious baked goods. 

Today I tried:

Carrot Cake (sample): 4.5 Stars. Delightfully dense, with a semi-sweet cream cheese frosting that neither overpowered the subtle carrot flavor nor cast me into a sugar coma.

Biengets (sample): 5 Stars. Airy, flavorful, and covered in powdered sugar, these were some of the best I've ever had.

Breakfast Sandwich: 3.5 Stars. Nestled between a gloriously dense, buttery and flaky biscuit lay scrambled eggs, a slice of sharp cheddar cheese and  two slices of thick bacon. While I could have used the temperature of all the ingredients to be warmer (the cheese was barely melted) the thick bacon helped to carry the day, providing necessary salt and outstanding crispness.  Nothing to complain about here.

Sightglass Coffee (French Press): 4 Stars. An upgrade from Blue Bottle to be certain, well nuanced and subtle, with a faint flavor of chocolate and citrus notes. It probably could have used a bit more time brewing, however this minor flaw did not detract from the overall experience.

Location is pleasant, close enough to the beach to be walkable, yet with plenty of seating in case you're not into dealing with the potential for sand as a condiment. 

Service was quick, and efficient, especially considering the number of customers present. 

I look forward to returning and sampling more of their menu.
author: Casey U.

description:
I came here for $1 yummy goodness and I got my beignet belly on. At first I thought...hmm..this bag is kinda light since I'm used to pillow sized beignets...but these little morsels were hot off the press and doused in lots of powdery sugar. First bite was sweet...so airy and with just the right touch of fried light crunch.

I wanted to get the oatmeal raisin but I'm on a kid-size meal diet so this will have to do. Everything smelled so good and by the size of the crowd, pretty popular too.
Will have to come back for the other goodies..

Lots of 1 hour free parking around and a good neighborhood vibe here.
author: Pauline L.

description: It was a decent sandwich. I wouldn't wait 30 minutes for it on a weekend. Went on a Monday no line.
author: Aych K.

description: Just went here over the weekend, the special breakfast sandwich lived up to the hype.
author: Kristin K.

description: Wow!  First visit.  Fantastic special breakfast sandwiches and coffee. Line already at 745am
author: Paul B.

description: This place is amazing! So yummy and great breakfast sandwiches!Love it!
author: Rasha K.

description: I love Devil's Teeth Bakery. I love them for the huge breakfast sandwiches they make, with crispy bacon, the coffee done just right, and their outdoor sitting space, which makes you feel like you are a part of the neighborhood. They are super efficient, even when really busy (does ANYONE work on Friday around here?), and the service is always friendly.  Well one, DTB.
author: Anton G.

description:
Living 1 block away, Devils Teeth has been my go to for breakfast, coffee, or lunch.. especially when I'm on the run. I have been eating here on average 3 times a week since I moved to the area in September. 

I'm not a fan of yelp comments.. some how someone always finds something to complain about. I don't base my decisions on you giving 3 stars because you had to wait a little bit longer than usual for a coffee on a Sunday morning when the place had a line coming out of the door. I signed up specifically to leave this comment. 

The food is delicious. The service is great, half of the employees know my name and know what I want to eat that day better than I do. The prices are fair. The portions are bigger than I can usually finish in 1 sitting. Dogs get free treats which my 80 pound malamute loves. 

If you're in the area, I highly recommend eating there. Breakfast sandwich, lasagna, cinnamon roll, and chicken salad sandwich are currently my top 4.
author: Daniel B.

description: The BLT's are the best that I've ever had! The chicken curry salad sandwiches are tasty and I can never go there and not get at least two slices of any of their simple and yet wonderful fruit pies. The lemon bars are like lemon meringue on a light, chewily crispy bar and the banana/chocolate cream puffs are heavenly.
author: Jared C.

description:
The outer Sunset is getting hip. It's nice to see businesses like Devil's Teeth Baking Company coming to the foggy outer lands of SF. We arrived early afternoon and a lot of the baked goods had already been wiped out. 

We settled on the banana cream puff, which was good, but didn't rock my world. I couldn't help comparing it to others I've tried.
author: Lee H.

description:
Holy moly Wowza breakfast sandwiches!  Portion sizes are huge and every bite is delicious. Finger lickin good. Did I mention it was good? 

Cinnamon roll = crack made of sugar, butter, butter and butter 

And the people there are just awesome. So glad we live down the street from this place!
author: Candace D.

description:
God bless these folks for taking Square. By the time Saturday rolls around, I don't have any cash, so this is the weekend spot.

This is also the weekend spot for all kinds of kids with what I'm guessing are divorced dads on weekend visit duty, so if you're into getting a piece of that: you know where to proceed.

Nice Bicycle coffee as well. And gigantic slices of cheesecake that will last you three whole days. Ask me how I know!
author: Maria D.

description:
Best Bakery in the Sunset and most of the city. This bakery offers FRESH made pastries, sandwiches and desserts and the cooks make it right in front of you as you're waiting in line, or waiting for your food. Aparently each day they have different treats that they offer. Every sunday they offer french donuts-those are bitchin'. They're only $1 and they're served all day! Extremely tasty! The Cafe has a wonderful seating arrangement inside as well as outside in a little park outlet. This place gets a ton of customers. I almost feel as if it's the New Tartine of San Francisco. There's always a line here, and there is so much to try that hasn't been consumed by me.

I would highly recommend this cafe/baking company. The foods are amazing! Unfortunately, their coffee changed, so it isn't as nice.
author: Cody A.

description: This place was amazing! Small little baking company putting out a lot of things! I came here with my bf and we got the social breakfast sandwich, a vegetarian quiche, carrot cake and a soy chai latte. I like that the cater to everyone's food needs! The carrot cake was so soft and moist, although I would have prefer more spices and nuts in it. The biscuit for the breakfast sandwich as so soft and moist as well. The quiche really hit the spot, still hearty enough with the potatoes so you feel full afterwards! Wish if took pics of the food but I was too excited!
author: Nancy T.

description: Everything about this place is AMAZING! They baked a custom Mickey Mouse Club cake for us and it came out gorgeous, and also tasted delicious. This is the best bakery in San Francisco! Love you guys!!!!!
author: Patrick M.

description: THE BEST!!!! Everything tastes freshly baked and homemade like yo mama made it! Scones, brownies, cookies are excellent. The breakfast sandwich is AMAZING - I prefer the special over the regular (the special has avo and an aioli mayo thats to die for). If you order a sandwich or coffee, be prepared to wait - especially if you're there in the AM on weekend. There's outdoor seating and sidewalk chalk to occupy the kiddies. The kitchen is open and you can see the prep and care the staff are putting into all of the orders. Beignets Sundays are great as well - they are just like giant malasadas (would be cool if they put different filling inside them).
author: nikki b.

description: Amazing breakfast sandwiches. Super straight-forward set up with a focus on the bread and pastries. Definitely grab a lemon bar and a donut muffin, too. Love this place.
author: kevin l.

description:
If you listen carefully, you can hear the song of the siren calling you out towards the sea.  On the way there, you will steer towards the legend known as Devil's Teeth.  

Gargantuan cinnamon rolls.

Doughnut muffins.

Not-too-sweet chocolate brownies.

Perfect cheesecake.

Individual banana cream pies.

Beignet Sundays.

Used books from Green Apple Books for sale.

Lovely staff.

Oh, yes, the devil made me do it.  And he makes me do it again and again.
author: Liz S.

description: watch out for the owner's teeth. i mean, her eyes. after being ignored, i skipped the ordering line for the register only to be reprimanded. the look i received was, yes, that of the Devil. never mind that the "local" in front of me was greeted by her, order included. as for the food, my over sized scone was over sized and my coffee was coffee.
author: David D.

description:
Used to be much better. 

Before I rant, they have one of the most sinfully delicious, if not heart attack inducing, breakfast sandwiches I may have ever eaten. (Hence the 2 stars)

They are already falling from the status of good. Weekends here are a nightmare. Beignets used to be the star, but they are now ridiculously overly greasy, barely touched with powdered sugar, and DARK brown (as opposed to golden brown as a beignet is supposed to be. Likely because they use only one pot on the stove to make them and I have never seen the oil changed. nasty.). It takes about  30 minutes to get an order of two beignets now, unacceptable and not worth the wait. 

The place is in serious need of MANAGEMENT. The efficiency could easily rise if it had any sort of management. Luckily the staff is very nice.

The amount of time one waits for coffee is obnoxious. Especially considering that it costs 2.50 for a tiny 12 ounce, one size only, cup. It is not even Blue Bottle any longer. Makes no sense and is borderline criminal. Get coffee before or after you go.

Probably won't be back anytime soon. But, sadly, this is one of the Sunset's best bakeries.

(Update: Already heard back from them, and they are very kind. So I can give them an extra star for that. Hopefully things will change and I can give them five someday.)
author: Donn E.

description:
I still feel this place is way OVER-RATED. 
Just got their chicken curry salad, which has increased in price by $1.50 since my last review, and it's now also much SMALLER. It also tastes sour! Ew.

But what is really irritating me and prompting me to update my review is that they left a LOT of grape seeds in the salad! i mean, seriously??? i keep chomping on these hard bitter little grape seeds that are getting stuck in my teeth. I now have 6 bitten-into seeds sitting on my napkin in front of me. This sucks.

Oh, and did I mention that after I ordered, they forgot to make the salad until they were reminded? Whoever manages this place needs to step it up.
author: Verna L.

description:
I went there again upon some email conversation with the owner. This time I went on a weekday and the store has different staff members than the last time (weekend). The lady greeted me and I ordered quiche again. 

Everything went well this time, no complaints. Looking forward to show friends this place in the future.
author: Annie T.

description: I need to try more of their offerings but the special breakfast sandwich was pretty delicious (and probably adding to my waist-line at an un-Godly rate)
author: Mark K.

description:
Could it be? Salvation from living so far from the city in the form of a $5 breakfast sandwich delivered from the gods - Poseidon himself maybe? (I mean we are next to the ocean amirite?!)

Did a little drinking with coworkers on a Thursday night and needed a jump start Friday morning before work and I don't think anything else could have gotten my heart and day going better than a $5 breakfast sandwich that was seriously huge and LOADED from Devil's Teeth. Well actually thats not true... the only other thing may have been a defibrillator - but I'd much rather take the b-fast sando.

Seriously amazing, seriously large enough for a full breakfast meal and did I mention ONLY $5!!!! Definitely come here for breakfast if you find yourself lost and for some reason at the outskirts of civilization that is the outer sunset.
author: Patryk T.

description:
Good coffee, decent baked goods, laid back crowd, outside seating with your dog.

Breakfast sandwich and chicken curry salad are ok, so go for the HUGE portion of lasagne.
author: J. M.

description: Breakfast sandwich is MUST GET!! The biscuit is melt in your mouth DELICIOUS. The cinnamon roll is to die for! I love the crunchy sweet taste of the outer layer. Pretty much everything is AMAZING here. The only reason why I subtracted one star is the wait time. I came here when it wasn't that busy. I ordered the "special breakfast sandwich". I waited about 15-20 mins before I got it. That's a pretty long time for a sandwich, no matter how good it is. What really did it for me was when a group of friends( who apparently knew the cashier) came in AFTER me, but got their breakfast sandwich BEFORE me.... If you don't mind waiting and waiting and waiting and waiting for your food, this is the place for you!
author: Elle N.

description: This place is really good, went there & tried their breakfast sandwich, banana bread & hot chocolate. The biscuit on the morning sandwich had great texture. It didn't fall apart easy like some biscuit when you eat it. Plus it was a good size portion. Fun place to try! Will go again.
author: Jp P.

description:
Iced Chai here is so yummy, spicy and not too sweet.

Pastries are excellent, esp the nice fresh beignets.
author: B C.

description: Came here on Thursday with the family after finding this place in Yelp. I'm so glad our original plans didn't pan out. We ordered the supreme breakfast biscuit sandwich and cinnamon roll(s). The biscuit was so soft and buttery with savory pieces of bacon, cheese and avocado...reminded me of 'Biscuit Bitch' in Seattle.  Then came the cinammon roll....first bite had my eyes rolling to the back of my head, subsequent bites had the devil on my shoulder screaming "can't stop, won't stop". Next thing you know, I'm going back in - "one for the road please". This is a MUST stop next time you're in or around the Sunset.
author: Theresa B.

description:
Cozy little bakery in the Sunset. As with most places in the city, the size of the line tells you everything.

We got the Breakfast Sandwich and Cinnamon Roll.

The Breakfast Sandwich was really tasty. Egg (yup), cheese (yup), and bacon (YUUP) on a buttery biscuit.

The Cinnamon Roll is surprisingly light and has an awesome crust on the outside.

This is a great place to stop at before a hike or a day at the beach.  Definitely worth an occasional trip.
author: Brian C.

description: Thank you again Kat for dropping off the carrot cake- that was an unexpected act of kindness! Everyone at the party loved the cake, and my husband was so pleased to have our wedding cake again. Delicious cakes and savories at this bakery. So happy we live so close! The staff here are so friendly and helpful- it really makes a difference with so much snotty and indifferent service. You guys do great work- we will come by soon.
author: Brigid S.

description: The breakfast sandwich was AMAZING. the biscuits were perfect. The other pastries looked really good, lots of original, cheap options. The Donut muffin was also delicious.
author: Arielle K.

description:
Whenever I visit my friend in this area, I MUST go by Devil's Teeth and I'll wake up 6am in the morning just to get here.  Their lines are long, their coffee is too small and is not Starbucks comparable, there's really nowhere to eat your food inside their VERY TINY eatery with so many people waiting, and their beignets are too small, BUT:

1-their service is super friendly
2-their special breakfast sandwich (in a homemade super large FRESH biscuit that dwarfs McDonald's breakfast sandwich) is tasty, super large, fresh, and everybody lines up for it
3-they have a large bench area outside to enjoy the sun while you eat your food
4-their super large professionally baked/presented (and I think award-winning) super-scented, super-flavored cinnamon roll is TO DIE FOR!! (it tastes great even if it's not heated)

Since I'm not a foodie and my time & energy is worth more to me than going half way across town waiting in long lines with expensive prices, I'm VERY careful about whether I say you should go out of your way just to get in a long line for good food, but I would DEFINITELY go out of my way to go here at least one time for breakfast (take your food to go since there's a lot of people).  Get 2 or more special breakfast sandwiches (they're that good!) for yourself (1 or more to save for later) so that you don't have to wait in line again.  Be sure to bring some durable $1 Trader Joe bags to hold your multiple boxed up foods.   The line is long but they're fast.    You can eat your food and get a better coffee or other drink across the street at "Sea Biscuit Cafe & Wine Bar" which is more spacious inside with more table/seat area and more empty in the morning OR if you have a car or willing to walk a few blocks, there's the beach nearby. And remember, they're CLOSED TUESDAYS.
author: Frugal C.

description:
We stopped in around 1:30 for our breakfast - yes, breakfast - and got a couple of chai lattes and biscuit breakfast sandwiches. The sandwiches were a bit heavy on the egg for me, but I'm not a big fan of egg in general. The biscuit halves were buttery and crumbly, and quite good. Chai lattes were very spicy, and not super sweet, which I thought was awesome.

Then. We also asked for a cinnamon roll. Couple of hours later we split it. I kid you not, over half of the words we said in the ten minutes it took us to demolish the cinnamon roll were curses and exclamations of pure joy. It was hands-down the best cinnamon roll I have ever had in my life, the caramelized sugar more than making up for the lack of soft, pillowy dough.

I would eat one of those cinnamon rolls every day of my life if I could - it was well worth the price, and it makes me very eager to come back and try the other baked goods. Everything looked amazing, especially the brownies.
author: Amanda P.

description: I had several of their baked goods and was afraid it would taste too healthy, it was yummy! I went on a sunday and got benets and they were warm, fluffy and wonderful. I had to wait like 10 min for them but totally worth it! I also got the breakfast sandwich which was good too. They have seating outside but it was way crowded, now I get why. They are quick and friendly too.
author: Vanessa G.

description: Love this place. Friendly people who are always smiling and baking absolutely delicious goods- the breakfast sandwiches are so legit and the cinnamon buns are ridiculous. Coffee is great too. Devil's teeth!!
author: Kristen D.

description:
I used to come here every morning because I run in Golden Gate Park and surf at the Beach and it was on the way.  I'd stop by here for (usually a soy chai and carrot juice.)  The chai is good but pretty small serving for what they charge and the carrot juice is convenient (I am guessing freshly pressed?)

Even though I think majority of the pastries and foods here are loaded with sugar and grease I occasionally have bought loads of pastries cookies and muffins here as gifts to neighbors, local surf shops etc.  It's not healthy food for the every day but agreeably nice treat for the rare occasion!

I tried their "Curry Chicken" and found that there were much more curried potato with tiny fibers of chicken mixed in... it was more like "Curry Potato w smidgen of chicken."  More than few times I have tried their freshly baked biscuits... usually flat and uncooked in center (kind of gross experience biting into one and getting mouthful of unbaked dough.)  I finally pointed it out to them and they were very nice about it and did not charge me that one time.

Most of the staff here seem friendly and personable... with the  exception of this one lady (she runs the cash register on most days.) I am not sure what her problem is but whenever she saw me, she would say things that seemed pretty awesomely rude... like, "Are you on a liquid diet?" And, "Do you eat ?" 
(Unfortunately, a few other times not worth mentioning the context but quite amazingly serious and rude comments and sometimes right in front of a surprised crowd... ) In the beginning I laughed at the commets, but after the second time it's not fun or funny!  I actually experienced serious trauma once and I finally told her to stop!

Who wants to experience insults when one is attempting to enjoy the atmospere and experience the joy of consuming unhealthy greasy but sort of yummy food that is a tad too expensive??
author: Lucia P.

description: Went in for the first time today around noon.. Not much of a line. I ordered two BLTs with avocado. 15-20 minutes go by and I'm waiting so I check on the order and am told the sandwiches are coming "now".  Another 15 minutes go by and I go up to ask for a refund and am told "no they're right here". Then I wait a few more minutes to get my sandwiches without the avocado. I paid for the avo but did not have time to go back in the shop. The sandwich was all bread and a tiny slice of tomato with a hunk of frisée and no other lettuce.  Ahhh new San Francisco
author: M L.

description:
I'm so glad that this is in our desolate Outer Sunset neighborhood. 
My GF and I went there for the first time a week ago. 
We both ordered the breakfast sandwich which I have to say, if you have a light appetite, be careful - its really good..but a gut buster. 

Also tried the carrot cake as well..which was also very good.
They have some muffins, but for the price (almost $3.00 apiece) was a bit small.
Have to agree with the other reviewer...coffee was just okay.
author: Darren J W.

description: What a great addition to the outer sunset. Stopped in with the family this morning. Tried the breakfast sandwiches and beignets..amazing. Be prepared for a wait, they are super busy. But its so worth it.
author: Rosa A.

description:
I came for here for breakfast on the recommendation of someone I met at Cavallo Point.  So glad I did!  Delicious food, great coffee & nice people.  It isn't a sit down place for breakfast.

There is a parklet for seating & a couple of stools along the windows.  If you don't need a table I highly recommend this place for breakfast.

I got the special breakfast sandwich which is super huge - I would say enough to share if you're not a big eater.  I couldn't finish it.  The buttermilk biscuit it was on was buttery & flaky & yummy.  The beignets are delicious - got them fresh out of the fryer ... and they need to be eaten hot! They use Bicycle coffee & the soy latte was so good.   

Often I go out for breakfast & think ... Damn I could have done better myself - not here!  Go - you won't regret it.
author: N A.

description:
Dont understand all the hype on this place. They serve good coffee brands and charge alot of money for them but do not know how to make a proper cup of coffee. Secondly they are very disorganized you walk in and just sort of stand around until someone offers to help you, Then when multiple customers order the same thing the often give it to the first person to stand up and come to the counter to get it. It would be nice to take down a name and call it.

Their baked goods are ok but judging by that huge contained of crisco they keep back their you probably do not want to eat it too often. 

The woman who runs the place is down right rude I walked in to this place because the door was open and she yelled at me like some kid. I guess they were closed that day but how was I suppose to know you had no sign up and the door was wide open.
author: Michael W.

description:
Definitely had to show some love for the one of the best bakeries in the City, hands down. I end up here at least once a week, usually for a quick breakfast or fresh lunch I can take down to the beach.

Pastries: All of them are fantastic, and they rotate things out frequently enough to always have something new.

-Raspberry bar: perfectly sweet and chewy, and really filling. You get a huge bar and its really dense, good for a few servings.
-Donut Muffin: Delicious and self explanatory.
-Lemon Bar: One of my favorites - not too sweet, perfectly tangy, great crumbly crust.
-Shark cookie: a well made cookie and something I can rarely resist.
-Cinnamon roll: HUGE, perfectly moist, very very tasty.
-Carrot cake: another favorite - moist, great spice, fantastic cream cheese frosting that balances the sweetness of the cake
-Scones: all are great, especially with a cup of their strong and flavorful coffee.
-Ginger Cookie: Super chewy and wonderfully full of ginger.
-Pies: again, all are amazing. You dont get the biggest slice, but that just makes you savor each bite more.

The coffee is strong, dark, and delicious. Their juices are refreshing, fresh, and not too sweet. I like the purple one, whatever flavor that is :P Great for hangovers :X

The breakfast sandwich is usually my reason for ending up here: fresh baked buttery biscuit, eggs, cheese, and thick bacon. $5 only, and you will be stuffed. Made to order every time.

The BLT is also one of my favorites - mixed greens, thick bacon, a thick slice of tomato, and some mayo/aoili that brings it all together on fresh chewy bread.

Made to order beignets for $1 each on sundays. Simple and classic and surprisingly large.

And of course, one can't forget their famous Beer Bacon Cheddar Chive whatever else Muffin. We usually stock up on these just to have them around the house. Ask for it to be heated up a little, its awesome.

On top of it all, the staff is always super friendly and attentive, the prices are more than reasonable, and theres an awesome little patio area out front where all the locals and their kids and dogs and the neighborhood pigeons all sit and hang out and chat and have breakfast on sunny Sunset mornings. Definitely one of the hidden gems of the Outer Sunset.
author: Joe F.

description:
Nice place by the beach, friendly staff and cool outside seating. First time here got 3x things:
Beer battered cheddar onion muffin: not too much flavor, a bit dry also.
Donut muffin: yummy, sugar donut in a muffin form, soft and flavorful.
Cinnamon roll: very delicious! Big and tasty, but costly, but a MUST! 
At the cashier area is a plate of sample goodies; chocolate chip cookie was soft baked and delicious, yumm~
author: Hao B.

description: ohgod! CINNAMON ROLLLS! thats all needed to be said.
author: Ada H.

description: Probably the best bake shop in the city.  The special breakfast sandwich is the best breakfast item I have ever eaten, hands down.  The cinnamon bun is also the best of its kind I have ever had - and I normally dislike cinnamon buns.  It's a bit of a trek from the city, but well worth it for these two items alone.
author: Josh Q.

description:
Awesome little bakery in the outer sunset! It's nice to see businesses doing well on this side of town! 

I must say this place is dangerous!! Everything looks and smells soo good! My first time here I had the breakfast biscuit, cinnamon roll and a coffee..... It was DELICIOUS!!! The biscuit is super soft and flaky with tons of flavor and the cinnamon roll is to die for!! Probably the best cinnamon roll i have ever had!! And of course the coffee was pretty bomb as well! But I can't remember is it was Sightglass or blue bottle... anyways go try this place ASAP!!
author: nabil s.

description:
Definitely one of my go-to places for breakfast, especially when we have visitors and don't feel like cooking.  The biscuit breakfast sandwich, the various quiches, and the blueberry scones with a lemon glaze are all excellent!  I'm not a huge fan of the beignets.  When you've had the real deal in New Orleans, these are a little on the heavy side.   I think they likely use the biscuit dough...

The place does get busy on the weekends, so we're usually in/out early.  The staff are generally very friendly and provide good service.  Overall a great place to either eat outside in the little street side park or to take home.
author: Steve F.

description: I can't say enough good things about this place. Everything on the menu is super bomb. The breakfast sandwich is the best breakfast sandwich I've ever had. The atmosphere is great, and it is a true local spot. The cinnamon rolls, the carrot cake... and also great salads and soups.
author: Jack J.

description: Amazing cinnamon rolls! Best I've had in SF. The chocolate/mint/candy cane cake is just ok, though.
author: Greg S.

description: Love pretty much any baked good here. Anytime I have the chance to buy baked goods for a party or gathering it is like a dream come true to be able to come in and order 1 of almost everything. The donut muffins, pie pockets, cinnamon rolls and breakfast sandwiches are my favorites. But everything else comes in a close second. Soups are great! I love picking up soup to go and having a meal for a few days out of it. The coffee is ok - but it's a bakery, not a coffee shop.
author: Carolyn S.

description:
You know a bakery is fantastic when out of all possible 1,022,000 words in the English language you are reduced to the grunts of early neanderthals while you bump your index finger against the glass panel of the display case.
 
It was yelp's calling to their cinnamon roll that brought us to Devil's Teeth. Not only was it the best we've ever had, it's one of the best creations in the history of evolution... but it's not just this single experience that will bring us back. We'll let their infectious and friendly service, welcome to our kitchen ambiance and all the other tempting selections of their tasty offerings lead us back to the Devil's Teeth.

The entire trance-inducing selection from baked goods to breakfast sandwiches fought our resistance to order the entire case. Could we really be "Those people"? Yeah, we could. Yet our compassion for our fellow species won out. We all know that feeling, when there is a person ahead of you with one chocolate chip cookie remaining and you're like, don't do it, don't you do it! Can you imagine the line's reaction pouring out the door had we gone through with our, at the time, highly rational thought? Sheer chaos! 

Devil's Teeth also serves pour-over Sightglass coffee, which recently won 7x7's blind taste test for the Bay Area's best coffee. We found the coffee and cinnamon roll to be a perfect pairing. 

There are many reasons to frequent Devil's Teeth, but their name says it all. Brilliant.
author: Michael R.

description:
I hope the devil brushes his teeth because he'll be toothless if he keeps eating all of the delicious sweets this bakery has to offer. I think I've just found two new things 7x7 should add to their "100 Things to Try Before You Die" list. 

The cinnamon roll is the best cinnamon roll I've ever had. No, I don't think you heard me. Let me say it again. The cinnamon roll is the best cinnamon roll I've ever had. The perfect balance of heaven and extacy. I mean ecstacy. 

The "Slap yo' grandmama, sleep with yo' bucktoof brother-in-law, drink with yo' Pastor Breakfast Sandwich" is sinful. Oh, that's not what it's called? Just Breakfast Sandwich? Well anyway, it's cray cray. 

Go in an angel, leave a devil.
author: Jen Y.

description: My wife and i were in there today for a breakfast sandwich. No surprise it took 20 minutes. The guy cooking them was slow as molasses going up hill in the winter, everybody was trading stories and roaming around. There was a lady with a baby on her back wandering around behind the already overcrowded workspace behind the counter. She was handling the food on the racks with her bare hands instead of gloves and it seemed unsanitary.  Once again the food is so good, but the business is very loosely run and when you see it from a customer service point of view, it could use alot of improvement.
author: dave d.

description:
One of the best things about living in the Outer Sunset is Devil's Teeth Baking Company.  I'm so thankful for their delicious treats and friendly service. The people that work here look like they GENUINELY like to be there.  (It's amazing how they're able to bake all those treats with just that tiny kitchen in the back.)  

I've tried so many things since they opened:  lasagna, carrot cake, lemon cake, cheesecake, donut muffin, breakfast sandwich, but I have to say that my ABSOLUTE FAVORITE is the apricot scone.  If I was one of those fortunate girls that could eat and eat and never get fat, I would eat this every day for breakfast.  It has the perfect texture, soft on the inside with lots of fruit, a nice crusty top and NEVER DENSE OR DRY.  I'm salivating just thinking about it and I'm not even a sweets person...(all those above treats were shared).  

If you're ever in the area, you should definitely stop by.   Don't be deterred by the crowds on the weekends, these guys know what they're doing and the line moves fairly quickly.  Support kind local businesses, like, Devil's Teeth.
author: Christie X.

description:
I have not tried the desserts yet but I LOVE the cinnamon roll and the breakfast sandwich! The cinnamon roll is unlike anything I've ever tried before. It's more like Tartine than it is like Cinnabon (for lack of better comparison). It's not incredibly soft, but instead it features a carmelized, crunchy top. It is delicious! 

And I dream about the breakfast sandwich! I live in Portland, OR where Pine State Biscuits is overly famous for their amazing biscuits. I find Devil's Teeth's biscuit to be even better!! I consumed the entire thing in a matter of minutes. 

We had just walked from Lincoln and grabbed Trouble Coffee along the way. Otherwise I would have loved a cup of Blue Bottle!
author: Angie Q.

description: I got the supreme breakfast sandwich and a chai latte here this morning. VERY good!! Oh man. The line was long, but totally worth it.
author: Amelia T.

description: Some of the best pastries I've ever tasted. Bought an assortment of about half a dozen scones, cookies, brownies, and buns. Everything had an amazing flavor and perfect texture. I come from a family of bakers and was most impressed. To top it all off, the staff was very helpful and friendly, despite the fact that they were busy when I went in.
author: Jacob R.

description:
went with 2 other buddies to try the place out. each of us got about 2 to 3 different pastries to try. 

this place is ok considering its the only one of its kind in sunset that I can think of  that makes and sells their own baked goods. 

i was really excited to try their beignets since not many places make em. it reminded me of a type of chinese donut and it wasn't that good either. their other baked goods were average. nothing super good and pricey for the quality. 

may go back to try their savory items, but won't be buying any baked goods anymore
author: Myron L.

description: My favorite go to bakery! I can't stay away, everything I've tried here is so yummy especially the special breakfast sandwich. All the pastries I've tried from here are all so good too, I have to refrain from spending all my money here lol. Great customer service as well! My son loves their grilled cheese sandwiches as well :)
author: Natalie M.

description:
2.5-3 stars.

This review is solely for the beignets. Though they are very inexpensive at $1for a decently sized beignet, they were no bueno. It's not light and airy as it's supposed to be, and rather bland. I know that fried dough isn't supposed to taste like much, but it was just dull and semi-dense. I wouldn't say it's dense like a cake, but it's definitely not as light like a Krispy Kreme. Not sure what the hype is.. maybe it's not for their beignets....?
author: Michelle L.

description:
I have tried hard to like this place, but I am never blown away by any of their offerings
Ordering is confusing ( tell one person what you want, tell another what you ordered so you can pay).
Service is slow, I always seem to get a mouthy lady at the register ... not unfriendly, just ... mouthy
Food is acceptable ... above average baked goods, but the breakfast sandwich, while ample, was a mess to eat
Coffee is decent but way overpriced for the tiny servings you get. I realize their coffee is "gourmet" but I am a GOURMAND when it comes to coffee 
People watching at the parklet can be fun. Apparently if you are a trustifarian surfer, this  place is nirvana
I keep thinking their attraction is that of an "anti-Starbux" but honestly I get the same sort of condescending vibe here as at that hated chain. Unfortunately this is a pervasive business model from SOMA to the Marina. Maybe they should open a branch there!

Sorry DTBC but I have way more fun at Seabiscuit Cafe or Java Beach.
author: Lloyd M.

description: I don't think you can go wrong here. Coffee is good I hear (I don't drink coffee so can't speak to it) but the pastries and sandwiches I have tried are awesome. Love the BLT, cinnamon bun is a decadent gooball (yum) with crunch, donut muffin, the one bite I got from the brownie was great oh the list goes on. Next I have to try the cheddar, beer, bacon and green onion muffin. That looked soo good. Remember to go to the gym afterwards.
author: Kirsten F.

description:
Honestly.. Outer sunset SUCKS. Dirty nasty cheap food.
Im completely blown away today though. I literally just got back from a blind date with the devil. My pup/cousin/I purchased the following;

2 Donut muffins:
Only took one bite, waiting for the boyfriend. The first bite was a bit sweet, but really soft and pillowy. Pretty much melts in your mouth. A bit cinnamon-y, and is exactly as the name says. A donut in muffin form. Overall just OKAY.

Apricot scone:
The texture of the scone was amazing. There were pieces of real apricot embedded in the scone. The taste wasn't too sweet at all, the perfect amount of sugar. The buttery aftertaste had me addicted. The best scone I ever had, hands down. Paw down for the pup too:)

Ginger cookies:
Again, the texture was PERFECT. I love that it was warm with pieces of ginger. It was not the least bit crunchy, but it did have that chewiness that was expected. I've heard it was good, but I didn't expect it to be THIS good. Keeper.

Beignets: 
Sundays only! I'm so blessssed to have made it this perfect sunday! I ordered 2, and it's made to order. It was warm and light. The best beignet I have ever eaten.

Banana cream pie in a cream puff:
I was immediately drawn to it. My cousin bought it instead, it had some banana custard but the winner? THE CHOCOLATE in the cream puff. banana with chocolate? You really can't go wrong.

I do wish they opened later:( The total for everything came out to be 15.. NOT BAD AT ALL. 

I was happy to see they offered blue bottle coffee, the blend of the day was Giant Steps, my favorite! But due to my allergies I could not enjoy a cup(both my hands would have been busy) I will definitely be back to try the breakfast sandwich, spinach quiche, lasagna, and lemon bars. I guess the devil made it on to a second date:)
author: Wendy X.

description:
Visited Devil's Teeth Bakery with friends today.   (Who thought of such a name?!!!)

Friendly staff!  There was a line and after we ordered we waited for about  7 minutes.

It has a few small benches outside and it was warm enough this morning to sit and wait for our food.  There were also a few very small tables inside.

My friends each had a breakfast sandwich $5.50.  It looked  good.  They said it was delicious and really two meals in one.

I had a beignets for $1 -  I read it was a Sunday "deal".  It was served piping hot with powdered sugar.  Small but delicious.  My cup of coffee was $2.50.  I  took home a cinnamon roll which probably has 1,000 calories.  It was good and I would order again, but I could only eat 1/2.

They have more sitting room than Arizmendi.  It seems like a very successful business model -- we would like them to get a larger site...

I would go back!!!
author: Lori G.

description:
Fantastic bakery in Outer Sunset!  One thing that was sorely missing in the this area until DTBC opened (about a year ago now).  I've been here many times since they opened and still keep coming back.

The highlights:
-Beignet Sundays: Hot, fresh, delicious beignets
-Donut Muffins: Great mix of a donut and muffin. One of my favorites!
-Breakfast sandwich: Egg, Bacon, cheese, on a biscuit

They also have some great fresh baked sourdough bread. 
Hint: Ask for your breakfast sandwich on sourdough instead of the usual biscuit.  The biscuits are good, but can't quite hold up to the massive egg, bacon, and cheese awesomeness of the breakfast sandwich.

The have changed the coffee now several times since opening and Blue Bottle was by far my favorite, but the latest Bicycle Coffee is very good.  If I were rating them as a "Coffee Shop" it would be 4 Stars, but I don't come here just for the coffee.  The coffee is just the icing on the cake... scones, muffins, fresh bread, and all of the other delicious baked goods!
author: Rob L.

description:
I have been here 3 times!! I live on the other side of town, so this is not a place I just pass by!! I made the effort to come here. 

I love their coffee and their cinnonmon rolls!! 

They can be a little disorganized, but it's like walking into someone's kitchen!!
author: Judi K.

description: I wanted to like Devils Teeth. There's a line out the door which makes you feel like you're about to get in on a secret for great pastries. I think I'm as disappointed about the bait and switch of that as the cinnamon roll. It was so hard on the top I couldn't cut through it. I had to crack it apart. And not the good, crisped sugar and butter, crack. It was the hard, I don't know when to take things out of the oven, crack. The edge was inedible. We waited a ridiculous amount of time for beignets. Typically beignets are worth any wait. But these took so long because they were over cooking them. Not kidding....tough, chewy, and seriously dark brown on one side. I will NEVER go back. There are too many good places to eat for this level of service, product, and price.
author: Elaine B.

description: Hands down the best breakfast sandwich I have had on the west coast by far. After living here for 8 months I am convinced that there a very few places that really know how to construct an amazing breakfast sandwich. Devil's Teeth Bakery nails it. I did not expect the marriage between all the ingredients to work so well but man the biscuit with the bacon the egg and avocado had me dancing in my seat. Great and super friendly staff. I'll buy a shirt next time because its that good. Pretty decent thai iced tea too. I recommend this place to anyone looking for a good on-the-go breakfast that will make your day better or start your day off right!
author: Shaun M.

description: So, this business remains a most wonderful local presence just because they do what they do so well,  but they also recently extended their support to a local cause: The Marine Mammal Center...DTBC provided an amazingly generous supply of baked goods to the volunteer workers at TMMC who are working crazy hours/ in crisis mode given all the seals who have been stranded recently on our beaches.  Devil's Teeth was already great in so many ways but now has added another precious layer in their presence here in the western end of the city/ coastline; as generous donor to a local environmental cause.  As an aside, I'd like to thank Andrew @ DTBC who facilitated the connection, a most gracious representative.
author: Lauris J.

description:
A friend recommended Devils Teeth Baking Company to me and I had to try it right away after reading the other reviews. I got the cinnamon roll and a piece of quiche to bring home. Everything in the case looked good but I wanted to practice a little constraint.

Both items were extremely good. My husband loves cinnamon rolls and the one we had was super chewy and sticky. It was so good.

The quiche was really tasty. The crust is super flaky and the filling was super flavorful. We even recently ordered a whole one to take to "Le Diner a San Francisco" last Friday. Since I live kinda far from this place, I love having an excuse to make the trip out here to grab some stuff.
author: Lindsay B.

description:
If you're in the SF area, and you enjoy baked goods, this is a MUST GO. The cinnamon rolls, muffins and breads are delicious. The rest of their treats look tasty, too, but I haven't sampled them. The reason you must go? Breakfast sandwich!!

An impossibly buttery, flaky, tender biscuit sandwiches fluffy scrambled eggs, thick bacon, and melty cheese. It's huge, probably too big for most people, but you still won't want to share. 

The sandwich is only about $5. I think my husband and I spent at least $40 on cab fare to get to and from the bakery when we were in town for the Nike Women's marathon. Worth it.
author: Wendy R.

description: The breakfast bars and cinnamon roll are rich and delish!
author: Johnny C.

description:
I will take one of everything!

So yummy, I really could have taken one of each home and been so happy! We had the breakfast sandwich , the biscuit was amazing, and fluffy eggs the way they should be.  Tried the donut muffin, the best of 2 wonderful baked items in one.  Cute little parklet with benches for warmer days, which at this location just means no rain. Don't miss out on this neighborhood gem.
author: Nikki H.

description: Breakfast sandwiches are amazing. I also love their brownies and lemon tarts!
author: Allyson L.

description: I really wanted to love this place. I have been there several times now and it has been hit or miss. Last week I ordered a meat quiche and ended up getting vegetable. This week I got beignets and when I got to work opened up the bag they were burnt. You do always have to wait in line which is not a bad thing if their products were reliable. I do usually end up waiting at least 20 minutes so not a place where your in a hurry.
author: michelle b.

description: The single best breakfast sandwich I've had outside of NC.  Donut muffin, decadelicious.  Chai latte, gorgeous.  Banana Nut Bread, pretty good.  Fast, friendly, yes!
author: Andy D.

description: This is an amazing bakery owned by locals that have the best breakfast sandwich in the city and it is reasonably priced! The only downside to this place is that the word is out and there is always a long line on the weekends but the owner always keeps this place well staffed and the line moves quickly.  They also have great quiches, cookies and a delicious curry chicken sandwich!
author: liz B.

description: I visited Devil's Teeth after hearing rave reviews about their breakfast sandwich. I ordered the 'special' version and it was well worth a visit. The biscuit is fantastic and all the ingredients are great quality. Highly recommended!
author: John B.

description: This is a great spot!  I LOVE the breakfast sandwiches... they are huge and delicious.  Looking forward to trying other treats.  The brownie we got last weekend was off the chain!  Get there early on the weekends before they run out of biscuits or you'll be forced to eat super thick sourdough (hard to eat and too much bread).  Cool seating on the sidewalk.
author: Rich F.

description:
Let me start off my review by saying...OMFG THIS IS HEAVEN aka. NIRVANA.

When I die I hope I can enjoy pastries and desert treats this great. No bullshit, this place is LEGIT, BELIEVE any and all hype! But why?

Well for one, the prices are SUPER CHEAP for the quality and size of portion. Let me give you a good example. If you have eaten their treats here I'm sure you have sampled some at Tartine Bakery (another amazing place for pastries, and deserts)...Devil's Teeth Baking Co. is just as good if not a tiny bit better but WAY CHEAPER. For example...at Devil's Teeth Baking Co, you pay $3.00 for their Cinnamon Roll but if you were to buy a comparable pastry at Tartine... guarantee it would be $8 or $9. 

Cinnamon Roll: ABSOLUTELY THE BEST! So good that every time you take another bite, you can't help but "omg so good". That is how you know it's SUPER LEGIT!

Cheesecake: VERY VERY GOOD and HUGE. Has a delicious lemon cream icing and the texture of the cheesecake is smooth. The crust is great as well, not overly sweet, but sweet enough to give it that yummy taste!

Breakfast Sandwich: EPIC! I never would have thought egg's could be so fluffy. Very big sandwich to fill you up the right way for the rest of your day.

I would like to end this review with...did I mention how CHEAP these AMAZING OUT OF THIS WORLD deserts are? Half of me feels guilty writing such a great review because I know that if more people see this...they will run out of things when I want to go in...but I will do this selfless act and spread the joy.
author: Nick C.

description:
I saw there was a new bakery in my old neighborhood, so I had to check it out on a recent trip. Boy am I glad I did!
I went in on a sunday for the beignets and coffee. The first thing you notice when you walk in, is the smell, that scent of freshly ground coffee mixed with the warm smell of baking sugary sweets. AMAZING. It is small but cute inside. The service was wonderful. Very friendly and attentive. 
 I got my order to go and walked down to the beach. (I don't mind sharing with the dirty sea birds)  The coffee was great, but I was more interested in getting to the beignets. I  have been a lover of beignets since my first trip to New Orleans when I was a kid. I am always on the lookout for a good beignets, and sadly I am frequently disappointed. Not this time. They were delicious! Lightly crisped on the outside and soft as a sweet, fluffy cloud inside, covered in a light powdered sugar coating. WOW, was I ever happy. I can not wait for my next trip to Devil's Teeth!
author: Jamie-Lynn H.

description:
Very underrated being that it's in the outer sunset. This is a hidden gem in the heart of the outer sunset. Literally everything they make is on point. The breakfast sandwiches are the best. The people there are awesome and you always feel at home when you order food/coffee there. And they have dog treats, which my dog loves. 

The place is quite small, but with the parklet on a rare sunny Sunset day, you can just sit and enjoy your food and people watch.
author: Robert C.

description:
Can we just reflect, one more time, on how amazing Devil's Teeth is? Still as delicious as ever. As I'm typing this I'm munching on my favorite: the apricot oat scone. But the heavenly goodness of their baked goods is not why I'm writing this.

How awesome is it that after I wrote my first review, the owner was nice enough to respond with a "thanks!"? And then send me another message later on telling me that they're thinking of expanding their coffee options (my one and only very small wish in my first review while still acknowledging that this is a bakery first and foremost)? And then today, I walk in after not being there for awhile (new job = morning commute that doesn't take me by Devil's Teeth, so sad), and I see the shiny new espresso machine with the note that the expanded coffee selection is coming soon. !!!!!!

Now I am not going to say that they went through all this trouble just for me... but it is 100% fantasticness that they listen to the needs and wants of their customers. I may need to start getting up earlier so I can deviate from the commute route to make this my morning coffee/scone stop before work. Not much will make me willing to set the alarm clock any earlier than it already is, but Devil's Teeth... you're just that good. ;)
author: Alison Y.

description:
I'm so ashamed that I must "sin" on Sundays at Devil's Teeth.
OK "sin" is an extreme word. Let's just say that I can enjoy indulging on my vices , coffee and pastries, each Sunday , more specifically, a cup of blue bottle coffee and a couple of freshly made beignets.                                                                                                                So devilishly delicious but oh so good.
author: Stella B.

description:
I paid $45 dollars for a cake this morning and asked for a receipt. Lady at the counter said they are "paperless" (despite the cake being in a paper box twice too large) and wanted my email/phone number to email/text a receipt. I said that I don't like giving out my personal information which is sold to marketers. At that point she was "over" me as a customer (I'd already paid) and already focused the next customer without addressing my very reasonable request. 

They may be attempting to be progressive by going "paperless", but their self-righteous attitude is ridiculous. Screw you too!
author: Jendy M.

description: BUTTER and FLOUR. This place doesn't hold back. Shared the biscuit breakfast sandwich and a couple Sunday beignets. Really friendly service. The biscuit wasn't quite as crisp as I woulda liked but it may have softened in the tin-foil wrapping. All is forgiven. That cinnamon roll is a 3 person ordeal tho.
author: Anthony R.

description: Had their breakfast sandwich and its amazing!!!  They make their own muffin for sthe sandwich and its amazing! The best part is for fresh and tasty sandwich you just pay $5 (plus tax I think) I tried a few other things there such as the chocolate cake and a cookie both were fresh and tasty. Place is always crowded so expect a bit of a wait. Well worth the wait though!!
author: Diana s.

description:
Wonderful and friendly little shop. Stopped by here after lunch to get some goodies and possibly something for breakfast the next day. This place had a great little assortment of cakes, scones and muffins (considering it was late in the afternoon). 

I was able to try the Apricot Oat Scone and the Donut Muffin. The scone was a bit dry for me but it's been hard to find a scone that isn't, I did however enjoy the fresh apricot taste of it and I do admit that I like oats :). I bought 1 donut muffin but eating it on the Bay Bridge driving back home I really wished I had got a 2nd or 3rd. The donut muffin was moist and could be described as a mix between a donut hole and a churro... but a lot better than that.

Would definitely come back especially since the guys here were so nice. The scene is pretty hip, considering they do their cashier duties on an ipad.
author: Tracy Joy K.

description:
This place has the best parklet! My favorite I've seen throughout the city.

And they have an awesome $5 breakfast sandwich. Really into the raspberry bar and the cinnamon bun is huge! could be shared between 4!
author: Jessica C.

description: Breakfast sandwiches are amazing, and they have the best cinnamon roll I've ever tasted. Great spot for after a surf at OB!
author: Josh S.

description:
just go here on a gorgeous day for sunshine, puppies, and the fattest, yummiest, buttery-est breakfast biscuit in the universe. 

drip coffee is pleasant, smooth, and a bit spicy 

the chocolate chip cookie is also a 5/5 ! 

this might be the best bakery/cafe in all of san francisco and i'm relieved that it's tucked so secretly away in the way outer sunset. 
can't wait to go back soon!
author: Libra J.

description:
Such delicious baked goods! So unique and "real" tasting! Not expensive at all, either. Located conveniently in the Sunset District where parking is (usually) plentiful. Devil's Teeth is also quite generous with their samples. I'm not a big ginger fan, but today I got their ginger cookie and it was sweet yet spicy in that weird sugary-gingered type of way. Its perfectly incorporated molasses (if I'm not mistaken) makes the cookie oh so chewy and moist. I ate half of it the next day and it was still as good as it was the first day. Also got the apricot scone- OMG! I always though scones were dry and brittle and yucky (that's what happens when all you've had was Starbucks scones) but Devil's Teeth's was lightly buttery, moist, yet held its structure and didn't crumble too much.

Overall, a recommended home-made style bakery in the City.
author: Tiffany C.

description: There are very few occasions I will venture to the outer sunset and DTBC is one of them and well worth it.  All the baked goods are amazing and if you don't like this there is something wrong with you.  The breakfast sandwich is my favorite and a must try.  Really this is probably one of the only reasons I would drive out toward the beach unless of coarse there was a massive wave that would sweep over my ex-boyrfriend's house and then I would watch that while happily eating a fluffy bacon egg and cheese biscuit sandwich.
author: Micaela M.

description: Just finished devouring my first breakfast sandwich from Devil's Teeth. It was delicious. I'm not sure if my judgement was clouded by my desperately high hunger level or if the tomato that I subbed in for bacon was one of the ripest slices I've ever tasted. Kudos to the produce buyer. The biscuit was fluffy and warm. The scrambled eggs were hanging out with the right amount of cheese to bring me back to the happily satiated state I now am. Seriously the best $5 I've spent on breakfast.
author: Jennifer W.

description: Get the special breakfast sandwich!!! Its amazing! Worth the weekend crowd at this little neighborhood joint in the sunset. What a find!  Benches to sit outside and  a couple of counter style chairs inside. But generally during the weekend its too crowded to eat inside. Oh yeah did I mention blue bottle coffee. I also had the blueberry lemon scone it was really good, buttery and flavorful.
author: Joel Z.

description:
Of course right when I move from this neighborhood is when they open the baking/coffee shop of my dreams....

Yummy Blue Bottle Coffee made in the same crafted manner as Blue Bottle's own cafe's and the best, yes BEST breakfast sandwich I have had thus far. I intially bought just one to share with my sister, but after I took the first bite I had to order my own (or maybe she had to order her own cause she couldn't pry the sandwich from my hands).

Many compliments to the staff as well for juggling the lines of hungry people shouting out orders of beignets with warm smiles. Because the sandwich was so delicious my sister and I dodged in and out of line to look at the pastries before deciding on a lemon bar and apricot scone to go, which I may have devored completely on the 10 minute walk home. And by 'may have' I mean I did.
author: Evita M.

description:
It was my first time trying Beignet and overall, not a bad experience. I enjoy the smell when I got out of my car. I loved how they have seatings outside where you can hangout with your friends, and I loved the powdered sugar-- who doesn't!? Although I had nothing to compare to, I have to say that the Beignets were a bit chewy. From what my friends said, beignets aren't chewy... so i was a bit dissapointed. 

Another thing... you have to go on a scavenger hunt to find napkins! They are hidden behind all the sugars!
author: Sappho C.

description:
What???  No more Blue Bottle?  It has been replaced by a weak, bitter coffee (Sightglass) that is infused with spices.  Sorry, not drinking the 'Sightglass' kool aid, and I don't want spices in my coffee.  And even though I feel like I am betraying a good friend, when I walk up to the counter to inform them that we are not happy with the coffee, and were unable to finish it, I damn well better get more of a response than "okay", when we are pouring $4 cups of coffee down the drain.
Signed,
Singin' the Blues

Update:
I was contacted By the bakery and offered an apology, refund on the coffee, which were $2.50 per pressed cup, not the $4 i had quoted, and most important, one of my favorite ginger cookies! Class act from a bakery that is back on my favorite list.  
Not sure about this new coffee movement toward what I perceive to be weak coffee, but it's all about the baked goods!

Thank you Devil's Teeth!
author: Arlene C.

description:
So, this place is pretty much Da Bomb Diggity and here's why....They have the most delicious hand made treats. Ever. 
I tried the doughnut muffin, Beignet, and Chocolate Chip cookie. This was my first time eating a Beignet and I have not to tell you....I would be tempted to scoot my booty over there every Sunday after tasting that delicious treat. WOW. A Hot, fresh, doughy and powdered sugary treat...SOLD. 
The other treats were good too but I think they are known for their Beignets and they are only...wait for it..... ONE DOLLAR! Yuuuuup. 

What I loved is that all the peeps working there had smiles on their faces. There was a kitchen aid mixer, a dozen eggs, cheese, out on the counter and you know they make up some legit breakfast sandwiches as well. 

ladies, there are lots of cute boys that hang there and if I was single....you better believe I would be parking it on the bench outside trying to spark some conversations with those cuties :-)
author: Melanie B.

description:
Dropped by Devil's Teeth on Sunday - missed out on their $1 beignets but was able to try the Donut Muffin and Apricot scone. Donut muffin is like a cake donut in cinnamon sugar...DELICIOUS...... Apricot scone was good but donut muffin won out this round. 

Service was friendly and quick. Can't wait to go back and try some more goodies!
author: Julie F.

description:
I love everything about this place: the environment, the food, the staff.

It was my first time here, somehow I've never noticed this place even with going to the Korean place next door or the pizza place across the street... I had a hard time deciding what I wanted to get first. Finally, I made up my mind , the sign said it was beignet Sunday so I had to get one right?

Boyfriend got a breakfast sandwich that was delicious (he wished for a sausage patty but I am no fan of breakfast sausages) and I ended up with only one beignet and a coffee (didn't want to overload before practice).

My only mistake was getting only one beignet. Boyfriend took a bite, loved it, and wanted one himself! He doesn't even like sweets! Will be back again, probably next Sunday. I want to try everything they've got.
author: Stefanie S.

description: Best breakfast sando in the city and I've done a lot of research!
author: Dan H.

description: Why did it take me a year to find this place?? Love the vibe here. Its a small, bustling shop with long wooden benches outside to hang out with your friends, babies and dogs. Cinammon roll is decadent and kale and cheddar scone was delicious. Will try the breakfast sandwich next time, as well as bring my own drip coffee. Wasn't really a fan of the roast they had - a tad on the sour side. A great pit stop on the way to the beach and a nice way to start the morning if you're not in the mood for a pricey sf brunch that you'd wait in line for hours for.
author: Lisa H.

description: Who needs Tartine when we have the Devil's Teeth!  The oatmeal cookie was wonderful.  I can taste the butter oozing down my arteries, but who cares.  It was good.  Looking forward to frequent visits.  Loved the seating outside, so chic.
author: Helen L.

description:
Today was a rare treat where I am alone on a Sunday morning which meant I did not have to cater to anyone for breakfast. Remembering a nearby bakery that Yelpers claimed to serve beignets on Sundays, I grabbed a hoodie and five dollars and I made the trekked through the mist to Devil's Teeth Baking Company.

I was vaguely surprised to see the crowd despite the typical Outer Sunset weather. Luckily, the queue was relatively quick and I ordered two beignets and a cup of coffee. The total rang up to $4.67. Good for me because I only had five dollars. The Bicycle Coffee was very good. I liked it better than Blue Bottle. It was perfect with the beignets which was fried and delicious when still warm. Advice: don't eat it cold--it does not taste great cold.

Cost Breakdown:
1 French Pressed Coffee (Bicycle Coffee) @ $2.50
2 Beignets @ $1.00/ea
Healthy SF tax/surcharge 3.77%? @$0.17

Total:  $4.67
author: Annie Y.

description:
It's a very long drive to get here, but I'm willing to take another trip here again and *early*!  We came here on beignet sunday ($1 each), which apparently is their busiest day.  We came for the cinnamon rolls, but it was close to 3PM and they were all out!  We tried their beignets, which comes out fresh and super hot from the fryer.  They were good beignets and decently sized so that one was enough to satiate my desire for deep fried goods.  Their donut muffin was okay, but not really my thing.  

They ran out of biscuits and had to bake some more, so we waited about 15 minutes for them, but when we got our breakfast sandwich, that thing was a monster!  It was a lot bigger than I had expected, and I really enjoyed it!  The fresh baked biscuit was totally worth the wait.
author: H. L.

description:
