May appear to look super packed from outside but it's a small shop and they get you through the line fairly quickly! 

Have been here countless times over the past couple years to treat my sweet tooth... it never disappoints. My family and I always try something new so here is a run-down of some different items :

What I've tried:
donut muffins-- ***these are the absolute BEST!!! they are essentially donuts shaped as a small muffin dipped in cinnamon sugar. my tip: ask when the batch came out of the oven...  they are the best fresh because they're still warm and incredibly soft. 

breakfast sandwich-- definitely filling and full of flavors. I did have a hard time finishing mine though because of the size! (guess that's a good problem to have)

beignets on sundays: good and very warm and fresh! there is always a line! nice to have that type of treat offered fresh at a bakery, especially after tasting the real deal in New Orleans at Cafe du Monde

giant cinnamon roll: Very GIANT, gooey, and sweet!! it's hard to pass up once you see it. Only way I was going to end up finishing it though, is if it was split four ways. 

Apricot scone: my moms a big fan of apricots and I bought her one on her birthday, it was a perfect texture and great mixture of fruit with pastry.
author: Adrianna C.

description:
Sometimes providence smiles down on you and good things happen. Through Yelp I discovered that a new bakery had opened in my neighborhood. It is directly across the street from my favorite produce store so I am not sure how I didn't notice it before, but after reading the reviews I searched it out this morning and there it was, a shining beacon of baked goodness standing out against the Outerlands overcast skies.

The smell of coffee greets you as you walk in the door. Fresh single brewed cups of Blue Bottle Coffee are being made to order. The flavor was robust. A great cup of coffee. (And after seven years as manager for Starbucks, I know good coffee).

All the baked goods looked great and the crew in the back was busy making breakfast sandwiches and I smelled some delicious soup being served, but I had my target set on the dougnut muffins.

A delicious, moist, cakey, doughnut like, muffin that had a nice firm outer layer, revealing a fluffy interior. The donught muffin was rolled in a sugar/cinnamon mixture and they had jsut the right amount of coating. 

Not quite a muffin and not really a doughnut these breakfast treats are delicious to eat. I can't wait to go back and try all the other items on the menu. The cinnamon rolls looked yummy.

From a food and coffee standpoint they are pro's, but the crew does need to work on the service side of business. Both counter people were taking orders and also expediting orders, so the register person kept walking away  and it took much longer than it should have to order and pay. 

The person working the ipad register should only take orders and cash and everyone else should do the expediting and preparation. 

In fact it would run smoother if the register and the coffee brewing station were reveresed. Then the customer flow would go from order placing and payment, to food and coffee pick up.


Devil's Teeth Baking Company is exactly 0.4 miles from my house (a brisk 8 minute walk to work of those Doughnut Muffins) so I can tell you right now I will be a regular customer.

Beignet Sunday's here I come!

if you are visiting the Outer Sunset be sure to stop in at Devil's Teeth Baking Company
author: joe f.

description:
Why wasn't this here when I was still living in SF?!? I lived 2 blocks away back in HS and often go back to see the family. Stumbled across this place this summer and it was great. The drip coffee was delish. Very bold and great flavor. The baked goods are scrumptous which includes: 

cinnamon buns: huge! you can share this with one or 2 other people. I like to heat it up a little so the inside is nice and soft while the caramelized crunch is still on the outside. 

lemon bars: perfect! not too sweet as many places make it and definitely more zesty than sour.

quiche and breakfast sandwiches: can you say yum? They have different choices each day also.

And the best part?!?! FREE DOG TREATS for my little pup...
author: Justin L.

description: The breakfast sandwiches with bacon are so amazing! I have never had better bacon. Simply delicious! Make sure to also try to the ginger cookies. They are definitely the best I've had.
author: Liza C.

description:
S   P   E   C   I   A   L
B   R   E   A   K   F   A   S   T  
S   A   N   D   W   I   C  H

everything here is good. coffee is bomb. savory & sweet baked goods, all bomb. service is excellent.
author: Tiger Lily ..

description: Amazing baked goods and breakfast sandwiches (don't forget to try their hot sauce)! The staff is super nice and kids can draw with chalk on the sidewalk while you sit in the sun (or fog) waiting for your delicious food.
author: Lauren S.

description: The special breakfast sandwich is amazing! Well deserving of the hype. It was too big for me so I had to split it so I could also have a beignet. The beignets are super messy but fluffy and delicious. My friend also got a cinnamon roll but it was too much for him at once. I recommend coming here with someone so you can try more things.
author: Jeanette C.

description: I came to this place after seeing all the great Yelp reviews and everyone's right... the Breakfast Sandwich is AMAZING. It typically comes with bacon, but since I don't eat meat, they let me substitute it for avocado with no additional charge! I love that! Also, $1 beignets on Sundays! Soooo yummy!!
author: Cat M.

description: Beignet Sunday!!! Baked goods such as the donut muffin and cinnamon rolls are on fire! Pastries are fresh and flavorful. Great place to stop by for breakfast! Closed on Tuesdays tho.
author: Brian C.

description: Finally hit up this place after saving their bookmark for a year! The praises and awards are well deserved. The indulgent Special Breakfast Sandwich is simply awesome and on-the-lighter-side Chicken Curry Salad Sandwich is supremely delicious. The salad consisted of red/green leaf, moist chicken (of course), cubes of apple and grapes, almond slivers, and some celery, and was loaded on a robust slices of bread. Can't wait to try their other bakery items and sweets.
author: Cliff W.

description:
OMFG!! The Cinnamon Roll thingy with the crunchy buttery top? OMFG!! I have NEVER had anything as delicious as the Cinnamon Roll Thingy. It should be friggen illegal to serve stuff that good. And for $3? WTF?? CHECK THIS PLACE OUT!!!!  And get the CInnamon Roll Thingy. OMFG!!

But they really really really need to stay open later than 4PM. Come on guys, seriously? 4PM?
author: Mark T.

description: I love the breakfast sandwich and the quiche is great! It can get a bit crowded and slow but it's worth it.
author: chris e.

description: Has some of the delicious breakfast sandwich in the area. It's pretty big, a sumptuous layering of bacon. The quiche is tasty too. The place isn't neat, one of those places which maintains the patronage by sheer taste..
author: Akash Y.

description: Delicious!! Had the Curry Chicken Salad sandwich and a cinnamon bun. Really delicious rich. It might be a small looking sandwich but it is filling. Just the right size. The people running/owning the bakery were a happy bunch. Made the waiting for the sandwich enjoyable. Thanks and will be back!!
author: Arthur G.

description:
Ah, the BLT.  An amazing sandwich, so simple and delicious, yet it can be pretty easy to f-up. Devil's Teeth does the BLT justice.  Delicious bread lightly toasted, appropriate amount of mayo and mustard (which they asked if I wanted for first) and great fresh greens and tomato.  Basically couldn't ask for more.  It was 5 bucks, which is a total steal. 

Also, as I started to write this, I just remembered I still have a chocolate chip cookie that I ordered this morning.  Mmmmm.. so delicious.  

Finally, there happens to be a very cute girl working behind the counter.  Always nice to get your sando with a pretty smile.
author: Alex R.

description:
Beignet Sundays! Beignet Sundays! Beignet Sundays!

I come here practically almost every Sunday I can to get a fix of their light, puffy, FRESH, powdery beignets in a brown bag. I love sinking my teeth into the fresh, soft dough as powder sugar collects all over my lips including my nose. Just don't breathe in... the sugar will choke you!

Their bacon quiche is delish. I've tried their spinach quiche, but can live without it. The boyfriend enjoys the breakfast sandwich because they overdose it with scrambled eggs, just as the way boys like it.

Everyone knows how much I normally hate lemon flavored pastries and cakes, but I am in love with the lemon squares. There were tiny pieces as samples to try. I had one crumb and decided to buy an entire square. Chocolate chip cookies are big... healthy tasting. 

"Small" lasagna was HUGE and very filling. I'd still choose the quiche over the lasagna.

Everything is reasonable priced for breakfast. I think I've tried everything on the menu throughout the weeks except for their coffee. Darn... if only I can drink caffeine ;[ This place is close, convenient, and an amazing place to grab a quick bite before heading on the road or even to practice.
author: Rosanne L.

description: Ooooh...   Ahhhhh....   Yummmmm!!!  I love having a late breakfast in the sunset on a lazy sunny afternoon, then taking a long stroll down Ocean beach!  This lovely bakery makes everything from delicious fresh scones & hot cinnamon rolls, to the most amazing Breakfast sandwich's you will ever have!  My personal fave is The "Special" breakfast sandwich, which is around $5.50'ish.  It comes on an indulging buttery biscuit filled with eggs, cheddar cheese, bacon & my personal fave avocado!!  Plus, on the counter while your standing in line to pay you can taste samples of their latest & greatest delicious baked goodies, and, at the counter they ALWAYS have samples of their ever popular natural doggie snacks!  My Shih Tzu  loves them!!!  Before 11 am, I've had to wait around 20 minutes, which is why I love having an afternoon breakfast between 1-4pm, when I rarely have had to wait longer than 5 minutes.  This place is one of my top 5 breakfast spots in the city!  I highly recommend it!  But,  don't forget they are closed on Tuesdays!
author: Sierra S.

description: This is the 3rd time I checked in and I can still see myself continue coming here.  I ordered the veggie quiche on my first visit and the last 2 visit,  I ordered the special breakfast sandwich without bacon.  They offered me tomatoes to replace the bacon.  I can in late this time and they are out of biscuit but I'm fine with the sourdough.  Portion of the breakfast sandwich is big... definitely good as brunch.  The only reason I didn't give it a 5 is that I think they can improve the cleanliness!
author: Chung T.

description: We'll ride our bikes from NOPA to the Devils teeth on a crowded weekend to get a special sandwich. Enough said.
author: Raylan W.

description: Unbelievable!  I've been a few times and their doughnut muffin puts my mother's muffins to shame.  Seriously mom, step up or step down because Devil's Teeth just called you ooooooouuuuuuuttttttttt!!!
author: Cody G.

description: I'm giving this place one star because I have had one decent experience out of the 5 times I've been here. I'm extremely irritated by the mediocre at best service. I had to get my money back after waiting 30 minutes for a cup of coffee and 2 biscuits. The employees (entitled hipsters) seem to not really understand how the service industry works. What I mean by that is when you have ordered something 10 minutes before one of the employees friends walk in and they get their food/drinks before you isn't good business. Not to mention they stop working to say hi to their friends and talk about how hungover they are from the night before. I'd like to show the owner of the place what a pathetic staff they've hired to see what kind of experience people have in their establishment. No Bueno
author: Ryan B.

description: The wait is worth it--Their breakfast sandwich will warm your soul and you will wonder how the in the heck they make biscuits and bacon THAT good. Eat the BLT too! Their cinnamon roll is different in that it has no frosting, but you will still totally dig it. Love the cheddar beer muffins too...Big kudos to the staff. There is a reason it is always busy--they are doing God's work!
author: jodi s.

description: Hands down the best breakfast sandwich I have ever eaten. One of the cook's commented that the sandwich would be extra amazing because the biscuits were fresh out of the oven. He was not kidding. This is my new favorite place in the Outer Sunset.
author: Casey B.

description: Really sweet people behind the counter and very baby and dog friendly. The breakfast sandwich is a buttery special treat! The donut muffin is okay, the cinnamon roll delicious. Such a great place to go if you are near la playa!
author: christine c.

description: What can I say that hasn't been said about this amazing place? The sticky bun, with its flaky layers of dark sugary butteryness...The fluffy, flaky biscuit samdwich (egg, cheese, and bacon). If it weren't closed now I'd be on my way to pick something up. Oh, btw, the chai is not sweet and pretty spicy. That works for me. I have not come across any better bakery than this one.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
Had to see what the fuss was about - that, and you had me at "beignet". 

Street parking was forgiving @ 11ish on a Sunday morning, which brings me to ... Beignet Sunday - made fresh to order - fried dough dropped into a powered sugar-filled brown paper bag with my name written on it... Lovely. Not too greasy, not too heavy, perfectly coated. Yum. 

While I was waiting, I threw in a cup of coffee & bought a lemon bar (a recent craving) and a ginger cookie (which I'm a sucker for) with the thought that I'd share them with Dad who is dropping by later.  I will say that I prefer stronger flavors - BOLD coffee, DARK chocolate, Darker beers - follow? This being said here we go - 

I LOVE citrus, and like my lemon goods more on the tart side than most.   I'd agree with another reviewer's take on it - not too sweet, not too tart. It was a nice lemon bar - generous size, gorgeous shortbread base, nice crunch. For my palate, I'd like a bit more ZIP and POP of LEMON - so this was lacking for me, but nice nevertheless. This one was easier to walk away from than the next item... 

The ginger cookie snuck up on me.  Bakesale Betty has the most GORGEOUS ginger cookie. It is my gold standard. And THIS ginger cookie gives Betty a run for her money. 
The full flavor experience didn't hit my palate for a few moments. It's sneaky like that. I'd like more bits of ginger, but it was chewy & delectable. And I'm being a VERY good daughter leaving half for Dad.

It was a good first visit, I'll go back to sample other treats  (and another ginger cookie). 

Limited seating inside a very small shop. Staff is friendly & helpful. It's worth a look if you're nearby, and I'd think coffee and some treats would be just the thing to take to GG Park or a stroll down the beach.
author: Mc L.

description: :( Guess they were bust on Sunday. Ordered two breakfast sandwiches, only one had bacon in it. I think they were super busy, so I'll forgive them, but a breakfast sandwich without bacon is a little disappointing. Nevertheless, they are always friendly and work hard to get your order out fast. I like how they mingle with the locals and they seem to have quite a popular spot going.
author: Naomi K.

description: Been to this place twice. Breakfast sandwich is delicious - bacon, cheese, and egg on a buttermilk biscuit. Yum! Also tried several dessert and breakfast pastries. The donut muffin was not my cup of tea. Basically, it's a dense cinnamon sugary muffin. I guess I was hoping it'd be more donut-like than muffin-like. The lemon bars had just the right proportion of crust and filling and tartness. Cinnamon roll was so sweet and rich that it should be made candy size, or just make sure to share! But the caramelized brown sugar and butter flavor is amazing. The brownie is pretty standard, more on the dense cakey side than fudgey side, if that makes sense. Lastly, the cheese cake has become one of my favorites! Just the right density and the flavor is somehow full and complex.
author: Rachel L.

description: Visited this cafe for the first time today and it was great all around, food and customer service. I ordered the vegetarian lasagne. It took a little while and when I did get my order it was meat lasagne not vegetarian.  Not only did the employee (maybe owner?) refund my money but she also gave me a donut muffin as an apology for having to wait so long. Until today I had never heard of a donut muffin, but it was delicious as was the lasagne!
author: Terra B.

description:
This place always has a line out the door on weekends (I haven't been any other time).  The breakfast sandwich is really simple with scrambled eggs and bacon, but what makes it so great is that it's on their homemade biscuit.  It's a buttery mess.  Another favorite is the cinnamon roll, it can feed 3 people.  Also $1 beignets on Sundays.

The coffee is pretty good, but I don't believe they make espresso drinks.  Friendly and laid back environment.  They have some outdoor seating, but it's usually crowded and pretty chilly outside.
author: Chuck P.

description:
I've only been here once so far, but my wife and I will definitely be coming back.  Their treats are eye-watering, and delicious.  There are a dozen different things I want to try.

The location kinda sucks though, they're out in the sunset.  On the other hand, it should keep the hipsters away.
author: Jon M.

description:
Sorry. Can't write much. Eating my "small" $3.50 piece of lasagna for the 5th time this week. Did I mention it's Friday...which is actually the 5th day of the week? 

Closed on Tuesdays. Have never seen my co-workers more upset than that.

Just check it out. You WILL regret it because you will spend your whole paycheck here for the rest of your life. Delicious. Sunset is on the rise!
author: Allan M.

description: You wouldn't expect such a great bakery out here by the beach. What a delightful surprise. The breakfast sandwiches are amazing. All the baked goods are great. I don't think they ever expected to be this popular or they would have gotten a bigger place. Really would love a larger space with table seating. Expect to stand in line for a few minutes and there is a wait for cooked food. Great baked goods. Really one of the best bakeries in the city.
author: Bill W.

description: Great food, awesome cinnamon rolls. Great atmosphere, with a nice outdoor seating area ( parklet) definitely a place to drive out of the way to go, and will return for their breakfast menu
author: R M.

description: An EPIC place to grab your sweet and savory fix.  Favorites include; breakfast sandwich, chicken curry sandwich, BLT, shark cookie, carrot cake, donut muffin, carrot juice and coffee...  I'm sure I missed a few.. :)
author: Blake P.

description:
Today was my first day visiting Devil's Teeth and I got the Cinnabun which was DELICIOUS!! They are chewy with a little bit of crunch, not overwhelmingly sweet and not caked in gooey type 2 diabetes inducing frosting! They're just awesome and I'll be back. The woman who rang me up was cheery (which isn't hard to pull off when you're surrounded by warm, sweet smells all day) and the whole place had a pleasant neighborhood atmosphere.

I noticed they have quiche, lasagna, and breakfast sandwiches as well as the normal bakery fare.
author: Danielle B.

description:
This place is hella good! I really love pastries; had I been by myself when I visited, I probably would have bought a bunch of things to sample then and there, like the chocolate chip cookie, lemon bar, and doughnut muffin. Alas, I needed to show some self-restraint in front of my breakfast companion, so I just had the cinnamon roll. 

But what a cinnamon roll it was! I had it warmed up like everyone here has suggested. I loved the top of the roll--kind of gooey but with crispy caramelized-like bits at the same time. Soooo good!!! And it wasn't cloyingly sweet, either. I thought it was perfect. I wish I had bought another cinnamon roll to take home with me for later. Mmmm....!!! 

I did buy a ginger cookie to take home to my husband and a piece of chocolate cake for me. The cake was a huge square and a bargain at $3! I thought that overall the flavor was good, but the cake part could have been a little more moist. I took a bite of hubby's ginger cookie before giving it to him, and it was excellent. Makes me wish I had just kept it for myself.

The chocolate cake knocked down a star for me, but I'm giving Devil's Teeth five stars overall for the excellent service. The workers were really nice and very accommodating to me and my five month old baby and to my sister-in-law and one-year old nephew. We took up a lot of space with our strollers, but the workers were very gracious.

I will definitely return, and next time, I'll order an extra cinnamon roll to go for later!
author: Caroline M.

description:
The people at this Bakery are hands down the nicest and most thoughtful. I locked my key, wallet and phone in my car right outside their place and went into ask to borrow a phone to call a tow company.  One of the employees lent me his phone 4-5 separate times as the tow company too over 2.5 hrs to get there. (When they told me 20 mins) 

During the 2.5 hrs that I spent at the bakery, they offered me coffee and a breakfast sando. I told them that I didnt have any money with me and they said.. its ok. How nice is that??  I watched locals flow in at a steady pace and listened to first timers come and leave while raving about how great the baked goods were. Their service was quick and friendly.

I recommend this place for their great service and would come back just for that. As for their food and coffee that is just an extra bonus. This is how a business should be run!! Kudos to you Devils Teeth!!
author: Lammers l.

description: Wow, this place is dangerous! As soon as you walk in, you are met with friendly faces, lovely smells, and an incredible feast for the eyes in the form of decadent baked goodness. This place is no joke! It's hard to believe you could go wrong by ordering anything off the menu here. The breakfast biscuit sandos are awesome, my husband drooled over the coffee, the curry chicken salad is perfectly savory (love the grapes in it!), the cookies were delicious- I could go on. Seriously- amazing!!  If you find yourself in the Outer Sunset (or even if you don't, make the trek!), check this place out! It's not to be missed! Can't wait to go back on a Sunday for the beignets!!
author: Kelly K.

description: Don't feel like trekking across the city to satisfy your sweet tooth? Devil's Teeth Baking Co. is a nice little find in the Outer Sunset that can take care of your pastry cravings. It's relatively new, but you can find all the things that you would want out of a small cafe and more including Blue Bottle coffee, an assortment of pastries including: muffins, cookies, bars, and pies, as well as a breakfast sandwich and lasagna. Everything is very very reasonably priced. Nothing on the menu is over $5 and you get really fresh tasting baked goods. I tried the doughnut muffin ($2), which was exactly what it sounded like. A cinnamon sugar doughnut that is baked into a muffin. It can be described as one of the fluffiest muffins you'll ever have. The breakfast sandwich is also a must-try. A thin homemade biscuit sandwiches pieces of crispy bacon, fluffy eggs, and creamy cheddar cheese into a hot piece of breakfast heaven. I would love to come back to try one of their lemon bars and a huge piece of their lasagna. This place will be a great neighborhood cafe and bakery for years to come!
author: Bailey Z.

description:
updating my review- and bumping up the stars.
I've been back quite a few times since that last review- I think my bad coffee was an anomaly- I have a knack for being the guy in line that gets the last in the pot.

when I've been back on bike I usually get a breakfast sandwich and some beignets to share - both great. but I was really really happy to be near the bakery recently in my car because I was able to load up with as much as I could carry- muffins, cheddar biscuits, cookies, beignets, a piece of quiche, pastries.... 

The quiche was what I wanted to try and what I was really happy with. The next time I have a party I'm going to order a whole one.
author: El T.

description:
Just my kind of bakery with a taste :D

I'm quite a fan of this bakery for quite a while since trying their cinnamon rolls, brownies, muffins, lemon bars, pies and quiche!!! This bakery just has that oomph factor I'm looking for in a bakery! Writing about their scrumptious food makes me wanna go down the street and get some :D

Toodles!!!
author: Pierre B.

description:
This place is a game-changer for me.  I work across the street, so I had to start doing that ding danged Zumba to counteract the effects of this delicious place!  I would love to escort each person to this bakery for their first time and suggest a few things, but there isn't enough time in the day.  So here are some favorites of mine.
Favorite savory items: 
quiche- bacon or spinach, both delicious
chicken salad - mildly curried and great big portions.  get it over greens
all soups - ask for a piece of her home made sourdough with it.

Favorite sweets: 
oatmeal raison cookie - this is not normally a favorite food of mine, but Hillary's are awesome
cheesecake - it's the creamy kind, not the chalky kind.  And it's distinctly lemony, but not enough to call itself "lemon cheesecake".  It's plain cheesecake and I'd fight someone for it.
author: Jenny M.

description:
I am LOVING this place! 

I never thought I'd get tired of Tartine and Arizmendi, but this is my new favorite bakery. My top favs at the moment are the raspberry bar and the carrot cake.  

Pros
Super tasty!
Reasonable prices
Easy parking
Friendly staff

Cons
Way out in BFE if you don't have a car
Closes too early on weekdays
author: Stephanie L.

description: Great lemon bar, beignet so good!!! Warm and cozy coffee shop. Would come back if I was ever in the area.
author: Carrie T.

description: Best little breakfast spot hidden in the outer sunset!  Awesome coffee, awesome staff, and an awesome display of baked goods! The kale parmesan scone blew my mind, and of course the breakfast sandwich is always a first go-to.
author: Kaitlyn D.

description:
LOVE, LOVE, LOVE DTBC!!!!!! This is my go to place if I need a fix for some baked goods because they taste home made!!! Also their quiche's are to die for!!!!! I had the strawberry pound cake for my birthday and everyone could't get enough of it, so fresh, so home made!!!!! 

I love see The Sunset with another grand slam place to go to because there are so few of them!!!!!

Check them out!!!!
author: T C.

description: A new friend recommended this spot.  She told me to get the breakfast sandwich on sourdough.  I was not disappointed!  I also bought several cupcakes which were enjoyed by all.  My favorite was the salty caramel cupcake.
author: Stacy S.

description: I drive across town to get my hands on one of their breakfast sandwiches. You gotta try it. They will change your life!
author: Phil D.

description:
Really good breakfast sandwiches. I love their homemade quiche. The crust is delicious and crunchy. Their sweets are delicious.

I recommend the huge cinnamon roll, muffins, and lemon squares. If you're there Sundays, beignets are a MUST. They're hot and fresh and absolutely destroy my so called "diet". 

Service is pretty good, I guess. However, sometimes I feel like they lack enthusiasm serving the customers. 

Oh and for those who have dogs, they have homemade dog treats! My dogs love them. He will bite my finger off if I tried to steal one. :)
author: Jasmine W.

description:
Wasn't a fan of their blue bottle drip coffee, not sure if it's suppose to taste like that or if something went wrong but it was a little sour. 
We also ordered a lemon bar and a chicken curry salad. 
Lemon bar was too sweet and while the chicken curry salad was good, it lacked curry flavor. It also had grapes in there which I did not care for.
All in all it was a cute little joint. Looks like it is family or friends run and they make everything by hand which justifies the higher price for a bakery. They do have savory items such as lasagna if you don't have sweet tooth.
author: Bunnie L.

description:
5 stars for the "oh my jesus, this is so good" cinnamon roll (fyi - this is what I said, not the name of the bun).  At $3.50, the cinnamon roll is a bargain...it's huge, chewy, gooey good with some nice caramel bits that get stuck in your teeth.  This is truly the star of the place - everything else is meh...the breakfast sandwich especially is a pass altogether unless you are running on fumes, it's pure sustenance for a deal at $5, but not visually appealing nor very delicious.  

Thank god it's so out of the way for me.  I headed back the next day for another and finally said I need to go a sweets moratorium.
author: Miss H.

description: I like the comfortable feeling of sitting outside the bench and watching over the ocean.  I love the cinnamon rolls - so sweet breakfast sandwich is very fulfilling.  cookie a little bit pricy... overall, a nice place to enjoy/start your day.
author: D F.

description:
Beignets.. do I need to say more?  I love this little neighborhood bakery. Everything is good.
Only thing I don't recommend is the blue bottle coffee made in au lait style.  Not so good.  But everything else is excellent.

They have a little outside patio for people to hang out when the weather is nice and chalk for kids to doodle with on the sidewalk.
Love it!
author: Sam S.

description: I was here yesterday.  I went because I heard the biscuits were amazing. I ordered my breakfast sandwich and was disappointed when I saw it was made with sourdough bread. When I went to clarify I ordered the one with a biscuit, I was told 'oh yeah, sorry, we ran out of biscuits'.  That is something I should have been told before buying my food, not after so I could decide if I wanted it still or not.  I ended up with a plain sandwich, nothing special. I'm big on customer service since I work in a service orientated business and this wasn't it. I won't be going back there again.
author: Fabi Z.

description:
You must stop by Devil's Teeth Baking Company to fill up on baked goods before braving the sub-zero environment at the beach (or if you are an hour early for your doctor's appointment and must stay in the Sunset area).

There was no immediate and sure answer when I inquired what the most popular item was, so my eyes (and stomach) settled on the donut muffins.  The muffins were cloud-fluffy, fresh, and delicately flavored with cinnamon.  The quality of the muffins made its slightly inflated price ($2 each) palatable.

Will be back to try other goods!
author: Andrew M.

description:
First of all, no disrespect to those who live in that area but Devil's Teeth Baking Company is out in the boonies, and you know it has to be good if everyone is going out there to get baked goods that aren't wrapped in a winning lottery ticket.  Seriously, DTBC is THAT guuud!  

The ambiance of the place is minimal and the goodies don't come in a pretty little box with french script font logo on it, but the baked goods are absolutely scrumptious!  And what's even more surprising is how big they are, and although I'm all about quality over quantity, for $3, it's nice to get pastries that'll last beyond a bite or two.  

The cookies, oatmeal being my favorite, are the size of a small child's head, and brownies, pies and cinnamon rolls are big enough to share.  I have yet to try their famous beignets but judging from what I've had so far, it may be worth making a trip out there on Sundays.
author: S. I.

description: Another neighborhood gem! Finally made it in after living just a few blocks away and was very satisfied. First off, great customer service. The french press, black, is the way to go. SO damn tasty. I've tried the blondie bar, choco chip cookie, and cinnamon roll and I recommend them all after a nice little work-out. I will absolutely be back for that french press.
author: Bree G.

description:
A place just down the block from my house where the devil really makes your teeth rot. It's really hard to decide what you want to eat when you go in starving after a morning run because all of their baked goods are laid out right before your eyes.  They've built an outdoor seating area, which makes it dog friendly and totally fits in with the hipster feel of this block. The employees are always friendly and don't rush you when your eyes are bigger than your stomach and you can't decide what you want!
My all time fave is their lemon bar and cinnamon roll.  The lemon bars are tangy and buttery and sweet and delicious and scrumptious and.... Now my mouth is watering.  The cinnamon rolls are huge and flakey. I was a little disappointed the last time I went because my cinnamon roll was overbaked, dry, and the gooey sauce on top had turned hard and slightly burnt.  I liked their cinnamon rolls a lot better when they first opened because they had much more chewy caramel on top, making each bite toffee-like. Also because of their popularity on yelp, they've upped the price to $4.
My sis loves their donut muffins and breakfast sandwiches. The donut muffins are cinnamoney and fluffy and the breakfast sandwiches are filled with eggs and finished with a thin biscuit.
author: Cheryl Q.

description: Five stars for the donut muffin! Definitely plan to come back and try just about everything else on the menu. That donut muffin though... might be worth going for that alone.
author: K. D.

description: Okay, usually I hate to go to places where I must wait to order/receive food longer than say 30 minutes. But my son was really craving a special breakfast sandwich and so I went and waited 15 min in line and 45+ min. for food. I was so impressed by the cheerful attitude the lady at the counter had, consistently with each customer. Our food was delicious and fresh, meeting my expectations. We talked to her and she was so gracious. She is a gem. They were making a masterful effort to keep up with a line that never diminished, not for hours. My hat is off to Devil's Teeth for their calm under fire and great attitudes. Oh and food was excellent.
author: Lisa B.

description:
I've been here a couple of times already and have only tried their baked goods.

Carrot Cake - Moist and delicious with just the right amount of frosting. Big enough for two people.
Blondies - Very good, just the right amount of chewiness, with whole walnuts and chunks of white chocolate.
Cinnamon Bun -  My teenage son tried this.  It's a huge pastry and even he couldn't finish it.  It had great flavor and a dense sugary coating.  Inside it was a tad dry... would probably have been better warmed up.

Interior is very clean.  Elevated baking case makes it easy to see all the goodies which are made in small batches.  You can see the bakery/kitchen behind the main counter. People who work here are nice and patient.  This is the perfect place to pick up morning treats and head for the beach.  There's some construction going on in front of the store...more seating perhaps?
author: A O.

description:
I usually don't travel to this part of town to grab breakfast, let alone much of anything, but boy was I glad I decided to this Sunday morning. After a 5K run, I decided that I deserved to treat myself to the much talked about breakfast sandwich at Devil's Teeth. One word, awesome!

The biscuit is perfectly baked, crispy and flakey. In between the two slices of biscuit is a massive amount of eggs, bacon, and cheese. While the biscuit was a solid 4 out of 5 stars on its own, adding a bit of hot sauce takes it to the next level. After polishing off the massive breakfast sandwich, I ordered some beignets to enjoy, which were cooked perfectly, and perfectly coated with plenty of powder sugar.

While there was plenty of other delicious breakfast items to choose from, as well as Blue Bottle drip coffee, I will have to save that for my next trip to this devilishly good breakfast spot.
author: David M.

description: Came in today, not knowing what this place was special for. My friend told me their cookies and blondies are very popular. Got a chocolate cookie for my friend and a blondie for myself. Right after that, he asked me, did I want a free cinnamon bun? And I said, yeah sure! Not knowing how it looked like or anything, the more the merrier. Total came out to be 5.50, pretty reasonable. When I opened the box for the cinnamon bun, I was amazed at the presentation of it. Looked very good. Will definitely come back here, and on the plus side, dogs are welcome! There is also a container containing dog treats, I'm assuming they baked it? Yum.
author: Emily L.

description:
CONS 
- the last time i went, the iced coffee tasted funky, it was sour?? weird. 
- they sometimes run out of beignets early on sundays
- I really would like more powdered sugar on the beignets, you know, so that they look like those beignets that you would see in Google images

and yet  I give them 5 stars, and this is why

PROS 
- got a refund on the iced coffee and was offered a soy chai instead, which was yum! 
- beignet sunday WOO HOO! 
- the donut muffin is surprisingly good!  I didn't share, haha 
- there is this cute dog that hangs around outside the store, sometimes there are several cute dogs haha

Devil's Teeth, I'm a fan!
author: Christy V.

description:
Love the Parklet.  The Chocolate Cake is yummy!  The French press isn't too expensive.  Nice respite for a wander to and/or the Beach.  Conveniently located near the other Noriega strip destinations.  

I will return.
author: Artnok A.

description:
We stumbled across this bakery after having pizza across the street. It was small, cute and when we peaked through the window, there was a gentleman rolling dough late at night. So I made it a point to check out this place the next day after my morning jog.

I ordered my coffee and scone (plus their delicious jumbo cinnamon rolls and blondie to go). They serve blue bottle coffee, which was perfectly dripped and apricot scone was buttery and flaky. But the best part of coming to this bakery was their free samples of blondies, brownies, and cookies. I do understand freetiquette, but you can't help to take another sample, particularly the chocolate brownies. 

I love having this bakery in the neighborhood. I'll have to come back for their Sunday Beignets.
author: Dav S.

description: This place was amazing!! I had a beignet ($1 on Sundays), a breakfast sandwich ($5 - delicious egg/cheese/bacon sandwich on fresh-baked buttery biscuit, and some moist, tasty carrot cake ($3). The latter was a pretty large piece I saved half for later. Everything was 5 stars, even with the somewhat long wait on a Sunday morning. Would go back any time I'm in the area!
author: Kyle J.

description:
The items in this bakery look very ordinary (à la what you would see in Safeway's bakery department), made with bleached flour, processed sugar, etc. I tried the carrot cake. First, the piece was huge and barely fit into the container. If you're a quantity over quality type of person, this might be your place. The texture of the cake was too moist, almost as though half a bottle of oil was dumped into the batter. Carrot cake done properly has subtle flavors; this cake was pretty one dimensional and ho-hum.

Friendly customer service. I would not return for the food, though.
author: Jolie S.

description: Great, relaxed Outer Sunset hang.  Pretend you live in a SoCal beach town on sunny days.
author: Rob P.

description: Soooo gooood.   Ive had sticky buns, beignets, muffins, and a strawberry/ blueberry pie.....all amazing.
author: Steven B.

description:
7am may seem like a good idea to beat the heavy traffic Devil's Teeth rumored to have on weekend mornings, but the truth is, I think it's just too darn early for anyone to be full awake to operate like a functional being at that hour.  Because our baby decided he didn't want to sleep in beyond 5 on a nice lazy Saturday morning, we thought we'd take advantage (or make lemonade out of lemons so to speak) and get breakfast at Devil's Teeth that we have been wanting to try.  

The place, as we had hoped, was pretty empty.  I got a cinnamon roll, my husband breakfast sandwich.  He munched on it, as I and my son watched the two girls working the kitchen, prepping baked goods, sweeping,etc.  At some point, my lazy sleepy self started to wonder how long it takes to warm up a cinnamon roll.  Eventually my husband finished his sandwich and we went up to the cashier register asking to pay, and asking about my cinnamon roll.  The girl gave us a quizzical "what cinnamon roll" and then quickly realized that it's been sitting in the microwave the whole time.

She apologized and I got my roll, which was especially delicious after waiting for so long.  It was really really rich and decadent though.  I felt like I was pouring butter and sugar straight into my mouth.  For that size, one cinnamon roll is actually good for two breakfasts. 

I would really like to try their beignets someday---not sure what the optimal hour of the day is for a revisit though.
author: Candice B.

description: They have been improving on their soups.  I had their creamy corn soup on July 2nd that was absolutely delicious - I even emailed them to say so.  They also have some more interesting scones lately.
author: Dora V.

description: This little spot was highly recommended by a friend and was truly worth it! The location by the beach makes it a perfect place to grab a bite and take it to eat. The wait for the breakfast sandwiches was a little lengthy, but as soon as you take a bite you'll understand why. The biscuits were made to perfection and everything inside was cooked perfectly! I also ordered a mocha which was small and sweet (how I like it) and so it hit the spot. The pressed apple juice is amazing as well! I definitely will be coming back next time I'm in the area.
author: Neela F.

description: I've been here a few times and absolutely love the special breakfast sandwich. It's probably one of the best breakfast sandwiches I've ever had. I would not recommend any of the drinks though. I ordered an iced chai and Thai tea and both were very tasteless.
author: Annissa D.

description: I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!!!!!!! Ordered a carrot cake for a birthday and everyone loved how delicious it was! The perfect amount of frosting and carrots and perfectly balanced level of sweetness: sweet, but not TOO sweet. Their $5 breakfast sandwiches have everything I love about breakfast: sweet savory bacon, eggs, flaky buttery biscuit, and CHEESE. Drooling on my keyboard just thinking about all the diabeetalicious stuff I can get in my belly. I really don't mind venturing out into the foggy, cold outer sunset just for my ginger cookie, breakfast sando, and cake.
author: Erin M.

description: Good stuff from Devil's Teeth Baking Company. The beignets are great, the cinnamon roll is good, a little too sweet for me, but others like it like that. Today I had the blueberry muffin, and it was really delicious. Coffee is good, dark and strong. I like the neighborhood vibe, they keep a bowl of water outside for dogs, chalk for children to draw on the sidewalk, and a wooden-benched parklet right in front.
author: James P.

description:
The bakery has upset some neighbors. I've written about it at: http://www.jacksonfuller.com/2011/05/18/you-had-me-at-muffin-doughnut/

I did some in-depth work before writing my post, and have to say that the doughnut muffin (or is it a muffin doughnut, who cares...) is absolutely delicious. Since it is shaped like a muffin, it has to be healthy like a muffin, right? But it tastes delightfully doughnuty! 

The carrot cake and chocolate cake are also delicious, I'd highly recommend both of them (unless there is only one piece left, in which case I'd appreciate it if you could save it for me).
author: Matt F.

description:
A and I were heading home after running errands and drove by this bakery.  We parked right away, ran across the street, and popped in to see what kind of yummy baked goods they had.

They didn't have a monstrous selection, but it was Saturday afternoon.  We ended up getting one Donut Muffin and one Blackberry Banana Muffin.  I didn't try any of the latter, but I had half of the former and it was DEElicious!  Whoever thought of combing a donut and a muffin is absolutely genious.  Almost as genious as whoever invented dental floss, but I won't get into that.  At least, not now.  In this review.  Maybe later.

We were in and out in a couple of minutes.  They also check you out via iPad instead of an old fashioned cash register.  That's pretty new-fangled and techy.  Businesses just don't process sales the same way they did when I was a young whipper snapper.

I see by reading some other Yelp reviews that Sunday is Beignet Sunday.  I might just have to drop by one Sunday and try it.
author: Kris L.

description:
Can I add another 5 stars to the first 5 I gave them?

The carrot cake is so moist and amazing, I drool over it.  The beignets are warm, fresh, and perfect.  

I am going to singlehandedly keep this place in business.  I think I've been there like 4 times in the past 3 days.
author: Kandi K.

description: I kid you not... the best breakfast sandwich in all the land. The buttery biscuit that holds the magical contents inside is what makes it fantastic. Just about everyone in the sunset knows that this is the best breakfast spot in town, so you might have to wait in line. Moves pretty quick though. The outside seating has a cool vibe too
author: Stephen S.

description:
Have been back since my last visit and they have made improvements on the varying size of the beignets --they are back to original size. I was told the that owner likes to cook them in the kettle in batches and hand cut each. I am not sure if this would really make the beignets taste differently but the size of the beignets are important to the quality of the product. You can tell the owners really care about the quality of each product they put out. 

I had a breakfast sandwich and it was SOO GOOD. Try it with the Chohuli hot sauce. the Bomb! 

I also tried a brownie and it was divine. I am looking forward to trying some of their pies in the future. 

A great place to hang out on a Sunday!
author: Petri Y.

description: Gingersnap cookies! So good. Soft, moist and chewy with chunks of ginger in them. My mom would love these, but I didn't save her any. It was too good =D The Blue Bottle Coffee here was only so-so, but I usually only order espresso drinks. We tried the beignets, which were ok. They don't compare to the ones I had in New Orleans, but those are much harder to get. Breakfast sandwich was ok and the donut muffins were pretty good - fluffy, soft and lots of cinnamon sugar. My cousin had the lasagna, which she enjoyed. My favorite is definitely the gingersnap cookies.
author: Sunny C.

description:
I saw a review on this place in 7x7 and thought to check it out on a cold Saturday morning.  This place is POPPIN in the middle of nowhere Outer Sunset District!  Hooray to successful businesses on a small Noriega commercial street.  

They have a line out the door but it's worth the wait for their delicious cinnamon rolls, breakfast sandwiches and daily baked goods fresh out the oven.  They also serve Blue Bottle and Sight Glass coffee which are delicious SF coffee companies =)  I would imagine a spot like this in the Mission or SOMA, but we're lucky enough to have one in my own neighborhood.

What I love love love about this spot is not only the fresh baked goods everyday, but the family feeling in the kitchen and the great service.  Really can't beat a local community gem and I think everyone around knows this too.  You look around and it's not just the hustle and bustle of in-and-out people trying to get their quick coffee and breakfast but couples, families....DOGS there hanging out and catching up.  They even have cute doggy pales of water and snacks u can purchase inside for the occasional dog visitor. 

Go quick!
author: Sandy L.

description: Awesome food. You'll have to wait but it will be worth it. Don't let the line deter you. Skip the coffee if you can. It's hit or miss and the decaf is usually cold. Eat the breakfast sandwich and the cinnamon roll. For lunch the even my Dad liked the BLT any the grilled cheese will put you in a happy carb coma.
author: Kalie J.

description:
5 more stars! Mmmm ginormous cinnamony  rolly thingy...sugary, smushy, buttery, yummy..... I'm just sad that I forgot to order the donut muffin. And drip blue bottle coffee! My only complaint is that  they're not closer to my house near 19th and Irving. 

6-24 stopped in for bfast and picked up a half loaf of sourdough. Not as good as my fave Santa Cruz bakery, but tasty.
author: Joanne D.

description:
Came by today to check it out. This is in my neighborhood and I'm so happy to support neighborhood businesses.

Ginger cookie: Just enough sweetness with the spiced aroma of ginger in your mouth. If you like ginger, go for this. It's crisp edges/outside gives a great texture contrast to the chewy center. There are actually little chunks of candied ginger inside.  Very exciting indeed! Don't tell my diet I was cheating. 

Blue Bottle coffee: Standard. 

Service: Friendly, neighborhood smiles. The owner is sweet just like the cookies she produces. 


Again, You're ginger cookies are amazing. I really look forward to coming on Saturday with my little brother. He would really enjoy it.

Will come back soon for new pastry updates.
author: Wanster L.

description:
Devil's Teeth Bakery and its tempting baked goods are a surefire way to satisfy any sweet tooth. 


Beware. Eat in moderation.


***P.S. Thank you for providing SFSU's Associated Students with delicious lemon and blondie bars for our annual Staff Appreciation night!
author: May D.

description:
The cinnamon sticky bun was amazing!  My friend and I shared one and unfortunately the two of us could not finish it.  Super sweet, super sticky, super buttery, and super good!

He also got a breakfast sandwich which he thought was good.  I'll try that next.
author: Rosalind S.

description: I love this bakery.  It's like a hidden gem near the beach.  After my first review, I was contacted by Devil's Teeth regarding the cake that I ordered.  They went above and beyond to make sure that my experience wasn't in vain.  Jason made me feel like a valued customer, and honestly when was the last time you felt that way about any business, right?  Anyway, I will always be a fan.  Thanks Devil's Teeth!
author: Karen C.

description: Great Breakfast Sandwich (Biscuit Bacon Egg Cheese).  The Spinach Quiche is delicious...but preferred the sandwich.  mmmm.... Beignets (available only Sunday)... they also serve Blue Bottle Coffee.
author: Zoran L.

description:
Came here at 7am on Saturday and was impressed that there was constantly a line of 3-5 people during the time we ordered and ate. The store is very small with some seating (the chairs we sat in were wobbly and the table was a bit too high for the chairs. I guess most customers get their order to go).

What we ordered: 
-Breakfast sandwich: bacon, egg and cheddar on a biscuit. I thought this was okay - the biscuit and bacon were a bit too dry for me and had parts that were hard to bite into.

-Red potato, bacon and leek quiche: I don't see potato in quiche that often, and I like that they offered this in addition to the spinach. I liked the quiche overall except the crust was a bit too salty for me. The potatoes were delicious.

-Spiced cider: hot with well-rounded spices. I was expecting something sweeter, but the cider had a tartness to it that reminded me of cranberry cider instead of apple (I didn't actually ask to see what kind of cider it was, so perhaps it wasn't apple?)

-Chai latte: very strong spices with a malty sweetness. I would definitely order this again if I were a regular chai latte drinker.

They also have $1 beignets on Sundays, if that's of interest.
author: Rae L.

description: Cinnamon roll is all I can say. They are fluffy, crunchy edges, oh it's perfection in a bite. I am not a morning person though, so that sucks cause if you do not get there in the morning, they're will be close to nothing left. If you're trying to satisfy your sweet tooth, I would definitely recommend stopping by.
author: T L.

description:
Its one of the only french style bakeries in the area so they could really make a name for themselves. The pasties are good, I see some consistency issues that keep them from being great.

one problem I find is they don't really offer pastries in the morning, its all cake type dessert.  I huge square of carrot cake at 9am would effectively ruin my day

 My GF and I are both CIA grads so we go a lil nuts watching how chaotic it is in this place thou, Its not that the staff isn't super nice, and capable, its just seems like there is no flow to this place 

The kitchen needs to be kept clean and neat when every customer that walks in the place gets a birds eye view of everything that's happening, its always really messy .

Not trying at all to bash the place, its more constructive criticism
author: johnny s.

description:
lots of parking.  though i don't live nearby so i don't come here when they're open at 7am...but they say there is a line.

i went by here because i heard the name and thought, wow, a baking company LOL.  I love bakeries.  i love sweet things...so i drove from Mount Davidsion/Diamond Heights area all the way down to this place.

I bought, oh lets see.  A brownie, a couple of cookies, a lemon bar, some blueberry something(forgot what it was) and 2 cinnamon rolls(for my mom and dad).  I only could choose from what they had left.  I guess around 1 or 2, they don't have as much as usual.

got home, ate them all..even a taste of their cinnamon roll they offered to me.  

It was SOO GOOD my mom wanted to go back and buy 4 cinnamon rolls.  Huge and Tasty!

I'll be on my way here again, soon.

They close on tuesdays...so they can keep the place extra clean.  We don't want to lose a place thats so tasty to eat.  So, save your craving on tuesday for wednesday.

Any place that can open from 7 to 4pm must be doing well.  Only the best can do that.
author: Bing D.

description: A few years later and a few visits since my original review, the cinnamon roll is lacking in cinnamon flavor and just sweet, it's not soft and fluffy but hard and crunchy.  I get it, you're busy but to be smug towards people because they are not familiar with your menu is just not acceptable. Not going to spend another dime there. There are better places with friendlier staff. Beignets are decent but not worth the unfriendly treatment.
author: Terri Y.

description: BLATE with a doughnut muffin - can't go wrong.
author: Matthew J.

description:
driving all the way to devil's teeth from noe based solely on word of mouth was like going on a blind date...

...a blind date with a handsome model by day/neurosurgeon by night who also rescues puppies. 

holy crap, this place was amazing. and i'm pretty much obsessed with bakeries, so i'm a tough judge. i'm already planning my next visit to get the things i didn't try today (breakfast sandwich/blt/homemade granola) and, more importantly, to get more of the things i DID eat today (bowl of fluffy scrambled eggs/gingersnap cookie with real bits of chewy ginger/cinnamon sugary donut muffin/cheddar bacon beer muffin that even i, a beer-hater, couldn't get enough of, and lastly, the most delicious, sticky, crack-tacular cinnamon roll i have ever had in my life.). don't worry - i didn't eat all of it on my own. just most of it. 

extra points for the cute parklet outside, the box of chalk that kept my 3 year old busy while waiting for our food and the ridiculously nice staff who were friendly, helpful, and didn't even blink twice when we managed to knock over an entire pan of dishes. 

trust me - you want to go to there. now.
author: Eryn K.

description: Love this place!  I consistently crave their breakfast sandwich every time I'm back in the Bay Area.  Their sourdough bread is extra amazing (better than Boudins in my opinion) and makes the breakfast sandwich even better.  I recently tried the breakfast sandwich "special" which comes with a special sauce and avocado and loved it even more!  This is definitely a go-to place for breakfast for my husband and I.  If you're looking for something on the lighter side try the bacon cheddar biscuit.  So yummy!  Their acai berry drink is a refreshing addition to any meal.  And you can enjoy it all at the beach which is only a few blocks away!
author: Jeannie C.

description:
Love this little bakery!  

There's usually a line, but it goes by pretty quickly.  Since it's near the beach parking can be a bit tricky, but you could always find parking at one of the neighborhood streets.  I've also noticed that a lot of people tend to double park right in front.  

They serve Blue Bottle coffee in 1 size and it always comes nice and hot.  It would be nice if they put a sleeve over the cup when they hand it to you since I always find myself running to the condiment section from the cup getting too hot.  I've tried both the regular breakfast sandwich and the special breakfast sandwich.  The only difference is that the special comes with avocado and garlic aioli.  Both are YUM and well worth it.  I'm not really a bisquit person, but I'll take one freshly baked with eggs and bacon from Devil's Teeth.  This weekend I was finally able to make it out on Sunday to try their beignets and loved them.  Again always freshly made, hot, soft, and not too sweet all for $1.  I also decided to try their chocolate chip cookies and their popular cinnamon rolls.  Oddly enough, I like chocolate chip cookies that aren't too sweet.  I loved how the chocolate wasn't so overpowering.  I'm used to cinnamon rolls that are soft and gooey.  Initially, I looked at the pictures from Yelp and though they'd be exactly that, but I was wrong.  It was much to sweet for my taste and was actually on the harder side.
author: Christine D.

description:
cinnamon roll. BB coffee.

end.

ps: I NEED TO MARRY YOUR CARROT CAKE.
author: Eliza D.

description: Great neighborhood place, everything's delicious, especially the doughnut muffins and brownies.
author: Colin S.

description:
I'm sitting here as I write this review. To start, actually I don't even know where to start. 

It's Friday lunch time and at least a few dozen patrons have come and gone. The girls here are very friendly...offered my bf and I samples of anything we wanted since it's "slow" (lines are out the door on sat and sun)

Holy Hell!

Holy because I'm in heaven.
Hell because I lost self control with all these goodies!

Their lasagna is HUGE!!! And it's only $5
We tried the lemon bars (my fav), cinnamon buns, raspberry bars, lemon pie.  We're already planning our next trip back!

Luckily I'm a dentist and get free dental work cus I have a sweet tooth and this place will definitely do me in. 

Oh and I LOVE their dining table/bar (Hilary Clinton's reject). It has natural "imperfections", the way a wooden table should be . I have a similar table in the reception room at my office. It's actually what prompted me to try this place out.
author: T H.

description: Great service and great food.  Had the breakfast sandwich special. Amazing!  Best biscuit I've ever had.  Also tried the carrot cake and it was delicious. The icing is a little different than your typical cream cheese icing but it was super fresh and tasty.  Def will go back.
author: Cassandra F.

description: I love this bakery!  Such delicious baked goods and friendly service. We had breakfast sandwiches...handmade, tasty and filling. Also bought an assortment of treats, which were all great: blondies, scones, muffins, gingersnaps (with real pieces of ginger!). Good Blue Bottle coffee made fresh by the cup. They also sell quiche, pie, cake, bread, drinks, and soup. It's a real boon to have this bakery in the neighborhood.
author: Colleen B.

description: I can't believe this place was a short walk away from my apartment and I had no idea that they served up such amazingly delicious eats. The breakfast sandwich served between two buttery biscuits is drool-worthy. Get the special with avocado and you wont regret it. Finish it off with a lemon bar, cinnamon bun or another one of their many delicious pastries and your morning is complete. I'm so happy to have found this place.
author: Jennifer T.

description: This is a hidden neighborhood gem. I love the feel because I'm from San Diego and it truly feels like one of the beachside coffee shops I'd frequent. I went with the intention of only buying an apricot scone, but...I ended up halving a scrumptulicious breakfast sandwich. As others have posted, the sandwich is made with a crunchy, flaky, really good biscuit. Their coffee is from Bicycle Coffee Co. and as a drip coffee - it was darn good.
author: Jennifer A.

description:
Devil's Teeth Baking Company has the great  San Francisco foodie atmosphere that really sets itself down as a place to stay. 

I came here for Beignet Sundays with the cousins who raved about this place. We only got Beignets, but everything else looked quite homey - They won me over with love for their display and atmosphere. I liked how I could see how everything was being made, how everything functioned like Santa's workshop - it's a cooking channel's dream! 

Unfortunately, the beignets were a disappointment. It was very doughy - like doughnuts than the light airiness of true beignets that I've gotten in Disneyland or the kind my cousin got in New Orleans. They'd be good as a new kind of dessert - not a beignet though. 

The service is really great. I saw another customer return their banana pie because the cream hadn't set, so the owner gave them a new piece and offered to exchange for anything else. He also greeted each customer new or old and thanked them.

Devil's Teeth is hip (iPad cashier for the win!) and child-friendly, I have high hopes for their other goodies. They're quite cheap and the portions are large. I like the atmosphere and I'm willing to come by again for another try.
author: Christal Y.

description: If I got super obese from eating the breakfast sandwiches and BLT's here then I would regret nothing.
author: Michelle K.

description:
LOCAL LOCAL LOCAL!!!

Support your local businesses! Devil's Teeth is a new bakery on Noriega in the Sunset. They make everything pretty much fresh and yummy.

Ive had their breakfast sandwich which has fresh eggs, bacon, cheddar, in a freshly made biscuit. 

Their quiche is great too! Tasty and decent portion.

Cinnamon rolls are good! Again fresh and not too sweet! no frosting but it doesnt need it cuz then it would cover up the goodness. I think they use a different dough or baking style for the rolls because the outer layer is supper crisp!

and of course, the raspberry bars!!! they are soo good! a layer of granola with some raspberry preserves then a layer of granola nut crust!

Need to try the doughnut muffin! Read some good things about it!
author: Gordon L.

description:
Finally - a bakery with delicious treats, coffee and good service in the Outer Sunset!  This place is filling the absence of a good bakery in the n'hood.  

I've only tried the coffee, tea and several sweet treats, but will go back to try out the other items.  The banana cream pie is very good (it's my second fave after Tartine's version), and the c'chip/ginger cookies were nice.  I went back for a brownie and it was delicious.  I can't wait to try the beignets!

The staff is friendly and helpful.  After only 5 weeks of opening, this place seems to be a hit with all the locals in the n'hood and I'm sure word will get out fast about the great food/service.  I hope they consider suggestions for an espresso machine, outdoor seating and/or perhaps later afternoon/early evening hours so people can stop by for a quick bite after work.
author: T M.

description: If I lived near here I would be obese.   This place is just wonderful.   Great quality food, served without the attitude you get at other SF food places of the same artisanal caliber.   I love Beignet Day!  Thanks Devils Teeth Gang!
author: Cecil D.

description:
Amazing pastries and desserts!! 

The only reason my sister ever drags me out to Noriega is for Devil's Teeth. We don't live nearby so I would never see a reason to waste our energy driving here if this place didn't exist!

Each time we visit, my sister orders 5 items (for herself! haha) and one of them is always the banana creme pie which she never leaves the bakery without finishing. I, on the other hand, often contemplate ordering either a  large cookie, cinnamon roll, raspberry bar, donut muffin, slice of pie, or cake. I've tried them all and I don't know if it's just me, but their goods are quite filling despite how small they look. Actually, it's probably because of the sugar!

The place is quite small so don't expect to find seating each time you're there, especially on a Sunday when they roll out fresh and cute beignets for just a buck each. 

Also, something very important I forgot to mention was they serve Blue Bottle Coffee! Altogether, Devil's Teeth is the only place in the gray and gloomy neighborhood I could see turning the frown upside down on a typical windy San Francisco day haha.
author: Bets Y.

description:
Excellent baked goods.  Just looking at the cheesecake will make you weak.

They serve Blue Bottle coffee, drip style, and have beignets on Sundays!  The only problem I have with this place is no outside seating, but I understand there's a petition to correct that.
author: Jo S.

description:
Made a stop for a quick breakfast and came out with a bunch of treats! We got a breakfast sandwich, cinnamon roll, raspberry bar, and a donut muffin.

- Breakfast sandwich was good and much larger than I anticipated. It had cheese, bacon, and egg in between yummy biscuits. I couldn't finish it all. I had to save room for the rest of my treats!
- Cinnamon roll was my absolutely favorite! Super sweet and fresh. Fluffy in the inside and a little crunchy outside. I wish I had bought more for my plane ride (I made the stop before my flight)
- The donut muffin was exactly what it sounded like... A donut disguised as a muffin! Small, sweet, and soft.
- Raspberry bar was nice and chewy & crunchy. It had raspberry filling and granola. Yum.

We also got an orange juice and iced chai. I will definitely be back!
author: Jackie M.

description:
I keep coming back. It keeps impressing me. The worst thing I have to say about this place is I had the unfortunate rare miss on my breaky sandwich one day; limp sad tiny bacon, burnt eggs, unmelted cheese, and dry biscuit.  But that was maybe one out of dare I say twenty or so breakfast sandwiches I have experienced. Don't judge me people, yes I share with my friends too so it's not just all me eating breaky sammies all day every day!! 

Aside from this one miss I feel like I really lucked out and had an amazing experience that made up for that one sad sandwich. Here it goes....One day, I asked if they had cinnamon buns because I didn't see any in the happy pastry window. The friendly counter dude was like Oh they are baking right now and should be done in TWO minutes. Exciting. Basically. I was so lucky I got my fresh scalding hot amazing sugary happy goodness cinnamon bun and the bf and I got DOWN (ahem, on the cinnamon bun). It was probably one of the best things that has ever happened to me : )  really. It was that awesome.

And.... one time i ventured off of my sweet tooth and tried the potato leek bacon quiche. It was also absolutely killer! I think I should venture out and try more of their savory dishes in the future.

To sum all of this up. I love this place. It makes me feel warm and happy. I still religiously go for the brownie which fits to my brownie heaven taste buds to the tee. I also never stray far from the donut muffin. I have heard other people rag on this little guy but for some reason that damned muffin of donut REALLY gets me! Maybe I should add that I'm not a fan of raised donuts. I like them cake donuts. So this is probably why I am possibly fanatical about the donut muffin. All and all. Thank you Devil's Teeth for being there and doing a fabulous job. The owner really has a great sugar thumb.
author: Kristen E.

description:
The donut muffin was amazing! 
It wasn't too sweet, or too heavy. Just right.
A bit expensive for donuts... well donut muffin, but still worth it to try it at least once. 
I was rushing to get to school, and I ordered their blue bottle coffee but it took awhile because they hand drip it.
The staff was friendly!
I think it was a nice addition to outer sunset
author: Vee 2.

description: I think they call it Devil's Teeth because that's what your teeth will look like if you come here too much!  Great place to visit on a foggy morning after drinking too much absinthe.
author: Nobody M.

description:
BREAKFAST SANDWICH WITH COFFEE, ENOUGH SAID 

if you need another reason to go, try the cookies, or the cinnamon rolls....or anything else. 

This is by far my favorite bakery in SF.
author: Mo B.

description: The beignets are awesome, just a notch below the real thing from my hometown.   I have not had a bad bite of food at Devil's Teeth.   The crowd is a factor on the weekends,  but it is worth it.  You don't find  crowds where there is crappy food.
author: Brian M.

description:
beignets!!! on sundays!!! for a buck a piece!!! shut the front door!!!



that is all.
author: Anthony L.

description:
my new neighborhood love affair! i am so thrilled i found a bakery with delectable cafe au laits and appropriately-sized, fresh and delicious blueberry muffins

the atmosphere is neighborhood-y and its only a few blocks from my house

a great weekend treat post my runs on the beach
author: Carolina S.

description:
YUM! What a bountiful selection of delicious sweets, *and* tasty filling savories to be had at this cute and super friendly neighborhood spot. I am so pleased that this opened up. The outer sunset needed this! I went down on my birthday and did an all-I-could-eat, and loved everything I tried -- the sweet potato muffin, the breakfast biscuit sandwich (tasty homemade biscuits and really good bacon plus egg and cheese), and the sweet roll. It's so nice to have the beach right there too to walk it off 
afterwards.
author: mo m.

description:
Five stars for the beignets!! Made to order and delish!!!
Yeah fresh baked goods right here in our neighborhood.
Owners are customer service oriented. Friendly, clean and fresh.
Thanks for opening around the corner.
author: Christy F.

description: Best breakfast sandwich in the city. Simple, buttery, bacony, quick, delicious and affordable. I'm not into pastries but the GF loves all of theirs. Monkey bread, lemon bars, etc. definitely worth a trip to the outer sunset.
author: Chancelor D.

description: This place is rules. Good coffee, good food, good vibes... The girl Catherine that works there is really sweet. Shout out to her!
author: Henry S.

description: I had high hopes for this little bakery out in the Sunset.  Kind of a let down.  My wife and I ordered the breakfast sand which has bacon, pepper jack, and egg on a biscuit.  It was a great size, perfect for breakfast, but the biscuit was nothing special and as far as I'm concerned the biscuit should be the star.  It was just too damn dense.  I could see layers, but that's all they were, dense compact layers.  The Bicycle coffee was good.  If I came back to SF I would just head over to Outerlands and give that a try.
author: Bob B.

description:
Don't you just hate it when you expect this amazing place and it just lets you down! ....So i kept reading and hearing how amazing this place was and I hate that I have to give it a 3 star.

I first removed a start because there was bad customer service. I was not welcomed, everyone seem to want to ignore me. There was just no good bakery vibe! When I order my slide of chocolate cake I'm "greeted" by this tall man who has no smile, no character, he seem like he didn't want to be there,...i ask him for my slice of cake and he collects my payment, he tells some other guy ( which was very sweet) to get the slice, while this nice guy is busy doing something in the kitchen and the rude guy just stands there doing nothing when he is standing right next to the cake! He totally made me feel like he just didn't want to serve me.

Minus another star because the chocolate cake looks amazing on yelp picture that it made me crave it all day.... it was moist, it was a big piece (which I always love!), but the mixture of the cake with the frosting was not amazing... good, but not amazing.

I live so close to it that I am going to give it another try because the other deserts looked good and I hope to have something better to report.

thank you sweet guy who served me my slice of cake!
author: Nina R.

description:
This place is GREAT! Gooooood goooood gooood.

I want to clone it and bring it to the East Bay.... or to San Juan.

I def. recommend the cinnamon roll, the blt, and the breakfast sandwich.

I've been there 4 times and it seems like it gets better every time i go there.  No matter what I get there they are far from disappointing, every time!!!  It just keeps getting better!!!
author: Andrew L.

description: Okay, We had a mishap with the green tea cake, but as soon as I wrote a review I got a call from Devil's Teeth and they were very kind and apologetic about their cake. I first gave 1 star but because of the customer service and quick response I now give them 5 star. This demonstrates they take great pride and are conscientious about their customer's satisfaction. I commend their effort in making it right.
author: Connie L.

description:
Samples abound at Devil's teeth, always a welcome sign and a taste of  good things to come. Whether it's the cinnamon bun, chocolate chip cookie, or raspberry bar, you really can't go wrong.
 
The breakfast sandwich is bomb -- a bacony, buttery, biscuity flavor blast. They use real eggs scrambled and griddled up - no microwave crapola. And at $5, it's more than generous. 

Disclaimer: this gut buster sits in your stomach like a warm bowling ball (like a good breakfast sandwich should.) Do NOT eat it before any heavy lifting or long religious ceremonies.

The "bicycle coffee" is great -- so I've heard from trusted sources. Skip the organic coconut water - it's full of pulp and nothing special.
author: Dan S.

description: I have always had a pleasant experience at Devil's teeth. The staff behind the counter is super friendly and always have a great recommendation. Awesome baked goods and a great way to start a Saturday.
author: Katy D.

description: Yes, you need to try this bakery, it always delivers top notch baked goods and pastries. Their bisquits are wonderful, flaky and, yes, greasy in a lick your fingers way. Chocolate cake like id make from scratch, carrot cake rich and pineapply. Lemon bar not tangy enough for me but others think it is perfection. Tried the curry chicken sandwich, very high quality for $5, ho-made bread, gourmet lettuce and chunks of chicken with marcona almonds and grapes. Never have to wait, happy to sample and outdoor parklet is perfect on a sunny day. Much success to them.
author: Kelly K.

description: Just had their home made peach pie that my boss got us for work.  Yum! Can't wait to try their other stuff...
author: Sheenie L.

description:
I come here with the gf  on a weekly basis, for the sweets. 

Everything they have is dangerously good. The cinnamon roll is the best I've had.  

I can't think of a better bakery that does EVERYTHING good.  

Come to think of it, Devil's might be the reason for my 6 lb weight gain.  Son of a bitch.
author: Per C.

description: Lemon bar, cinnamon roll (warmed up), and brownie were good. I thought their choc. chip cookies was ok. Hubby liked their peanut butter choc. chip cookie. There's a bench area outside, but being in Sunset, not sure how often you can take advantage of it. Friendly staff.
author: Freckles H.

description: This place has the best breakfast sandwich in the sunset! If you go there on Sundays they have equally delicious beignets! Don't be put off by the line .. It moves quickly and is worth the wait!
author: Liz B.

description: The wait is way too long!!!! Waiting 20 minutes for an iced late and almost 30 minutes for a sandwich! They need to HIRE MORE STAFF!!!!!!!
author: Elizabeth I.

description: Finally after three visits.... I managed to get a sourdough bread loaf which is always in low supply.. Absolutely theeeeeee BOMB!
author: Demanding T.

description: This is what you need to get: caramel cinnamon rolls, doughnut muffins (exactly as it sounds) and blondies (cross between a cookie and a brownie). Also their breakfast sandwiches (biscuit with eggs, cheese, and bacon) are really good, if you are hungry you can eat one, but if not you can always split it.
author: Ally W.

description: Best breakfast sandwich I've ever had. Great baked goods, too - especially their massive cinnamon rolls and peanut butter chocolate chip cookies. Get there early - long lines on the weekends but totally worth it. Close to the beach and not that far from the park.
author: Mike R.

description: Didn't scroll through all the reviews, but didn't see anyone mention the SPECIAL breakfast sandwich...which is the greatness of the original, but with pepper jack cheese, sliced avocado and a lemon aioli.  Can't explain how delicious it is - you will be hooked.  When they have the tomato soup and grilled cheese combo, get it!
author: Linda C.

description: Cinnamon rolls and breakfast sandwiches FTW!!!
author: Michael S.

description: Found this on a 7x7 list. The line moves quickly and the service was super friendly (plus there are samples by the register which lure you into buying baked goods). The breakfast sandwich was pretty good, I just wish the biscuits were a little fluffier. The baked goods definitely did not disappoint, the lemon bar and peanut butter chocolate chip cookie were both amazing. Bonus points for having chalk outside so you can make some breakfast sandwich-inspired art while you wait.
author: Staci L.

description: My husband trekked over to Devil's Teeth a couple week ago and brought fresh hot beignets and a banana puff. It was so yummy that I wanted to try more of their baked goods. This past Sun, he bought breakfast sandwich, slice of quiche and more beignets. My 4 year old gobbled 2 beignets within mins while I savor the breakfast sandwich. Then I tried the quiche and OMG! that was the amazing. I ordered a whole pie for pick up this Sat for some friends coming over for breakfast. Hope that quiche will make them into fans.
author: Ellen T.
