description: This place is fantastic!  I moved to the neighborhood about 3 months ago and finally went to check this place out today.  I've been missing out!  The staff is very friendly and the special breakfast sandwich is amazing!  My new favorite place in the city
author: Steven S.

description: They make some of the best soups anywhere, I h ave tried a few now and my fave is the wild mushroom soup  it changes daily and they come with a piece of bread or there biscuit. yum when it's chili out.
author: Chris D.

description: Nothing special here except the kaotic line to order and get your cold sloppy sandwich. Food was mediocre at best, coffee was ok- nothing special, the real turnoff was the  line to order food and the confusion to get my food. It was bad enough to warrant not coming back. Took 30 minutes off my time to get a cold breky sandwich.  No thanks
author: Jocko J.

description: Great place for my morning snack. Serves coffee, but wish they served espresso drinks.
author: Cup C.

description:
This place is almost TOO good!  The breakfast sandwiches are incredible, the chocolate chip cookies are delicious, the doughnut muffins are amazing (and original), but the real show stoppers are the CINNAMON ROLL!S!!  These cinnamon rolls are by far the best I've ever had!!!...Words cannot even explain...Just try them!  

I also enjoy the friendly staff and family recipes!  I highly recommend this place!!! :)
author: Jami C.

description: I was doing a scavenger hunt for a friend's birthday and needed a clue written on the inside of the box. The staff was VERY friendly and took care of my strange request, no problem! The cake itself was delicious (strawberry shortcake with whipped cream) and the small square was perfect for 4 people to share. I will be back! Love this bakery!!
author: Ashleigh N.

description: C'mon guys you can do better. You're almost there. My group ordered 4 breakfast sandwiches and all were in need of improvement. Bigger is better has been the status quo for so long, why follow the same paradigm? Too much egg, too much biscuit, not enough flavor. Sorry, but your breakfast sandwich was just meh. The coffee was just meh. I've found Sight Glass to be very sour and not worth the premium the roaster expects. The place needs to be cleaned and more thought put into the inside ordering/seating arrangement of your business. Good luck, your heart is in the right place, but you need to execute on the basics.
author: Brent R.

description: Love love love! I stopped here on my last trip to San Francisco and boy was it worth it. We got one of just about everything and it was really tasty. I think they use a ton of butter in everything because I tasted buttery goodness in everything I ate. The cinnamon rolls were especially wonderful. I also enjoyed the lemon bars a lot. I ate their carrot cake and I don't even like carrot cake. My one criticism was that the banana cream puffs were just ok. But I will gladly overindulge in sweets at Devil's Teeth any day!
author: Dave D.

description:
Dear Devil's Teeth Baking Company:

I really want to love your Sunday-morning beignet tradition.

As I am human and have been to New Orleans, I have had beignets before and think they are pretty tasty (OK, in truth, I went there primarily for beignets, and ate them three times a day for four days straight).

So, as you can imagine, I really want to love this tradition. I want to wake up early on Sundays, wait in line in the dreary cold fog, thankfully receive my precious parcel, and scarf them down whilst wishing I'd ordered more. I imagine myself taking visiting friends and family here, sharing a secret (ok, not that secret) SF spot. I imagine sitting on the curb while the dog keeps trying to steal the goods, powdered sugar going everywhere, and grumpily going back to wait in line (we came all this way, I'm eating some beignets dammit).

Problem is, you are ruining the beignets. 

I think maybe it's because you are trying to serve them too quickly? Whatever the reason, please make the following two changes:

1. Dry and cool the beignets for a little while after frying. They should be warm - not insanely, holy shit, how do I hold this thing? - hot. Also, they need to be dry before you apply the sugar. Otherwise, it absorbs the oil and turns to a sort of sticky glaze which is totally not the thing at all.

2. Why are you serving them in paper bags? The presentation is a major part of the fun. I should feel like scarface being served a huge pile of coke with a dainty side of doughtnut. Serving them in a bag, I feel more like a cheap smack addict instead. And the bag has the side-effect of steaming the doughtnuts, contributing negatively to their fluffiness, and adding to the glaze problem described above. You should serve them in small bowls. If people want to ruin them in paper bags, they should have to do that themselves.

To be clear, I'm not going to stop visiting. I mean, what you have here is basically dough, oil, and powdered sugar. Kinda hard to go wrong.

But I always feel a little disappointed. And it would be so easy to do right.
author: Aaron B.

description: Big fan.  Unfortunately went later in the day so didn't get a chance to try some of their specialties however the cream puff and bread pudding i did have was delicious. My friend had the egg sandwich and he really enjoyed it.  I need to go back and try the BLT among other items. One day i'll make it there early for the cinnamon rolls.
author: Dilly M.

description: Such a cute little place with quality food and good service.  I used to live in the neighborhood so I think of it more as a local spot but everyone is super friendly.  Cinnamon rolls and lemon squares are definitely worth a try.  They also have really good biscuit sandwiches for breakfast.  Close walk to the beach too, you won't be disappointed.
author: Kash S.

description: Update: still good and getting better. Plenty of seating, more cool stuff to eat, and a seriously local neighborhood vibe. Always crowded when I'm there, but it's cool - it's the Outer Sunset - no one is tense.
author: Anna L. C.

description: I agree with Amelia b.  go away devil's teeth.  I had one of your cinnamon buns and I've been sick to my stomach all day.  Too much butter and too much pretension. You can't even get off the phone to help your customers? Not a great addition to the neighborhood.
author: Andrea L.

description: Amazing local bakery!  Everything is delicious.  Super friendly staff and great outdoor seating area.  So glad I stopped in to see what all the hype was about.  It definitely deserves it :)
author: Jena C.

description: DTB is a nice neighborhood gem for any day of the week, except Tues. when they're closed. Can't go wrong with the strawberries muffins and chocolate brownies. They're moist inside and sugary outside.  You may want to order everything you see because they all look so delicious. Lastly, benet Sundays is a must do - especially when they're piping hot.  These New Orleans style pastries are only available on Sundays and they are indeed delicious!
author: Katie L.

description: Great place. Prices are reasonable. Blue Bottle Coffee.
author: Forest S.

description: Great food, mouth-watering sweets, and nice staff. The garlic veggie soup paired perfectly with a slice of homemade bread and the ginger cookie was sooo good!  Can't wait to try everything on the menu.
author: Kim G.

description: I was super excited when I heard about their beignets sundays. As an excited customer I waited patiently for as long as I could watching as other happy customers left with their bag of beignets. Once I actually received them, I was super disappointed because it really wasn't anything that special. I expected something the size of  a donut not a donut hole. The consistency was okay, nothing to die foe. It was an alright beignet but it definitely didn't live up to what everyone was raving about.
author: Jayne A.

description: I hadn't been to Devil's teeth before moving just a block away. So glad it is there because it's one of my favorite features of the neighborhood. Nothing better than strolling down the street to get great food and amazing ambience. Truly a gem of the outer sunset. Dog and baby friendly.  The breakfast sandwich is as good as everyone says it is, but my new favorite is the Kale cheddar scone.
author: Heather S.

description: Tasty bakery and sweets. A great addition to the neighborhood
author: Billy C.

description: The currant scone is awesome! Can't get enough of that thing. Also goes down with the good coffee served as well! Keep up the great work!
author: Michael W.

description:
Yum! I went Saturday and asked if they were going to have hot cross buns for Easter - and she made some! The buns were  a huge hit at brunch, and we also really liked the bread pudding. Very friendly service and what a nice addition to the neighborhood. 

They need a sign and a phone, but as everyone said, they just opened. I'll definitely be back.
author: Anne J.

description:
I live in the neighberhood.... 2.50 for a small cup of coffee is a bit much, but i can understand that they are a small business just starting up. 
Personally I'd rather go to starbucks or petes coffee for a much more delicious and flavorful LARGE cup of coffee for Less then 2.50. 

Their heartshaped cookies with blackberry jam are delicious..
author: Boris S.

description: Great local spot for the outer sunset neighborhood.  Breakfast sandwich.....that's all I'm saying.  Oh yah, and the lemon bar is bomb.  Awesome little park-let in front, very family friendly and lots of cool dogs.
author: Sheila S.

description: Food is great. I just hoped they would clean their sidewalk and benches. Its pretty dirty, and all the children that come here and play on it.
author: John C.

description: Love the cinnamon bun. At $4 it's an expensive meal. It's more like a sticky bun (no icing) but great. Also love the huge oatmeal raisin cookie and peanut butter choc chip. Strawberry pie also amazing. Nice staff and parklet.
author: Christine M.

description:
First of all, let me say that I really like this place. This two star review is for one item only, the apple pie we got for Thanksgiving. 
The ordering and pick up process was pretty good. There were no mistakes for us and it was ready when they said it would be. The price was $20 for the whole pie, which I think is reasonable. 
The crust on the pie was fantastic. Truly. I wish I could make pie crust like that. So far this sounds like a five star review, right? 
But then when we cut into the pie it all went down hill. The filling was made from a green skinned apple and they left the skins on. Gross! It looked like baba ganoush or some smushy vegetable filling. The appearance was very unappetizing. And the skins also gave the filling a bitter, astringent flavor that just tasted flat out bad. The texture was off as well because the apple flesh was tender and the skins were tough and chewey. Nobody really liked it and we threw most of it away. Bummer. So please, for next time, would you peel the apples?
Thanks,
F.B.
author: F B.

description: Get a cinnamon sticky bun. Or a breakfast sandwich. Everything else was fairly meh, but those two stuck out. Love the location and atmosphere on an early Saturday morning, too. I'll likely be back.
author: Chris J.

description: Love their breakfast sandwiches and veggie lasagna. Also a great place to bring our pup since there is outdoor seating. They also have free doggie treats at the front counter. Just be prepared to wait about 15minutes for the breakfast sandwich, even if the line to order is short.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
a good solid 5!

heard great things and finally decided to stop by on a sunday! woke up early (yes 9am is early).

There was already a small line forming, luckily i was standing where the line was forming keke.

a good number of workers, but one takes ur order, one rings u up, and the rest making the food. They used an ipad which looked pretty cool.

we ordered
breakfast sandwich- my bf was right, he coulda made this if he wanted too...it was good but nothing special.

beignets- haha i can't pronounce this for the life of me. they are $1 on sundays, and not as big as I thought they were going to be. but they were fluffy and pretty good. just the right amount of sugar on them also.

cinnamon bun- omg! i thought they would be super sweet and blah. but!! they are flakey and soft like croissants on the inside, and the perfect amount of sweetness. the outside however was kinda too sugary/hard? very very sticky...

donut muffin- yummy lil treat. tastes like a donut shaped and crumbles like a muffin.

oh and their lemon bar is yummy too! they give out lil samples by the register.

overall a great place to come in the morning if your in the area. the wait for some items may take awhlie. they are building benches right outside though!

wish they had blue bottle coffee still, i have yet to try that popular kind!
author: Christine M.

description: Come for the cinnamon rolls- they're one of a kind. Baked and rolled differently than your average cinnamon rolls, they are heavy with taste.
author: Nikhil V.

description: Back to 5 stars with the change to really good coffee!  I'm so glad they changed. This is now my go to post surf stop again!
author: Jason S.

description: Order the breakfast sandwich and cinnamon roll. You won't regret it!
author: Elizabeth C.

description:
I LOVE THIS PLACE!

From the Blue Bottle coffee to the donut muffins, cinnamon rolls, sour dough bread, need I go on my mouth is watering... I so wish I lived next door.

Stumbled on the bakery as we were headed to Ocean Beach. I am sorry we don't live in the city, but, will try to go back each time I travel 19th ave.

Easy parking
author: hannah k.

description: This place deserves it's praise!  We went here on a recommendation and seriously, this place kills it.  1) one of the best carrot cakes I have ever had.  The cream cheese icing was not too thick, and surprising light.  The cake was not too dense and had a ton of little treats inside.  I recommend you share it because it was a HUGE slice.  2) a really solid breakfast sandwich.  I am huge on breakfast sandwiches and I liked how they made everything fresh.  From the biscuit coming out of the oven to preparing it right in front of you.  Yum!  3) the people working there we so kind.  I loved the service they provided.  All and all if you are down at the ocean beach and want some munchies, stop in.  Definitely won't disappoint!!!
author: Vinh N.

description:
FINALLY, those of us who live in the Western half of San Francisco don't have to drive 30 minutes to the other side of town in order to wrap our hands around some awesome pastries! (Tartine, anyone?) The gods of sweet confectionaries have finally shined some sun down onto our foggy existence!!

When we went to Devil's Teeth for the first time last weekend, everything looked so good we just HAD to try as many things as possible. Here's the breakdown of what we tried (in order of our favs):

1) Currant Scone: One of the best scones we've EVER had (if not the best)! Rich, soft, buttery perfection. I dare say better than Arizmendi's, plus you don't have to spend 10 minutes looking for parking. They also had apricot scones for those who aren't into currant.

2) Banana Blueberry Muffin: For the past 8 years, I've prided myself in baking the best banana bread around. I'm afraid I've been dethroned. This muffin is moist, dense and packed with sweet, fresh blueberries. My husband just asked me if I can start adding blueberries to my banana bread as well. Darn them. 

3) Cinnamon Roll: THANK YOU for not ruining this with a bunch of sickly sweet frosting! (The reason you'll never find me anywhere near a "Cinnabon"). Just the right amount of cinnamon & buttery sweetness, with a nice caramelized crust. Needs to be warmed up first though, or else the crust is too hard. And did I mention it's large enough to feed 4 people?

4) Donut muffin: Has more of a cake-like texture than a donut, which is perfectly fine with me. Super moist, cinnamony deliciousness. Ever-so-slightly too sweet though, which places it 4th on my list. You also have to like cinnamon, as it's even more cinammon-y than the cinnamon roll. 

5) Oatmeal Raisin cookie: Also slightly too sweet for my taste but nevertheless one of the best oatmeal raisin cookies I've ever had. Has a nice roasted, fresh-out-of-the-oven after-taste too. 

One theme you'll notice... EVERYTHING is super-moist, even the next day. (I couldn't tell you beyond that because it would never survive that long in our house). The supernatural moistness of all their pastries makes me suspect they add loads of butter, but then if you're trying to be healthy, why bother going to a bakery?

Oh and they only serve beignets on Sundays and unfortunately, they ran out when we got there & we would have had to wait 15 minutes to get them. Will have to go back again next Sunday to try them. =) 

We ended up paying $24 for 9 items. So... to top it all off, it's very reasonably priced. What more could you ask for?? (Probably more seating, if I was to name one thing. But hey this is S.F. we're talking about).

Alright all this writing has made me hungry. I think I'm gonna have to head back and buy some more scones now. LOVE IT!
author: Rachel M.

description: Amazing food. The brownies are dreamy. As in, I dream about them- crisp on the outside and soft on the inside and SO rich. Everything is amazing. Recently had a pastrami sandwich with onions caramelized to perfection and a curry chicken sandwich with just the right amount of spice.
author: Evie M.

description: A bright ray of sunshine in the foggy sunset! Terrific Blue Bottle drip coffee, donut muffins are to die for, and cool iPad checkout. What more could a girl ask for?
author: Cynthia J.

description: Great quiche and beignets and how can you not love a cheddar, bacon and beer muffin?
author: Brian J.

description: Okay - the actual food I've had here is pretty good. However, I've given them enough opportunities and I won't waste my time there anymore. I would recommend they get a professional in there to set up and run the place so you don't have to wait for 45 minutes for a breakfast sandwich - and a coffee that never ever arrives. I guess it's the curse of being popular? Can't keep up the quality product/service that made you popular in the first place....
author: Zac W.

description: Am I missing something from this place or did everyone eat something else? I was really excited to try this place because of the high ratings whilst close to home. But gosh darnit, it was an eh with a heavier price tag. I tried their egg muffin ham thing and I think it was 5 dollars. It pretty much tasted like an egg mcmuffin from mcDs. I'm not even a FAN of mcDs. I generally favor mom and pop places but I really don't think this place deserves four and a half stars thus the 2 stars. I'll come back to give it another try.
author: Theresa N.

description: I just had the most magnificent lunch with my friends at Devil's teeth!!  4 of us had the buttermilk biscuit breakfast sandwich-PHENOMENAL :)) and the other had the BLT-OUT OF THIS WORLD (and only $5)! We also tried the lemon bars-my mouth is watering just thinking about how delicious they are. As a matter of fact, I ended up grabbing a lemon bar to go!
author: Sandra K.

description: I ordered the breakfast sandwich, a donut muffin and a coffee. All three of these items came highly recommended by other customer reviews on foursquare..I was very disappointed. The sandwich had absolutely NO flavor and the biscuit may have been good at one point, probably just before it started to burn in the oven. The coffee was so disgusting. I used soymilk instead of creamer and it curdled instantly and was gross looking and tasting. I personally think coffee that bitter is gross. No thanks. The donut muffin was cool. I liked the concept. The service was also very good. I asked for another coffee and she was more than happy to replace it but if the foods not good, who cares about the service. I won't go back to a place because they were nice if the food wasn't good.
author: Marie H.

description: Simply amazing.  The best brownie in San Francisco.  They are big so buy several and cut them up for a kids' birthday party.  Then you can pretend you made them yourself.  Lemon squares are divine too.  The atmosphere is friendly and chill, and there's outdoor seating in the form of a swanky well-designed parklet.  Hilary, the owner, and her staff make you right at home (that is, if your home happens to smell like delicious baked goods and the perfect cup of coffee).
author: Rebecca H.

description: This place is soooooooo cute!!!! Not too pricey, amazing Quiche and lemon bars! Outside and inside seating with a variety of options of food and beverage. I suggest really checking this place out.
author: Leah K.

description: A wonderful place to stop and relax and have a pastry & coffee.  I had the donut muffin.  Its one of a kind and delicious.
author: Joel C.

description: The most amazing breakfast sandwich ever!!!! Also the most amazing cinnamon roll ever - it's a breaded, caramel deliciousness. You're in for a treat.
author: Gael D.

description: This place is bomb! I savored every bite of my gigantic breakfast sandwich while   looking out at the beach (which is about 3 blocks away).  The beignets were also a Sunday feature. The bag was soaked with powdered sugar and grease, an early predictor of how delicious they were! Perfect place to have breakfast, especially on a sunny day
author: Alex W.

description: Five stars because four does not do the high quality food and service justice. I am enjoying the pastry and the breakfast sandwich so much that I rarely miss the transition from Blue Bottle anymore.  Yum.
author: Mosey S.

description:
Cinnamon Rolls-Bomb!
Breakfast Sandwich-Incredible
Ginger Cookies-I didn't know they could taste so good. 

Eat here and you won't be disappointed!
author: Gabe H.

description:
It is so hard not to cross the street to Devil's Teeth and get myself a treat when I am at Sunset Pet Supply getting my pups a treat!

Let's start with their scones.  I had the best apricot scone here, I could eat them all the time.  Good thing I have a little self control and I don't, but really, I could.

Then there's the cheesecake.  The self control lessens here... a lot.  The creamiest cheesecake with such a delicious and moist crust.  Am I drooling?  It may be a cheesecake day tomorrow... I shouldn't be writing this review because it's making me crave it!

Anyway, they also have some great dog treats here to add to my stash from across the street.

They are a great local business, very friendly staff, I love that they use iPads and keep it simple here. I know they will be around for years to come, especially if they keep it up with the cheesecake.  Seriously, go have some cheesecake, it's amazing.
author: Jessie M.

description:
I can not say enough about this awesome place! You definitely need to make a stop -  but I warn you...can become habit forming.  :)  It has become quite the hot spot and don't be surprised if there is a line leading out the front door.  :)  But their goodies speak for themselves!!  The awesome & friendly staff, the delicious coffee, the fresh baked bread, the fresh pastries, the quiche of the day, the yummylicious breakfast sandwiches, the fresh beignets on Sunday... Need I say more??

Just make sure to get yourself to Devil's Teeth Baking Company!!!
author: Toni - S.

description: I love coming here, especially on nice, sunny days. Everyone brings their dogs out and families are hanging out for their coffee and pastries. I've been here twice. Had the breakfast sandwich the first time which was delicious and the second, ordered a curry chicken salad sandwich. It is exactly what it sounds like. -1 star for not having enough chicken in the sandwich, but I still say ORDER IT. Also, DO NOT leave without buying their salted caramel cupcake. OMG. That is all.
author: Katie P.

description:
Three cheers and five stars for Devil's Teeth for making my daughter's first birthday a huge success!  The sheet cake was not only beautiful, but was absolutely delicious.  Moist, rich chocolate, perfect buttercream frosting... our guests were asking to take leftovers home (the ultimate compliment).  And Hilary even made a smash cake.  Too beautiful for smashing, our child decided to go at it with a spoon, which was great, as our guests decided to sample that one too!

This was primarily a pizza party (compliments of The Pizza Place), but we also ordered lasagna from Devil's Teeth for those who didn't want pizza.  Very, Very good!!!

I am so happy to have this business in our neighborhood.  It is a guilty pleasure on a weekend morning, and will be our "go-to" spot for birthdays too!
author: Jessica C.

description: Yum! Excellent bakery, out by Ocean Beach.  Everything looks was great; everything we tried was great.  Yeah, really.  Very friendly staff in a small, clean place.
author: Mark M.

description: On a chilly Sunday morning in the Sunset, there is nothing better than sitting in the Devils Teeth parklet with some good coffee and a paper bag filled with fresh, hot beignets, crunchy on the outside and tender inside, sweet and yummy. The breakfast sandwich (which can be vegetarianized by replacing egg with tomato and cheese with avo), donut muffins, and scones are always good. And the cupcakes are amazing.
author: Jennifer T.

description:
I was the lucky recipient of a box of beautiful goodies from DTBC. Having never set foot in this establishment, my review will be based purely on the pastries themselves. Which is saying something-- because for me, part of the joy of paying for baked goods is being able to browse the pretty displays and enjoy the delicious aroma of freshly made treats. It all makes eating the actual pastries kinda...anti-climactic. But who am I kidding, I still love gorging on sugar and fat like any good american citizen. 

Highlights: 
Lemon bar- just tender and moist enough without being too heavy or cloying
Mixed berry bar w/ oatmeal? - surprisingly delicious! hard to describe...it's like the best fig newton ever! tastes like it's made from fresh fruits :) 

I like that the staff layered each treat with wax paper so that none of the flavors would transfer inadvertently. People who watch me eat know that I like keeping each unique flavor discrete :P It's my one and only OCD-like behavior, I swear!
author: jennifer s.

description: This bakery JUST opened today but you wouldn't be able to tell because there isn't a sign for the business out front yet. We were actually headed to La Playa for lunch today but heard that the bakery opened so we decided to check it out. We asked what their soup of the day was and the owner actually scooped us a small bowl of it to try! It was delicious. We ended up getting the spinach quiche and lasagna and enjoyed it on their wooden style counter. Both tasted really fresh and homemade. What really did it for me though was their cookie. They had a small sample tray at the register and after lunch I grabbed a piece of their oatmeal raisin cookie and it was SOOOO GOOD. Moist, chewy, not too sweet...just perfect. I'm definitely going back to try the other things on their menu and also get another oatmeal cookie!
author: Annie N.

description: Holy crack head cinnamon rolls.  Be forewarned-dangerously addictive!  The coffee and the breakfast sandwiches are also delicious.  Only downsides are that the line can be long on the weekends and ordering/pickup can be a little chaotic.
author: Cassandra C.

description: Hmmmm. No hair nets, no sanitary gloves? Great food.
author: Ron S.

description: One of the best bakeries in the city.  Great place for a quick breakfast sandwich.  Weekends can get busy, but worth the wait.
author: I M.

description: I m raising my last review for this local coffee shop. I m glad that the operations manager contact me and explain it to me that they really care and strive for the best product and service. I understood that the person who help me was just having a bad day and this is unusual. Thank you J for the quick and professional response also to keep our outer sunset a place to shop and enjoy ourselves
author: Alex M.

description: I love this place!  Their breakfast sandwiches are always amazing!  The pastries are pretty good too.
author: Gabriela H.

description:
Donut muffins, scones, quiche, beignets, carmel-y cinnamon roll the size of your head, raspberry bars and BEIGNETS!!  

Every single item I have ever eaten from Devil's Teeth (and there have been a lot of them) has been a religious experience.  You can taste the quality and the love in every bite. They have got this baking thing down.

Even the dog treats are amazing, according to my dog (I took her word for it).

If there is a line, get in it. It never takes that long and is well worth it.
author: Mere B.

description:
What's not to like about Devil's Teeth?  Um...NOTHING!  I haven't had a bad item, or even a mediocre item, yet.  

Let's start with the savory stuff: breakfast sandwich on the sourdough is a must.  Lasagna is delish and HUGE!  There's usually a daily rotation of hot soups.  I can personally recommend the coconut daal, and the sweet potato and apple soup.

My daughters crave the doughnut muffins, banana muffins, chocolate chip cookies, and brownies; and these items are almost always in the case. There's a rotating selection of pies, and other delicacies. I've had the banana cream pie, strawberry rhubarb pie, and just today, I tried the green tea layer cake with whipped cream frosting.  I recommend each and every one.

Love the counter which was made by the Woodshop, just a block away.  It's hard to believe that Devil's Teeth occupies what used to be a dog grooming place.  

Delicious food, Blue Bottle coffee, nice people, what more can you ask for? The owner, Hilary, has opened a wonderful business which has really resonated with the neighborhood.

I don't mind that it's located in the Outer Sunset, because I live in the Sunset (although Inner Sunset), and Devil's Teeth fills a desperately needed niche in the Sunset, period.
author: Sun L.

description: There aren't enough words to describe how awesome this place is.  I'm a huge fan of the lemon bars, donut muffins, quiches, and their breakfast sandwich, which I think is the best item on the menu.  Sunday's are best because they serve beignets.  If there was one suggestion I have for this place, it's to replace the coffee they serve from Blue Bottle to Philz.  I'm not saying Blue Bottle is bad, it's just Philz is that good!
author: Chris A.

description: Not good.  We tried their cinnamon rolls and they were gross.  Hard as a rock as if it  day-old, had been out on the counter all night and then added a slathering of whatever they call it to cover it up.   It wasn't gooey or sticky, but more like I was eating something put together with super glue.  Not a good experience. Will never try this place again.
author: Lori B.

description: Forget about dieting...I LOVE to eat. Favorites here include the cinnamon rolls, lemon bar, chocolate brownie, chocolate chip cookie, Sunday beignets....but not necessarily in this order. Oh and the breakfast sandwich is yum too. Stop reading and just go! You need this in your life!!!
author: Derek L.

description: Super Solid Bakery. love how personal it is being able to see all the food being made fresh by passionate people.  The banana blueberry muffin was pretty fantastic, and so was my spinach quiche. The prices  are great and leave room for a tip!
author: Zachary B.

description: I was tempted to rate this place with 1 star to discourage more people from finding it and potentially getting the last muffin. But I couldn't in good conscious to that.  Devil's Teeth is a great bakery with homestyle baked goods, and there just aren't too many of those any more.  The breakfast sandwich is a winner because of the buttery biscuit. The BLT  because of thick-sliced homemade bread. The donut muffin? Yes.  The raspberry bars? Yum!  There is a lot of staff and they move the crowd through pretty quickly.
author: Kris C.

description:
I am so glad I don't live in the neighborhood, otherwise I would weigh 400 lbs!  As it is I have trouble not turning the steering wheel in that direction on a daily basis.

The staff is awesome and super friendly, and they seem to enjoy working there, which makes me enjoy eating there.  We ordered a swathe of items just to try them out and absolutely loved all of them.  The beignets are warm and sweet and not the least bit greasy (hooray for beignet Sunday!);  the cinnamon rolls are to die for (and yes, you really should let them heat it up for you); but my favorite has to be the chocolate cake.  It's not particularly pretty or fancy in any way.  It's just a big brown square, but OH. MY. GOD.  It is the chocolatiest chocolate cake I have ever eaten and I crave it constantly.  Seriously, you have to try it.  In fact, I think I'm going to head over there now!
author: Samantha R.

description: all i can say is yum ! yum ! .....my bro and I tried this place within the first few weeks of opening, and every time I go back it gets better every time. They make the most AMAZ-ING egg sandwich's...probably the best in the city.  Kids LOVE the donut muffin (wish I thought of that one) and all the little treats are de-lish.  Everyone is super sweet.  And...coffee is great! I feel like usually you have to either got to a place that has good food OR good coffee but this has both! LOVE
author: Noelle M.

description:
The. Egg. Sandwich. Is. Amazing.

For a while there, they were still getting getting used to the iPad register interface - this gave customers (or maybe just me?) the opportunity to stuff their face from the sample tray on the counter. They are much quicker now. Dammit.

Nice folks, great food.
author: Shane C.

description:
i stopped by after hearing about this place from a friend..

i've been told i have a sweet tooth breakfast-noon-or night and a mouth full of sugar..oddly enough its really not that bad. Needless to say tried the ginger cookie as Im a sucker for Ginger molasses chew cookies---Yumm!! also had their abundant offering of samples..from brownies, oatmeal cookie, apricot scone, chocolate chip cookie. 

Also purchased the blueberry banana muffin--what's great about this is that i get the best of a blue muffin and banana bread which Im always struggling to find without the nuts...delish!! will be back again to try their other delightful treats.
author: Tiffani L.

description: Awesome. The BLT has a stunning amount of bacon for $5 and the sticky buns are incomparable. The staff are the sweetest too. They walked to the bodega across the street just so I could have an iced coffee.
author: Mary S.

description:
Found this place through Yelp and decided to give it a try. OMG!
We got a few pieces to take home and sample.
The donut muffin (2) - lots of cinnamon sugar sooo good. The chocolate cake, thick rich chocolate tasted like devils food, not too sweet, but makes me drool just typing about it. Lastly, we (ok it was just me cause I got to it first) tried the carrot cake. It was like everything else, moist with a great cream cheese frosting. The best thing about this place was that everything was fresh and moist, I can't stand dry baked goods.  All that for $10 is a steal.
author: GiGi H.

description: OMFG!!!! Go here!!!!!   Choc cake was better than sex(almost). Coffee was PERFECT. Staff was great! My buddy had the breakfast pastry, and he said it was only "alright", but DUDE....this place is for yummy deserts. I'll be back:-)
author: Peter B.

description: Be prepared to wait, but the breakfast sandwich is worth it. Flaky biscuit as big as your head with egg, cheddar, bacon.... Mmm. Probably best for my waistline that it's a bit of a jaunt to get there!
author: Caitlin E.

description: Best cinnamon roll ever. Amazing breakfast sandwiches (super flaky biscuit A+). We loved this small bakery, and are quite disappointed that we live about 1000mi away from it.
author: Darren L.

description: Had their chocolate cake and the slice was so big for $3 dollars! Will be going back to try the other sweets! :p
author: Benjamin G.

description: Tried this place for first time last week and I've already been back 4 times!!!  The brownies, my favorite--are one of the best I've ever had!  Loved the currant scones.  They were crisp on the outside and moist, with just the right flavor.  The lemon bars are excellent too, tasty, not too sweet and the crust just perfect.  The blueberry pie was very good and today, I had a benignet.  It was amazing!  Always served fresh and hot and dusted with powdered sugar.  LOVED it!  It is definitely a new "regular" spot for me.  Service nice and friendly too.  A great local, neighborhoody place.
author: Kailee Q.

description:
Read about the cinnamon rolls and had to try it. One word that describes it is YUM! They will heat it up for you if you want or you can bring it home and heat it up yourself about 35 seconds in the microwave. Price was $4 but worth it.

They have other desserts i have yet to try so will be going back.
author: Michael T.

description:
Saw all these good reviews on yelp and decided to give this bakery a try,
I went there at 3:30pm, hoping there are still something left, and I was NOT DISAPPOINTED! There were still a lot pastries left, and they were fresh:) I saw them putting fresh hot cinnamon roll on the pan the minute I arrive, and I was like...man, I 've come to the right place. 
Normally, I don't usually eat American pastry, but I tried their brownies and Donut Muffin, and they taste very delicious. They were very moist and were not overly flavored. :) I Feel very warm when eating them.  I wannted to try the beignet, too but they said it was SUNDAY ONLY. :( Will go on a sunday next time!

Overall, I love this bakery, it is warm and cozy = what I always love! I hope I can open a bakery like this someday:)
author: Christy Y.

description: Yay! Yummy, reasonably priced baked goods near my house. I had the chocolate cake, cheesecake, blondie, and lemon bar. Lemon bar and cheesecake was on the too sweet end for me. Blondie was good, but I prefer a brownie. The chocolate cake was so good, the dark richness of the icing offsets the sweetness of the cake, omg party in the mouth. Best part is the price, $3 for cake, $4 for cheesecake. Happiness all around for my stomach and wallet.
author: Erica B.

description:
I love this place!  The cinnamon rolls and unreal - delicious cinnamon in each fluffy bite except for a nice bit of crunch.  These are so perfect that if they ever gave out the recipe, I would be making them all the time at home.  They are so good that it may be better than Bob's Donuts.  Yes I said it, Bob's Donuts.  Blasphemous sure, but that's how unbelievably delicious their cinnamon rolls are.  

I also recently tried the raspberry granola bar.  It was really good, but too sweet for my taste, I think strawberry would've been a nice balance versus the sweetness of raspberries.  Now I just need to work out this week so I can go back next weekend for more delicious treats!
author: Kim C.

description: Awesome cinnmon roll...awesome people...awesome store. You just got a new fan and a regular. Such a friendly bake shop! Cheers!
author: Terry O.

description: Melt in your mouth pile of eggs, cheese and bacon on a buttery, flakey housemade biscuit makes the best breakfast sandwich you can almost handle without a fork. Get one of these and a couple piping hot beignets, and your Sunday is finished.
author: Angelina C.

description: This place is tiny compared to other bakeries. It's also higher priced than the ones I'm use to, but then again who isn't compared to a Chinese bakery. The staff is friendly and the baked goods they offer look as good as they taste. If they have it, try the peanut brittle! it's light and crisp, i'd compare it to eating a wafer more than eating candy. The onion, bacon, and leek muffin had a nice texture to it, though it wasn't quite that muffin denseness that I was hoping for. It was light and somewhat spongy, great with coffee. The best muffin they have, in my opinion, is the donut one. It's light, somewhat cake like and covered in cinnamon sugar! They also had these blueberry banana muffins, but I swear they were blackberries, I could have just read the sign wrong though.
author: Brian J.

description: Best coffee in San Francisco, hands down.  Plus you can get a healthy slice o' pie for 3 bucks! Everyone needs more pie in their life.  Great little bakery, friendly people and delicious food. Go in on sunday and get the beignets!!
author: Ryan W.

description:
After hearing a bunch of hype about Devil's Teeth Baking co, my girlfriend and I finally made it over to Noriega St on Sunday morning. There was a decent line by 8:30 am, but the crowd was friendly, and there were several dog owners sitting on the bench outside, keeping their pooches company.

When we entered the bakery, we found a nice open plan with a large bakery case fully of goodies. There's single cup Blue bottle coffee to the left, and a little nebulous line over to the right. We tasted the oatmeal cookies, and lemon bars which were delicious. We ordered a breakfast sandwich and a cinnamon roll to go. 

The sandwich is a large biscuit piled high with fluffy scrambled eggs, crisp bacon, and a slice of cheese. It's big, and was delicious. 

The cinnamon roll is also large and tasty. Jason(?) at the register told us to heat the cinnamon roll before eating it. I had to try it in the car though, and the dough was nice and toothy and the coating is sweet but not overwhelmingly so.

I'll definitely go back and try more of their baked goods. The quality of the ingredients is extremely high, and the prices are very reasonable for the size and quality of the food.

The only wrinkle is that the efficiency of the staff was only ok, but it's worth the wait. I promise.
author: Shinjiro H.

description: My new favorite bakery!   The breakfast sandwich was delicious, with egg, bacon, and cheese served in a flaky biscuit.  Reasonably priced at $5.  The doughnut melts in your mouth.  The beignet, only available on Sundays, was good too.  Only complaint is that there's not enough seatings.
author: Irene C.

description:
my friend katie, at "overland one salon" across the street from devil's teeth bakery was raving about the bakery the last time i got a haircut from her. took her advice and stopped by. sooo far i loved what i got!! the scones are delish! katie was telling me about the beignets. i'm really looking forward to getting some soon!!

i'm making another trip over tomorrow!! can't wait to get some freshed baked goodies!!

i wish devil's teeth baking company lots and lots of success ( and plus i love love love their farallon island and great white shark reference!!!)

**************update 5/19/2011******************************************

omg omg omg!!! the breakfast sammie is da bomb!!! soo soo good, freshly made to order and delish! usually i need to add extra salt and pepper to my eggs cuz most places never get it right, but this massive breakfast sandwich was so tasty i didn't have to add anything!! and the biscuit...ohh sweet baby jesus!! flaky yummy goodness. 

i also got the donut muffin...2 thumbs up. my coworkers devoured the 1 i brought back to sample/share. 

and then i got the cinnamon bun, gigantic ooey gooey yumm yumm to ur tum tum!! god that was awesome, but i ate the breakfast sammie so i only had a bite. 

i'm going back sunday morning for the beignets. i think i turned my friend into a fan and shes taking her bf there!
author: caroline g.

description: this place is iconic...always a line but the folks behind the counter are super efficient, nice and helpful.  The breakfast sandwich is huge and either I have to share one or crawl home. I had the soup the other day it was a little cold when I got it and so I thought what's up with that... turns out they thought I had ordered it that way.  They were very quick to give me  a new bowl that was piping hot and delicious....  to me 5 stars goes not necessarily to a place that is perfect but to a place that handles their mistakes perfectly... and they did. So glad it is in my neighborhood.
author: Shawn M.

description: This is my bakery of choice.  I would drive miles to go there.  Thank god its near me.  The lemon bars are scrumptious and the CINNAMON ROLL IS THE BEST!  Coffee is good, workers are nice.  Go here, you won't be disappointed.  The only thing I would add is a couch..
author: Jane S.

description: This is the best bakery in the Sunset, and seriously excellent for the rest of the city as well. The food is all fresh, homemade, and delish. I love the coffee. I also love the people who hang out there. I don't know what the reviewers who complained about snarky counter folks are talking about. I really haven't had that experience.
author: Jen M.

description: I came here seeing that it is always full on weekends. My girlfriend and I got two special breakfast sandwiches, two coffees, a shark cookie, and a vegetable muffin. The muffin was good, the cookie was hard, the coffee was too strong, and the sandwich had its good and not so good. Overall what turned me off was the cost and wait.
author: Oscar A.

description: Beautiful outdoor parklet to lounge in with your order. Brownie was incredibly decadent and delicious. Blondie bar was light and tasty. Cheese, bacon and onion corn muffins were awful. I bought two and ate 1/3 of one, then threw out the rest. I love the decor, the ambiance and the neighborhood needs a coffee shop in this area. Bravo, DTBC!
author: marjorie m.

description: It's been a while, hasn't it? Rest assured I've been eating quite well even though I haven't been yelping lately. But I need to recognize this place for, of course, their Beignet Sundays! What better way to start the morning/week with a beignet? I no longer have to pine for the Mickey Mouse shaped ones from Cafe Orleans in Disneyland. I can go straight to Devil's Teeth and get some made fresh! If you get there and you're looking for the beignets in the window and don't see any, it's because they make them fresh when you order them. This makes them extra wonderful! Plus, you can get a drip Blue Bottle for $2. If that isn't a great way to start a Sunday, then don't talk to me because I won't even discuss other options.
author: Valerie E.

description:
The owners wrote a thoughtful response. The inconsistencies in some of the baked goods was explained - the brand new staff is still perfecting the execution of the recipes. Same with the coffee, maybe a rushed or inexperienced pour.

The answer to the awkward seating: it was designed with ADA standards in mind - enough said.

As for the storefront - SURPRISE! They've painted and it looks awesome. Much more inviting!

I had to up the score to 5 stars, because I just went to Beignet Sunday! YUM! What an awesome idea. Also, I asked for a stronger cup of coffee and that's what I got - I still am not partial to the roast, but that's just me. The last brownie I had was great. I had an apricot scone - nothing left to be desired in that! That  leaves my complaints at mere trifles.

Good work, bakers!
author: J S.

description: Every savory and sweet pastry i have tried here I've liked so far. i highly recommend their Donut Muffins and their vegan lentil soup w/veggies. Their customer service is upbeat and gentle. Hopefully soon they will have a espresso machine and serve those drinks, else their regular coffee is great (Blue Bottle)
author: Giselle C.

description:
A really sweet gem in the most unexpected area. Nice to be able to get a variety of tasty baked goods and a cup of Blue Bottle. I really came to check out the beignets, since a few people mentioned this place to me, given my roots in New Orleans. First of all, beignets are only on Sunday. What the **? They are available almost 24/7 in the Crescent City (OK, Cafe du Monde closes about 2A). So, I waited until Sunday and I was disappointed. They were rather chewy and dry. Rather than perky rectangular pillows of fry dough, they were potato shaped--but that's OK since the place clearly makes everything by hand and does not use a machine like the New Orleans joints. Still, they put the beignets in a bag with powdered sugar then shake before handing it over. The powdered sugar should be served on the side so you can sugar as much or as little as you want. I saved some for other family members, and by the time I got them home, the powdered sugar was a cakey mess!

I also tried their cinnamon roll, and it was just too large and bulky for me to handle. It was also rather sticky and a bit stale. I tried the doughnut muffin on two different occasions, and while tasty, it was nothing to write home about. They did serve these tiny alfajores, and while not like the ones in Argentina, they were quite tasty. Their cookies are also yummy. The coffee was dripped fresh, but a but too strong for me--probably perfect for coffee aficionados.

I thought the service was fine and friendly. The place has a nice ambiance, with neighbors and police officers taking a short break from their morning routine. I would definitely go back, just not for beignets or cinnamon rolls.
author: 和子

description: My parents are just a few blocks from this place, and yet I didn't know about these donut muffins until I stumbled upon it on yelp. I don't know what it is about the muffin but it really is as good as these reviews claim them to be. I also tried the cinnamon roll, but they burnt it. Other than that, the roll was pretty good too. Will definitely be back for more muffins.
author: Elaine C.

description:
Finally!  A bakery in my neck of the woods that serves blue bottle coffee, great pastries and delicious light lunches!!  I don't need to drive halfway across town to Tartine anymore,  wait 20 minutes in line just to get in the door and have one of us hog a table while the other one orders.  After a 
1 1/4 hr brisk walk around Lake Merced, my friend and I were starved.  We decided to check this place out and ordered their drip coffee, curry chicken salad, spinach and cheese quiche and cinnamon roll to share.  Everything was absolutely delicious and totally hit the spot!  I'm craving more of the curry chicken salad.  The cinnamon roll was warmed up for us and they even split it in half on two separate plates.  YUMMY!  Perfect with our coffees.  Service is warm, friendly and down-to-earth.  Love the ambiance too but they need more seating.   I need to come back and try all of their cookies, pies, cakes, doughnut muffins and beignets on Sundays!  This little gem is a must try!!
author: Sharon D.

description: Originally I gave Devil's Teeth 5 stars for their lemon bars. However, the other day I tried their carrot cake and chocolate cake. I am sorry, but they were not up to par. The carrot cake was bland and the cream cheese frosting was runny and needed more sugar. My son wouldn't even touch it. The chocolate cake tasted like cocoa and was nothing special. You would do better using a box mix. Sorry Devil's Teeth.  Stick to the lemon bars.
author: Debi L.

description: Beignet Sundays. Come here on Sundays to get one of the most delicious and indulgent breakfasts you can find in the Sunset. Made to order and comes out piping hot. Just buy a bag of them and tell yourself you're going to share it. I doubt they'll last the car ride home.
author: Anthony H.

description: HUGE lines on the weekends for breakfast/lunch. If you can't stand crowds, this might not be the place for you. The service was very good. The breakfast sandwich was A-OK. I think people are really deprived in the Sunset? The biscuit was tasty and there was plenty of egg, but I've had better McMuffins (sorry, it's true). I thought the whole thing was way too DRY. Maybe the eggs were over cooked? Maybe someone forgot the cheese? I know the poor girl at the egg station was pumping it out as fast as humanly possible and I have lots of respect for her, but QC just can't really be maintained at that pace maybe. For $5, it's a very healthy portion especially for SF. I picked up my sandwich and started walking towards the beach while eating it. By the time I crossed 48th, I decided I couldn't eat another bite. The mini banana cream pie was also A-OK as well. They could try and flavor the cream a bit to incorporate the parts a bit more (add vanilla bean or banana to it?) Right now the cream and the rest of the pie just seems like components that happen to be served together. Hooray for the Blue Bottle coffee!
author: John H.

description:
After my family trip to Disneyland earlier this month, my sister and I have been craving beignets. A search on Yelp turned up the Devil's Teeth bakery, and this place seemed ideal because it's right off the Great Highway. This place sells beignets, but only on Sundays. The beignets here are almost as good as Disneyland's, but not exactly as good, because I felt they weren't as sweet. They give the beignets in these small paper bags, but I'd prefer that they use something a little thicker, because the paper bag can get a little greasy with the beignets in them.

They're open early, but there's a line around 10AM.
author: Efrain T.

description: This bakery has wonderful ENERGY.  It is heartwarming to go into a place where it just feels right, from the sweet and savory food offerings to the way it is all set up, and specially the people who work there.  I congratulate all of you for bringing some sunshine to the Outer Sunset!
author: Rona M.

description: After a 20 mile ride around Lake Merced, and having read about their Beignet Sundays, I biked a few miles out of the way to grab a few before heading home. They are open until 4pm Sundays so I figured 315pm would be fine, but they had run out around 1pm apparently, which was sad. But I was pretty hungry, so I broke down and bought one of their ginger cookies ($2.50)- pricey, but they were big and had whole chunks of ginger in them- hard to resist! Extremely tasty, although I would be a fan of a slightly crispier (but not any drier) cookie. Maybe one day I'll get to try the beignets :)
author: Amanda S.

description: Double thumbs up for the lemon bar and cinnamon roll. They taste so good. The chicken curry sandwich is fair, I like the recipe but the flavor is too light. I am going to try more items.
author: Wendy W.

description: Great food, great coffee, close to the beach ... a welcome addition to the neighborhood!
author: Carrie H.

description: Excellent new bakery with a great, friendly, local vibe! The sweets are amazing (especially if you're a chocolate fan). I recommend the breakfast sandwich - fresh, pure ingredients and absolutely delicious. I'm a regular for sure.
author: Justin R.

description: I dashed in and asked for a donut muffin, bacon cheddar muffin, cinnamon roll and a slice of carrot cake- wanted a small smorgasbord of samplings. Donut muffin was very yummy and I normally wouldn't be attracted to that- but it was a moist soft pillow of cakey donutness wearing a muffin costume. The savory bacon muffin was surprisingly soft and moist as well. Of course I assumed it would be spectacular but really it was more than expected as it was fluffy yet packed with bold ingredients. Tres yum. Then I broke into the cinnamon roll and literally started giggling like a little girl who had just been released from a dark, miserable, oppressive, cinnamon bunless prison. I cut off about 1/4 to taste and pulled/peeled the dense sticky layers out of themselves and the the caramelly sugar crust crunched as my whole outlook on life opened up. Seriously, I was in a good mood but that damn roll turned me into a dancing queen. I have to take it easy before trying the carrot cake as I don't want to explode myself into bakery heaven just yet.
author: Julie R.

description: My best friend and I went out to the sunset for the day and stumbled upon this neighbourhood gem.   Looks like they just opened recently or remodelled.   Go for the coffee cake.  And the roaster of their coffee is Blue Bottle coffee co.   Brilliant!!!!
author: Christopher R.

description: I love this local bakery within walking distance from my house. They just added a 'parklet' out front which is a huge bonus, especially on sunny days. All the baked goods I have tried are delicious; cinnamon rolls, lemon bars, carrot cake, beignets, ginger cookies. My one criticism is about the coffee. They started with Blue Bottle which I didn't like very much because the wait was too long, it was lukewarm by the time you got it and on the bitter side. The coffee has gone downhill though. It is now French press, not sure where the coffee is from. It is very watery and gritty.I just want a good cup of coffee to go with my sweet .  . . . strong in flavor, not acidic or gritty and worth the $3. Please Devils Teeth Bakery, figure out your coffee!!!
author: Michaela C.

description: Far out and somewhat in the middle of no where.  Probably wouldn't make a hike out here but if you happen to be in the neighborhood, highly recommended.  A cute grab and go bakery spot, it has a very youthful down-home sort of feel to it.  Their breakfast sandwich is in fact made on real biscuits (coming from the South, that's saying something), and their cinnamon buns are so good.  Make sure you get a fork and knife for that one because it is ginormously delicious.
author: Alice Y.

description:
Couldn't wait for this place to open!  

They have soups and some other savory goodies that look interesting (not just some slimy chicken noodle, yesterday they had a coconut daal).  

But, of course, their decadent sweets are what everybody's excited about.

The spinach quiche: delicious.  Flaky crust, lots of good spinach flavor, not overcooked, rich enough without being too cheesy.
The lemon bar: delicious, sweet-tart, and super-rich.
The chocolate cake: almost better than mine. Well, about as good as mine. Best store bought chocolate cake ever, that's for certain.
The cinnamon buns: excellent, although a bit too buttery (I know, is there really such a thing?) for my taste.

Go here. You won't be disappointed.  

The outer Sunset is the BEST!
author: K. B.

description: Great addition to a hood that just keeps getting better and better.  Got the bread pudding muffin thingy...so tasty.  Moist, eggy...mmm.  Looking forward to trying everything on their menu, and seeing what else they cook up.
author: Pat M.

description: Yummy, wholesome baked goods in sensible portions. (I love the fact that these aren't gigantic mutant muffins like you find coming from most commercial bakeries.)
author: Greg H.

description: You can order anything on the menu and it will be delicious! Especially the breakfast sandwich, cinnamon roll, donut muffin, and apricot-oat scone. Also, blue bottle coffee is always a plus! They even have a nifty ipad register to ring up your purchases. Overall, this is a good breakfast-to-go place!
author: Yi-Fang T.

description:
The cheesecake is out of this world and the chocolate items are fantastic! It's a great bakery with friendly staff. Everything I tried is top quality and the prices are reasonable.

I wish they were open later then 2 o'clock- I generally stop by the area after work for groceries-  but they always have a fresh supply of everything so even when I make it in near closing everything is top quality. With parking and such a convenient location I am ecstatic about this bakery!

It is an outstanding addition to the neighborhood! I'll be ordering cakes from there in the future, too!
author: Katie C.

description:
The luxury of baked goods a few blocks away from the Great Highway and the sandy beach the lies beyond those dunes. On a sunny summer day, before you walk through the doorway of this bakery, you can glimpse the blue ocean and feel the cool breeze. As you enter the bakery, you're met with a display case full of tiny muffins, decadent cakes and pies, sumptuous bars and crispy-chewy cookies. 

There's a counter with some stools along the window on the inside, where you can enjoy your food and desserts. If it's sunny, you can grab a couple of the chairs outside and bask in the warmth of the sun's rays or the heat of your freshly-fried beignets. So as much as I would have liked to love this place, I can only remain lukewarm to it. I tried a few of the cookies, the beignets, and the chocolate cake. The ginger-spice cookie was nice and chewy with a good dash of spice. The beignets, although very airy and piping hot out of the oil, left something to be desired compared to the pillowy beignets they have down south. That's possibly an unfair standard to hold it to. The chocolate cake was moist and topped with a rich layer of chocolate-fudge icing. I like my cake a bit thicker, while this cake seemed more fit for a sheet cake. While I would have tried some of their interesting muffins like the donut, I couldn't justify $2 for a tiny muffin that I could have finished in two bites, three bites max. If they had the banana-blueberry muffin, I might have considered it. I believe they also have lunch-type fare, although I didn't see any of it. 

The service was decent, although it seems that they have yet to work out a very efficient system. Their register is an iPad. How modern. 

I think it's a good place to pick up some dessert if you're headed down to the beach to enjoy a day in the sun or are headed to a dinner party in the area.
author: Saunders C.

description: Best cinnamon roll eva eva... eva, eva! Really huge and buttery, artery clogger fa sho, definitely smarter to share. The crunchy edges make me not wanna stop. I've also had a blondie and donut muffin and there are many more I wanna get my hands on.
author: april p.

description:
Went yesterday for the 1st time. It was good enough to come back today.

The Beignet's are only served on Sunday and are worth going for.

Go Now.
author: Tim K.

description: I really, really want this place to do well and I want it to be the best it can be because I live in the Sunset and am pro-local businesses.  But, unfortunately I cannot hang with trans fat, and I've seen Crisco at this bakery.  Also, the breakfast sandwich everyone raves about, not so much for me.  The biscuit is overkill - I would prefer it on some sort of savory roll instead - too much butter and sweetness for me to go with my egg and bacon. That said, I would really like to see them succeed and I plan to go back for a visit to see how they are getting on.
author: Cami B.

description: Went to Devil's Teeth Baking Company recently. I haven't had a chance to try many things -- but so far I love everything I tried. I had a sample of a lemon square which was easily the best lemon square I've ever had. I also had a cup of coffee with a apricot scone which was very tasty. I also tried a little bit of a donut muffin which is a very good idea. But I didn't notice that they also had beignets until after I was almost done with my scone -- but I had to have at least one with a hot cup of chocolate. As the Terminator would say, "I'll be back!"
author: Ian F.

description: Was very excited to have a bakery finally open in the neighborhood.  Friendly staff.  LOVE the cinnamon rolls and doughnut muffins.  And it's nice to have Blue Bottle coffee out here but it does take quite a while -- weigh the "worth the wait" for yourself.  And I like the free doggie treats.  It's a nice touch for such a heavily dog populated area.  Still have to try to lunch menu and bread, though...
author: James S.

description: I really like this bakery. Younger, very friendly staff. The cinnamon rolls are awesome. Flaky deliciousness. The alfajores are a must try. Sooooo good. I'll go back for sure.
author: Nick G.

description:
A wonderful, warm, family owned bakery that's a great addition to the outer Sunset.  While the breakfast sandwich gets a lot of the ink below (and it's very good), their baked good are the highlight for me, especially the sourdough bread, the lemon bars, and the banana cream pies.

I promise you will find a delicious treat.
author: pete m.

description: This gem of a bakery has brought sweet culinary delights to our neighborhood for the last few years. Can't say enough about the treats; but the lasagna, soups, sandwiches are amazing as well. All the staff are super friendly, and it's always a pleasure to go.
author: Ian Z.

description:
About time the Sunset got some decent establishments! We need more places like this.

Got my breakfast sandwich fix here and a currant scone. Fresh baked taste and delicious.

Not a fan of the coffee setup with Blue Bottle coffee because they use those funnels to pour hot water and brew per cup. See my review on Blue Bottle Coffee. Again, it just takes too long for a cup of drip coffee. There was only one person ahead of me who ordered 1 cup of coffee. But the lag in brew time took so long that they forgot who ordered what and ended up handing him two cups of coffee (and he took both!) Somehow, I got lost in the coffee queue because they started handing coffee to the guy behind me who ordered coffee as well. One star off for that setup.

BUT 4 stars for an awesome breakfast sandwich that came with their baked biscuit, egg, chedder cheese and bacon. It wasn't overly greasy and actually had a hard time finishing it.

I will continue to support this establishment especially after getting wind the upstairs neighbors knowingly moved into a commercial/residential block and are now complaining about bakery smells and whatnot. Psshhh... who doesn't like the smell of freshly baked goods anyway.

I'm all for progress and this is a huge leap in progress for the Sunset.
author: S. S.

description: Huge fan.  Really, HUGE fan. Maybe I'm biased because it's only 2 blocks from my house, but this place is amazing. Quiche, breakfast sandwiches, muffins, cakes...all to die for. Maybe it's a hair on the pricey side, but that doesn't both me at all.  The quality is out of this world.  The people that work there are super nice too, and you have to love a place that bakes free doggie biscuits.
author: Dale M.

description: I am a breakfast sandwich fein and because of that I will give this place five stars due to the thick bacon, fresh eggs, and biscuit bread that helps energize my mornings.  Did I also mention Blue Bottle Coffee.
author: Luciano A.

description: This is the neighborhood bakery you wish you had. Staff is friendly. Food is awesome. Breakfast sandwiches are great; lemon bars are great; pies are great; sticky buns are really, really great, brownies are great. Are you sensing a trend here? And there's something about being way out in the Sunset that's a welcome decompression from city life. This place is the best.
author: Brian C.

description: Amazing baked goods! Great coffee. Great service. Awesome addition to the neighborhood.
author: Patrick S.

description: Heard the breakfast sandwich here was great, so I had to stop by. Me and my man went in on a Saturday morning, not really knowing what to expect, and were pleasantly surprised. The place seemed packed from outside, but the line to order had subsided. Our order was taken right away, and our server let us know to expect a 10 minute wait for our breakfast sandwiches. So, we asked for a couple of coffees and a donut muffin and made ourselves comfortable. 10 or 15 minutes later, our name was called and we were handed breakfast sandwiches wrapped in foil. From bottom to top: biscuit bottom, egg, bacon, cheddar, biscuit top. Great. The biscuit was flaky, the eggs and bacon hot, the cheddar cheese melted. I'm a huge fan of the egg&cheese on a roll ubiquitous to bodegas and street carts in NY, and am always looking for something on this coast that compares, and this breakfast sandwich certainly does. Plus, its only $5! With 2 sandwiches, 2 coffees and the muffin, I think we spent a grand total of $16. Next time I'm out in the outer Sunset early in the morning (...) I'll definitely be eating a Devil's Teeth breakfast sandwich.
author: Piper A.

description:
What a great addition to the neighborhood.
Thus far we have tried the breakfast sandwich, the apricot oat scone, the cinnamon bun, and the blueberry muffin.  Scrumptuous.  Really can't wait to try everything else in the window.  
Slowly but surely the Outer Sunset is becoming hip.
author: Leo S.

description: The food at Devil's Teeth is ridiculously good. I drive over from the Inner Richmond to eat here and it's worth it. Staff is great and I love the owner, Hillary. She's fantastic.
author: Mitchell L.

description: I was so excited when I heard that a place in San Francisco made buttermilk biscuits.  I recently moved here from Atlanta and have really been craving an awesome biscuit.  I placed my order for a bacon, egg, and cheese biscuit only to be told that was a breakfast sandwich.  A biscuit is just a biscuit.  I've never in my life heard of a biscuit being called a breakfast sandwich (must be a west coast thing).  My wife ordered a grilled cheese and we also got two coffees.  25 minutes  later I had to check to see if my order was being processed because numerous other patrons came in after us and received their order before us.  We finally received our order and were completely disappointed.  The biscuit was similar to a canned biscuit and  it was thrown together.  The grilled cheese was extremely bland.  I could not believe an order that basic took that long to make.  I had high hopes for this place and was very let down.   If anyone ever sold some real southern buttermilk biscuits in SF people would not know what to do with themselves.
author: C R.

description: My family and I make pilgrimages here from Marin for the cinnamon rolls. They are to die for! Huge, gooey, soooo cinnamony and buttery. Absolutely divine!
author: Melissa T.

description: Yeah!  This bakery just opened in my neighborhood and is my new favorite place for breakfast!  The apricot scones are yummy and Blue Bottle coffee is divine!
author: Kelly D.

description: We've been back many times and brought friends, and this place is such a great little neighborhood joint. The new parklet makes it a great place to hang out and have a bite while chatting with new-found friends.
author: bree g.

description: Tiny little bakery, but there is usually a line out the door. Great food, and really sweet employees.
author: Emily B.

description: DIVINE! It takes a lot for me to get in the car and head over to the waaay outer avenues, but for Devil's Teeth..amen! I LOVE me some cinnamon roll but without all the frosting..Devil's Teeth provides. Today I bought a peach/berry pie and OMG it was summer in your mouth! Love this place..be okay to wait for some coffee, otherwise grab a muffin or roll and wait with everyone else, you will not be disappointed.
author: Carolyn C.

description: I recently had the blueberry muffin which I totally enjoyed.  The muffin was very moist and large. This a great place whenever you are in the mood for outstanding pastries.
author: kirk l.

description:
Devil's Teeth, you and I have had a rocky relationship, but I think we now understand each other.  The first time I visited, I had an oatmeal raisin cookie and your delectable breakfast sandwich and adored every bite.  Sadly, the second time I visited, there were some major issues with the staleness of the baked goods and customer service.

But now, Devil's Teeth, you have definitely worked out the kinks, and I think we can once again be happy together.  I came back for a third visit because my roommate was determined to give the breakfast sandwich another shot.  Delicious!  When those buttermilk biscuits are fresh and flaky, there's nothing like it. We also tried a lemon bar and a cinnamon roll (which was so good it made my eyes roll back in my head).  

Ultimately, this is a new, small, locally owned business that has fantastic recipes and is doing its best to improve its service as it goes.  Since I definitely give points for effort - and for delicious, delicious cinnamon rolls - I'm upgrading my 2-star rating back to 4 stars.
author: s w.

description:
YUM!!!  This place just opened today and I have already been in twice!  I took the kids in before school for scones, cinnamon rolls and coffee.  Everything was amazing!  They make the coffee to order-it was so, so good!  They also have a jar of small cookies at the register that are free for kids, what a great idea!  
I took the kids back again after school and we got individual bread puddings for snacks...again, yum!  It was delicious!  Sweet, but not too sweet!  Moist and just fantastic!
To top it all off, everyone who was working there was super friendly and helpful!
I highly recommend Devils Teeth Baking Company!  I cannot wait to go back at least once tomorrow!
author: Katie N.

description:
Thank you so very much for opening a clean, contemporary facility in the outer sunset with a good product.  These aforementioned accoutrements are not easily found in surfer land.    The products are made with care, pride and quality.  The best of luck, and the support of myself and my friends will continue.   

Maybe expand the menu with a little more substance food?  I know it's a bakery, but for a quality establishment like yours, there is no competition......   fairly certain I will never step into the coffee shop across the street again, as long as your excellent venue is thriving.
author: Johnny C.

description:
J'adore Devil's Teeth and all their tasty treats.  We make the trip from the Castro as often as possible, and love grabbing some breakfast sammy's, hot coffee, and lemon bars and heading a few blocks down to the beach.  

The food is terrific and the place is adorable.  It' s nice to know that a family-run business can still open and thrive in San Francisco! 

Go! you'll be so happy that you did.
author: Thomas M.

description: You can't go wrong with this place...everything is great! I keep going back for the yummy lemon bars and end up trying something new each time I go in. The breakfast sandwiches, made to order, are delish with a flakey biscuit. And don't forget the made-to-order beignets on Sundays. So far we have also had the quiche, lasagna, raspberry bars, scones, cookies, and carrot cake. Like I said before, everything is fantastic! Can't wait to order a cake for a special occasion. I drive across town from Bernal to come here and it is well worth it!!
author: Heather B.

description: A colleague of mine recommended the Devil's Teeth Bakery because they have an amazing breakfast sandwich and are located near the beach.  My husband and I drove to the restaurant and as we drove by saw a line down the street.  This is a hole in the wall restaurant with almost no seating inside and limited seating outside.  As we approached the front of the line to order we were overcome with views and smells of cinnamon rolls, scones, cupcakes, cookies, cakes, etc.  My eyes were bigger than my stomach and I wanted to order 1 of each item.  We ordered the breakfast sandwich and the breakfast sandwich special.  While waiting for our food we tried their beignets, holy moly are these things dangerously good.  We drove a few minutes and parked at the beach to eat our breakfast sandwiches, it was great because our dog was with us.  BEST BREAKFAST SANDWICHES OF ALL TIME... SERIOUSLY!  We probably could have shared 1 sandwich because they are huge, but wanted to indulge so we got our own.  We took 2 chocolate chip cookies to go and ate them later in the evening at home, best chocolate cookies I've tasted by far.  BEWARE - if you are counting points, calories, trying to eat healthier... this restaurant is not for you!  Devil's Teeth Bakery makes their food with love and lots of butter (or could be oil)... either way their stuff is full of yumminess
author: Bernadett M.

description: super good!!!! :) i love their breakfast sandwich! they need more vegetarian options, but they will exclude stuff if you ask them. i took out bacon and added avocado. they are super nice there too. love this place! :-)
author: Hello G.

description: After reading all the reviews on yelp I had to give this place a try, I tried the breakfast sandwich and there beignets on sunday, I would consider both to be average, I have had much better beignets though and the eggs on my breakfast sandwich were a little on the dry side
author: Mark O.

description:
i have to write!
b/c i was there last saturday - 10am - i know - peak time for pastries all over the city- but my parents were here from nyc & i was dying to show them a great SF breakfast place
the situation there was out of control. especially b/c it was a sunny day.
crowded doesn't even begin to describe the place.
there was a line - about 15 people deep snaking out the door. way more inside.

the good -
-food is still great, coco dal, cookies, chai - all delish.
-service still warm & friendly -but frazzled too!
-the parklet is really really beautifully designed.

the bad -
-it was tough to find seating @ that parklet!! we were squeezed together!
-the garbage was all over flowing.
-no samples.

i don't know. they're a victim of their success. people love them & want more.
what's the answer? expand? raise prices? it's sad b/c i love their food & vibe & aesthetic but i don't want to go & brave that craziness on a sat. morning.

if you like a bustling hip crowd - this is the place for you.
for me, i'll stick to weekdays.
author: Kim Y.

description: I finally got up early one morning and came to pick up breakfast. As soon as I got in there I knew I wouldn't be walking out with just one or two items. I ordered a cinnamon bun, doughnut muffin, carrot cake and oatmeal cookie along with two cups of Blue Bottle drip coffee. The cinnamon bun was ginormous and filled with gooey goodness. It didn't seem like a traditional cinnamon bun. It was a bit crunchy, almost as if it had some caramel in it.  It was so rich I ate it over the course of three days. The doughnut muffin was a surprise. I was expecting it to be greasy, but it was light and fluffy. The carrot cake was moist, there's no way you can't eat it all in one sitting. I didn't get a chance to try the oatmeal cookie . . . someone ate the whole thing before I was even able to try it SO I assume it was good.  I've had Blue Bottle Coffee before and didn't care for it, my feeling hasn't changed. Sorry. Other than the coffee, I love everything about this place!
author: Adelina W.

description: This is a f/u to the review I posted 11/23.Amazing shop! I met with the owner after he sent me a response to my post! Short story, they have their SightGlass coffee all dialed in and tasty (evidently I originally tasted it the first day of the switch). They are now offering a couple different coffee options. They are also in the process of building an Urban Park in front of their shop with more seating and a SANDBOX.  Still the same awesome staff and incredible baked goods.  If you want to shop local and consume a GREAT product you need to roll on by.  Thanks DT!
author: Tod S.

description: This place rocks. Good stuff any time of the day: breakfast and coffee is delicious; very chill place to hang outside and eat if it's a sunny day. Cookies are a little sweet for my liking but I adore the cakes - got one for bf's birthday and another for a bridesmaid's party. Their ingredients are top quality and they brew good coffee. The Sunset is lucky to have Devil's Teeth.
