author: Lily L.

description: My friend bought me a cup of coffee and cinnabun for breakfast. It was effing delicious. I'm not a big fan of coffee, maybe it's because most places don't put the time and effort into making the perfect cup. Once I took a sip, I knew I was holding something glorious. It was full of flavor and not a hint of any burning. I asked him how a shop can manage to get it right, and he told me they make it BY-THE-CUP. That totally threw me off. So there you have it from a non-coffee lover. Now I must not forget about the cinnabun. It was tasty and gooey, I was quite sad when I finished it. I guess that means I'll have to pay them a visit soon. Very soon.
author: Edwin L.

description: I only had the banana cream puff (3/5) and chai latte (2/5). I will go there again and retry other stuff. maybe it will be better! The outdoor seating is cool!
author: Cindy L.

description: Yes! This place is higly recommended! I visited at least 5 times and had all kinds of food they make. The more I go there the harder it is to choose since everything is so delicious. Friendly people too. Prices are very reasonable considering the quality and quantity. I love the bacon and egg sandwich which is great for breakfast, but I wish they would also serve the traditional bacon 'n eggs (on a plate). Highly recommended!
author: R S.

description: WOW! Just had the best bacon, egg and cheese biscuit breakfast sandwich ever!!! Going to come back to try the banana cream puffs!
author: s g.

description: a little bit disorganized but the food and goodies are out of this freak'in world....lucky for me i live very close so i can get treats any time (except tues)...pls chk this join t out it's rea real good.....
author: David R.

description: friendly staff and fresh pastries everyday compared to the old and stale pastry of sea biscuit. coffee is also alot stronger and much better than sea biscuit.
author: mister f.

description: I was planning on getting a dozen cupcakes for the teachers at my new job. After noticing the bakery while getting coffee on Noriega one day, I decided to email the bakery and ask if they could help me out with a dozen cupcakes. Not only was the management extremely nice to me and complimented me on getting the new job, but the gave me a great deal and the lemon cupcakes were beyond delicious! I'll definitely continue to support this local bakery. Thanks Devil's Teeth!
author: Natalie P.

description: woot! walking distance from my place.  the breakfast sandwich is definitely worth a try, large biscuit, crispy bacon and a small mountain of fluffy scrambled eggs, scones and cinnamon sticky bun are also very tasty, i think i slowly become a regular.
author: Wei W.

description: What a great value! We headed out to the Sunset for Outerlands only to discover they were closed, so with a quick turn to Tasting Table we found ourselves at Devils Teeth. Ordered the bacon beer cheese biscuit, breakfast sandwich, potato quiche, and lasagna...yea I know a lot of food, but after a whole bottle of scotch and not much else food was essential.  The interior was sweet and sparse, the muffin a bit doughy but otherwise everything was wonderful. A bit out of the way for me, but a perfect stop in place for the mornings I make it out to Funston with the pooch!
author: Jenny E.

description: yumm!! i love there cinnamon roll! it taste a bit like a sticky bun but whatever it is is yummy! must get it! and im craving and dreaming about right now. must get!
author: M A.

description: A nice family run business.  The staff seems real happy and are very accommodating. I love the ginger cookies.
author: Jennifer P.

description: Since Devil's Teeth has opened, i've tried about half of what they bake, and I am impressed with everything. The owner is super nice and let me pay later when I forgot my wallet once. With customer service like that I will always be a loyal customer.
author: hank l.

description: i really hate to do this, but i was not impressed by this neighborhood bakery at all. the donut muffin looked REALLY good, i mean so good i wanted to lick my screen...but when i took a bite out of mine it was just mediocre to say the least. it wasn't fluffy like i had imagined. the sugary outer layer was good, but come on, when is sugar and cinnamon not good? i also tried a cookie, and that didn't fare well either. not quite chewy and not quite crunchy, the texture did not excite me. i feel extremely guilty for bashing a mom-n-pop shop(as i'm typing this out actually), but i'd feel even guiltier for lying.
author: Melissa Y.

description: This is a really great place! Loved the blueberry muffins - really good! Great low-key place with good stuff!
author: Walker W.

description: Delicious ginger cookies, chewy and very ginger-y!  Not as impressed with the chocolate cake and cinnamon roll.
author: Tam V.

description: $1 beignets. THEY MAKE THEM RIGHT THERE, just dip them in oil and powder 'em up, and there you go: a one-dollar dollop of heaven. The other stuff is good, too, but holy lord. The coffee is Blue Bottle, a nice touch, but mine could have been made stronger and hotter. Haven't heard that complaint from others, so I'll let it go. I just moved to the Sunset and have been trying to think of excuses to get people to visit...and I just found one.
author: Hillary R.

description: 3.5* - As much as I want to love this place, I don't understand the reviews here. Nothing is bad - but it is all homemade goodness that I can make at home as well. However, there is convenience and variety which enhance the desire for it. I did enjoy $1 beignets sunday - can you ever go wrong with a beignet? (well I guess you could.. this is not a new orleans beignet from cafe du monde, but it is good). The business is family-run and has a cute interior although I will say the whole operation of watching them bake is a bit distracting because it isn't always cleanly organized.
author: Jeannette L.

description: Another great food joint on Noriega! donut muffin was a soft, moist cinnamon treat. Just sampled the cinnamon roll, incredibly tasty but so intense I would probably only share one. Blue bottle coffee was good. Spinach quiche was just so-so, a little too cheesy and crust was soggy. Hubs' breakfast sandwich was good, but very crumbly. Everything looked very tasty, homestyle baked goods with quality ingredients. Hope they make it! Wish they had a couple more savory vegetarian items, otherwise would give 5 stars!
author: L J.

description: I always enjoyed the quality baked goods from Devil's Teeth.  No doubt there's some great goodies in there.   But this review is for the woman working the register. My wife and I ordered 12 beignets today and went to pay.  The place was packed with a big Sunday crowd and was noisy.  We heard her say $13 dollars and we handed her the cash.  She then said in an irritated voice "$13 dollars".  My wife asked her how much did we give her and she said it was $13 dollars.  So what was the problem? We're confused.  So it turns out that it was really $13.02 but she didn't explain to us that she needed two more cents.  She just repeated "$13 dollars" and looked pissed off.  All she had to say was that we need to pay two more cents.  I don't know if she was stressed out from the crowd but being rude with a customer who just wants to pay for their food was a turn off for us.  We're not interested in going back.
author: Jim T.

description: LOVE Devil's teeth!  You can't go wrong with anything there.  The pastries, sweets, homemade bread (you can buy a half loaf!), chicken salad, and delicious coffee are all winners.  So glad they are in our neighborhood!
author: Heidi S.

description: Super cool place. Really delicious baked goods and the kids behind the counter are nice. One star off because it seems to take way longer than anywhere else to get a drip coffee .
author: mark h.

description: Love this place! Especially happy that a place like this has opened up in my hood. Sunday beignets, the breakfast sandwich and the donut muffin are awesome. Staff are very friendly. They seems to still be trying to work out efficient systems, but that's understandable since they are new. Here's to more hip food options in the Outer Sunset!
author: Charlie B.

description: i'm gonna start by saying i have a love affair with food and use yelp constantly, but i've never registered an account. devil's teeth is so good that i really had to sign up just to post a review. i really, really love this place and find myself going about 4 to 5 times a week these days. (minor addiction)  i've always been a fan of breakfast sandwiches to start the day off right, but devil's teeth does it better than any other place in the bay area hands down. staff is chill, baked goods are always amazing (reccomend the doughnut muffin, not too sweet like a lot of their goodies) but nothing compares to that buttery buiscut with chewy bacon, warm cheese and delicious egg. i've considered applying for a job here just so i can stop spending all my money on god-forsaken breakfast sandwiches. keep up the good work devil's teeth, i really love what you guys have going on.
author: Aaron S.

description: Best ginger cookie I've ever had.  Great coffee.  Good prices.
author: Rachele F.

description:
i heard about this bakery, so i had to drive up from the burbs (Palo Alto) to check it out.  fabulous pumpkin muffins, and ginger cookies.

They were closing when I got there (2p) or else I would have hung around for hours trying everything they had -- it all looked and smelled wonderful.

Instead, took their  lasagna home for dinner (yes not just baked goods!)
deelish.

LOVE this place!    I will be stopping by whenever i  get to the city
author: janet g.

description: I have nothing against chinesse food but that is all there seems to be in my neck of the woods, so once I heard there was a new place to eat in the far reaches of the sunset I could not wait to go. I finnaly got my chance last weekend and I was rewarded. The items 3 items I purchaced were the  blackberry muffin, lemon blueberry cake with cream chesse frosting and a breakfest sami. The muffin and cake were azaming. Neither were overly sweet which really allowed the flavor to come though. The cake was a b day cake for my girlfriend. It was so good she only let me have three bites of it, but every one was worth it. The only disappoint was the the sami. All the elements except for the eggs were great. The eggs were kinda runny which put a damper on the whole thing. I will still be coming back and know for next time to make sure the eggs are cooked the way I like em. Also I am gonna order my own piece of cake!!!!(one for the gf too)
author: Brian P.
